summary: Lead, advise and support product decisions through insights – use your quantitative and data mining skills to understand how users interact with all areas of...
post_text:
Gilt Groupe Careers - Product Data Scientist Gilt Groupe Careers Product Data Scientist Technology / Product Management New York, 
                    New York Apply Description Position at Gilt Groupe Job Summary The Data Team is seeking talent who are passionate about technology, information, and analytics. Individuals who are driven to learn, innovate, and are interested in working within a culture dedicated to your growth and success. We have data crying out for attention. Gilt needs that special individual with the ingenuity of a hacker, morals of a statistician and area expertise of an... expert. Hopefully thats you! The results of your work will have direct impact on site design, user content, personalization and overall company performance. Your insights will turn into real products on a regular basis. It would be difficult to get closer to seeing what you uncover put into action. Responsibilities: Lead, advise and support product decisions through insights – use your quantitative and data mining skills to understand how users interact with all areas of Gilt. Work collaboratively with Product, Engineering and Data teams to find opportunities and solve problems. Raise the company’s collective ability to understand insights from Big Data. Lead the way discovering and exploring new data sets and define new metrics for the team and company. Author SQL and Java for integration into ETL framework to empower the entire organization. Teach team members how to construct their own dashboards and reports. Work with rest of data engineering team to set analytic and product best practices. Help design, measure team KPI’s. Use data to identify ways to move the KPIs. Use statistical knowledge to construct and evaluate AB and multivariate tests. Understand and share the root cause of changes the team makes to those KPIs. Communicate test results and findings to product and tech teams. Requirements 3+ years experience with analysis preferably for an ecommerce company BA/BS in Statistics, Economics, Math, Computer Science, or other quantitative field. MS/PhD preferred but not required Understanding of statistical analysis, experience with packages such as R, pandas. Solid understanding of statistical modeling/machine learning/ data mining/ recommender systems concepts. Amazing written and verbal communication skills SQL Fluent with some development experience in at least one scripting language ( Python, R, sh, etc.) Experience working with large data sets within MPP databases and MapReduce paradigm a plus Ability to initiate and drive projects to completion with minimal guidance Comfortable with *nix The ability to communicate the results of analyses in a clear and effective manner Experience working with mobile and website event data to perform behavioral analytics and AB/multivariate testing Apply Apply Later ? Stratton, VT) Self-managed paid vacation and sick time Ping-pong. Lots of ping-pong A gym membership on us Collaborative work spaces The most delicious baked goods, courtesy of our Office Manager Ready to join the x.ai team? We’re a fast-growing band of data and science geeks, working out of our “garage” – swanky highrise in Downtown Manhattan – to invent something new! We’re looking for some of the best and brightest to join us. Find a list of superheroes we are looking for below, but please pause and go read our pledge – it is the most important part of our on-boarding package and we want every new member to read it carefully, then read it again, and finally truly commit to it. We think it paints a very honest picture of who we are – and what we believe in. Open Positions NLP Data Scientist Apply Who we are x.ai is building a virtual personal assistant based on natural language understanding (NLP) and dialogue modeling. Our start-up began 2 years ago and we have successfully gone through $23M round-B funding. We have an awesome dataset, an awesome team of data scientists and an equally awesome NLP challenge. We have the ability to quickly produce labeled datasets and test novel NLP techniques, including semantic parsing, deep learning (Convolutional, Recurrent, Recursive neural nets), and various forms of dialogue modeling (e.g. POMPDs). We are looking for PhD-level candidates (or equivalent) with a strong background in either semantic parsers, entity extraction from text, or human-agent dialogue modeling. The candidate is expected to be able to design, implement and lead the evolution of one of our critical NLP tasks together with a team. While x.ai has a strong engineering support team for data science, the candidate is expected to understand the challenges involved in the design of production-ready, scalable algorithms. NLP Data Scientist will Lead in the design and implementation of a semantic parser or similar NLU component Create large labeled datasets on which to carry out various forms of supervised/unsupervised learning / model testing Interact with data engineers and software engineers to make algorithms scalable and production-ready Help in the overall online product architecture design to speed up full machine automation Ideal Candidate Strong background in semantic parsing, dialogue modeling, or information extraction from written natural language. Proficiency in at least one modern programming language such as Scala or Python. Ability to effectively share knowledge and mentor more junior team members PhD in quantitative degree and/or relevant experience Data Scientist Apply Who we are At x.ai, we are building an artificial intelligence powered personal assistant. The software will schedule meetings for our customers automatically without subjecting them to the typical back and forth over email negotiating when and where to meet someone. We are looking for a smart, self-motivated, and enthusiastic individual to join us on the journey in building the artificial intelligence of the future. You’ll get to work side by side with a small team of serial entrepreneurs moving at breakneck speed. A Data Scientist will Design, develop and implement statistical models to carry out various novel aspects of classification and information extraction from unstructured text, such as emails or email threads Using a combination of judgement and experience, create hypotheses to confront complex Natural Language Processing problems Be capable of designing stringent tests of these hypothesis and use results to guide further development towards performance optimization Familiar with or eager to learn various advanced statistical techniques to solve different optimization and constraint problems related to automating the coordination of people’s schedules and derivation of implicit and explicit preferences from email-related data Be capable of visualizing and communicating data science concepts to other team members, and seek meaningful feedback from them Ideal Candidate PhD in quantitative degree and/or relevant experience Strong statistics background, ideally experience with Natural Language Processing techniques; loves building mathematical and probabilistic models and algorithms Code experience in a production environment; familiar with data structures, parallelism and concurrency Intellectually curious, collaborative, self-motivated, fast learner that comfortable working in a dynamic environment tackling challenging problems Bonus: Experience with Scala, Python, AWS, and MongoDB; implementation experience with supervised and unsupervised machine learning algorithms Growth Engineer Apply Who we are At x.ai, we are building an artificial intelligence powered personal assistant. The software will schedule meetings for our customers automatically without subjecting them to the typical back and forth over email negotiating when and where to meet someone. We are looking for a smart, self-motivated, and enthusiastic individual to join us on the journey in building the artificial intelligence of the future. You’ll get to work side by side with a small team of serial entrepreneurs moving at breakneck speed. A Web Application Engineer will Evolve Human-Machine interaction to improve data collection for our information-hungry AI Develop clever ways to capture both implicit and explicit human preferences Participate in design and implementation of new features Evolve frontend architecture Integrate with various external APIs Ideal Candidate Build maintainable, well tested and scalable code Excellent product sense; evolve features to provide better user experience constantly Awesome at JS/HTML/CSS Able to find the right tool for the job. Quickly evaluate different libraries but not afraid to roll your own stuff Experience with Node.js, Angular, and integration testing with Selenium Want to be part of a passionate and collaborative team, looking to make a mark in the world VP of Customer Acquisition Apply Who we are At x.ai, we are building an artificial intelligence powered personal assistant.The software will schedule meetings for our customers automatically without subjecting them to the typical back and forth over email negotiating when and where to meet someone. We are looking for a smart, self-motivated, and enthusiastic individual to join us on the journey in building the artificial intelligence of the future. You’ll get to work side by side with a small team of serial entrepreneurs moving at breakneck speed. You love your customers and the idea of being able to magically schedule meetings using Artificial Intelligence – and you are eager to tell this sexy story to EVERYBODY! A VP of Customer Acquisition will Own the responsibility of driving up MMS (Monthly Meetings Scheduled) and hit MMS Targets as provided by Management. Take advantage of the inherent viral opportunities of a meeting scheduling product. We expect super creative “growth hacks” and innovative solutions to increase reach, activation, engagement – and a viral coefficient which supports the ambitious growth. Drive CAC down CLTV up! Ideal Candidate You signed up hundreds of thousands of users in a B2C2B like setting before – and you’ll look like that first head of Customer Acquisition at Dropbox, Evernote or similar. 5+ years of experience with digital marketing or online advertising including budget management, specifically with Social, Search and Email. Experience with internet marketing and sophisticated campaign tracking and analytics, specifically tracking of lead generation and acquisition programs Experience with strategizing, planning and implementing integrated marketing programs Strong project management skills Technical Skills – ability to translate business issues into technical language and vice versa. Hands on experience in Multivariate Testing and Landing page optimization A Can-Do attitude and is goal oriented, delivering results no matter what! Customer Acquisition Analyst Apply Who we are At x.ai, we are building an artificial intelligence powered personal assistant. The software will schedule meetings for our customers automatically without subjecting them to the typical back and forth over email negotiating when and where to meet someone. We are looking for a smart, self-motivated, and enthusiastic individual to join us on the journey in building the artificial intelligence of the future. You’ll get to work side by side with a small team of serial entrepreneurs moving at breakneck speed. The Analyst will play a critical role in understanding our customers, identifying growth tactics that work and those that don’t, and improving the performance of paid customer acquisition tactics and other product marketing. She will work with senior team members to assess qualitative and quantitative methods, define success metrics and data sources, data integration, channels, customer targets. Leverages testing capabilities to ensure best performing solutions are identified. Provide reports and dashboards with recommendations. Responsibilities Monitor data quality using basic statistical techniques to improve confidence in the data used for analysis. Evangelize a measurement culture and contribute to analytics documentation (e.g., data dictionary, variable map) using existing x.ai knowledge management tools to provide a reference repository for the organization. Participate in evaluation of digital analytics technologies based on established criteria in order to satisfy business needs. Compile metadata to categorize values for analysis and reporting (e.g., products, campaigns, location, scoring, and flags). Document analyses requested and completed in a database to maintain institutional memory so that analyses are not repeated without due cause and so that analysis recommendations are consistent and never contradictory between projects. Contribute to the ongoing maintenance of an institutional memory resource so that analysis requests are not repeated without due cause, and analysis recommendations are consistent and not contradictory between projects. Gather business requirements for data collection to provide implementation guidance to the technical team. Build models (e.g., explanatory, predictive) using statistical tools to address business questions. Execute analysis (e.g., segmentation, campaign) using analytic and/or statistical/applied statistical tools (e.g., Excel, R or Directly from MongoDB) to address business questions, issues, and opportunities. General Application Not seeing an opening for you, but think you have what it takes? Apply “What I love about x.ai is that you can choose from a list of interesting problems and take ownership of the piece you like the most. The team has some really smart, passionate people from very diverse backgrounds all working together to solve an unsolved problem. This provides the perfect environment to learn, grow and have fun while you’re at it “ — Nikhil Raju, Data Scientist “As a marketer, there is nothing more exciting than working at a company that truly focuses on its product as its core. Amy is set to take over the world—well, for scheduling meetings—and it’s amazing to have a front row seat alongside such a strong and inspiring team” — Brian Coulombe, Customer Acquisition Director “I’m constantly impressed by the people around me. With everyone super focused on the task of scheduling meetings, there is no shortage of energy, passion or talent around the office. Return to the home page Printable Format Job Description - Statistician (1604269) Job Description Statistician - 1604269 Description eXelate, a Nielsen® company, is the leading provider of data technology powering the digital marketing ecosystem. Our customer data cloud™ provides the industry’s only unified customer profiles, which connect identities across all channels and devices - including display, video, audio, offline, mobile and smart TVs - enabling marketers to engage individuals and households with personalized messages to drive performance at scale. eXelate’s data marketplace is the largest 3rd-party cross-device data set in the world with over 5B unique users and devices. eXelate was acquired by Nielsen in March of 2015. Nielsen brings to bear the market’s most powerful proprietary data assets, and together we are helping the world’s biggest brands make better and faster marketing and media decisions, we are permanently disrupting the landscape of audience measurement. This hands-on position reports to our VP, Analytic Solutions and will take a leading role in the creation of analytical strategies designed to maximize the value of our data, all while playing an instrumental role in the development of eXelate’s DMP related products and services. The Data Scientist will be responsible for ensuring that our data products are of the highest quality, through prototyping (what –ifs) analyses and supporting pilot programs for R&D purposes.  The primary areas includes – but are not limited to – trend analyses, identifying gaps for improvements in coverage, representation/ sampling, bias reduction, and indirect estimation as well as  data integration and harmonization. Responsibilities Significantly contribute to the development of eXelate’s data-related products and services Develop and maintain ongoing data exploratory analyses against internal and client-provided data Help the business teams solve complex analytical challenges Work with our R&D team to embed analytical technology into our DMP platform Conduct studies, tests and use advanced statistical techniques to build solutions that optimize the quality and performance of the company’s data Qualifications Requirements Advanced degree in statistics or related fields (such as econometrics or sociology) required Minimum of 2+ years relevant experience in trend analyses, multivariate statistics (parametric/ non-parametric), sampling, bias reduction, indirect estimation, data aggregation techniques, automation, and generalization In depth knowledge of the advanced techniques and tools common to the statistics / data science world such as R and/or Python (SAS and/or SPSS alone is insufficient) Strong attention to detail and excellent quantitative and qualitative analytical ability Working experience with relational database management system (RDBMS) and/or the Hadoop ecosystem, with a strong knowledge of SQL, Hive, and/or Pig Experience in demography, particularly regarding the size and distribution of characteristics among populations Experience in marketing analytics, including marketing response modeling and customer segmentation and / or online media and targeting a big plus Nielsen is committed to hiring and retaining a diverse workforce. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action-Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability status, age, marital status, protected veteran status or any other protected class. *LI-MJ1 Job : New Acquisition Primary Location : North America-US-NY-New York Organization : eXelate Schedule : Full-time Shift : Day Travel : Yes, 15 % of the Time © The Nielsen Company. All Rights Reserved. Privacy Policy Terms of Use

post_text: Bank Of America Job - Quantitative Finance Analyst , New York, NY, United States Skip to main content Menu Navigation Home Our Company with submenu Our Company with submenu Overview Our Business Working Here with submenu Working Here with submenu Overview Culture, Inclusion, People Military & Veterans Benefits & Advantages Career Development & Learning Recruitment Tips Locations Career Areas Search Jobs Events Applicants with Disabilities Change Location Change Location Argentina Australia Bahamas Bahrain Belgium Brazil Canada Cayman Islands Chile China Colombia Costa Rica France Germany Greece Hong Kong India Indonesia Ireland Isle of Man Israel Italy Japan Jersey Lebanon Luxembourg Malaysia Mexico Monaco Netherlands Norway Panama Peru Philippines Poland Portugal Russia Saudi Arabia Singapore South Africa South Korea Spain Sweden Switzerland Taiwan Thailand Turkey United Arab Emirates United Kingdom United States Uruguay Venezuela Search Jobs Quantitative Finance Analyst New York, NY, United States Job number: 16018305 Back to job search results Apply Now for this job > Job description Responsible for independently conducting quantitative analytics and modeling projects. Responsible for developing new models, analytic processes or systems approaches. Creates documentation for all activities and works with Technology staff in design of any system to run models developed. Incumbents possess excellent quantitative/analytic skills and a broad knowledge of financial markets and products. The purpose of the Counterparty Credit Risk Analytics team in the Global Risk Analytics Organization is to build, test and document simulation and pricing models used to quantify counterparty credit risk for credit risk limits and capital (RWA). The team works very closely with the FO CVA quant team and there is a deliberate effort to ensure model convergence across applications where appropriate. Further, the team is responsible for general quantitative support in connection to trading platform migrations, other system changes and to a limited extent trade support. As part of the CCRA Quant team, the Quantitative Financial Analyst will be primarily responsible for measuring counterparty credit risk (CCR) for all lines of businesses in Global Banking and Markets (GBAM). His/her primary focus will be on the fixed income and currency derivative products, but may also cover other traded products ( commodities, equities, credit) in the Bank’s IMM framework. The role will be in enhancing and maintaining pricing and simulation models, but may extend to overall exposure calculations (aggregation/collateral modeling), back testing methodology, on-boarding new trade types to the regressor framework etc. Qualifications Required Skills: 1.  Excellent knowledge of derivative products, particularly Interest Rates and FX, and financial market dynamics with approximately 4-7 years experience. 2.  Monte Carlo Simulation in Financial Modeling, Stochastic Calculus, Knowledge and Understanding of Advanced Modeling Theories 3.  Strong computer programming skills.( C++, Python, VBA, SQL) 4.  Very strong communicator, written and verbal 5.  Ability to work on multiple projects simultaneously Highly Desired Skills: 1.  Quantitative experience in counterparty risk analytics and/or CVA 2.  PhD or M.S. degree in a quantitative discipline or finance/economics 3.  Familiarity with Basel III concepts and metrics 4.  Familiarity with LaTeX tools Posting Date : 04/11/2016 Location : US-NY-New York Travel : Yes, 5 % of the Time Full / Part-time : Fulltime Hours Per Week : 40.00 Shift : 1st Shift Already have a candidate profile? Research Analyst Business Development | New York City, NY Job Description Tastemade is connecting the world through video! Who are we? Would you consider yourself a food & travel lover? Do you get excited about bringing people together over a great meal? Does the idea of working at a company that is at the forefront of game changing media and technology make you giddy? If you answered yes to all of these questions, then keep reading! Tastemade is a community of food & travel lovers on a mission to connect the world through video. We are passionate about creating and distributing high quality, engaging and shareable food, travel, and lifestyle themed content all over the world. We tell stories. We entertain. We are the food & travel destination for the millennial audience. We are looking for passionate people who want to change the world and make a difference. People that are driven to disrupt the status quo and not looking for just another job. We’re currently seeking a Research Analyst to join our team. This person will work closely with the Account Execs and Sales Team by providing research data to help with sales positioning. Who you are: Strategic Storyteller. You’re a well-rounded, experienced researcher who loves gathering data and determining the “why” of results. Analytically Minded. You’re skilled at analyzing a variety of factors, from the small details to the bigger picture. Calm. You’re able to keep focused and think logically in a fast-paced environment. What you’ll do: Create strategic and customized research with actionable insights and visually compelling formats Analyze, mine and interpret data to present to team Provide audience tracking and trending reports across multiple platforms Use trend and marketplace knowledge to assist with ad sales leads, strategies and tactics Track the pacing of the actual ratings vs. the budget and rate card estimates Strategize with the ad sales team to develop competitive positioning and materials to secure ad business Respond to and fulfill day-to-day research requests from the Sales Team Be an industry expertise by maintaining in-depth knowledge of competitors and media landscape via trades and syndicated resources What you’ll bring: 5+ years sales media research experience in digital a must Must be well versed in Keynote, Microsoft Powerpoint, Excel and Word Excellent oral and written communication skills Great organizational, analytical and problem solving skills Great interpersonal skills and able to multitask are necessary Experience presenting research data A passion for Tastemade and a positive, upbeat attitude! Perks: Competitive salary Stock options Flexible vacation days and 11 Paid Holidays Medical, Dental, Vision, LTD, Life EAP and 401K benefits Apple iMac, MacBook or equivalent hardware Colleagues who are fellow food & travel lovers! Africa Arab States Asia and the Pacific Europe and the Commonwealth of Independent States Latin America and the Caribbean About Us Publications News Centre Multimedia English Español Français United Nations Development Programme Our Work Sustainable Development Goals Blog Home About Us Jobs All Vacancies By group Governance and Peacebuilding (33) Sustainable Development and Poverty Reduction (50) Resilience and Climate Change (47) Crisis Response (29) HIV, Health and Development (11) Gender Equality (53) Management (60) Other (1) By location Africa (68) Arab States (46) Asia and the Pacific (51) Europe & the Commonwealth of independent States (22) HQ and Other (47) Latin America and the Caribbean (12) Internship – Statistics and Data Analysis Support to HDRO Location : New York, UNITED STATES OF AMERICA Application Deadline : 18-Apr-16 (Midnight New York, USA) Time left : 1d 2h 14m Additional  Category : Management Type of Contract : Internship Post Level : Intern Languages Required : English Starting Date : (date when the selected candidate is expected to start) 16-May-2016 Duration of Initial Contract : Three (3) months Refer a Friend Apply Now Background The mission of the Human Development Report Office (HDRO) is to advance human development with the goal to contribute to the expansion of opportunities, choices and freedoms. HDRO works towards this goal by promoting innovative new ideas, advocating practical policy changes, and constructively challenging policies and approaches that constrain human development. HDRO works with others to achieve change through writing and research, data analysis and presentation, and outreach and advocacy work. The objective of this internship is to provide the intern with the opportunity to learn about the Human Development approach and current international development issues; and investigate and learn about different sources of data that are useful for the work of the office. In particular, the intern will be able to contribute through research and data analysis to the Human Development Report 2016: Human Development – the Way Ahead. Duties and Responsibilities The intern will be supervised by the chief of statistics and will work closely with the team on the preparation of the Human Development Report 2016. In particular, s/he is expected to deliver the following tasks: Provide assistance for quantitative and qualitative background research for the report; Review and verification of statistical materials for the 2016 Report; Support the team in analysis and presentation of human development statistics; Assist in identification of data sources and preparation of datasets; Assist in fact checking and proof reading; Support other activities as requested. At the end of the internship, s/he will have identified and worked with two data sets and conducted data analysis on aspects related to the report. Competencies Corporate Competencies: Demonstrates integrity by modeling the UN’s values and ethical standards; Promotes the vision, mission, and strategic goals of UNDP; Displays cultural, gender, religion, race, nationality and age sensitivity and adaptability; Treats all people fairly without favoritism. Functional competencies: Strong organizational and research skills; Excellent analytical, communication, and writing skills; Excellent interpersonal skills; Work under minimum supervision and tight deadlines. Required Skills and Experience Education: Currently enrolled in a Master’s or Ph.D. Program in economics, statistics, or social sciences. Experience: Familiar with the Human Development concept; Experience with and knowledge of Stata and Excel. Language: Fluent in English. Intern’s Expenses/Arrangements: Interns are not financially remunerated by UNDP.  All costs connected with an intern's participation in the program must be borne by the student, who will have to obtain financing for subsistence and make his/her own arrangements for travel (including to and from the office), visas, accommodation, etc. UNDP accepts no responsibility for the medical and life insurance of the intern or costs arising from accidents and illness incurred during an internship. Subsequent Employment: The purpose of the Internship Programme is not to lead to further employment with UNDP but to complement an intern’s studies. Therefore, there should be no expectation of employment at the end of an internship. Click here for important information for US Permanent Residents ('Green Card' holders). UNDP is committed to achieving workforce diversity in terms of gender, nationality and culture. Individuals from minority groups, indigenous groups and persons with disabilities are equally encouraged to apply. All applications  will be  treated with the strictest confidence. Refer a Friend Apply Now If you are experiencing difficulties with online job applications, please contact jobs.help@undp.org . Quantitative Analyst The D. E. Shaw Group Locations New York , United States Salary/Rate Competitive Job Sectors Hedge Funds , Information Technology Career Levels Entry/Junior , Mid Level Position Type Permanent Employment Type Full Time Start Date ASAP Posted 11 Apr 2016 Post Expires 06 Jun 2016 The D. E. Shaw group is a globally prominent investment and technology development firm based in New York City, with offices around the world. We offer a collegial work environment and high-caliber colleagues from diverse backgrounds—everything from mathematicians and computer scientists to philosophers, musicians, and journalists. Our culture combines some of the best aspects of academia, finance, and technology. We pride ourselves on adhering to the highest standards of ethics and performance, but in our offices you’ll see more flip-flops than suits—we have no dress code, and our meritocratic culture gives employees the opportunity to make significant contributions early on in their careers. If you’re intellectually curious, energized by ambitious goals, and willing to take on a new challenge, we’d like to hear from you. Quants at the D. E. Shaw group apply mathematical techniques and write software to develop, analyze, and implement statistical models for our computerized financial trading strategies. Keen insight and innovation are essential for creating solutions for trading profitably in markets around the globe. Specific responsibilities range from examining trading data to increase profitability, decrease risk, and reduce transaction costs, to conceiving new trading ideas and devising the simulations needed to test them. Successful quant candidates have traditionally been exceptionally talented students at the top of their respective math, physics, engineering, computer science, and other technical and quantitative programs. While Ph.D.’s in these fields are common, many of our quants join us with undergraduate or master’s degrees. A considerable number have competed successfully in the United States and International Math Olympiads, as well as the Putnam Competition. Members of our highly versatile team possess the wide range of quantitative and programming abilities necessary to solve challenging problems that are critical to the firm’s continued success. Interested students should apply directly through our website at: https://www.deshaw.com/recruit/jobs/Ad/QFJ/Quant Members of the D. E. Shaw group do not discriminate in employment matters on the basis of race, color, religion, gender, pregnancy, national origin, age, military service eligibility, veteran status, sexual orientation, marital status, disability, or any other protected class. Job: Prospect Research Data Analyst - The Chronicle of Philanthropy Skip to main content Log In Subscribe Today Store JOBS Toggle navigation Search the Chronicle Home Magazine Resources Data Grants Webinars Jobs Favorites Search the Chronicle Job Details Prospect Research Data Analyst Mount Sinai Health System Posted: April 11, 2016 Location: New York, United States Position: Fundraising Field: Health, Research Salary: Not specified Website: http://www.mountsinai.org Application Deadline: Open until filled Category: Other fundraising, Prospect research Employment Level: Full-time Apply Now Save Job The Mount Sinai Hospital / The Mount Sinai School of
Medicine Human Resources Job Description Job Title Research Data Analyst Job Summary Reporting to the Director of Prospect Research and Strategy, the
Prospect Research Data Analyst is part of a seven-person team
responsible for prospect research, prospect identification and
prospect management.  The Prospect Research Data Analyst will
manage our team’s data and provide research to frontline
fundraisers.  We seek a candidate with strong organization,
communication and time management skills, an inquisitive mind, the
ability to distill complex information into clear, actionable
reports, and the talent and skill required to manage large amounts
of data. Duties and Responsibilities Run and create as needed, a variety of reports that ensure our
best prospects are properly assigned. Verify high-level capacity ratings on wealth-screened lists
using research resources like WealthEngine and LexisNexis. 
Provide notes and analysis of key findings. Assist prospect managers with portfolio coding and updates in
order to inform prospect strategy and effective movement toward
department goals. Complete prospect profiles at the verification and qualification
levels.  Assist with event research and follow-up. Collaborate on prospect identification projects as needed. Monitor select publications for significant articles on current
or potential MSHS prospects; inform colleagues of relevant news as
found. Other projects and activities as assigned by the team. *-indicates duty is “essential” as defined by the Americans with
Disabilities Act (ADA) Minimum Education Bachelor's degree required. Minimum Related Experience Minimum of two years' experience in development research or a
related field, such as library sciences, academic research,
financial analysis, or law/paralegal. Minimum Computer Skills MS Excel – Intermediate to Advanced MS Word – Intermediate to Advanced Experience with development research tools and resources. 
Experience with Raiser’s Edge is a plus. General Skills Must understand information management in a database structure,
particularly the ability to store, retrieve, and analyze data.
 Strong Excel skills required. Must be detail-oriented with the utmost commitment to protecting
the confidentiality of our donors and prospects and collecting
information ethically. Describe Work Environment Office Supervisory Responsibility This position generally reports to Director of Prospect Research

										Management Tools Subscription Center Year Round Intern - Statistical Analysis Locations: New York ID: 12235 Description Position Description: The candidate will help to assist in research projects and perform quantitative analyses in support of developing new products as well as part of specific commercial or competitive analyses. Principal Responsibilities: Perform analytical and quantitative analyses to support different projects. Qualifications: Strong knowledge of derivatives and economic theory Strong statistical and econometric analysis Strong written and verbal communication skills Programing expertise a plus Local candidates only Education Advanced degree in financial engineering or other relevant field preferred Relevant undergraduate area of focus is required Why CME? CME Group is the world’s leading and most diverse derivatives exchanges. Our technology drives the global economy by providing leading investment banks, hedge funds, proprietary trading firms and individual traders a venue to manage risk. Software engineers at CME write and maintain ultra-low-latency electronic trading platforms, risk management systems, and front end trading interfaces, all central to CME’s business and the financial industry. CME Technology interns will gain unparalleled experience in electronic trading and financial technology.  We are looking for motivated and talented software engineers that want to help solve some of the most complex challenges in financial technology. As the world’s leading and most diverse derivatives marketplace, CME Group ( www.cmegroup.com ) is where the world comes to manage risk. Based in Chicago, with offices in New York, London, Singapore, Calgary, Houston, São Paulo, Singapore, Tokyo and Washington D.C., our team of more than 2,500 employees has an impact on the global economy every day. We offer: The widest range of global benchmark futures and options available across all major asset classes; The most advanced trading technology; Industry-leading clearing and risk management capabilities; A relentless customer focus, serving leading investment and commercial banks, hedge funds, proprietary trading firms, pension funds, sovereign wealth funds, asset managers, corporations and individual traders; and, A great place to work. With this strong foundation in place, we are looking to continue growing our business in both listed and over-the-counter markets. To support this growth, we are seeking highly motivated individuals to help foster our corporate culture and uphold our core values of leading with conviction and integrity, advancing the global economy, building lasting relationships and acting with ingenuity every day. We hope you will consider joining our world-class team. Are you a returning applicant? Previous Applicants: Email: Password: If you do not remember your password click here . Return to the home page Printable Format Job Description - Optimization Research Scientist (1600128) Job Description Optimization Research Scientist - 1600128 Description 84.51° helps companies create sustainable growth by putting the
  customer at the center of everything. Using a sophisticated suite of tools
  and technology, we turn data into knowledge to help some of the world's
  leading retailers, CPG manufacturers and partners develop, nurture and
  embrace deeper relationships with their customer. We excel at challenging convention and pushing beyond what’s
  comfortable. The result is a more enlightened, more personal, remarkably
  dynamic approach to putting the customer at the center of every decision. There’s a much-needed revolution taking place in business. Discover a
new and improved customer-first commitment. Join us at 84.51º. General Description The Research Scientist
  will employ skills and experience to improve, create and innovate for our
  price and promotion optimization solutions, while anticipating and charting
  future research needs. The role has
  both strong research and computational components. Specifics The Research Scientist
  will create solutions in areas of importance to 8451, including, but not
  limited to: Optimization, both
  continuous and discrete Price, promotion, and
  assortment optimization Optimization under
  uncertainty Price games, as applied
  to fuel, revenue management, and markdown Allocation and
  logistical optimization Demand forecasting Model parameterization,
  training, and validation Project responsibilities
  run from requirement formulation, literature exploration, selection of method
  of solution, creation and prototype of solution, and working closely with
  other Scientific Researchers, Scientific Developers, and Software Engineers
  to productionize the solution. Qualifications Qualifications
and Preferred Skills Typical Research Skills
and Experience Include Expertise in continuous
and discrete optimization techniques. Experience with pricing,
pricing games, and prediction as applied to consumer goods, fuel, revenue
management, and markdown. Experience in demand
modeling and demand model parameterization and tuning. Appreciation of
computational/efficiency considerations in designing methods of solution. Expertise in formulating
and solving discrete, continuous, and stochastic optimization problems. Experience in supply chain
optimization. Experience designing and
conducting statistical measurements. Solid background researching
statistical machine learning methods, especially forecasting, supervised
learning, classification and classification trees, Bayesian methods. Application
of machine learning techniques to regression, classification, prediction, and
clustering.to problems that arise in retail, manufacturing, and market science . Desired
Computation Skills Include C++ development or
prototyping expertise. Experience with a
Unix/Linux and .NET environments. Experience with R. Experience with
multi-threaded and parallel algorithm design. Ability
     to create computationally efficient solutions, applying techniques from
     statistics, machine learning, and optimization (continuous or discrete). Experience with Big Data
concepts, tools and architecture. Experience with methods on
transaction data and near real-time solutions Education The
successful candidate will have a PhD in computer science, computer engineering,
mathematics and statistics, operations research, or related subject; and/or
extensive work or other experience demonstrating expertise utilizing these
skills. Alternative education with extensive experience demonstrating track
record with R&D projects will be considered. title: STATISTICIAN
summary: The "Natural Capital Accounting and Valuation of Ecosystem Services Project" (hereafter project) seeks to advance the knowledge agenda on environmental and...
post_text: UN Careers Home | FR | Login | UN.org | Site map | Contact us {1} ##LOC[OK]## {1} ##LOC[OK]## ##LOC[Cancel]## {1} ##LOC[OK]## ##LOC[Cancel]## Your email has been successfully sent. Job Opening Posting Title: STATISTICIAN Job Code Title: STATISTICIAN Department/Office: DEPARTMENT OF ECONOMIC AND SOCIAL AFFAIRS Duty Station: NEW YORK Posting Period: 07 April 2016 - 06 May 2016 Job Opening Number: 58374 Staffing Exercise N/A United Nations Core Values: Integrity, Professionalism, Respect for Diversity Apply Now Special Notice This JO refers to a capacity development project position subject to availability of post and/or funds. The initial appointment is for one year and extension of the appointment is subject to continuation of the project's mandate, priorities and/or the availability of the funds. Org. Setting and Reporting The "Natural Capital Accounting and Valuation of Ecosystem Services Project" (hereafter project) seeks to advance the knowledge agenda on environmental and ecosystem accounting and, test ecosystem accounting and valuation. The project will be managed by the UN Statistics Division and is expected to cover a period of three years. This position is located in the Economic Statistics Branch, Statistics Division, Department of Economic and Social Affairs (DESA). The position is to lead the planning, implementation and monitoring of the project work programme. The incumbent of the post reports to the Chief of the Environmental-Economic Accounts Section. Responsibilities Under the overall supervision of the Chief of the Section, the Statistician will be responsible for the following duties: •Plans and contributes to the project work programme •Prepares progress reports and other technical documentation for the project work programme •Plans and organizes technical advisory activities for national capacity building for the testing of the SEEA Central Framework and the SEEA Experimental Ecosystem Accounting through missions, consultations and training workshops. •Prepares technical documents for international, intergovernmental and expert group meetings and assists in drafting relevant reports in environmental-economic accounting. •Undertakes methodological research with regards to the development and revision of standards on statistical concepts, definitions and classifications in environmental and ecosystem accounting •Develops new or improved statistical methods and quantitative models for environmental and ecosystem accounting. •Maintains close liaison and co-operation within the field of responsibility throughout the organization and with other relevant national and international institutions to ensure full co-ordination and to avoid duplication of efforts. •Organizes and participates in seminars, working groups and expert meetings on environmental economic accounting as a technical resource person. •Performs other duties as assigned. Competencies PROFESSIONALISM: •Ability to formulate new strategies and technical approaches with respect to statistical development. •Shows pride in work and in achievements. •Demonstrates professional competence and mastery of subject matter. •Is conscientious and efficient in meeting commitments, observing deadlines and achieving results •Is motivated by professional rather than personal concerns. •Shows persistence when faced with difficult problems or challenges. •Remains calm in stressful situations. •Takes responsibility for incorporating gender perspectives and ensuring the equal participation of women and men in all areas of work. COMMUNICATION: •Speaks and writes clearly and effectively. •Listens to others, correctly interprets messages from others and responds appropriately. •Asks questions to clarify, and exhibits interest in having two-way communication •Tailors language, tone, style and format to match audience. •Demonstrates openness in sharing information and keeping people informed. TEAMWORK: •Works collaboratively with colleagues to achieve organizational goals; •Solicits input by genuinely valuing others’ ideas and expertise; is willing to learn from others. •Places team agenda before personal agenda. •Supports and acts in accordance with final group decision, even when such decisions may not entirely reflect own position •Shares credit for team accomplishments and accepts joint responsibility for team shortcomings. Education Advanced university degree (Master’s degree or equivalent) in statistics, mathematics, economics, environmental management, physical sciences or related field.  A first-level  university degree in combination with qualifying experience may be accepted in lieu of the advanced university degree. Work Experience A minimum of seven years of progressively responsible experience in the analysis and dissemination of statistical data or areas related to the assigned duty of the post is required. Experience on national accounting, environment statistics or environmental-economic accounts is desirable. Experience with managing large geo-spatial data is desirable. Knowledge on ecosystem modelling is desirable. Experience in organizing and implementing projects on ecosystem assessment or related field is highly desirable. Languages English and French are the working languages of the United Nations Secretariat. For this post, fluency in oral and written English is required;knowledge of the other is desirable. Knowledge of another UN official language is an advantage. Assessment Evaluation of qualified candidates may include an assessment exercise which may be followed by competency-based interview. United Nations Considerations Candidates will be required to meet the requirements of Article 101, paragraph 3, of the Charter as well as the requirements of the position. The United Nations is committed to the highest standards of efficiency, competence and integrity for all its human resources, including but not limited to respect for international human rights and humanitarian law. Candidates may be subject to screening against these standards, including but not limited to whether they have committed, or are alleged to have committed criminal offences and/or violations of international human rights law and international humanitarian law. The United Nations shall place no restrictions on the eligibility of men and women to participate in any capacity and under conditions of equality in its principal and subsidiary organs. (Charter of the United Nations - Chapter 3, article 8). The United Nations Secretariat is a non-smoking environment. Applicants are urged to follow carefully all instructions available in the online recruitment platform, inspira. For more detailed guidance, applicants may refer to the At-a-Glance on "The Application Process" and the Instructional Manual for the Applicants, which can be accessed by clicking on “Manuals” hyper-link on the upper right side of inspira account-holder homepage. Applications are pre-screened by the system according to the published requirements of the job opening on the basis of the information provided in the application.  In relation to the requirements of the job opening, applicants must provide complete and accurate information pertaining to their qualifications, including their education, work experience, and language skills.  Each applicant must bear in mind that submission of incomplete or inaccurate applications may render that applicant ineligible for consideration for the job opening.  Initial screening and evaluation of applications will be conducted on the basis of the information submitted.   Applications cannot be amended following submission. Candidates under serious consideration for selection will be subject to a reference-checking process to verify the information provided in the application. Job openings advertised on the Careers Portal will be removed at midnight (New York time) on the deadline date. No Fee THE UNITED NATIONS DOES NOT CHARGE A FEE AT ANY STAGE OF THE RECRUITMENT PROCESS (APPLICATION, INTERVIEW MEETING, PROCESSING, OR TRAINING). title: Data Scientist
summary: A mixture of analytical approaches will be employed including raw data mining (sql, nosql and programmatic approaches), data visualization, rules and supervised...
post_text:
Job Search Job Details Data Scientist Job
						              code: 18689 Job Category: Datamining City: NY Job Description: Data Scientist Location: New York, NY Type: Full Time Min. Experience: Mid Level Data Scientist PlaceIQ in New York City. Background: We are a rapidly growing venture funded ‘Big Data’ business pursuing a tremendous opportunity to become the market leader in the exploding location intelligence marketplace. PlaceIQ transforms time and location into context through a deep analysis of large amounts of often unstructured, unrelated, location based data including photos, place data, event data, digital and social data. This anonymous location context is used across a wide variety of markets, including our primary market, mobile advertising optimization. We are hiring a Data Scientist to join our team. The role: The candidate will analyze PlaceIQ hyperlocal data sources to develop accurate predictions of audience and behavior.  A mixture of analytical approaches will be employed including raw data mining (sql, nosql and programmatic approaches), data visualization, rules and supervised / unsupervised machine learning. We deal with extremely large data sets requiring the design and development of highly memory and cpu efficient methods.  We use a mixture of commercial, open source and home grown solutions.  This role will require familiarity with tools such as R and languages such as Python. Experience with horizontally scaling statistical algorithms via parallel processing methods is a plus.  Experience with geospatial tools is a plus. Key Responsibilities: • Raw data analysis – assessing quality, cleansing, structuring for downstream processing • Design and prototype of accurate and scalable prediction processes and programs • Functional and technical documentation of designs • Collaboration with software development team to implement software • Oversight of production systems – monitor accuracy and performance, resolve issues • Communication of results to partners and customers Requirements • Creative and pragmatic analyst with a passion for understanding audience location and behavior • Problem solving – ability to identify issues quickly and rapidly determine root cause and effective resolution approach • Data analysis – very solid data analysis skills including application of analytical techniques such as statistics, graphical analysis, mathematical modeling and hypothesis testing • Data management – familiarity with sql, nosql and programmatic techniques for manipulating data • Business solution development – ability to ramp quickly on marketing / audience domain • Software development - fundamental coding skills enabling building of small scripts and applications to implement support personal analytical work and develop prototypes for core company systems • Communication - excellent verbal and written communication skills, ability to communicate technical topics to non-technical individuals • Execution - ability to manage own time and work effectively with others on projects.  Working efficiently and delivering on commitments. Education / Experience • Bachelors degree in Statistics/Applied Math/Computer Science, related field or equivalent work experience required • Masters degree in Statistics, Applied Math strongly desired • 2+ years relevant job experience Compensation in cash and equity commensurate with the opportunity. Apply for This Job Return to the List of Opportunities IMPORTANT: Please remember to attach a Word document resume when applying!

Data Analytics Business Consultant - Alteryx Champion KPMG New York, NY United States At KPMG, we believe our people are our main and most integral resource. The KPMG culture is rooted in our values; our integrity and policy of open and honest communication builds trust and collaboration, while our flexibility and diversity creates a culture in which people share knowledge freely, and bring out the very best in each other. Our business services groups consist of professionals with a wide range of skills and backgrounds. We are currently seeking a Data Analytics Business Consultant, to join our New York office with multiple other location options. Responsibilities: Deliver client analytics projects leveraging and championing Alteryx applications as part of broader team of data scientists and industry/solution professionals by working with the appropriate technical resources to transform client problems into technical problems Translate business requirements and unstructured business issues into data analytic problems Work with data scientists to identify data needs, sources, and structure to support client issues Track and communicate project risks Proactively broaden and deepen client relationships by managing client relations with senior-level clients Establish and successfully execute engagements against financial targets, such as rate per hour and budgets, managed hour, and profitability Qualifications: Minimum five years of data analytics experience in a professional services firm or similar environment with a particular focus using Alteryx Demonstrated project management skills as well as the ability to efficiently manage projects and resources Detailed knowledge Alteryx and a strong understanding of business processes, including business operations, business delivery models and business revenue models Bachelors degree in a technical or quantitative field from an accredited college or university Client consulting skills including ability to build relationships with clients, potentially with C-level executives Strong communication skills with the ability to explain technical data analysis results to business people and business processes, challenges and issues to technical people KPMG offers a comprehensive compensation and benefits package. title: Data Scientist
summary: Lead/assist in methodology research and solution deployment across marketing analytics, scientific attribution, predictive modeling, segmentation, simulation,...
post_text: Careers Data Scientist Research & Development | New York, NY, United States Apply Send Jobvite Analytic Partners is a fast growing global consultancy that leverages innovative analytics and leading edge technology. As part of our dynamic team you will be responsible for helping the world’s most sophisticated marketers improve performance through more optimal spend allocation and enhanced marketing execution. We are looking for smart, talented and hardworking team members to support our growth. Description Analytic Partners is looking for Data Scientist candidates with strong analytic and problem solving skills. As an employee at Analytic Partners , you will have the opportunity to lead or assist in the methodology research that will directly impact the business planning processes and strategic vision for our clients. Data Scientists at AP are integral to both the Project and R&D teams, aligning research methodology tools and techniques with practical application to address the evolving needs of our clients. Responsibilities: Work with ‘big data’ via hands on data processing and leading edge statistical modeling Lead/assist in methodology research and solution deployment across marketing analytics, scientific attribution, predictive modeling, segmentation, simulation, forecasting and optimization Employ sophisticated analytic methodologies to help clients work through challenging marketing planning issues and business questions Identify innovative ways to drive efficiency in our data and modeling processes Collaborate as part of a team to recommend methodology solutions that will lead to more informed decisions and improved business performance Applicants should possess: Masters degree in Data Science, Statistics, Economics, Econometrics, Operations Research, Engineering, Marketing Analytics and or relevant analytic fields Experience with statistical software R, Python, SPSS, SAS, etc. Experience in large scale databases and data management – SQL and NoSQL Highly analytical with strong problem solving skills Strong attention to detail Strong verbal and written communication skills Desire and ability to work well with others in a team environment Strong working knowledge of Microsoft PowerPoint and Excel Quick learner, willing to learn and apply new knowledge Analytic Partners is a fast-growing marketing analytics consulting firm with global operations in the Americas, Europe and Asia Pacific. We provide highly-customized, results-oriented analytics and consulting services including marketing mix modeling, digital attribution, cross media attribution, pricing strategy, promotional effectiveness, forecasting and marketing optimization. AP is a client-focused, team-oriented organization where innovation and results are rewarded, and individuals can chart the course of their own careers. With a wide breadth of business experience and analytic techniques, we guide our clients (many of whom are Fortune 500 companies) toward more cost-effective and profitable marketing strategies. We help our clients make wiser choices for their marketing budget, build market share, increase revenue and profit – and achieve their best Return on Investment (ROI). The growth of Analytic Partners is made possible through the growth of our people. We focus on strong development of our employees through ongoing training, a wide variety of client opportunities across industries and analytic approaches, and a corporate culture centered on meritocracy. At Analytic Partners , your career is yours for the making – this is a company where innovation and results are rewarded, and you can chart the course of your own career. We offer a competitive salary and benefits package. Analytic Partners is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Please visit our website at www.analyticpartners.com . Apply « Back to Current Openings

title: Behavioral Research Scientist
summary: The Behavioral Research Scientist will conduct primary and secondary research, review materials from the rest of the Delos team for scientific integrity and...
post_text: Behavioral Research Scientist <iframe src="//www.googletagmanager.com/ns.html?id=GTM-ZC3S" height="0" width="0" style="display:none;visibility:hidden"></iframe> Privacy Policy Job Openings Behavioral Research Scientist Delos Labs – New York, New York Apply for this Job Department Delos Labs Employment Type Full-time Minimum Experience Experienced Compensation Salary for this position is competitive and commensurate with prior experience.  A comprehensive benefits package is included for full-time employees. Position Summary : The Behavioral Research Scientist will conduct original research that supports Delos’ pursuit to better understand the intersection between human health and wellness, with behavior, genetics and social and physical environments. The Behavioral Research Scientist will conduct primary and secondary research, review materials from the rest of the Delos team for scientific integrity and collaborate with other researchers, project managers, experts in the field and members of the Well Living Lab (a research center operated by Delos and the Mayo Clinic). Responsibilities: Employ an advanced knowledge of good scientific methodology to evaluate documentation, develop literature reviews and provide support for Delos initiatives. Activities and responsibilities include: Conducting qualitative and quantitative research Working with large data sets Generating documentation on various topics in health and wellness Coordinating and leading any activities required to meet the needs of the various departments at Delos Candidate Profile & Prerequisites: PhD in Behavioral or Cognitive Sciences or a related field OR Master’s degree and 5-6 years’ research experience A strong research and statistical background grounded in the fundamentals of human behavioral sciences, including broad knowledge of several of following topics, and advanced knowledge in at least one of the following: Social health psychology Sleep health Productivity Chronic and acute stress Cognitive psychology Classic and operant conditioning Genetics and behavior Habit formation and attenuation Demonstrated leadership and management skills; a strong record of research efforts Extensive outreach and communication experience with researchers, engineers, designers, and other professionals across a range of technical disciplines Willingness to learn in a fast-moving, deliverable-focused environment Genuine interest in finding and developing meaningful and innovative real-world solutions to improve human and environmental health and wellness Ardent detail-orientation, organizational skills, and commitment to delivering high quality work To Apply: Please submit your resume and cover letter through the following link: www.delos.bamboohr.com/jobs Applicants are selected based upon their qualifications for this position and without regard to the applicant’s race, color, ethnic or national origin, religion, creed, age, disability, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, pregnancy, marital or partnership status, citizenship or alienage status, veteran status, whether children are, may be or would be residing with a person, or any other characteristic protected by law. All inquiries about the position should be directed through this link. www.delos.bamboohr.com/jobs About Delos: As the pioneer of Wellness Real Estate™ and founder of the WELL Building Standard®, Delos is transforming our homes, offices, schools, and other indoor environments by placing health and wellness at the center of design and construction decisions.  The Delos platform includes research, consulting, merchandising, and programming and licensing innovative solutions for the built environment, creating spaces that nurture and promote human health and wellbeing. Exploring the intersection between humans and the built environment, Delos creates spaces that actively contribute to human health, performance and wellbeing by marrying the best innovations in technology, health, science, design, and enterprise. We see the built-environment as an asset to maximize human-potential and envision environments that enhance us. Environments that are proactive, enabling us to live better by cultivating better lifestyle choices and by solving health problems before they are created.  We have broadened the scope of environmental sustainability, extending the concept beyond the best of green technology to an integrated solution that addresses human sustainability. Our mission is to build a better world. Join us. summary: Proficiency in relational databases, OLAP tools, data mining, data structure, and data manipulation skills....
post_text: Senior Business Intelligence Analyst/Data Scientist Home Capital Group Worldwide Sign in Home Featured Jobs Investment Research & Trading Jobs Investment Operations Jobs Corporate & Human Resources Jobs Client & Customer Service Jobs Information Technology Jobs Marketing & Sales Jobs Accounting & Finance Jobs Facility & Office Services Jobs TAP (The Associate Program) Current Students New Graduates Working at Capital Community Involvement Diversity & Inclusion Meet Our Associates Rewards & Benefits Work Environment Join Our Talent Network Join Our Talent Network View All Jobs Home Featured Jobs Investment Research & Trading Jobs Investment Operations Jobs Corporate & Human Resources Jobs Client & Customer Service Jobs Information Technology Jobs Marketing & Sales Jobs Accounting & Finance Jobs Facility & Office Services Jobs TAP (The Associate Program) Current Students New Graduates Working at Capital Community Involvement Diversity & Inclusion Meet Our Associates Rewards & Benefits Work Environment Join Our Talent Network Join Our Talent Community View All Jobs Email similar jobs to me Join with LinkedIn Join with Facebook Join our Capital Group network Start Please wait... Share this Job Senior Business Intelligence Analyst/Data Scientist Apply now » Apply now Start apply with LinkedIn Start apply with Facebook Apply Now Start Please wait... Apply now × Apply for Job × × × Enter your email to apply Date: Apr 2, 2016 Location: New York, NY, US, 90071 Company: Capital Group Req ID: 870 Experience Level: Professional Other Location(s): Los Angeles (CA) Come grow with us At Capital Group, how we work is defined by shared values that include absolute integrity, respect and collaboration. But it’s more than that. It’s smart and highly driven people united in purpose to serve our investors and one another. Bring your energy and unique perspective to Capital and you’ll have the opportunity to grow with us professionally, personally, and financially. You’ll be part of a team that genuinely cares about helping you succeed. You’ll work alongside talented colleagues, many of whom build long careers while progressing through multiple roles, establishing lifelong friendships and making a difference in our communities. In return for your contributions, you’ll receive premier compensation and benefits, and a company-funded retirement plan that ranks among the most generous. Capital Group is in the midst of building out our Advanced Analytics team. We envision a group that specializes in applying predictive modeling techniques to guide the firm’s decision making at all levels. Whether it be a tactical decision in terms of determining ‘Next Best Product’ models, or spatial-geographic coverage optimization, or predicting the success likelihood or certain internal investments in the 5-7 year timeframe, the team’s goal is to infuse analytical frameworks into every decision. Teammates will collaborate together to deploy the latest machine learning techniques, on the latest platforms (Spark on Microsoft Azure), and develop 5 independent ‘Test Labs’ to set the stage for continuous learning. Importantly, we are looking for bright, creative professionals, who are passionate about the developing field of predictive science, and excited to see their work impact Capital Group everyday. As a Senior Business Intelligence Analyst based in New York or Los Angeles, you will perform analyses that provide decision support to Senior Management for North American Distribution (NAD) on strategic and business initiatives, serving as a technical and business expert on both internal and external data sources. Responsibilities : Collaborate with sales and marketing leadership on various aspects of strategic analysis, sales and marketing analytics, competitive analysis, and intelligence to support NAD in managing the business and making strategic decisions Creates analytical models to support sales-generating business initiatives, including prospecting and retention, leveraging a variety of programming languages, including SQL, SAS, SPSS and other 4GLs, and web tools, including Adobe SiteCatalyst, for data mining to provide insights and answer key questions as well as provide foundational reporting on client segment performance Serves as subject matter expert on the client segment, data structures, database schemas and database design for NAD’s data warehouse working with internal and external data sources to develop expertise for the assigned client segment Responds to ad hoc requests for information and analysis, functioning as key point of contact to understand, post_text: Careers Data Insights Analyst, Analytical Services Sales | New York, NY, United States Apply Send Jobvite We're seeking to hire a Data Insights Analyst to join our team in NYC. The Data Insights Analyst will be an individual contributor that will support IAS’s Causal Impact, User Exposure, and future measurement products.  The ideal candidate will have an exceptional quantitative and analytical background that will enable them to perform in-depth analyses as well the ability to communicate simply to a diverse audience.  This Insights Analyst will be the clients’ trusted go to expert and advisor on interpreting data and what actions to take base on it. The ability to create a compelling narrative and action plan specific to a variety of clients is critical.  The ideal candidate must be results oriented, organized, able to handle multiple priorities and concurrent discussions.  Candidate must be flexible, work well with others with minimum supervision in a fast paced, dynamic environment.  The growth potential for this role is limited only to the capabilities of the candidate. Responsibilities Serve as a day to day client facing analytics expert for Integral’s Marketer Analytics products Understand clients’ campaign measurement needs and educate them how to apply IAS solutions Responsible for analyzing data, developing insights, and presenting to clients in a clear cut and relatable way Work closely with data science, sales, client services managers, and clients (pre-, mid-, and post-campaign) to ensure a seamless customer experience for all things analytics related Dive deep to understand clients’ goals and KPI’s to craft insights and build data based narratives for clients Create stories from data analysis and communicate them to clients Build trust with client’s analytics and insights teams through education, consulting, and partnership Drive overall usage and adoption of Integral’s Marketer Analytics by agencies and direct advertisers Collect the “voice of the customer” to identify common needs that will inform future product direction Qualifications 3-5 years experience as a business analyst or similar role 3+ years in a client facing role BA/BS in a quantitative field such as math, statistics, engineering, computer science, economics, or business Digital advertising experience with emphasis on measurement and interpreting data Comfortable dealing with all stakeholders at a client ranging from a media planners, data scientists, and executives Technical and marketplace expertise with online media buying and selling, advertising technology Strong analytical and quantitative skills Outstanding prioritization, analytical, quantitative, and follow-up skills Proven ability to collaborate with cross-functional teams and disparate systems Excellent Microsoft Office skills, including a strong working knowledge of Excel Working knowledge of SQL, familiarity with data visualization software About Integral Ad Science Integral Ad Science is the leading global provider of actionable advertising intelligence data for buyers and sellers of digital media and is the industry's standard for rating media quality. Since launching the industry’s first preventative brand safety solution in 2009, powered by constant growth and innovation, Integral has evolved into a global media valuation platform that is essential to the buying and selling of quality media. Integral focuses on a comprehensive solution set that enables advertising to appear in quality environments and receive favorable exposure — while the sell side can monitor and control its quality and performance. Integral’s technology drives improved visibility, efficiency, and ROI for players across the digital media landscape. Integral Ad Science was named #37 on AdAge's list of Best Places to Work in the US (2015), #64 on Deloitte's Technology Fast 500™ (2015), #23 on Crain’s New York’s Fastest Growing Companies (2015), and Crain’s Best Places to Work in New York City (2013, 2014, 2015), #15 on Forbes Magazine's - America's Most Promising Companies (2015), and #115 on the Inc. 5000 list (2014). To learn more about us, please visit www.integralads.com or http://bit.ly/glassdoorIAS Equal Opportunity Employer: All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, protected veteran status, or disability status. Return to the home page Printable Format Job Description - Research Analyst (1605535) Job Description Research Analyst - 1605535 Description Overview Founded in 1923, Nielsen is the global authority on the consumer. We help over 20,000 clients, from Coca-Cola to Walmart to Apple to Disney, in 105 countries understand consumers and grow their businesses, every day. The company is organized into two areas: What Consumers Watch, serving media, telecom and tech industries; and What Consumers Buy, serving consumer goods, retail, financial services and automotive industries. Nielsen employs more than 35,000 associates worldwide and has headquarters in New York, USA and Diemen, the Netherlands. Nielsen became a public company in 2011 and joined the S&P 500 in 2013. Global revenues in 2012 were $5.6 billion. Nielsen is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer including Women, Minorities, Veterans and Individuals with Disabilities. Description The Consumer Packaged Goods (CPG) Sector of Nielsen Ad Solutions is seeking a Research Analyst to provide actionable insights to clients and to help the Sector continue its fast-paced growth. This Ad Solutions Sector provides clients with recommendations for improving the effectiveness and efficiency of their television and digital advertising based on real-time, real-world ad performance measurement. The Research Analyst will be responsible for generating value-added analyses of syndicated and custom advertising performance data to support on-going and ad hoc client business decisions. In particular, the Research Analyst will be responsible for compiling analysis results into a coherent narrative and turning the numbers into stories our clients can understand. Together with a Research Lead and Account Managers, the Research Analyst will develop creative and media placement recommendations to help clients optimize their advertising investment. Qualifications Responsibilities - Create in-depth research analyses through hands-on exploration of complex syndicated database; decide on the correct analytic approach(es). - Perform data extracts to deliver appropriate data - Analyze, mine and interpret syndicated and custom data and determine the “why” of the results; prepare the “story” using charts/graphs in Excel - Prepare scheduled and custom client-ready reports using PowerPoint - Work as part of a team to create research solutions - Initiate discussion / raise questions with manager when elements of the data are inconsistent with prior findings or expectations Required Skills - Bachelor’s degree in Marketing or related field - Knowledge of marketing and advertising a plus - Knowledge of CPG industry a plus - Very strong quantitative, data tabulation, analytic thinking and data mining skills - Advanced skills in the Microsoft Office suite of products (Excel, PowerPoint) - Knowledge of BRIO a plus - Strong written communication and interpersonal skills - Ability to deliver under deadlines - Effective organizational skills and ability to multi-task - Close attention to detail - Eager to learn and develop skills Job : Consulting- Analytics/Client Services Primary Location : North America-US-New York Organization : Ad Solutions - CPG Schedule : Full-time Shift : Day Travel : No © The Nielsen Company. All Rights Reserved. Privacy Policy Terms of Use

AIG Science is the hub for decision sciences at AIG.  The Science team offers an excellent work environment that provides the opportunity to use cutting edge techniques, to engage worthy problems and to work with other world-class professionals. Position Summary Our ideal candidate should possess the following: • Very strong background in one or more computational areas (Computer Science, Statistics, Economics, Physics, Computational Linguistics) • Proven facility with multiple modeling techniques • Exceptional programming skills in one or more platforms • The drive to deliver on commitments and an openness to new ideas • Master Degree (Preferably a PhD) • 10+ years of  relevant experience (will be flexed for exceptional candidates) Position Requirements: Responsibilities include but not limited to: • Understanding complex business challenges, designing scientific solutions, manipulating large data sets, using cutting edge machine learning or statistical modeling techniques and synthesizing insights • Building scalable solutions that create great business impact • Strong and effective communication (both written and verbal) with colleagues and business leaders • Continuously advancing your skills and those of others In addition, the ideal candidate needs to be familiar with the following techniques and tools, with an expert-level experience in some: • Expertise in one or more modeling/machine learning platforms as such as R, SAS, and Python • Experience with additional programming languages such as C++, Java, Matlab, Octave a plus • Classification methods (e.g., Neural Net, Logistic Regression, Decision Trees, KNN, SVM, Random Forest) • Regression methods (e.g., Linear, Nonlinear, Boosted Regression Trees ) • Clustering methods (e.g., K-means, Fuzzy C-means, Hierarchical Clustering, Mixture Modelling) • Time-series Modelling/Forecasting (e.g., AR, ARMA, GARCH, Exponential Smoothing) • Statistical Analysis (e.g., Hypothesis Testing, Experiment Design, Hierarchical Modeling, Bayesian Inference) • Familiarity with common computing environment (e.g. Linux, Shell Scripting) • Knowledge about Big Data related techniques (e.g., Map-Reduce, Hadoop, Hive, NoSQL) • Advanced skills in SQL
