title: Adaptive Instruction Analyst
summary: You’ll engage with our partners’ products, our data scientists, and our engineers. Ability to gather and review data from multiple sources, synthesize, and...
post_text:
Adaptive Instruction Analyst - Knewton - Job Board Go to our website » « Go back to job listings Adaptive Instruction Analyst Location: New York, NY Department: Adaptive Instruction Type: Full Time Min. Experience: Mid Level Knewton is poised to revolutionize education with the world's most powerful adaptive learning engine. We are a startup rich in eclectic personalities, are ridiculously dedicated, and are unified around a passion for democratizing education. We have also been recognized as a Technology Pioneer at the World Economic Forum in Davos and one of the top 25 best places to work by Crain’s New York Business. Our team is looking for an Adaptive Instruction Analyst. This is a cross-disciplinary role, equal parts pedagogical and technical. You will use an educator’s eye to validate and help iterate on the models that drive our recommendations and analytics. You’ll engage with our partners’ products, our data scientists, and our engineers. In carrying out this work, you’ll develop a knowledge of our learning ontology, our algorithms, the technologies and platforms that support our products, as well as educational applications across a variety of disciplines — and synthesize this knowledge into actionable tests of our products’ educational quality. If you’re adept at both independent research and collaborative discussion, then this may be the perfect way for you to join Knewton’s growing team of adaptive learning technologists. Primary Responsibilities Ensure that Knewton’s adaptive algorithms meet requirements and quality standards by performing quality and functional tests on our products Draw on pedagogical and domain knowledge to frame questions for tests, observational studies, and experiments Propose structured ways to improve our recommendations and analytics, based on experience and research Relentlessly look for and implement ways to automate tasks and increase the frequency, accuracy, and validity of our tests Requirements Bachelor’s or Master’s degree (with college-level calculus, linear algebra and stats to facilitate interactions with our models) Demonstrated experience in and passion for the field of education, and an ability to think broadly about the intersection of technology and education Professional experience with instructional design, cognitive science, quality assurance, or the educational technology landscape a plus Ability to gather and review data from multiple sources, synthesize, and perform statistical analyses using languages such as Python, R or another statistical package Demonstrated ability to debug code and data issues that arise Experience designing and independently conducting research Ability to solve practical problems in a self-directed manner and independently deal with a variety of concrete variables in situations where only limited standardization exists Proven capacity to work productively in cross-functional groups and on multiple, parallel projects Ability to speak effectively before groups of employees and external parties Scrupulous attention to detail and strong organizational, quantitative, and logical skills Strong written and verbal communication skills Forward this Position Recipient email address (one) Your name Your email address Enter a message (optional) Privacy & Terms

Located in the heart of Manhattan in the Union Square area, Knewton is building the world's most powerful adaptive learning engine, with the goal of making personalized and engaging education available to all. Knewton has been recognized as a Technology Pioneer for 2011 by the World Economic Forum in Davos and one of the top 25 best places to work by Crain’s New York Business. You’ll be coding the core algorithms, models, and services that drive the Knewton Adaptive Learning Platform, the thing that generates the spot-on, highly-personalized educational recommendations that maximize each student’s probability of success. Want to use tons of data to help figure out what students know, how they learn best, and how to help them learn more efficiently and effectively? If so, this job’s for you! This is an outstanding opportunity to: Work with and learn from the world's best engineers and data scientists Contribute to key engineering decisions regarding technical direction of team Quickly build world class consumer facing products THAT SEE DAYLIGHT Become an industry luminary – we are open sourcing our projects/codebase Engineers must have: A track record of writing high-quality, elegant code A willingness to learn and use Python and Java The potential and desire to rise into positions of technical leadership A passion for transforming education Not required but highly desired are: Experience with the Java Virtual Machine (JVM) Experience in machine learning and data mining, and with the R statistical package Familiarity with Amazon Web Services (AWS) and Unix Experience with open-source technologies Experience with big data processing using NoSQL techniques like Cassandra, Hadoop, Hive Perks include: Competitive salary and stock options As much paid vacation as you need to take Flexible hours High-quality equipment (default setup: a Mac laptop with a giant monitor) The opportunity to use cutting-edge machine learning and engineering techniques to transform and democratize education Apply for this job Powered by VentureLoop - post_text: Research Analyst job - UBMD Neurology (State University of New York at Buffalo) - Buffalo, NY | Indeed.com Find Jobs Find Resumes Employers / Post Job Sign in What: Where: Advanced Job Search job title, keywords or company city, state, or zip Research Analyst UBMD Neurology (State University of New York at Buffalo) - Buffalo, NY UBMD Department of Neurology (SUNY at Buffalo) is seeking a Research Analyst for its Multiple Sclerosis Center. The successful candidate will work closely with and provide research support to the Principal Investigator and other members of the Neurology/Neuropsychology research teams. This position involves active participation in multiple aspects of clinical research, including, but not limited to: 1) Recruitment and enrollment of study participants, 2) Database management and data analysis, 3) Tracking and monitoring of online survey data/website activity, 4) Correspondence with study participants through phone, email and/or in-person interaction. In addition the Research Analyst may be offered the opportunity to administer standardized cognitive testing to study participants. The qualified candidate will have a bachelor's degree in Social Sciences, Health Sciences or a related field. The qualified candidate must be familiar with data management and statistical software (SPSS). Clinical research experience and knowledge of clinical research practices, human subject research ethics and HIPAA guidelines are preferred. The ideal candidate is: team-oriented, personable, professional and dependable. He/she should demonstrate strong organizational skills with attention to detail and the ability to multi-task. In addition, strong interpersonal, verbal, telephone and written communication skills should be exhibited. Return to the home page Printable Format Job Description - Analytics Product Manager, VP (160034016) Job Description Analytics Product Manager, VP - 160034016 Job Description J.P. Morgan Private Bank J.P. Morgan Private Bank is a global wealth management leader that delivers the highest quality advice, service, and capabilities to wealth individuals and families in 36 countries around the world. It is the largest private bank in the U.S. and the third-largest worldwide in terms of total client assets. J.P. Morgan Private Bank enjoys relationships with 40% of the individuals on the Forbes Billionaires list. Our New York office (in New Jersey) is currently looking for creative and dynamic professionals for its Technology department. The Technology department is part of the Technology & Operations Hub based in New York, which services J.P. Morgan's American and international private banking business. The Technology department is responsible for application delivery, Business and Operations support & projects. Global Wealth Management (GWM) Analytics The GWM Analytics team is a new group within the GWM Technology space set up to extract value from GWM’s data. By identifying opportunities to provide insight, business intelligence and efficiency to traders, investors and advisors the Analytics team will directly contribute to the creation of shareholder value. The applications created to make use of GWM’s big data will be delivered as part of GWM’s strategic Connect platform using exciting modern, customizable, scalable technology in an agile environment and brought to market in partnership with the business, JP Morgan Intelligent Solutions, the corporate data strategists and the wider Investments technology community. Title: Senior Product Manager – Analytics VP New York Description The Development & Delivery Manager will be responsible for supporting the Analytics team in developing and delivering the end user solutions. This role is a mix of consulting (problem solving, client interaction), project management (leading the development and rollout of data/analytics driven products) and data analyses (understanding how to develop or work with data scientists to develop models that satisfy a business insight). The successful candidate will be able to help design solutions to meet specific client needs, establish a plan for their development and then lead the development and implementation. The position will offer an opportunity to: · Partner with a variety of business and technology stakeholders to solve business problems and provide strategic insights through data mining, analytics and modeling · Interact with senior leaders within GWM to drive and develop the analytics strategy · Derive a broad understanding of different businesses within GWM as well as external parties, and the opportunity to use data to drive business performance · Establish a grounding within the Big Data/Data Science space and disseminate this knowledge to the wider team Responsibilities will include: · Identify and define new product / solution opportunities (i.e., take high level ideas, pressure test feasibility, assess the market for the ideas, push POCs) · Engagement with end users and senior management in Technology to assess the feasibility and usefulness of a given product / solution · Plan and execute implementation of product build (day to day responsibility, project management, program management, agile software development management) · Manage the prioritization and the roadmap from concept to project completion A successful candidate will be able to: · Clearly articulate ideas (how will a product add value? for which clients/users?) · Clearly define analytics (and work with data scientists to execute the analytics) · Clearly lead a team to deliver a solution (big data architects, software developers, data scientists) · Create strategic visions and roadmaps for client engagement with data analytics solutions and/or process re-engineering · See value the value in GWMAI can add to groups both within and outside of GWM Tech · Drive decision making and solution delivery · Demo mockup, video and live presentations confidently to senior leads in technology and the business · Design solutions that look great and are fully interoperable with the Connect suite of solutions Qualifications Minimum Qualifications · BS degree, preferably in Computer Science / Engineering or similar analytical degree · 3+ years experience in Business Analysis/Development or Product/Project Management · Knowledge of agile software development methodologies · Evidence of working with either big data or analytics · Well balanced understanding of business relationships, business requirements, IT requirements, technical solutions, test strategy and approach plans and test plans · Strong analytical skills, leadership skills, writing skills · Expert in gathering and analyzing user requirements, defining technical solutions and creating technical documentation · Experience in creation of project plans, issues, risk and dependency management · Self-directed, self-motivated, independent worker · Exceptional project management, budget management, negotiation, interpersonal and organizational skills. Preferred qualifications · 5+ years experience in Business Analysis/Project Management · Financial Services Industry Experience, Wealth Management and Private Bank a plus · Big Data (Hadoop/equivalent) · Understanding asset classes equities, options, bonds, structured products, syndicates and other complex securities. · Product Manager Experience JPMorgan Chase is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer Disability/Veteran. Added - 04/15/16 Director of Engineering & Facilities Other Area(s) Allentown , Pennsylvania | Direct Hire Director of Engineering and Facilities

Summary

Directs and coordinates activities of engineering department to design, manufacture, and test components, products, and systems by performing the following duties personally or through subordinate supervisors.



Essential Duties and Responsibilities

Directs department activities to design new products, modify existing designs, improve production techniques, and develop test procedures.

Maintains current production equipment for manufacturing and directs the design of equipment to meet future production needs. Responsible for preventative and predictive maintenance process.

Directs department activities to maintain facilities (100,000 sf+). Responsible for facility services, maintenance, and the design, installation and maintenance of facility systems (HVAC, DI/RO water, electrical, compressed air, back-up power, etc). Coordinates work of contractors to maintain facility and systems.

Directs Process Improvement activities, including process improvements for quality, cost or customer satisfaction. Directs failure investigations, customer complaint investigations, and qualification of materials and suppliers.

Directs Validation activities including process, equipment, software, cleaning, environmental and other required validations.

Resolves problems using solutions that involve new techniques, technologies, or concepts Analyzes technology trends, human resource needs, and market demand to plan projects

Confers with management, production, Quality, and marketing staff to determine engineering feasibility, cost effectiveness, and customer demand for new and existing products

Performs job duties and tasks in compliance with Quality Assurance standards and requirements

Ensures job duties and tasks conform to FDA and ISO regulations.

Forecasts operating costs of department and directs preparation of budget requests.

Advises management of new developments which may affect profit, schedule, costs, customer relations, and/or inter-departmental relations

Provides direction and example for interpretation and application of company policies and procedures to the engineering activities


Maintains a working knowledge of new technologies which may improve operations, and develops recommendations accordingly


Maintains a working knowledge of safety policies and regulations to ensure duties of self and others are performed in a safe manner.

Supervisory Responsibilities

Directs three or more subordinate supervisors or Engineering Leads. Facilities and Engineering departments has 12 or more employees in total.

Responsible for the overall direction, coordination, and evaluation of these units.

Carries out supervisory responsibilities in accordance with the organization's policies and applicable laws including interviewing, hiring, and training employees; planning, assigning, and directing work; appraising performance; rewarding and disciplining employees; addressing complaints and resolving problems.

Physical Requirements

The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

The employee must regularly lift and /or move up to 25 pounds. While performing the duties of this Job, the employee is regularly required to sit and talk or hear. The employee is frequently required to use hands to finger, handle, or feel; reach with hands and arms; climb or balance and stoop, kneel, crouch, or crawl. The employee is occasionally required to stand and walk.



Qualifications

Thorough knowledge of FDAs Quality System Regulations (QSR).

Knowledge and experience in enzyme immunoassays or other medical device required. Exceptional oral and written communication skills and mathematics skills are required. Prior project management background and experience

Exceptional organizational skills and ability to manage multiple priorities required. Windows-based computer skills, familiarity with Microsoft Word and Excel required

Knowledge of statistics required, experience with sampling and SPC, and CAD software desired. Six Sigma Green Belt or Black Belt preferred.

Education/Experience

BS in Engineering required, Mechanical Engineering preferred.

Master's degree (M. S.) in Engineering, one of the sciences or equivalent; and/or MBA a plus Three to five years of prior experience in a similar position. title: Associate Talent Advocate, NYC
summary: Build relationships with technical candidates (primarily software engineers, data scientists, product managers, and designers)....
post_text:
Job Application for Associate Talent Advocate, NYC at Hired Apply Now Associate Talent Advocate, NYC at Hired (View all jobs) New York, NY We’re on a mission to help get everyone a job they love. Find the job you love here at Hired! ABOUT US Hired is a career marketplace for the world's knowledge workers. Starting with in-demand tech, sales and marketing roles, we’re bringing together job seekers with the companies who want to hire them. Users on the Hired platform receive objective guidance throughout the interview process from a dedicated Talent Advocate, as well as the ability to compare new opportunities side by side so they can make their next career move with confidence. Employers get access to a hand-picked pool of candidates who are interested in new roles, as well as unmatched transparency into competing offers so they can recruit and hire with insight. The end result is an efficient, effective and enjoyable experience that’s far faster than traditional methods. Hired is headquartered in San Francisco, with offices in more than a dozen cities in North America, Europe and APAC and plans to expand to a variety of industries and job categories. ABOUT THE ROLE An Associate Talent Advocate is the guide for job seekers while they go through the Hired platform. They utilize technology market expertise and coaching skills to support job seekers in identifying and securing the right career opportunities.  They deliver value by helping Hired users’ position themselves in the marketplace, prepare for interviews, and ultimately accept the best job offer. Ultimately, it is the job of the Associate Talent Advocate to help every job seeker have a “wow” experience using Hired. Our next Associate Talent Advocate will have a firm understanding of the local market and best practices in job searches. They’ll need to be process-oriented, strong communicators, and passionate about candidate experience as a new batch of 20-40 candidates is hand delivered to them weekly by our awesome marketing and curation team. Associate Talent Advocates are measured on how they create the best job search experience, not how many calls they make per day. We concentrate on measured candidate experience and simple marketplace success metrics focused on growth, experience, and efficiency. We love people who can own new projects from start to finish, work collaboratively with diverse teams, and manage themselves efficiently. The future of the role is limitless and we’re looking for people that can hone their current skills - and craft new ones - to be effective in other areas of the company. WHAT WE NEED YOUR HELP WITH Build relationships with technical candidates (primarily software engineers, data scientists, product managers, and designers) Prepare 20-40 new job seekers for the marketplace by helping them polish their profiles and understanding their goals As the batch cycle continues, process manage the existing candidates interviews and ensure they are prepared for phone screens, technical interviews, and onsite success Keeping dozens of hiring processes on track simultaneously - including providing guidance, gathering feedback and pushing job processes forward Developing new processes for matching job seekers with new job opportunities Providing feedback to the Hired product and  engineering team that will make the marketplace more efficient WHAT WE LOOK FOR Possess 0-2 years experience working within customer success, recruiting, account management, or other relevant fields Are passionate about technology and helping people Like process, are organized and detail-oriented Have a high EQ and love communicating with people via phone and email Are able to balance being a high-achiever with being team-oriented Comfort with using technology tools and CRMs (bonus points: experience with Salesforce, Yesware, Looker) Bachelor’s degree preferred but not required COMP, BENEFITS, & PERKS Competitive compensation & equity options Open vacation & sick time Employer paid health insurance, vision, and dental 401(k) Pre-tax commuter benefit Lunch 3 days a week Stocked kitchen & beverages Cell phone reimbursement Gym reimbursement We believe that when we can bring our whole selves to work on a day to day basis when we become happier, more comfortable, more confident and more excited to do great things for our company, each other, our product and our users. Hired aims to both build an internal team as well as help our clients build their teams with talent from all different backgrounds and lifestyles. At Hired we welcome all applicants regardless of gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, race, religion, age, national origin, citizenship, pregnancy status, veteran status, or any other differences. title: Research Analyst, CIJ
summary: Collect monthly and manage large program data sets from subcontractors. Perform basic data analysis using statistical software....
post_text:
Research Analyst, CIJ - Vera - Job Board Go to our website » « Go back to job listings Research Analyst, CIJ Location: New York, NY Department: Center on Immigration and Justice Type: Full Time Min. Experience: Mid Level The Vera Institute of Justice, founded in 1961, is an independent, non-partisan, nonprofit organization that combines expertise in research, technical assistance, and demonstration projects to assist leaders in government and civil society, examine justice policy and practice, and improve the systems people rely on for justice and safety. Vera has offices in New York City, Washington, DC, and New Orleans, and its projects and reform initiatives, typically conducted in partnership with local, state, or national officials, are located across the United States and around the world. Vera is an equal opportunity employer with a commitment to diversity in the workplace. Vera ‘s Center on Immigration and Justice (CIJ) works to address the challenges presented by the convergence of the criminal justice and immigration systems. CIJ works with government, nonprofit organizations, and communities to improve government systems that affect immigrants and their families. CIJ implements programs and provides technical assistance in addition to conducting applied research related to the various program areas. CIJ focuses primarily on increasing detained immigrants’ access to legal information and counsel and has conducted research and evaluation studies in areas such as legal orientation services for immigrants and access to justice for vulnerable populations. CIJ seeks an enthusiastic and self-motivated individual with a background in the social sciences, a passion for justice and excellent skills in data management and analysis to work as a Research Analyst on a variety of projects. Responsibilities Reporting to the CIJ Research Director, the Research Analyst will work in close collaboration with research and program staff to perform quantitative and qualitative data analysis for contract reporting and other research related to the Center’s ongoing projects. Principal responsibilities will include collecting, cleaning, coding and organizing data from subcontractors, government, and other sources; preparing summary statistics for monthly, quarterly, and annual reports; helping to formulate and analyze performance indicators; and learning basic programming in SQL. The Research Analyst will also carry out the following duties: Collect monthly and manage large program data sets from subcontractors Perform basic data analysis using statistical software Assist in preparing statistical reports for government partners and funders; Review and analyze information collected through surveys, reports, interviews and focus groups using SPSS and other data management/data analysis techniques Draft data collection instruments and conduct interviews Conduct background demographic, substantive and literature research and distill key findings into memos Assist with grant proposal preparation Assist on other projects and tasks as assigned. Qualifications Candidates should possess the following qualifications: Bachelor’s degree in a social science or related discipline and two years of relevant experience, or a Master’s degree; Demonstrated experience in data analysis using SPSS or other statistical packages Experience with recoding datasets Experience with database management Strong interest or experience in immigration, criminal justice, child and/or youth issues; Ability to work on multiple projects effectively and efficiently, both independently and collaboratively; Excellent oral and written communication skills; Proficiency with Microsoft Office software, including Word, Outlook, Excel, Access and PowerPoint; A commitment to a collegial workplace; Willingness to travel outside of New York City occasionally; Proficiency in Spanish is desirable. Please note that this position requires government security clearance. That clearance is restricted to U.S. citizens and citizens of countries that are party to collective defense agreements with the US. The list of those countries is here: http://www.state.gov/s/l/treaty/collectivedefense/index.htm. An additional clearance requirement is residence in the U.S. for at least five years before being hired. Salary Commensurate with experience; excellent benefits To Apply Submit cover letter, resume and a 3-5 page writing sample. Online submission in PDF format is preferred. However, if necessary, materials may be mailed or faxed to: ATTN: Human Resources/CIJ Research Analyst Vera Institute of Justice 233 Broadway, 12th Floor New York, NY 10279 Fax: (212) 941-9407 Please use only one method of submission (online, mail or fax). No phone calls, please. Only applicants selected for interviews will be contacted. Vera is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. All qualified applicants will be considered for employment without unlawful discrimination based on race, color, creed, national origin, sex, age, disability, marital status, sexual orientation, military status, prior record of arrest or conviction, citizenship status, current employment status, or caregiver status. Vera works to advance justice, particularly racial justice, in an increasingly multicultural country and globally connected world. We value diverse experiences, including with regard to educational background and justice system contact, and depend on a diverse staff to carry out our mission. For more information about Vera, please visit our website, www.vera.org Forward this Position Recipient email address (one) Your name Your email address Enter a message (optional) Privacy & Terms

Position Information Position Title Research Analyst Classification Title Associate for Institutional Research Posting Number 1600218 Department 0006-Office of Institutional Analysis Employer State Appointment Type 03 - Professional Position Type UUP Professional Appointment Term: Term Temporary Until Salary Grade SL4 Strategic Strength None Selected Posting Details Position Summary The Associate for Institutional Research will collaborate with other Office of Institutional Analysis (OIA) personnel to help create an information and analytic environment to support the needs of UB's many external publics, senior administration, and other internal constituents.   In particular, this will involve the analysis of complex institutional behavior to deliver accurate, comprehensive, and trusted information products. The incumbent's primary responsibility will be the collection and interpretation of data to meet a variety of information needs.  This will involve the capture, analysis, and summarization of data sourced from complex, interrelated campus transactional systems, as well as providing support to assist with the development of local systems, processes and applications to support institutional reporting, analysis and research.  Accuracy, attention to detail, and the ability to work comfortably within many processing environments and executive strata are critical components of the position, as the information products created often have great impact on local, state and federal policy decisions. Position Category: Administrative Staff Minimum Qualifications Bachelor's degree.  Master's degree preferred, but will consider a combination of education and experience equivalency. Four to five years of experience working in a complex, deadline driven office environment, preferably in higher education.  This experience should include the capture, analysis, and presentation of information in support of institutional research efforts, including the rapid creation of ad-hoc queries utilizing modern desktop database tools using the Microsoft (MS) family of office products including usage of a database solution such as MS Access or SQL Server is a mandatory requirement for this position to further support executive inquiry. Preferred Qualifications Master's degree preferred, but will consider a combination of education and experience equivalency. Four to five years of experience working in a complex, deadline driven office environment, preferably in higher education. Background in exploring data using modern visualization tools such as  Oracle Business Intelligence Enterprise Edition (OBIEE), Tableau and Alteryx a plus. Physical Demands n/a Salary Range Commensurate with experience Multiple Positions Available?                                                             New York, NY, United States Job Posted:
                                                                6 days ago [Save] Save In: New ... Name folder: [Flag] Flag As: Misclassified Forbidden Spam About HemoGenyx LLC HemoGenyx LLC is a biopharmaceutical company developing new treatments for blood diseases. HemoGenyx's research and core technology has already made it a leader in making traditional methods of patient conditioning and bone marrow transplants obsolete. Our technology is an ideal platform for developing the next generation of blood disease treatments. We are committed to continued innovation to bridge the gap between basic research and clinical medicine. A career at HemoGenyx offers competitive compensation, opportunity and significant impact. Role Description HemoGenyx seeks an individual with a strong background in hematopoietic system development and/or immunology. The successful candidate will conduct research in the fields of hematopoiesis and immunology. The successful candidate will be responsible for ensuring their research project progression by designing and executing experiments to characterize the biological function of hematopoietic stem cells/progenitors and the effect of drug candidates on the modulation of hematopoietic stem cells function. Research projects will be focused in therapeutic areas related to blood malignancies. Excellent interpersonal and communication skills are essential for the success of our biotechnology startup. Responsibilities • Perform prospective isolation of hematopoietic stem cells and other cell types from various tissues and organs • Study regenerative properties of the isolated cells in vivo and in vitro • Work closely with company leadership to plan and execute project activities. • Work independently, creatively and in collaboration with other members of the team to design and implement key experiments to address aspects of the basic and translational biology of cellular targets, link to human disease and validate the mechanism of action of drug candidates. • Analyze, interpret, and present scientific data, draft technical reports, prepare publications and present results at internal and external meetings, including industry conferences. Qualifications • PhD and Postdoctoral training in Cell Biology, Immunology, Life Sciences or a related field is REQUIRED. • Skilled biologist with in depth knowledge of hematopoietic system, capable of handling small animals, performing flow cytometry analysis and possessing basic surgical techniques and hands-on experience in tissue culture. • Outstanding interpersonal and communication skills. • Strong project leadership skills. • Strong collaborative and team-work skills. • High level of self-motivation, entrepreneurial spirit and ability to thrive in a fast-paced, goal- and team-oriented biotechnology startup environment. Please forward your CV and cover letter. Equal Employment Opportunity & Employment Eligibility HemoGenyx is committed to equal opportunity in the terms and conditions of employment for all employees and job applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, age, gender identity or gender expression, national origin, disability or veteran status. HemoGenyx also complies with all applicable national, state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment, as well as work authorization and employment eligibility verification requirements of the Immigration and Nationality Act and IRCA. title: VP Decision Science
summary: Author POVs and other IP covering recent trends and developments in marketing analytics, big data and data science....
post_text:
Job Application for VP Decision Science at RAPP Apply Now VP Decision Science at RAPP (View all jobs) New York, NY -RAPP Summary Decision Sciences is charged with bringing actionable and inspiring insights from all data sources to develop data driven strategies for our clients. Responsible for evolving best in class output, analytical rigor, innovation around campaign and media analytics, customer insights, advanced analytics (as they apply to marketing and digital solutions), and business intelligence for RAPP clients. The VP Decision Sciences is expected to continuously seek out, learn about and actively use new data sources, technologies, tools and methods and be able to apply this experience to innovate new analytical solutions aligned with client needs. Resourcefulness, curiosity, passion and fearlessness are required traits of all Decision Sciences employees. About RAPP RAPP is the only agency that specializes in high-precision Core Dialog™: those critical, enduring and high-value relationships that link people and brands with high precision across the fast-changing digital landscape. Our solutions are focused on the five crucial elements of today’s social plasma — customer-managed relationships (CMR), social engagement, mobile, digital, and commerce — bringing high precision and creative magic to well-defined, addressable audiences. Our network of 35 offices across 30 countries supports more than 1,300 marketing innovators, creative technologists, experience designers and data scientists, all working collaboratively to create compelling and exciting brand engagement for our client partners. RAPP is a part of Diversified Agency Services, a division of Omnicom Group. Your Role The ideal candidate is a quick strategic thinker, a natural leader, an excellent communicator- highly motivated while being highly precise. This is an incredible opportunity to become a founding member of a dynamic team in New York in a dynamic global marketing organization. Define data, decisioning and measurement strategies to optimize multi-touch marketing programs across all forms of media (digital, social, direct, etc…). Promote and enable data-driven decision-making across all RAPP New York clients. Represent RAPP Decision Sciences as a thought leader internally and externally. Your Responsibilities Work as lead client contact for all analytics and business intelligence portions of RAPP projects. This includes pushing the client forward in using data driven intelligence through clear POVs and presentations, as well as continual conversations around the uses of intelligence for decision-making processes. Defne state of the art approached to assess and model customer profiles, segmentation and behaviors Combine disparate data sets (customer database, marketing behavior, macro-economic data, etc.) to expose brand realities, market opportunities and potential marketing strategies. Provide leadership in developing M&A Plans, learning agenda’s, ROI/ Pro Forma’s, and results for all client projects. Inform business rules development for dynamic communications strategies thropugh effective correlation of customer segmentation, behavioral patterns and trigger events. Provide accurate attribution platforms/ models across multiple media channels Develop and implement digital ecosystem measurement and insights Attract, Nurture and Retain best talent; Build and manage a team of analysts and data strategists capable of meeting needs of agency and client. Author POVs and other IP covering recent trends and developments in marketing analytics, big data and data science. Skills and Experience Experience: 7-10 years marketing analytics experience, at least 3 years with an agency Knowledge: Extensive working background in digital analytics (site analytics, social, EM, online) Extensive knowledge of database marketing principles Working knowledge of statistical analysis, marketing mathematical rigor, and DM test and learn plans, and ROI Extensive knowledge of CMR principles and best in class methodologies Working knowledge of databases and structure Working knowledge of the technology around digital analytics (tagging, web services, digital tools, etc.) Working knowledge of social/digital listening tools Understanding of emerging research methodology and technology Strong analytical skill Strong communication and presentation skills Strong management skills and a proven track record of talent development Education Education: Bachelor’s degree in Math, Economics, Finance, Marketing, Social Science, Computer Science or other related degree. Master’s degree preferred. Apply for this Job * Required (Optional) Almost there! Review your information then click 'Submit Application' to apply. title: Research Technician I
summary: The doctors and scientists of Weill Cornell Medicine—faculty from Weill Cornell Medical College, Weill Cornell Graduate School of Medical Sciences, and Weill...
post_text: Job Description - Research Technician I (31607) Go to the main content section. Welcome. You are not signed in. My Briefcase | Sign In Job Search My Jobpage Basic Search | Advanced Search | Jobs Matching My Profile | Beginning of the main content section. Return to the home page Printable Format Job Description - Research Technician I (31607) Job Description Research Technician I - 31607 Description Position Summary Assist scientists in performance of laboratory and investigative procedures related to pediatric brain tumor biology and cancer biology. Position Activities Manage lab mouse colony, work with postdoctoral research fellows and PI for the breeding and maintenance of mouse colonies, inventory and genotyping. Manipulate animals according to approved experimental and institutional protocols for experiments (ex. injections, phlebotomy, surgery and euthanasia). Plan and executes experiments and projects and assist up to 3-4 lab members in the lab with their projects and experiments. Manage and assist in the oversight of laboratory including preparing reagents, water purification system maintenance, equipment maintenance and repair, chemical inventories and lab safety compliance. Responsible for de-identified human patient sample tracking, preparation and storage, responsible for record keeping and data management for human samples. Perform cell culture, histological techniques, microscopy, cryosectioning, immunoassays and molecular biology techniques (RNA and DNA isolation, PCR, quantitative real-time PCR), flow cytometry. Maintains records of lab procedures and results, collects, verifies, records and compiles data; prepares graphs and reports. Assist with management of laboratory reagent inventory and receiving packages. Oversee functions of lab members in change of inventories of lab supplies, ordering and restocking/organizing supplies. Performs other related duties as assigned. Qualifications Minimum Requirements Bachelor Degree in Science or related field; 1-2 years of experience working in a hands-on research laboratory setting Highly Desired Requirements Motivated to learn and develop new techniques, detail-oriented, excellent interpersonal skills. Working Conditions/Physical Demands No additional working conditions/physical demands provided. No relocation assistance is provided for this position. Visa sponsorship is not available for this position. Weill Cornell Medicine is committed to excellence in patient care, scientific discovery and the education of future physicians in New York City and around the world. The doctors and scientists of Weill Cornell Medicine—faculty from Weill Cornell Medical College, Weill Cornell Graduate School of Medical Sciences, and Weill Cornell Physician Organization—are engaged in world-class clinical care and cutting-edge research that connect patients to the latest treatment innovations and prevention strategies. Located in the heart of the Upper East Side's scientific corridor, Weill Cornell Medicine's powerful network of collaborators extends to its parent university Cornell University; to Qatar, where an international campus offers a U.S. medical degree; and to programs in Tanzania, Haiti, Brazil, Austria and Turkey. Weill Cornell Medicine faculty provide comprehensive patient care at NewYork-Presbyterian/Weill Cornell Medical Center, NewYork-Presbyterian/Lower Manhattan Hospital and NewYork-Presbyterian/Queens. Weill Cornell Medicine is also affiliated with Houston Methodist. EOE/M/F/Vet/Disabled Job - WCMC-Research Primary Location - New York City Organization - Pediatrics Schedule - Full-time Overtime Status - Non-exempt Grade - 3 Number of Openings - 1

title: Senior Research Technician
summary: Our mission is to establish a fully integrated research program that coordinates basic scientific discovery, early-phase clinical trials, and drug development....
post_text:
Senior Research Technician - Cancer Genomics - Careers at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center <iframe src="//www.googletagmanager.com/ns.html?id=GTM-PF8FMW"
height="0" width="0" style="display:none;visibility:hidden"></iframe> Menu Hide Home Why MSK Our Culture Benefits Diversity and Inclusion Relocating To MSK Career Areas Administrative/Clerical Allied Health Craft/Skilled Trade Faculty Information Technology Non-Clinical Professional Nursing Research Service Strategy and Innovation Early Careers Veterans Locations Josie Robertson Surgery Center MSK Monmouth Relocating To MSK Job Search FAQs Menu Toggle Home Why MSK Our Culture Benefits Diversity and Inclusion Relocating To MSK Career Areas Administrative/Clerical Allied Health Craft/Skilled Trade Faculty Information Technology Non-Clinical Professional Nursing Research Service Strategy and Innovation Early Careers Veterans Locations Josie Robertson Surgery Center MSK Monmouth Relocating To MSK Job Search FAQs Senior Research Technician – Cancer Genomics Job Posting Number: 8311 Research – Other New York , NY April 13, 2016 Apply Add to Cart Company Overview: At Memorial Sloan Kettering (MSK), we’re not only changing the way we treat cancer, but also the way the world thinks about it. By working together and pushing forward with innovation and discovery, we’re driving excellence and improving outcomes. For the 26 th year, MSK has been named a top hospital for cancer by U.S. News & World Report. We’re treating cancer,  one patient at a time. Join us and make a difference every day. Job Description: We are an expanding team of research, clinical and computational investigators working in cancer genomics with a focus in blood and childhood cancers. Our mission is to establish a fully integrated research program that coordinates basic scientific discovery, early-phase clinical trials, and drug development. As part of the center’s clinical and research investigations we are generating a wealth of genomic annotation data. To support and inform both ongoing and future research in cancer, we are building end-to-end infrastructure for large-scale innovative experimental and computational methodologies. As a Senior Research Technician you will: Lead the implementation, testing and operation of high-throughput molecular assays to include genotyping, next generation sequencing, single-cell (G&T seq, Smart-Seq2, Drop-Seq) and high depth sequencing incorporating unique molecular indexes. Establish protocols, troubleshoot and document laboratory standard operating procedures for laboratory assays. Present research findings on conferences, and publishes articles in peer reviewed research journals. Work together with research and computational scientists in the group to support the design execution, analysis and interpretation of data from the following assays: High-throughput multiplex genotyping by digital PCR or microfluidics Next generation sequencing (RNA, DNA, ATAC-seq) assays Single-cell RNA sequencing or combined DNA and RNA profiling from single cells (G&T-Seq). Deep next generation sequencing using unique molecular indexes. Standard molecular profiling assays. Qualifications Bachelor’s Degree or Masters level in molecular genetics or relevant discipline with at least 3 years’ experience, in running high-throughput PCR, sequencing and genotyping assays and at least 1 year experience in novel assay development and implementation. Experience with liquid handling equipment and familiar with new and emerging technologies. Independent thinker, strong problem solving and analytical skills. Excellent organizational skills, commitment to generating accurate data, ability to meet deadlines, and demonstrated experience in multi-tasking. Strong interpersonal and teamwork skills, and aptitude in interacting with clinical and research collaborators. Strong oral and written communication skills. Proficient in Microsoft Excel, Word and Powerpoint. #LI-GS1 Closing: MSK is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer committed to diversity and inclusion in all aspects of recruiting and employment. All qualified individuals are encouraged to apply and will receive consideration without regard to race, color, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, age, religion, creed, disability, veteran status or any other factor which cannot lawfully be used as a basis for an employment decision. Federal law requires employers to provide reasonable accommodation to qualified individuals with disabilities. Please tell us if you require a reasonable accommodation to apply for a job or to perform your job. Examples of reasonable accommodation include making a change to the application process or work procedures, providing documents in an alternate format, using a sign language interpreter, or using specialized equipment. Have you ever been excluded, debarred or otherwise ineligible to participate in the Medicare, Medicaid or any other federal health care program or in any federal procurement or non-procurement program? Yes No * If Yes, please provide dates and details. If No, then indicate N/A. * 10. Has your medical/dental staff appointment/employment status, license or clinical privileges in any hospital or health care facility ever been denied, revoked, suspended, restricted, reduced, limited, placed on probation, not renewed, voluntarily relinquished, discontinued or otherwise changed, including any leave of absence? Yes No * If Yes, please provide dates and details. If No, then indicate N/A. * 11. Have you ever been suspended or discharged by an employer for incidence of physical or verbal abuse of a patient, co-worker, customer or visitor? Yes No * If yes, please explain. If No, then indicate N/A. * 12. Have you ever served in the US Military/Voluntary Services? Yes No * Please provide US military branch & dates of service.  For voluntary service, please provide name and organization(s), duties and dates of service. If No, then indicate N/A. * 13. Will you be able to perform all essential job functions with reasonable accommodations? Yes No * If No, please describe accommodations needed. If Yes, then indicate N/A. (*) Required question Automatic Routing to Pipelines Tell us which area of our organization you think you'd fit best. Clinical Applications Epic Healthcare Business IT Healthcare Project Manager Network / Infrastructure Software Development By joining the community, you are consenting to Mount Sinai and our affiliates collecting your personal data and contacting you by e-mail, phone or SMS about news, information, events, and job opportunities at Mount Sinai that may be of interest. By using this service, you agree that we can place cookies on your device and you acknowledge that your information may be transferred to other countries. Privacy Policy and Terms of Service . Please sign to confirm: Clear Join Now Cancel Biomedical Software Developer - 847 - PATHOLOGY Union Classification: Non Union Shift: Day Job Department: 847 - PATHOLOGY Career Section Name: Mount Sinai External Careers Mount Sinai Health System Careers Do you have what it takes to wear the badge? Our multidisciplinary approach to patient care defines us as an organization. Contributing to our world-renowned reputation is the dedication of allied health professionals. Working collaboratively with nurses and physicians, our allied health providers are valued partners providing diagnostic and therapeutic extensions of care on a daily basis. Mount Sinai's allied health team members work side-by-side with global leaders in health care to create a patient-focused network of services that support healing in our local communities and around the globe. Are you ready to discover the world of limitless possibilities that comes with wearing the badge? Explore more about this opportunity and how you can help us write a new chapter in our story of unrivaled patient care! What You'll Do: The Biomedical Software Developer participates in full life cycle application development; designs and support complex scientific software development and deployment for basic and clinical research studies. The Biomedical Software Developer interacts with researchers and provides technical expertise and develops successful solutions Duties and Responsibilities 1) Take ownership as lead developer of shared Institute informatics software packages such as the Precise Informatics Platform – an integrated workflow and high performance computing engine for creating machine vision computational pathology tests. 2) Contribute to all aspects of the systems including UI, web applications/interfaces, machine vision pipeline, variant databases, etc. These efforts include working with HTML/Javascript, Python, C#, .NET, SQL, NoSQL and variety of internally and externally developed software. You will also contribute to assembling validation data and workflows (and corresponding documentation and SOPs) required to obtain and maintain NYS regulatory approval.. 3) Work with Institute researchers and Institutional collaborators to mine the Mt. Sinai Data Warehouse/Electronic Medical Record system for novel clinical insight. This will include integrating machine learning algorithms and other data mining techniques into our platform. 4) Contribute to a professional software engineering culture including participating code reviews, mentoring junior developers and other activities that help improve the Institute's software engineering capabilities. 5) As appropriate write and or contribute to scientific publications and when needed, contribute to grants applications. 6) Performs other duties as required. What You'll Bring: Minimum Education Senior computer scientists with BS. or equivalent in CS, Electrical Engineering or related field Minimum Related Experience 3 years of experience developing, architecting and managing the development of software in C/C++, C#/.NET, Javascript/HTML,  and or Python. Should have strong record of successfully developing and shipping complex software packages. Do you share our dedication to extraordinary service and have what it takes to wear the badge? Apply now! Who We Are: Over 35,000 employees strong, the mission of the Mount Sinai Health System is to provide compassionate patient care with seamless coordination and to advance medicine through unrivaled education, research, and outreach in the many diverse communities we serve. Formed in September 2013, The Mount Sinai Health System combines the excellence of the Icahn School of Medicine at Mount Sinai with seven premier hospital campuses, including Mount Sinai Beth Israel, Mount Sinai Beth Israel Brooklyn, The Mount Sinai Hospital, Mount Sinai Queens, Mount Sinai West (formerly Mount Sinai Roosevelt), Mount Sinai St. Luke's, and New York Eye and Ear Infirmary of Mount Sinai. The Mount Sinai Health System is committed to the tenets of diversity and workforce that are strengthened by the inclusion of and respect for our differences. We offer our employees a highly competitive compensation and benefits package, a 403(b) retirement plan, and much more. The Mount Sinai Health System is an equal opportunity employer. We promote recognition and respect for individual and cultural differences, and we work to make our employees feel valued and appreciated, whatever their race, gender, background, or sexual orientation. EOE Minorities/Women/Disabled/Veterans Location/Division: New York, New York Job Requisition: 1894924 Apply Now Not ready to apply? Join our Talent Community to stay in touch. title: Science - Senior Manager, Data Scientist Modeler
summary: Understanding complex business challenges, designing scientific solutions, manipulating large data sets, using cutting edge machine learning or statistical...
post_text: Science - Senior Manager, Data Scientist Modeler - New York NY 10038 Skip Navigation Toggle navigation Menu Search View My Account View Job Cart (0) Sign In Job Details Science - Senior Manager, Data Scientist Modeler Job ID #: 127441 Functional Area: Science Estimated Travel Percentage (%): 25 Location(s): NY-New York Employment Type: Full Time - Permanent Education Preferred: Masters Degree (or equivalent) Relocation Provided: Yes Share Facebook Twitter LinkedIn Email a Friend Apply with LinkedIn Position Description: Data Science is fundamentally changing the way we do business. At AIG Science, we reinvent the business of insurance every day. Our mission is to shape the landscape of insurance by making AIG more data-driven, improve our customer’s experience, and well, just be better. We are a team of high performers with diverse backgrounds—our roster includes physicists, economists, computer scientists, mathematicians, biostatisticians, computational linguists, psychologists, and more. While our degrees may be different, we all share a passion for data and a desire to make an impact. We are looking for talented, curious, and creative Data Scientists to join our growing team. What you will do: Build predictive models utilizing both traditional statistical methods (Generalized Linear Models, Mixed Effects Models, Ridge, Lasso, etc.) and modern machine learning techniques (Gradient Boosted Trees, Random Forests, Kernel methods, Deep Learning, etc.). ?Extract, clean, and manipulate large datasets (structured and unstructured) for model building. ?Communicate (written and verbal) insights from quantitative analyses to technical and non-technical audiences. ?Stay current on the latest machine learning and big data trends. ?Work with business sponsors and IT teams to implement analytic solutions. ?Train, mentor, and lead junior data scientists. ?Serve as a technical expert on one or more domains (e.g. Time Series Analysis, Text Mining, etc.) * Is Data Science a passion for you instead of just a job? * Are you a curious high performer? * Do you want to work on a team that values harmonious collaboration? * Is your desire to learn and reinvent? AIG Science is the hub for decision sciences at AIG. The Science team offers an excellent work environment that provides the opportunity to use cutting edge techniques, to engage worthy problems and to work with other world-class professionals. Position Summary Our ideal candidate should possess the following: * Very strong background in one or more computational areas (Computer Science, Statistics, Economics, Physics) * Proven facility with multiple modeling techniques * Exceptional programming skills in one or more platforms preferably R, SAS or Python * The drive to deliver on commitments and an openness to new ideas * Master Degree (Preferably a PhD) * 6+ years of relevant experience (will be flexed for exceptional candidates) Position Requirements: * Understanding complex business challenges, designing scientific solutions, manipulating large data sets, using cutting edge machine learning or statistical modeling techniques and synthesizing insights * Building scalable solutions that create great business impact * Strong and effective communication (both written and verbal) with colleagues and business leaders * Continuously advancing your skills and those of others In addition, the ideal candidate needs to be familiar with the following techniques and tools, with an expert-level experience in some: * Expertise in one or more modeling/machine learning platforms as such as R, SAS, and Python * Experience with additional programming languages such as C++, Java, Matlab, Octave a plus * Classification methods (e.g. Gradient Boosting Machines, Random Forest,  Neural Net, Logistic Regression, Decision Trees, KNN, SVM) * Regression methods (e.g., Linear, Nonlinear, Boosted Regression Trees ) * Clustering methods (e.g., K-means, Fuzzy C-means, Hierarchical Clustering, Mixture Modelling) * Time-series Modelling/Forecasting (e.g., AR, ARMA, GARCH, Exponential Smoothing) * Statistical Analysis (e.g., Hypothesis Testing, Experiment Design, Hierarchical Modeling, Bayesian Inference) * Familiarity with common computing environment (e.g. Linux, Shell Scripting) * Knowledge about Big Data related techniques (e.g., Map-Reduce, Hadoop, Hive, NoSQL) * Advanced skills in SQL What you bring to the table: ?You have expertise in at least one modeling/machine learning platform such as R, Python, or SAS. ?You have knowledge of an additional general purpose programming language such as C++ or Java. ?You have advanced SQL skills and experience with No SQL technologies. ?You have built several predictive models that have been put into live production. ?You obsess over sample bias, over-fitting, variable selection, missing values, etc. ?You understand the need to balance predictive power, interpretability, and ease of implementation. ?You appreciate that all models are wrong, but some are useful. What you can expect from us: ?Unparalleled opportunity to apply state-of-the-art machine learning techniques to real world data sets. ?Constant opportunity to learn through regular guest speakers, “brown bags”, and sponsorship to attend conferences. ?A fun time, even though our floor at AIG headquarters still looks like it’s from Office Space ?Work with highly intelligent and accomplished individuals who understand and value technical challenges ?A prompt and personal application process. If you’re well qualified for this position, we know you have several options in front of you ?No egos, no bravado and no hostility. We value character and achievements, not who speaks the loudest in the room ?And, if the process goes well, an extremely competitive offer About Us: American International Group, Inc. (AIG) is a leading international insurance organization serving customers in more than 130 countries and jurisdictions. AIG companies serve commercial, institutional, and individual customers through one of the most extensive worldwide property-casualty networks of any insurer. In addition, AIG companies are leading providers of life insurance and retirement services in the United States. AIG Property Casualty is a global market leader, one of the few truly global property casualty franchises. AIG Life and Retirement is one of the largest life insurance organizations in the U.S., and provides protection, investment and income solutions needed for financial and retirement security. United Guaranty Corporation is the marketplace leader in mortgage insurance in the U.S. Additional information about AIG can be found at www.aig.com | YouTube: www.youtube.com/aig | Twitter: @AIGInsurance| LinkedIn: http://www.linkedin.com/company/aig jobDetails BESbswy BESbswy BESbswy BESbswy

post_text: Amneal |   Research Scientist Analytical R&D 2015-07-89 ­ <style type="text/css"> .wpb_animate_when_almost_visible { opacity: 1; }</style> Careers Contact News Customer Login Search for: About Our Story Leadership Locations North America Asia Australia Europe Philosophy Philanthropy Products Catalogs United States Australia Germany Spain Scandinavia United Kingdom Pipeline Amneal Biosciences Operation API/Raw Materials Product Development Manufacturing Packaging Distribution Account Management Partnering International Amneal Nordic Amneal Australia Amneal Germany Creo Pharma – UK Amneal Spain Consumer Information About Generic Drugs Drug Safety FAQs Glossary About Our Story Leadership Locations North America Asia Australia Europe Philosophy Philanthropy Products Catalogs United States Australia Germany Spain Scandinavia United Kingdom Pipeline Amneal Biosciences Operation API/Raw Materials Product Development Manufacturing Packaging Distribution Account Management Partnering International Amneal Nordic Amneal Australia Amneal Germany Creo Pharma – UK Amneal Spain Consumer Information About Generic Drugs Drug Safety FAQs Glossary Careers at Amneal Careers at Amneal Job Openings Mission & Values Home » Careers » Research Scientist Analytical R&D 2015-07-89 « Return to List Job Detail Research Scientist Analytical R&D 2015-07-89 Requisition# 2015-07-89 Position: Full Time Shift: 1st Location: Brookhaven, NY Department: Pharma R&D Exemption: Yes Description: The Research Scientist, Analytical Method Development fulfills a critical role in supporting the analytical development and validation of testing methods for the Analytical R&D laboratory; as well as develops, validates, and qualifies testing methods for active pharmaceutical ingredients, such as excipients and dosage forms. Responsibilities: Develop and validate analytical methods (mostly LC and GC) for active pharmaceutical ingredients, excipients and dosage forms to be used in the analytical R&D laboratory for routine analysis. Ensure that procedures are technically developed and conform to appropriate standards of identity, strength, quality, purity of components. Development and optimization of new and existing analytical methods for qualification, release testing of products Perform and coordinate laboratory equipment qualifications, calibrations and preventative maintenance programs as needed Audit/Review laboratory data for approval to next step Expand analytical capabilities of the Analytical Group Evaluate, recommend and implement new analytical technologies and instrumentation for testing Provide training and guidance to laboratory analysts and group members aimed at developing technical capabilities Provide timely responses to internal and external inquiries Ensure specific objectives and goals of the department are met Requirements: Stay abreast of new developments in analytical technologies. Contribute to improvement in laboratory operations to increase efficiency, cGMP compliance and safety requirements. EDUCATIONAL REQUIREMENTS: PhD / M.S. in organic and/or analytical chemistry or other relevant pharmaceutical sciences EXPERIENCE & QUALIFICATION: BS + 10 – 12 yrs or MS + 6 -8 yr, or PhD + 0-3yrs experience Broad knowledge of modern Analytical and Organic chemistry Extensive experience in cGMP laboratory testing with hands-on experience with sophisticated instruments like UPLC, HPLC, GC, LC/MS, GC/MS. Methods development experience Experience writing standard operating procedures and test methods Prior supervisory experience preferred Additional Information: To apply please go to www.amneal.com/careers We offer a comprehensive compensation package which includes medical, dental and vision insurance as well as an employer-matched 401(k) plan. Amneal Pharmaceuticals is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or protected veteran status. Mount Sinai Health System's multidisciplinary clinical research teams are pioneering innovative new approaches in health care across a variety of fields. Working alongside leading physicians and within internationally acclaimed medical institutes, centers, and laboratories, our scientists continue to shape the future of clinical care and improve outcomes for patients of all ages. Are you ready to discover the world of limitless possibilities that comes with wearing the badge? Explore more about this opportunity and how you can help us write a new chapter in our story of unrivaled patient care! What You'll Do: Mount Sinai Health System Careers Do you have what it takes to wear the badge? Mount Sinai Health System's multidisciplinary clinical research teams are pioneering innovative new approaches in health care across a variety of fields. Working alongside leading physicians and within internationally acclaimed medical institutes, centers, and laboratories, our scientists continue to shape the future of clinical care and improve outcomes for patients of all ages. Are you ready to discover the world of limitless possibilities that comes with wearing the badge? Explore more about this opportunity and how you can help us write a new chapter in our story of unrivaled patient care! What You'll Do: The Biostatistician I is responsible for providing statistical support, including study design, sample size and protocol development in support of clinical projects. Prepares statistical analysis plans, generates statistical summary tables and performs database integration for more comprehensive analyses. Duties and Responsibilities: 1. Prepares statistical analysis plans, timelines for statistical project management and performs and interprets basic and complex analyses. Utilizes knowledge of statistics and medical understanding to propose and perform additional analyses when appropriate. 2. Documents analyses, creates summaries and presents written and verbal results to requestors. 3. Writes statistical text for study reports and clinical publications. Prepares analysis plans and methods used for incorporation in abstracts, manuscripts and grants. 4. Identifies potential data problems from analytic queries and takes appropriate actions to guide the resolution process. 5. Collaborates with principal investigators, sponsors and external representatives to ensure that project results and conclusions are presented accurately and without bias and to jointly achieve objectives and timelines. 6. Provides quality review on statistical analysis plan to ensure consistency with protocol and adequacy to meet objectives defined in protocol. 7. Adheres to standard operating procedures of the functional department as they apply to documentation and validation of clinical research statistics. 8. Provides consultation to the clinical research project team on statistical issues related to the project. 9. Collaborates with statistical programmers that support clinical projects to identify potential data problems from analytic queries and to take appropriate action to guide the resolution process. 10. Performs other related duties as assigned. What You'll Bring Education: Education: Bachelor's degree in sciences or related field or equivalent experience Experience: 2 years of clinical research. Computer and General Skills: Intermediate MS Word (Word, Excel), Access, Outlook Excellent verbal, written & interpersonal skills. Knowledge of standard concepts, practices and procedures in directly related field. Exceptional attention to detail and accuracy . Do you share our dedication to extraordinary service and have what it takes to wear the badge? Apply now! Who We Are: Over 35,000 employees strong, the mission of the Mount Sinai Health System is to provide compassionate patient care with seamless coordination and to advance medicine through unrivaled education, research, and outreach in the many diverse communities we serve. Formed in September 2013, The Mount Sinai Health System combines the excellence of the Icahn School of Medicine at Mount Sinai with seven premier hospital campuses, including Mount Sinai Beth Israel, Mount Sinai Beth Israel Brooklyn, The Mount Sinai Hospital, Mount Sinai Queens, Mount Sinai West (formerly Mount Sinai Roosevelt), Mount Sinai St. Luke's, and New York Eye and Ear Infirmary of Mount Sinai. The Mount Sinai Health System is committed to the tenets of diversity and workforce that are strengthened by the inclusion of and respect for our differences. We offer our employees a highly competitive compensation and benefits package, a 403(b) retirement plan, and much more. The Mount Sinai Health System is an equal opportunity employer. We promote recognition and respect for individual and cultural differences, and we work to make our employees feel valued and appreciated, whatever their race, gender, background, or sexual orientation. EOE Minorities/Women/Disabled/Veterans What You'll Bring Education: Master's degree in biostatistics, computational biology or related. Experience: 1 year of biostatistics or related experience in clinical research preferred. Advanced level of experience in SAS, R or similar application. . title: Asset Allocation Research Economist
summary: Create complex data-sets utilizing sample design, data mining and other tools to synthesize large macro-economic esoteric data....
post_text: Asset Allocation Research Economist Location: New York, New York, United States Share with: Facebook LinkedIn Twitter Send to a friend Asset Allocation Research Economist Two Sigma is looking for a data science economist to help us predict global macroeconomic drivers. This data scientist would be responsible for identifying timely and unique datasets, and potentially building our own, for forecasting inflation, unemployment, credit growth, and other key variables. The ideal candidate would combine intuition for the actors and flows within the economy, a strong statistical background, and experience working with macroeconomic data across several countries. Responsibilities: Identify and analyze macroeconomic data, fiscal policy, and Federal Reserve actions, in order to interpret and forecast their effect on the US and global economy and, ultimately, their impact on US and global trading markets. Develop and maintain reliable quantitative and econometric predictive models. Isolate causal effects and forecast both Central Bank actions and policy implications. Create complex data-sets utilizing sample design, data mining and other tools to synthesize large macro-economic esoteric data. Qualifications and Experience: Master’s degree or PhD in Economics or International Political Economy (with focus on macro and monetary/financial markets) from a highly accredited university. 3 – 6 years relevant work experience demonstrating a quantitative background in econometric analysis and forecasting Must work well in a collaborative, team?centered environment Bachelor’s degree in Math, Statistics, computer Science or Data Science preferred but not required Diligence - displays dedication, shows attention to detail and quickly separates relevant from irrelevant information Innovation & Intuition - thinks laterally to identify other sources of useful information and displays an ability to think outside the box Coding experience utilizing Python, R, Java or C++ is preferred but not required Excellent verbal and written communication skills Apply Now

title: Senior Equity Research Analyst Housing

post_text: Senior Equity Research Analyst Housing Jobs in New York State at Wells Fargo Our Benefits Our Values Life at Wells Fargo Careers Home > Wells Fargo Jobs > Business Development Jobs > New York State Business Development Jobs At Wells Fargo we believe in the power of a conversation. It’s how we learn, how we grow, and how ideas spread. It’s at the heart of everything we do. We ask questions. We listen. That’s how we help our customers succeed. So when the conversation turns to your future, your success, talk to us. We want to know how your story fits with ours and where we can go together. We are a diversified financial services company providing banking, insurance, investments, mortgage, and consumer and commercial finance through more than 9,000 stores and 12,000 ATMs and the Internet at wellsfargo.com, across North America and internationally. Our headquarters are in San Francisco, but every local Wells Fargo store is a headquarters for satisfying all our customers’ financial needs and helping them succeed financially. Our team members serve one in three households in America. And with $1.3 trillion in assets and nearly 275,000 team members across our 80+ businesses, we ranked fourth in assets and second in market value of our stock among our U.S. peers as of June 30, 2011. That’s our history. Let's talk about your story, and how together we can help our customers succeed. apply Senior Equity Research Analyst Housing Job Title: Senior Equity Research Analyst - Housing Job ID Number: 5201994 Schedule Type: Reg-Time Work Hours: 40 Location: New York,NY Qualifications: Job Description Wells Fargo Securities Research & Economics Equity Research Senior Analyst – Housing In this position you will provide primary coverage as a Senior Analyst covering the Housing sector. Specific responsibilities include creating, updating, and maintaining financial models, writing company and industry reports, conducting fundamental research and communicating with clients, internal sales people and senior management. Exposure to institutional investors and covered company/industry corporate executives is an integral part of the position. Required Qualifications 10+ years of capital markets industry research experience 8+ years of management experience Desired Qualifications A Masters of Business Administration (MBA) or Chartered Financial Analyst (CFA) Designation FINRA registration including Series 7 and 63 (or FINRA recognized equivalents) FINRA registration including Series 86 & 87 (or FINRA recognized equivalents) Other Desired Qualifications 10+ years of research experience covering housing, specifically homebuilding and building products and be proficient in creating financial models. Possess superior financial accounting and financial statement analysis skills, excellent financial modeling skills, a strong work ethic and the ability to work autonomously and in a team environment. Must have strong written and oral communication skills and the ability to manage multiple tasks simultaneously. Proficiency in Microsoft Word, Excel and Power Point is required. Experience using Factset, CapIQ and Bloomberg, and other data aggregation programs a plus Job Expectations Registration for FINRA Series 63 (or 66) must be completed within 120 days of hire date. FINRA recognized equivalents will be accepted. Registration for FINRA Series 7 must be completed within 120 days of hire date. FINRA recognized equivalents will be accepted. Obtaining and/or maintaining appropriate Financial Industry Regulatory Authority (FINRA) license(s) is required for ongoing employment in this position. In addition state registration, specific product licenses or SAFE licensing may apply. Additional requirements include meeting enhanced financial fitness and criminal background standards. Wells Fargo will initiate the FINRA review process at the time of offer acceptance. Registration for FINRA Series 87 must be completed within 180 days of hire date. FINRA recognized equivalents will be accepted. Registration for FINRA Series 86 must be completed within 180 days of hire date. FINRA recognized equivalents will be accepted. Disclaimer All offers for employment with Wells Fargo are contingent upon the candidate having successfully completed a criminal background check. Wells Fargo will consider qualified candidates with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of applicable local, state and Federal law, including Section 19 of the Federal Deposit Insurance Act. Relevant military experience is considered for veterans and transitioning service men and women.
