Return to the home page Printable Format Job Description - Strategic Planner - Razorfish Health, New York (RHW000195) Job Description Strategic Planner - Razorfish Health, New York ( Job Number: RHW000195 ) Description Job Summary At Razorfish Health, we strive to improve health by using behavioral intelligence and technology innovations to build personalized customer experiences. Here you will find Strategists, Data Scientists, Creatives, Technologists, and Account & Project Management teams working hand-in-hand to bring insightful and innovative customer engagement solutions to our clients. Razorfish Health has two offices: Center City Philadelphia and New York City. We are part of Publics Healthcare, the largest healthcare communications network in the world, and a division of Publicis Groupe S.A., the third largest advertising and media company, giving us unparalleled global reach. Publicis Health manages top-tier agencies specializing in promoting innovative solutions in advertising, medical education, sales and marketing, digital, market access, and medical and scientific affairs. Our nearly 5,000 employees work to manage nearly 10 agency brands through 58 offices located in 11 countries. In a constantly changing world, our goal is to create life-changing dialogue around health and wellness. We are looking for a Strategic Planner to join our Strategy team. The Strategy team uncovers breakthrough customer insights and identifies brand opportunities that inspire impactful cross-channel marketing programs. The ideal Strategic Planner candidate has up to 3-5 years experience in identifying breakthrough customer insights in a general agency account planning group or brand consulting firm. Exceptional thinking, communication and influence skills are required. Core Duties & Responsibilities • Conduct research and filter key findings from data to create relevant, breakthrough customer insights and identify brand opportunities across key channels for client • Partner with cross-functional teams to bring consumer and brand insight to the creative/media/program development process • Identify the key insights from existing client data and determine relevant consumer, brand or marketing program implications • Analyze data inherent in lists alongside in-house data • Conduct research, both primary and secondary, to deliver true consumer insight; conduct stakeholder, consumer and prospect interviews • Stay abreast of the new tools and methodologies for developing consumer and brand insights • Moderate brainstorms that are collaborative, inspiring and maximize team contributions • Contribute to brand positioning and brand strategy projects for client and agency teams • Support the development of consumer and brand insight in the company new business process • Conduct research to inform the consumer and brand POV for new business pitches for the agency • Monitor developments within the client’s industry and feed this knowledge to the rest of the team • Support thought leadership initiatives and develop trend perspectives based on key consumer and digital trends • Manage target lists of HCPS with differing levels of complexity Qualifications • Aspiration to make the world a healthier place by transforming the healthcare experience. • An understanding and passion for marketing and experiences across a variety of touchpoints; both digital and traditional • Innate curiosity and ability to connect insights and gain inspiration from the health and wellness journey, digital ecosystem, and other disparate sources • Demonstrated ability in digital strategy and/or account or brand planning • Confident and clear communicator; strong presenter to both internal teams and clients • Inspirational, compelling personality; the kind of person others always look to for ideas • Strong brainstorm contributor; facilitation of conceptual idea development • Experience contributing to brand positioning and applying customer insight to the development of marketing campaigns • Qualitative research - projective techniques, etc.; passionate about applying cutting edge qualitative methodology to insight creation • Proven success working in cross functional teams • Comfort working in highly flexible, entrepreneurial environments Experience & Education • Undergraduate or Advanced degree a plus but not required. • Up to 3-5 years of experience working in a general advertising agency account planning or strategy department or brand consultancy; with a focus area in digital or brand experience development required.

summary: Our R&D roles provide the truly unique opportunity of performing data and analytics research over all data available from a campaign (by consolidating social...
post_text: Sr Research Scientist job - Konectors - New York, NY | Indeed.com Find Jobs Find Resumes Employers / Post Job Sign in What: Where: Advanced Job Search job title, keywords or company city, state, or zip Sr Research Scientist Konectors - New York, NY We are in search of a Sr. Research Scientist for our client Based in NYC and reporting to our Global Head of Product and R&D, this individual will have responsibility for research and development in the commercial marketing and advertising sector. You will be responsible for proposing, prioritizing and managing research projects; writing and review of technical papers and other relevant deliverables, productizing technologies and mentoring junior staff. Our R&D roles provide the truly unique opportunity of performing data and analytics research over all data available from a campaign (by consolidating social media data, search data, display data, TV data, CRM data, etc.). Examples of research projects include large-scale optimization, natural language processing, agent based modeling and paid-owned-earned exploratory analysis. Specific research focus and projects may include: Advertising performance measurement (e.g. attribution modeling) ROI optimization and advertising channel budget reallocation Marketing mix modeling Behavioral targeting * Market behavior simulation (e.g. agent-based modeling) Desired Educational and Research Experience: A PhD in a relevant field (Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics) + 5 years of experience; or an MS degree + 10 years of experience. PhD is not required but is highly desired. Solid background in one of the areas of: Machine learning, Optimization and High performance computing Hands on Expertise with as many of the following tools and languages as possible: Hadoop, Hive, Pig, Spark, Python, R, Matlab, MapReduce, C++, Java, SQL, NoSQL We provide relocation but must be a US Citizen. Job Type: Full-time Required experience: Behavioral Analytics modeling: 1 year Required education: Master's 14 days ago - save job » Apply Now Please review all application instructions before applying to Konectors. title: Materials & Reliability Intern- EIG
summary: Our dedicated scientists conduct their research with the highest integrity, finely tuned processes and superb skill....
post_text: Applicant Home Job Description Job Title: Materials & Reliability Intern- EIG Job ID: 180522 Location: Regular/Temporary: Temporary Return to Previous Page Corning is the world leader in specialty glass and ceramics, creating and manufacturing keystone components that enable high-technology systems. Corning’s history is filled with breakthrough technologies that have played an important role in the way the world works. We thrive on solving difficult, commercially relevant problems through an innovative and collaborative research and development process. Corning succeeds through sustained investment in R&D, more than 160 years of materials science and process engineering knowledge, and a distinctive collaborative culture. A world leader in industrial research and development, Corning staunchly believes in change. We thrive on seeking new opportunities to make a difference for mankind and bringing them to life. Our dedicated scientists conduct their research with the highest integrity, finely tuned processes and superb skill. Breakthroughs occur when our researchers leverage existing technologies across product lines or come as the result of a profound moment of inspiration or even as an unexpected, experimental outcome. That is when research is at its most exciting. We do everything possible to sustain our culture of innovation. We continually invest in research and development to provide our scientists with the resources they need. This has enabled our scientific community to develop a unique ability to solve complex problems and maintain a keen focus on things that really matter -- technologies that improve our lives and change our world. R&D is the foundation on which Corning’s history has been built, and we have no doubt it will lead us to future technological triumphs. To know more about Corning's Science and Technology division, please visit the R&D website at: http://www.corning.com/r_d/index.aspx Scope of Position: Team member: Environmental Technologies Development – light duty substrates new products development group Individual contributor: Study and understand Materials & Reliability characteristics. Day to Day Responsibilities: Develop a basic understanding of materials & reliability Develop basic in materials & reliability processes. Design and carry-out experiments using a variety of standard laboratory equipment. Build basic knowledge of the development role in the product innovation process and further understanding of an engineer’s role in technology and industry Document results and experimentation. Travel Requirements: None Hours of work/work schedule/flex-time: 40 hrs./week, overtime as needed to meet objectives 7am-4pm core hours – flexible based on operations schedule Job Title: Materials & Reliability Intern- EIG Reference Number: 180522 Required Education: Near completion of BS (3 rd year+) in ] Material Science, Chemical, or Mechanical Engineering or related discipline Required Years and Area of Experience: Lab experience required Required Skills: Experience with lab equipment operation and understanding of analytical requirements Process understanding rigor to ensure delivery of repeatable and reliable system output in order to meet desired experimental requirements Ability to effectively communicate technical results verbally and through written documentation Desired Skills: Experience and/or interest in technology and industry environment with focus on experimentation Experience with ceramic process flow including material interaction understanding Experience and/or interest in emissions reduction technologies Skilled in the use of data analysis tools including either (SOLIDWORKS, or MATLAB) or (html database capabilities) Ability to build relationships and interact within and across organizations Soft Skills: Able to work in a team Self-motivated EOE/AA including Veterans and Disabled. title: Training Grant Administrator
summary: The doctors and scientists of Weill Cornell Medicine—faculty from Weill Cornell Medical College, Weill Cornell Graduate School of Medical Sciences, and Weill...
post_text: Job Description - Training Grant Administrator (31609) Go to the main content section. Welcome. You are not signed in. My Briefcase | Sign In Job Search My Jobpage Basic Search | Advanced Search | Jobs Matching My Profile | Beginning of the main content section. Return to the home page Printable Format Job Description - Training Grant Administrator (31609) Job Description Training Grant Administrator - 31609 Description Position Summary The Training Grant Coordinator serves as the primary Graduate School contact regarding predoctoral and/or postdoctoral training grants (e.g., National Institutes of Health (NIH) T32 grants) and other institutional-level program grants.  Under the supervision of the Manager of Finance and Grants, the coordinator will support departmental or program efforts to apply for training grants (new application or resubmission), submit annual progress reports, and the competitive renewal process.  The coordinator will work closely with the training grant directors to ensure successful grant management and ensure that grants are in compliance with regulatory, funding agency and policy requirements. Position Activities Under the direction of each training grant director, coordinate various aspects of the training grant application, including but not limited to: data collection, table creation, budgets, faculty outreach, collection of supporting documents, etc. Serve as Graduate School point person regarding assistance with the Medical Scientist Training Program (MSTP) training grant. Coordinate and prepare annual grant progress reports. Effectively doing so requires continual internal tracking of key data points, trainee progress, grant activities, etc. Develop forms, processes, procedures, and policies for the purpose of ensuring all compliance requirements are being met. Maintain currency of knowledge of training grant funding policies, regulations, and procedures; disseminates and/or presents changes to programs and advises on the implementation of changes. Maintain and develop new content for the WCM “Training Grant, Program Project, and Center Grant Resource Site.” Coordinate the internal application process for students and postdocs to apply for a slot on a training grant (for grants that use such an application mechanism). Monitor and assist trainees in progressing and meeting program metrics. Organize annual training grant program retreats. Assist and support other Graduate School coordinators who currently support funded training grants. Performs other related duties as assigned. Qualifications Minimum Requirements Five to seven years of progressive work experience dealing directly with grant management in a higher education setting. Proven ability to work independently and under minimal direction but as an effective team player. A completed Bachelor’s degree from an accredited institution. Highly Desired Requirements Experience with NIH institutional training grants. Working Conditions/Physical Demands No additional working conditions/physical demands provided. No relocation assistance is provided for this position. Visa sponsorship is not available for this position. Weill Cornell Medicine is committed to excellence in patient care, scientific discovery and the education of future physicians in New York City and around the world. The doctors and scientists of Weill Cornell Medicine—faculty from Weill Cornell Medical College, Weill Cornell Graduate School of Medical Sciences, and Weill Cornell Physician Organization—are engaged in world-class clinical care and cutting-edge research that connect patients to the latest treatment innovations and prevention strategies. Located in the heart of the Upper East Side's scientific corridor, Weill Cornell Medicine's powerful network of collaborators extends to its parent university Cornell University; to Qatar, where an international campus offers a U.S. medical degree; and to programs in Tanzania, Haiti, Brazil, Austria and Turkey. Weill Cornell Medicine faculty provide comprehensive patient care at NewYork-Presbyterian/Weill Cornell Medical Center, NewYork-Presbyterian/Lower Manhattan Hospital and NewYork-Presbyterian/Queens. Weill Cornell Medicine is also affiliated with Houston Methodist. EOE/M/F/Vet/Disabled Job - WCMC-Administration Primary Location - New York City Organization - Graduate School Schedule - Full-time Overtime Status - Exempt Grade - 6 Number of Openings - 1

title: Data Visualization Designer
summary: The Data Visualization Designer will work with an interdisciplinary team of interaction designers, visual designers, developers, data scientists, subject-matter...
post_text:
Data Visualization Designer | UserEdge Technical Personnel MENU Home Blog About Working With UserEdge Testimonials Our Clients Our Staff Our Services Outsourcing Solutions Staffing Solutions Training Solutions Projects Writing Projects Training Projects Usability Projects Jobs Job Hunting Info Useful Links Contact Us Data Visualization Designer Category: Jobs , Temporary/Contract Positions Posted on: April 6th, 2016 Location: New York, NY Salary: Description: Data Visualization Designer Location: NYC This is a long term contract and opportunity to work with an award winning UX team. Looking for an experienced Data Visualization Designer to design visualizations for individual applications as well as defining data visualization systems and patterns for a suite of products. In addition to creating data visualization solutions, the role will encompass the presentation and communication of concepts and solutions to senior stakeholders using sketches, mockups, user workflows, and functional prototypes. Succeeding in this role will require an ability to understand and communicate the complex relationships between financial markets, governments, businesses, and people via the analysis – and visualization – of very large datasets. The Data Visualization Designer will work with an interdisciplinary team of interaction designers, visual designers, developers, data scientists, subject-matter experts, and product managers to implement and deploy data visualization tools. Qualified candidates will have: 10+ years design experience with a focus on complex interactive data visualization . Deep expertise in data visualization theory and techniques. Financial background/subject matter expertise is highly desirable. Ability to rapidly iterate through conceptual ideas or designs and effectively communicate these using low- to medium-fidelity prototypes, such as sketches, paper prototypes, storyboards, interactive click-throughs, and data visualizations. Strategic project leadership: experience leading and facilitating projects through concept, pitch, iterative design and development, delivery, and ongoing support. Prior experience working in an interdisciplinary team of developers, designers, and/or subject-matter experts. Ability to communicate with and present to stakeholders at senior levels within the organization. Graduate Degree or equivalent experience in any of the following fields: Information Design, Interaction Design, User Experience, Human-Computer Interaction, Graphic Design, or Statistics. Knowledge of visual perception and cognitive theory. Apply for this position.(2) Please use this form to submit your resume. summary: Work with stakeholders across the organization to establish strategic priorities related to our client’s presence on established and emerging social media...
post_text: Social Data Product Management in New York City, NY | Open Positions Jobs at Eliassen Eliassen Search jobs Recent Searches skip to main content Toggle navigation Menu Careers Home Contact About Legal & Privacy Internal Careers Submit Your Resume Blog Job Cart Your job has been added to the Job Cart . Welcome to Social Data Product Management New York City, NY Requisition Number: 257372 Employment Type: Direct Hire Add to job cart Job Type: Direct Hire Job Id : 257372 Apply Now Position Summary Job ID: 257372 Face to face interview required. W2 only. This is a major role in a major organization, built solely for someone great, who is looking for an equally great engagement. As Senior Manager of Social Data Product Management, your job is to design, deliver and iterate ground breaking, data-driven social media data products that increase engagement and revenues.  You will dig deep in the users, influencers, brands, ad products and APIs of mature and emerging social networks - Facebook, YouTube, Instagram, Tumblr, SnapChat, Twitter - and steer how our client interacts and drives clear business value on these platforms.  You will partner with integrated marketing teams, data scientists and developers to create unique experiences in the market that delight and drive revenues. What you’ll be doing: Work with stakeholders across the organization to establish strategic priorities related to our client’s presence on established and emerging social media platforms Partner with sales team to increase direct and in-direct revenue associated with multi-platform, social-by-design, integrated marketing campaigns Partner with data science teams to deliver deep dashboards, projections and insights across cross-social data sets Partner with content teams and lead the data strategy behind social media campaigns that resonate with audiences and drive trackable outcomes Manage a complex and evolving data environment across a wide variety of sources, servers and data types Identify new trends, technologies and solutions and drive the uses of social data across the organization Your background should include: Degree in computer/information science, statistics, engineering or another quantitative field Experience in product and project management Experience with data visualization / BI tools like Cognos, Tableau, Domo, others Experience in data management, data analysis, ETL tools and database design Bonus points for: Familiarity with social media analytics: Facebook, Twitter, YouTube, Instagram, Social Listening Familiarity with media industry/digital analytics: Nielsen, Rentrak, Tivo, Adobe, comScore, DMPs If you’re waiting for a perfect time to seize a new opportunity, the time is now.  Send us your resume today! About Eliassen Group: Eliassen Group has been driving the success of our clients, consultants, and employees within Technology Staffing and Consulting Services since 1989. For over 25 years, we have been at the forefront of innovation by uniting talented people and quality solutions within successful companies to help them attain their business objectives. Our solution oriented approach to understanding your needs ensures that we identify and represent the best possible talent available in the market, personally selected and matched to your requirements by our highly-tenured, extraordinarily capable recruiting team. Our consulting divisions include expertise focused on Agile, Big Data, Biometrics & Data Solutions, Creative Services, Government Services, Life Sciences and Workforce Management. Eliassen Group is privately held and headquartered in Wakefield, MA. Don’t miss out on our referral program! If we hire a candidate that you refer us to then you can be eligible for a $1,000 referral check! and update your profile, click here Process Scientist (Downstream) Process Scientist (Downstream) United States-NY-Rensselaer Requisition Number:  6415BR Req ID: 6415BR Job Summary and Essential Functions: Known for its scientific and operational excellence, Regeneron is a leading science-based biopharmaceutical company that discovers, invents, develops, manufactures, and commercializes medicines for the treatment of serious medical conditions. Regeneron commercializes medicines for eye diseases, high LDL-cholesterol, and a rare inflammatory condition and has product candidates in development in other areas of high unmet medical need, including oncology, rheumatoid arthritis, asthma, atopic dermatitis, pain, and infectious diseases. Summary:  Support the Process and Analytical Sciences Department through small scale laboratory experiments, as well as analysis, troubleshooting, and validation of manufacturing bioprocesses. Essential Duties and Responsibilities may include, but are not limited to, the following: • Performs protein purification and support scientific investigations related to downstream unit operations of biologics manufacturing processes. • Performs protein stability study and microbial study including bioburden clearance using small-scale chromatography column. • Supports activities to assure that scientific investigations are planned and coordinated cross-functionally, and executed effectively. • Conducts experiments in scale-down models using DOE or other experimental principles using GE AKTA systems. • Supports the execution of an effective raw material use testing and control plan. Knowledge and Skills: • Protein purification sciences. • Protein stability and formulation. • Microbiology. • Scale-down model development. • Raw material controls. • JMP and advanced statistical software programs. • Interpersonal, oral, and written communication skills; • Word processing, spreadsheet, database management, statistical analysis, graphing, and presentation programs. • cGMP operations. Experience and Required Skills: Education and Experience: • PhD in chemical engineering, life sciences, or related discipline with 0-2 years of relevant experience. • Experience working in a purification sciences team, knowledge of protein separation techniques, experimental design, data analysis using advanced mathematical tools and protein stability and formulation is required. • Knowledge of microbial study and complex raw material chemistry and experience in the identification of chemical markers is beneficial. This is an opportunity to join our select team that is already leading the way in the Pharmaceutical/Biotech industry.  Apply today and learn more about Regeneron’s unwavering commitment to combining good science & good business. To all agencies: Please, no phone calls or emails to any employee of Regeneron about this opening.  All resumes submitted by search firms/employment agencies to any employee at Regeneron via-email, the internet or in any form and/or method will be deemed the sole property of Regeneron, unless such search firms/employment agencies were engaged by Regeneron for this position and a valid agreement with Regeneron is in place.  In the event a candidate who was submitted outside of the Regeneron agency engagement process is hired, no fee or payment of any kind will be paid. Regeneron is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. title: Research Analyst - Associate
summary: Understands different types of data, such as clinical, administrative and personalization, and can draw associations with this data....
post_text: Independent Health View All Jobs Search Jobs Post Resume Applicant Login Research Analyst - Associate Department: 6212-Analytic Services Category: Professional Type: Full-Time Description: The Research Analyst – Associate will be responsible for developing reports to monitor Independent Health Triple Aim initiatives. The analysis is also responsible for performing tasks related to querying, aggregating, and validating data from multiple sources. The analyst will be exposed to analytical methods and tools and will need to develop skills to complete advanced analytical analysis. Requirements: Bachelor’s degree in a quantitative/research discipline required. One year of analytics experience required or an advanced degree in a quantitative/research discipline, to include research/intern experience.  Experience in a managed health care environment preferred. Understands value of integrating multiple data sources: understands different types of data, such as clinical, administrative and personalization, and can draw associations with this data. Ability to use data querying tools such as SQL/SAS/R/MS Access or other similar software. Ability to frame questions that create value for the business partners. Ability to present and communicate output and analysis in a meaningful way that meets the understanding needs of the business partners. Understands data warehousing concepts and data architecture, such as table structures, metadata, etc Ability to access data using standardized tools and processes. Ability to analyze information: strong data mining skills, strong statistical capabilities (study design, population assessment, epidemiologic analysis, and outcome evaluation), and effective development of rules and algorithms designed around operational processes. Proven examples of displaying the IH values: Passionate, Caring, Respectful, Trustworthy, Collaborative and Accountable. Good abilities in the use of computational software for statistical analysis. Teamwork and leadership qualities and experience are a plus. Independent Health is an equal opportunity employer. This person may be responsible for assisting in the day-to-day activities of the analytical laboratory including responsibility for performing assays on biological samples from pre-clinical and clinical trials for pharmaceutical and biotechnology projects or performing assays on characterization of APls and raw materials. Responsible for ensuring that all analytical data reported are reliable. Overview of the Role Recognize, exemplify and adhere to ICON's values which centres around our commitment to People, Clients and Performance As a member of staff, the employee is expected to embrace and contribute to our culture of process improvement with a focus on streamlining our processes adding value to our business and meeting client needs Travel (approximately 0%) domestic and/or international. Operate general laboratory equipment and instrumentation systems and utilize automated data collection/reporting systems. Ensure calibration of analytical systems and maintain instrument systems in good working order. Perform bioanalytical/chemical method development duties under supervision and method validation for the quantification of NCE, NBE and Biomarkers in tissues, biological fluids or chemical matrices. Assist in preparation of method documents. Recognize instrumental and procedural problems and refer to supervisor/Manager. Perform assays for routine batch analysis of NCE, NBE and Biomarkers in biological fluids/chemical matrix involving simple to complex analytical techniques. Perform laboratory work to GXP standard. Work in compliance with Study Plans and validation plans. Document all work and results accurately, completely and in compliance with GXP regulations and SOPs. Generate high quality analytical results. Under supervision, ensure smooth transfer of data to Project Leaders/Principal Investigators and participate in evaluation and interpretation of data. Understand and adhere to SOPs and contribute to improvements to SOPs. Author SOPs as needed. Under supervision check, verify and sign notebooks and data as required. Work in compliance with GXP. Any other duties as assigned commensurate with skills and qualifications and appropriate to the role. Role Requirements To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. Good verbal and written communication skills Ability to work independently on routine analysis. Strong computer skills (Microsoft Word, Excel, Access and Power Point). Ability to undertake tasks with minimal supervision. Good organizational skills and record keeping ability. Strong attention to detail Associates degree -a minimum of 3 years’ experience with lab instrumentation and equipment is required. Bachelor's degree in scientific discipline/ HND or local equivalent is preferred. Benefits of Working in ICON Other than working with a great team of smart and energetic people, we also offer a very competitive benefits package. This varies from country to country so a dedicated recruiter will discuss this with you at interview stage. We care about our people as they are the key to our success. We provide an open and friendly work environment where we empower people and provide them with opportunities to develop their long term career. What’s Next? Following your application you will be contacted by one of our dedicated recruiters and if successful we will be able to provide you with more details about this opportunity. ICON is an equal opportunity employer - M/F/D/V and committed to providing a workplace free of any discrimination or harassment. ICON is an equal opportunity employer - Minorities/Females/Disabled/Veterans and committed to providing a workplace free of any discrimination or harassment. title: Scientist III AR&D
summary: Assists the Group Leader with training, and overseeing the work of other scientists, according to project needs....
post_text: Amneal |   Scientist III AR&D ­ <style type="text/css"> .wpb_animate_when_almost_visible { opacity: 1; }</style> Careers Contact News Customer Login Search for: About Our Story Leadership Locations North America Asia Australia Europe Philosophy Philanthropy Products Catalogs United States Australia Germany Spain Scandinavia United Kingdom Pipeline Amneal Biosciences Operation API/Raw Materials Product Development Manufacturing Packaging Distribution Account Management Partnering International Amneal Nordic Amneal Australia Amneal Germany Creo Pharma – UK Amneal Spain Consumer Information About Generic Drugs Drug Safety FAQs Glossary About Our Story Leadership Locations North America Asia Australia Europe Philosophy Philanthropy Products Catalogs United States Australia Germany Spain Scandinavia United Kingdom Pipeline Amneal Biosciences Operation API/Raw Materials Product Development Manufacturing Packaging Distribution Account Management Partnering International Amneal Nordic Amneal Australia Amneal Germany Creo Pharma – UK Amneal Spain Consumer Information About Generic Drugs Drug Safety FAQs Glossary Careers at Amneal Careers at Amneal Job Openings Mission & Values Home » Careers » Scientist III AR&D « Return to List Job Detail Scientist III AR&D Position: Full Time Location: Brookhaven, NY Department: Analytical Research & Development Exemption: Yes Description: The Scientist III ARD fulfills a critical role in supporting the analytical development for oral dosage form pharmaceuticals; leads and manages all analytical development, qualifications, validations for Active Pharmaceutical Ingredients (API), excipients, dosage forms, testing and release activities and in-process analytical testing services in support of the formulation development department; trains, mentors and evaluates members of the analytical development team; and qualifies and maintains analytical equipment. Responsibilities: Support the analytical development for the oral dosage form pharmaceuticals. Analyze organic or inorganic compounds to determine chemical or physical properties using chromatography, spectroscopy, or spectrophotometry techniques. Assists the Group Leader with training, and overseeing the work of other scientists, according to project needs. Additionally, drives advances in analytical capabilities for all analytical technology, qualifies and maintains analytical equipments. Analyze organic or inorganic compounds to determine chemical or physical properties, composition, structure, relationships, or reactions, using chromatography, spectroscopy, or spectrophotometry techniques. Conduct quality control tests. Maintain laboratory instruments to ensure proper working order and troubleshoot malfunctions when needed. Prepare test solutions, compounds, or reagents for laboratory personnel to conduct tests. Development and Optimization of new and existing analytical methods for qualification, release testing of products. Perform Analytical Method validations. Assist Group Leader with guiding members of the Analytical Group to meet deadlines tied to Product development schedules and to fulfill technical and compliance requirements. Expand analytical capabilities of the Analytical Group. Evaluate, recommend, and implement new analytical technologies and instrumentation for testing. Provide training and guidance to Analytical Group members aimed at developing technical capabilities. Provide timely responses to internal and external inquiries. Compile and analyze test information to determine process or equipment operating efficiency or to diagnose malfunctions. Write technical reports or prepare standards and specifications for processes, facilities, products, or tests. Stay abreast of new developments in analytical technologies. Contribute to improvement in laboratory operations to increase efficiency and GMP compliance . Requirements: Master’s degree in Chemistry or related technical field. In lieu of the Master’s degree, a Bachelor’s degree plus 5 years of experience in analytical chemistry is acceptable. Special Requirements : Extensive experience in GMP laboratory testing. Hands-on experience with HPLC (Waters Empower Chromatography Data Software), GC (Agilent and Perkin Elmer), TLC, and MS. Knowledge of the chemical composition, structure, and properties of substances and of the chemical processes and transformations that they undergo. This includes uses of chemicals and their interactions, danger signs, production techniques, and disposal methods. Methods development experience. Experience writing standard operating procedures and test methods. Hands on experience with High-speed centrifuges; Tabletop centrifuges, Differential scanning calorimeters; Ultraviolet-visible spectrometers and Infrared spectrophotometers and Titration equipment — Autotitrators; Karl Fischer titrators; Titrators Additional Information: Qualified candidates should submit a resume, including salary history and requirements, to dlodato@amneal.com. We offer a comprehensive compensation package which includes include medical, dental and vision insurance as well as an employer-matched 401(k) plan. Amneal Pharmaceuticals is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability or protected veteran status. « Return to List About About Our Story Leadership Locations Philanthropy Products Products Catalogs Pipeline Amneal Biosciences Operations Operation API/Raw Materials Product Development Manufacturing Packaging Distribution Account Management Partnering International International Amneal Nordic Amneal Australia Amneal Germany Creo Pharma – UK Amneal Spain Consumer Information Consumer Information About Generic Drugs Drug Safety FAQs Glossary Internet Privacy Policy Copyright and Legal Disclaimer © Copyright 2016 Amneal Pharmaceuticals LLC. post_text: Applicant Home Job Description Job Title: Development Intern Job ID: 180386 Location: USA,NY-Painted Post Regular/Temporary: Temporary Return to Previous Page Corning is the world leader in specialty glass and ceramics, creating and manufacturing keystone components that enable high-technology systems. Corning’s history is filled with breakthrough technologies that have played an important role in the way the world works. We thrive on solving difficult, commercially relevant problems through an innovative and collaborative research and development process. Corning succeeds through sustained investment in R&D, more than 160 years of materials science and process engineering knowledge, and a distinctive collaborative culture. Corning Life Sciences brings new and innovative laboratory tools to researchers. Our core technical competencies include polymer science, biochemistry and molecular biology, glass melting and forming, surface modification, and characterization science. As part of Corning Incorporated, we are a world leader in specialty glass and have a 150-year tradition of innovation. We are committed to meeting customers’ unique and changing needs with original solutions for today’s emerging life sciences technologies. Our dedication to quality, technology and innovation has enabled us to produce the world’s most comprehensive line of laboratory tools for life science research. Corning Life Sciences also offers custom capabilities such as special packaging, bar coding, and printed lot numbers, to meet specific customer requirements To know more about Corning Life Sciences, visit us at: http://www.corning.com/products_services/life_sciences.aspx Day to Day Responsibilities: Designing and executing experiments Analyzing data and forming conclusions and recommendations Collaborating with other scientists and engineers to get answers and develop solutions Communicating and documenting results Travel Requirements: None Hours of work/work schedule/flex-time: Mon-Fri    8:00am-5:00pm / 40 hrs. per week Job Title: Development Intern Reference Number: 180386 Required Education: Pursuing a four year degree in Engineering Required Skills: General Engineering  concepts Excellent problem solving skills Ability to design and carry out experiments Strength in analyzing data and drawing logical conclusions from them. Return to the home page Printable Format Job Description - Senior Machine Learning Engineer (1604111) Job Description Senior Machine Learning Engineer - 1604111 Description eXelate, a Nielsen® company, is the leading provider of data technology powering the digital marketing ecosystem. Our customer data cloud™ provides the industry’s only unified customer profiles, which connect identities across all channels and devices - including display, video, audio, offline, mobile and smart TVs - enabling marketers to engage individuals and households with personalized messages to drive performance at scale. eXelate’s data marketplace is the largest 3rd-party cross-device data set in the world with over 5B unique users and devices. eXelate was acquired by Nielsen in March of 2015. Nielsen brings to bear the market’s most powerful proprietary data assets, and together we are helping the world’s biggest brands make better and faster marketing and media decisions, we are permanently disrupting the landscape of audience measurement. This hands-on position reports to the Manager of our Machine Learning Lab and will take a leading role in developing and leveraging the team’s machine learning assets. The Sr. Machine Learning Engineer will build turnkey solutions for ETL pipelines, machine learning applications and model shipping via Machine Learning Engineering Data Engineering Analytics Software Development Algorithm and Technology Research Qualifications Requirements Advanced degree in statistics, mathematics, computer science, or machine-learning related fields required Minimum of 3+ years relevant machine learning work experience with internet scale data Familiarity with sophisticated data mining & modeling solutions Knowledge of an object oriented and functional language such as Python, Java, C++, and/or Scala Extensive experience with R Extensive experience with the Hadoop ecosystem and parallel computing, with a strong knowledge of Spark, Hive, and/or Pig High energy and enthusiasm to develop the next big thing in internet advertising; someone that can think out of the box, solving new and unique analytical challenges Familiarity with marketing analytics, including marketing response modeling and customer segmentation Experience with online media and targeting a big plus Extensive experience with relational database management system (RDBMS), with strong knowledge of SQL Nielsen is committed to hiring and retaining a diverse workforce. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action-Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability status, age, marital status, protected veteran status or any other protected class. *LI-MJ1 Job : New Acquisition Primary Location : North America-US-NY-New York Organization : eXelate Schedule : Full-time Shift : Day Travel : Yes, 10 % of the Time © The Nielsen Company. title: Senior Administrative Secretary
summary: The doctors and scientists of Weill Cornell. Under direction, provides administrative support to the Chairman of the Department of Cardiothoracic Surgery at the...
post_text:
Job Description - Senior Administrative Secretary (31605) Go to the main content section. Welcome. You are not signed in. My Briefcase | Sign In Job Search My Jobpage Basic Search | Advanced Search | Jobs Matching My Profile | Beginning of the main content section. Return to the home page Printable Format Job Description - Senior Administrative Secretary (31605) Job Description Senior Administrative Secretary - 31605 Description Position Summary Under direction, provides administrative support to the Chairman of the Department of Cardiothoracic Surgery at the New York Methodist Hospital and assists in overseeing the administration of clinical practice activities. Position Activities Serves as the Executive Administrative Secretary to the Chairman of the Department of Cardiothoracic Surgery at the New York Methodist Hospital.  Maintains and updates calendars on a daily basis.  Maintains physicians’ CVs to reflect current publications, society memberships and invited lectures.  Prepares society membership applications:  completes application forms, requests letters of reference and submits required documents, adhering to all deadlines.  Facilitates physician attendance to annual peer meetings and processes reimbursements accordingly.  Assists with applications, grant/paper submission and manuscript reviews.  Maintains an accurate log of CME activities. Serves as liaison for internal and external contacts.  Plans, coordinates and schedules meetings and maintains calendar of standing meetings.  Prepares agendas, edits and types memos and policy revisions.  Maintains highly confidential files and administrative records and assists with committee obligations. Assists in training of new employees in office policies and procedures.  Assists in coordinating all office functions, parties and events. Serves as primary contact for physicians to internal and external contacts (patients, referring physicians, etc.).  Acts as liaison between clinical and administrative personnel on behalf of physicians and the Department.  Provides support and back-up as needed. Responsible for answering and screening incoming calls, utilizing the established protocols for the practice.  Accurately and professionally identifies, triages and escalates priority calls.  Appropriately transfers calls when necessary.  Takes accurate and complete messages and assures that all messages are directed to the appropriate personnel in a timely manner. Assists with managing outpatient schedule templates.  Accurately relays pertinent information and instructions to patients, family members and caregivers, based on the physician’s protocol.  Obtains pre-certification, and schedules diagnostic tests. Obtains and accurately updates complete demographic and insurance information for new and existing patients.  Accurately schedules appointments based on the availability of the physicians, patient needs and established protocols.  Accurately documents patient information, referral information, verifies eligibility and any additional information as needed for the appointment.  Assists in organizing and rescheduling patient appointments based on physician availability, protocol and any existing or possible schedule conflicts. Fulfills clerical responsibilities as assigned, which may include entering referral and other pertinent data or information, managing charting process to ensure information is complete and filed accurately utilizing the EMR.  Mails patient correspondence and other items as needed.  Faxes reports to outside physicians as required.    Scans documents to patients’ charts. Assures full compliance with customer care standards set forth by Weill Cornell, New York-Presbyterian Hospital and the Department of Cardiothoracic Surgery.  Abides by and responds to patients’ rights and privacy standards and emergency codes, sharing issues related to patients and or staff with supervisors.  Adheres to all governmental regulations (HIPAA, Joint Commission, etc.).  Maintains constant communication with supervisors, Practice Managers and Department Administrator to alert and escalate issues on an as needed basis.  In an effort to better serve patients, provides suggestions and recommendations to improve work flow, communication and overall protocols. Contributes to the team by providing support and back-up as needed and directed by the Department.  Attends all customer service training as directed by the manager. Performs all other duties as required. Performs other related duties as assigned. Qualifications Minimum Requirements High School Diploma or equivalent required. Professional and courteous demeanor. Highly Desired Requirements AA or BA preferred. Experience in a clinical practice, medical office or hospital setting preferred. Skill and Abilities Excellent communication skills (both oral and written). Proficient in computer skills inclusive of Microsoft Office. Ability to function in a fast-paced environment. Ability to assimilate quickly. Customer Service, Product Knowledge, Quality Focus, Problem Solving, Documentation Skills, Listening, Phone Skills, Conflict Resolution, Analyzing Information, Multi-tasking and Organizational Skills. Working Conditions/Physical Demands No additional working conditions/physical demands provided. No relocation assistance is provided for this position. Visa sponsorship is not available for this position. Weill Cornell Medicine is committed to excellence in
patient care, scientific discovery and the education of future physicians in
New York City and around the world. The doctors and scientists of Weill Cornell
Medicine—faculty from Weill Cornell Medical College, Weill Cornell Graduate
School of Medical Sciences, and Weill Cornell Physician Organization—are
engaged in world-class clinical care and cutting-edge research that connect
patients to the latest treatment innovations and prevention strategies. Located
in the heart of the Upper East Side's scientific corridor, Weill Cornell
Medicine's powerful network of collaborators extends to its parent university
Cornell University; to Qatar, where an international campus offers a U.S.
medical degree; and to programs in Tanzania, Haiti, Brazil, Austria and Turkey.
Weill Cornell Medicine faculty provide comprehensive patient care at
NewYork-Presbyterian/Weill Cornell Medical Center, NewYork-Presbyterian/Lower
Manhattan Hospital and NewYork-Presbyterian/Queens. Weill Cornell Medicine is
also affiliated with Houston Methodist. EOE/M/F/Vet/Disabled Job - WCMC-Administration Primary Location - New York City Organization - Cardiothoracic Surgery Schedule - Full-time Overtime Status - Non-exempt Grade - 5 Number of Openings - 1

title: Account Manager
summary: Xaxis combines proprietary technology, unique data assets and exclusive media relationships with the brightest team of audience analysts, data scientists and...
post_text:
Xaxis Careers - Account Manager Xaxis Careers Account Manager Account Management New York, 
                    New York Apply Position at Xaxis Position Overview Xaxis is actively looking for an Account Manager. At Xaxis, you will collaborate with a group of quick witted, humorous, and extremely dedicated coworkers and clients whom are all passionate about digital media. The Xaxis work environment is inviting. You will work in an open modern space where you will often find groups in casual brainstorming sessions sharing ideas and strategies for new initiatives. Everyone has a voice at Xaxis, and we are open to new ways of thinking, especially those that will contribute to the overall success of Xaxis. Opinions and ideas are always welcome, in fact they are encouraged! We believe in the power of digital media to transform the way businesses and consumers can interact. You must believe as well. Responsibilities Work with other Account Managers and Associates to ensure campaigns are pacing and meeting agreed upon KPIs Take responsibility for reporting on adoption of Xaxis within your assigned agency team and all revenue generated from your agency. Develop strong and effective media plans based on sound strategies Supervise insertion order process and ensure adherence to terms and conditions Handle re-allocations and strategy shifts a timely manner Work in partnership with Audience Campaign Management team to optimize campaigns Lead agency communication, campaign strategy, campaign setup and kickoff process Conduct post-campaign analysis and deliver results to agency team and clients Essential Qualifications Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Communications, Advertising or related field Minimum of 2 years prior experience within online marketing or digital media industry Proven ability to build businesses within the digital and traditional media arenas Strong analytical skills, particularly in developing and leveraging web usage and user data to develop and expand business opportunities Extensive knowledge of current Digital, Publishing, and Technology trends Proven ability to work within fast paced deadline driven environment Strong quantitative and research skills with proven ability to demonstrate data interpretation capabilities to the agency team Excellent verbal and written communication skills, ability to prepare clear and concise client-ready documents Excellent with numbers and a strong eye for detail Experience with third party ad tags, conversion tracking pixels, floodlighting, piggybacking and reporting Advanced proficiency with Microsoft PowerPoint, Word, Excel A passion for digital marketing Experience managing digital ad campaigns, including display, video, mobile, social or paid search campaigns Experience with DART/DFA, Open AdStream (OAS), MediaMind and/or Atlas ad serving technology MBA or related graduate degree About Xaxis Xaxis is a global digital media platform that programmatically connects advertisers and publishers to audiences across all addressable channels. Xaxis combines proprietary technology, unique data assets and exclusive media relationships with the brightest team of audience analysts, data scientists and software engineers. Advertisers working with Xaxis achieve higher ROI from digital marketing campaigns. Xaxis works with over 2,700 clients across 39 markets in North America, Europe, Asia Pacific and Latin America. For more information, visit www.xaxis.com . Xaxis | Digital Brilliance Xaxis is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Scientist I, QC Apply now Job ID 33357BR Candidate must be able to work independently, as well as on teams within the cell culture, Analytical Chemistry, Microbiology, Environmental and Incoming Quality Control Laboratories. Must have the ability to multitask in a fast paced environment and prioritize work as necessary. Carry out standard operating procedures involving basic laboratory techniques, calculations, materials measurement, operation of laboratory equipment and record keeping necessary for Quality Control testing of raw materials and finished products. Responsible for testing data records, notebooks, customer reports and computerized data storage. Utilize specialized technical knowledge and skills to make detailed observations and analyze data to ensure assays are within operating parameters. Advise manager of factors that may affect quality of data. Suggest options / ideas for corrective and preventative actions. Requires a functional knowledge of laboratory equipment and techniques such as GC, HPLC and ICP-MS. Accuracy and attention to detail is required in performing all functions of this position. Initiative, organizational and computer skills are extremely valuable to ensure effective laboratory operations. Must demonstrate judgment, tact and diplomacy; in dealing with internal and external customers. Must possess self-motivation and the ability to work on routine analysis with no instructions or new assignments with limited instructions. Excellent written and oral communications skills are required. Responsible to: Read, understand and interpret analytical procedures Write WINS and SOPs Provide expert interpretation of data and compare results to established specifications or anticipated trends Adheres to written work instructions and procedures. Works with Research and Development and manufacturing Sciences to facilitate the development and or transfer of new assays. Interacts with diverse internal functional groups to solve moderate complex problems. Responds to internal and external audit observations and identifies and implements appropriate corrective and preventive actions. Initiates investigations into process failures, product failure and safety incidents, and identifies and implements and appropriate corrective and preventive actions. Requirements/Qualifications Bachelors Degree in Chemistry, Analytical Chemistry, or related field with 5 years experience in Analytical Chemistry. Masters Degree in Chemistry, Analytical or related field with 2 years experience in Analytical Chemistry. Extensive experience with HPLC or UPLC. Experience with ICPMS prefered Experience with analytical method validation Experience with cGMP, GLP, CLIA or other lab regulation is preferred Experience with Empower Software is preferred.                                                         my password Forgot Password Resend New Activation Link Register Now Dashboard Logout Job Details Job Details ( to apply  add job to Job Cart ) Job Title: Senior Quantitative Analyst - Model Validation - Trading Room Models   CVA Job ID (22042) Job Description: A Top Tier New York Bank is looking for a Quantitative Risk Analyst/Modeler to work on model review, model validation and model governance of the firms trading room pricing, risk, and valuation models including CVA models. This firm will expect the candidate to have experience in risk model development across trading room products [rates, credit, fx, commodities] for credit, counterparty credit and market risk analysis. Responsibilities include: working with a team that will build, analyze, calibrate, and validate cutting edge quantitative risk management methodologies used to price products and to measure exposures in the Rates, Credit Derivatives, Commodities, FX MBS/ABS, and Emerging Markets businesses. The role requires proven experience in quantitative risk model development. The role requires experience in model risk process and will provide technical expertise on model risk development, process and risk governance. The bank is looking for a quantitative Masters or PhD, with 5+ years of experience in risk modeling these asset classes and demonstrated work on VAR and CVA analyses and Model Validation. Strong technical skills in one or more of the following is required: (C++, R, SAS, Matlab VBA, Java] Strong quantitative Math or Finance (Stochastic Calculus) background and Excellent verbal and writing skills are required. Job Title Research Scientist II/III Education Bachelor's Degree Location Albany, NY - Albany, NY 12203 US (Primary) Career Level Experienced (Non-Manager) Category Analytical Date Needed By 2/1/2016 Job Type Full Time Travel Required 0 - 10% Job Description Opportunity For A Research Scientist II/III Albany Molecular Research Inc. provides global contract research and manufacturing services to the pharmaceutical and biotechnology industries. The principal responsibility of the Research Scientist II/III is the analysis of chemical intermediates and target compounds. The Research Scientist II/III is expected to demonstrate expertise in both the theoretical and practical aspects of LC/MS, LC/MS/MS and MS maintenance and calibration. A major component in the scientist’s performance rating will be based on productivity. RESPONSIBILITIES Conduct laboratory operations in a safe manner. Maintain familiarity with the Chemical Hygiene Plan. Exhibit safety awareness and safe work practices. Follow responsible actions regarding chemical disposal. Maintain compliance with all regulations at the federal, state, and local levels, a well as appropriate SOP’s. Develop and maintain working knowledge of commonly used mass spectrometry and chromatographic procedures. Write analytical method procedures to establish format. This may include procedures beyond that typical of the laboratory. Write analytical validation reports. Use sound judgment and previously acquired knowledge and experience to develop new procedures for new compounds. These procedures may go beyond the normal routine and may involve literature searching, as well as contact with suppliers and customers, etc. Process samples with the standard procedures effectively and under minimal supervision. Analyze experimental data for validity before reporting results. Use and maintain equipment in a neat and orderly manner. Report any malfunction immediately to supervisor. Repair minor problems. Maintain service and calibration records. Keep contemporary, accurate, legible, and complete experimental records in accordance with GMP and GLP practices. Use technical and regulatory knowledge and judgment to validate procedures to comply with internal SOPs and regulatory needs. These procedures may go beyond the normal routine and may require special or uncommon validation protocols. Submit complete, documented, and legible reports of analytical testing. Ensure that data is properly filed and accessible for review in accordance with appropriate SOP’s. SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES This position may have supervisory responsibilities assigned. # of Hires Needed 1 Job Requirements Education and/or Experience Bachelors or Master’s Degree in Chemistry or Biochemistry with an emphasis on Mass Spectrometry. Significant industrial experience and proven ability to handle difficult, or unusual assignments Chemical Hygiene training Requisition Code 2486 Relocation Offered Shift Type Standard 8 AMRI provides equal employment opportunities to all individuals without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, marital status, veteran stats, sexual orientation, citizenship, or any other characteristics protected by law. To ensure that employment decisions are consistent with equal employment opportunities, AMRI imposes only job-related requirements for these opportunities. If you need special assistance or an accommodation to apply for a posted position, contact our Human Resources department at (518) 512-2000. ID: 6462BR Job Summary and Essential Functions: Known for its scientific and operational excellence, Regeneron is a leading science-based biopharmaceutical company that discovers, invents, develops, manufactures, and commercializes medicines for the treatment of serious medical conditions. Regeneron commercializes medicines for eye diseases, high LDL-cholesterol, and a rare inflammatory condition and has product candidates in development in other areas of high unmet medical need, including oncology, rheumatoid arthritis, asthma, atopic dermatitis, pain, and infectious diseases. Summary: The preferred candidate will have training in the proper handling and care of mice, general surgical techniques, and the collection of blood and tissue samples. Experience in tissue culture (maintenance of transformed and primary cells), cell-based assays, ELISA, MSD, and flow cytometry are highly desirable. Study novel methodologies based on protocol provided by literature, seminars, and other scientists. Analyze data and interpret results of experiments within the context of research project goals, and work closely with supervisor to prepare and deliver effective oral presentations and papers in the area of expertise during internal and external meetings. Maintain state-of-the-art laboratory equipment, and accurate and complete records. Basic computer literacy and experience collecting and analyzing biological data on the computer is a necessity. Candidates will need to be highly organized, flexible and motivated. Responsibilities: Must have experience in tissue culture. Cell line and primary cell based assay (mouse and human) experience along with knowledge of flow cytometry (multi-color) is a plus. Must have experience conducting experiments using mouse tumor models, autoimmune and inflammatory disease models (preferred), with training in the proper handling and care of mice, general surgical techniques, and the collection/processing of blood and tissue samples. Must have experience with RNA/DNA isolation and basic molecular biology skills. Must have experience with ELISAs & preferred experience with MSDs, Luminex etc *Preferred experience analyzing biological data using GraphPad Prism, FACS DIVA software, FlowJo, SoftMax Pro, Excel, and Meso Scale Discovery (MSD) Discovery Workbench software. Preferred experience with primary human cell isolation and design/execution of immunological assays Experience in interpreting, analyzing and presenting research data and working in fast-paced, result oriented research environment and inter-departmental collaborations. Contribute to lab and equipment maintenance and order supplies/reagents to help create a safe, effective and efficient working environment. Experience and Required Skills: Requirements: Masters degree in Immunology, Biology, Biochemistry, or related discipline with at least 3-7+ year relevant lab research experience or Bachelor’s degree in Immunology, Biology, Biochemistry, or related discipline with 7-10+ years relevant lab research experience Demonstrated hands-on experience with cellular and molecular biology techniques including isolation and culture of cell lines and primary cells (immune cells of human and mouse origin), experience with multi-cellular assays highly desired, transfections, DNA/RNA/qRT-PCR, multi-color flow cytometry, ELISA (MSD etc), Western blots, functional assays (e.g. proliferation, cytokine production, TEER, chemotaxis, etc.). In vivo and ex vivo experience highly desired. Must have experience conducting experiments using mouse tumor models with training in the proper handling and care of mice, general surgical techniques, and the collection/processing of blood and tissue samples. This position will require the individual to pass a physical before beginning employment. This is an opportunity to join our select team that is already leading the way in the Pharmaceutical/Biotech industry.  Apply today and learn more about Regeneron’s unwavering commitment to combining good science & good business. To all agencies: Please, no phone calls or emails to any employee of Regeneron about this opening.  All resumes submitted by search firms/employment agencies to any employee at Regeneron via-email, the internet or in any form and/or method will be deemed the sole property of Regeneron, unless such search firms/employment agencies were engaged by Regeneron for this position and a valid agreement with Regeneron is in place.  In the event a candidate who was submitted outside of the Regeneron agency engagement process is hired, no fee or payment of any kind will be paid. Regeneron is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. Back to Search Results Page> Financial Analyst Add to Job Cart | View Job Cart | Apply Now Existing Resume Apply here Job ID: 1030408_RR00009398 Area of Talent: Finance/Accounting/Billing Position Type: Full-Time/Regular Location: NYU Hospitals Center Shift: 09:00 AM to 05:00 PM NYU Langone Medical Center, a world-class, patient-centered, integrated, academic medical center, is one of the nation's premier centers for excellence in clinical care, biomedical research and medical education. Located in the heart of Manhattan, NYU Langone is composed of four hospitals - Tisch Hospital, its flagship acute care facility; Rusk Rehabilitation; the Hospital for Joint Diseases, one of only five hospitals in the nation dedicated to orthopaedics and rheumatology; and Hassenfeld Children's Hospital, a comprehensive pediatric hospital supporting a full array of children's health services across the medical center - plus the NYU School of Medicine, which since 1841 has trained thousands of physicians and scientists who have helped to shape the course of medical history. The medical center's tri-fold mission to serve, teach and discover is achieved 365 days a year through the seamless integration of a culture devoted to excellence in patient care, education and research. For more information, go to www.NYULMC.org. We have an exciting opportunity to join our team as a Financial Analyst. Position Summary: This position is responsible for providing financial information and administrative support needed for making informed managerial decisions, as well as being responsible for budget prep, forecasting, and financial reporting at a high level. Job Responsibilities: Generates reports on a regular reporting basis, or as requested. Follows instructions accurately and completely. Processes, calculates, inputs, and maintains data accurately and thoroughly in reports and other assignments. Designs and prepares tables and spreadsheets, narratives, and/or other necessary materials showing competency and understanding of financial and reporting systems. Investigates causes of variances based on a sound understanding of basic budget assumptions and work criteria. Works independently and is capable of generating reports, as needed, under minimal direction or supervision. Organizes tasks to provide appropriate information in a timely and concise manner. Prepares monthly and/or quarterly financial and other types of reports emanating from the VP of Facilities Operations, Director of Finance & Administration, Business Manager and Senior Financial Analyst as needed. Prepares and/or assists in the maintenance of up-to-date information via downloads or files, and/or data, from e-Finance, Dashboard, or other financial systems. Assists the Senior Financial Analyst in the completion of special reports and/or projects for accounting or financial reporting. Prepare/process requisitions and change orders in PeopleSoft, process invoices and ensure that supporting documents are in accordance to established specifications. Assists in generating, updating and distributing reports and/or assigned work. Review vendors statements, contact vendors to request copies, confirmation and clarifications. Maintains accurate records and files up-to-date. Develops and maintains appropriate filing systems based on office needs. Organizes filing system and record keeping minimizing space needs, and increasing office efficiencies. Functions as liaison with other Medical Center departments in a professional manner to resolve discrepancies and/or problems on behalf of the FM finance team. Makes suggestions for a positive change and demonstrates independent and critical thinking. Readily accepts new responsibilities and assignments. Collects and compiles data, statistics and other materials for reports and/or budgets regularly, or as requested. Understands basic budget assumptions and criteria to investigate causes of variances with respective departments or areas and supports departments or areas with explanations and/or justifications of variances and proposes and executes budget modifications and adjustments, where appropriate. Reviews and analyzes assigned budgets and/or related work based on historical performance, changes in operations and other relevant factors to validate appropriate recommendations or requests and provides feedback/input to the finance team appraising of activities, reports, and other pertinent office matters. Has the ability to manage multiple tasks and prioritize needs based on requests and work requirements; shows understanding of workload and office work needs; determines priorities; adheres to these priorities with minimal changes. Demonstrates flexibility in adjusting to the fluctuating needs of the office of Facilities Management. Assists in the preparation of accurate analyses and reports in a clear and well-written manner. Integrates operational and financial information; is capable of generating reports independently. Researches data accurately, independently, and thoroughly using available tools; resolves discrepancies. Effectively utilizes automation, e.g. databases, for data input and retrieval of records, as needed. Audits own work before distribution to make sure that there are no inaccuracies or data deficiencies. Completes reports in a timely and efficient manner. Maximizes office time to the fullest potential. Utilizes computer skills to maximize efficiencies within financial processes and assigned work. Demonstrates initiative for taking on new tasks and/or responsibilities without being asked. Demonstrates creative thinking by suggesting alternative options to the normal solution. Provides the necessary customer service on behalf of the office of the finance and administrative teams both within the areas of responsibility, and externally throughout the Medical Center. Is a team player with all areas of the department and cooperates and communicates effectively and harmoniously with administration, peers, general staff, and other Medical Center personnel in a courteous and professional manner; communicates with leadership and/or other appropriate personnel to increase self knowledge and understanding of the operation of a particular department or area. Minimum Qualifications: Must have a Bachelors degree plus 5 year of related experience or an equivalent combination of education and experience. Must demonstrate good communication and interpersonal skills. Good working knowledge of excel application and spreadsheets. Good analytical and computer skills. Preferred Qualifications: Excellent working knowledge of Microsoft Office, and familiarity with other computer databases and spreadsheets is highly preferred. Qualified candidates must be able to effectively communicate with all levels of the organization. NYU Langone Medical Center provides its staff with far more than just a place to work. Rather, we are an institution you can be proud of, an institution where you'll feel good about devoting your time and your talents. And just as our employees invest so much in us, we invest in our employees. We're pleased to have one of the most competitive compensation packages not only among New York's hospitals and healthcare institutions, but within the corporate sector as well. We begin with exceptional medical, dental, and drug coverage. We enhance this basic coverage with comprehensive wellness programs, and supplement those with retirement investment and benefits plans, and generous paid time off allowances. Add to that a very attractive tuition program, and you'll see just some of the ways that NYU Langone Medical Center demonstrates our commitment to our employees. NYU Langone Medical Center is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer committed to diversity and inclusion in all aspects of recruiting and employment. All qualified individuals are encouraged to apply and will receive consideration without regard to race, color, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, age, religion, creed, disability, military and veteran status, genetic information or any other factor which cannot lawfully be used as a basis for an employment decision. We require applications to be completed online. If you wish to view NYU Langone Medical Center's EEO policies, please click here . Please click here to view the Federal "EEO is the law" poster or visit http://www1.eeoc.gov/employers/poster.cfm for more information. title: Data Architect
summary: The Data Architect works with Calero’s Data Scientists, Software Architects and IT Engineers to analyze requirements, review design objectives, and evaluate...
post_text: Calero - Careers For full functionality of this site it is necessary to enable JavaScript. Data Architect Job Tracking ID : 512285-530571 Job Location : Rochester, NY Atlanta Job Level : Mid Career (2+ years) Level of Education : BA/BS Job Type : Full-Time/Regular Date Updated : April 11, 2016 Years of Experience : 2 - 5 Years Starting Date : ASAP « Back to job search Invite a friend Job Description: The Data Architect designs and maintains systems for data management, storage and analysis. The Data Architect works with Calero’s Data Scientists, Software Architects and IT Engineers to analyze requirements, review design objectives, and evaluate current systems. The Data Architect then designs and leads implementation of data management, storage, and processing solutions to satisfy technical requirements including integrity, performance, security and data protection. The role’s primary responsibility is owning and extending data analytics capabilities to Calero’s commercial software products. Some additional responsibilities are related to enterprise data warehousing and analytics capabilities. Duties and Responsibilities: Works with multi-disciplinary teams to develop and analyze data and analytics technology and process requirements Leads the analysis, design, and implementation of logical data models; physical database objects’ data conversion, integration, and loading processes; query and reporting functions; data management and governance; and data quality assurance processes Maintains database performance by identifying and resolving production and application development problems; calculating optimum values for parameters; evaluating, integrating and installing new releases; completing maintenance; answering user questions Provides data systems and storage infrastructure requirements and works with Systems Operations teams to ensure successful implementation and operational support Updates job knowledge by participating in educational opportunities; reading professional publications; maintaining personal networks; participating in professional organizations Experience and Skills: Education: Bachelors’ degree in Computer Science Experience and Training: Minimum 3 years’ of experience in design and implementation of relational databases and data warehouses, including design from scratch, documenting entity relationships, and automating data integration using ETL solutions Experience working with very large data sets in live production systems Experience with multiple data technologies. Microsoft SQL Server required. Qlik Sense preferred. Oracle, Postgres, Hadoop, Spark, MongoDB, Cassandra, and Redis desired Skills & Technical Knowledge: Qlik Sense Data modeling Database design, Management and Security Operating Systems: Microsoft and Linux Relational Databases: Microsoft SQL, Oracle, Postgres Big Data and NoSQL: Hadoop, Spark, Mongo, Cassandra, Redis Ability to design, implement, maintain, and administrate large scale big data systems. Also, must have the ability to train additional technical staff in support best practices for these systems Ability to develop system and storage infrastructure technical specifications, detailed design for implementation, and lead implementation, configuration and tuning efforts Can design, develop, test, and implement automated extract, transformation and load routines using tools such as: SQL, PL/SQL and SSIS. Direct the research and evaluation of new tools and techniques and management and maintenance of related tools and environments General utility programming (shell scripts, Python, Javascript, etc.) Time management skills; able to work on a large project with many data streams and deadlines If you are having difficulties with the application process, please click here. | Privacy Need Help Applying? Check out our FAQ . or call us at 1 (800) 585-3084 Option 3
