Job Application for Copy Editor at RAPP Apply Now Copy Editor at RAPP (View all jobs) New York - RAPP ABOUT RAPP RAPP is the only agency that specializes in high-­?precision Core Dialog™: those critical, direct and high-­?value relationships that link people and brands with high precision across the fast-­?changing digital landscape. Our solutions are focused on the five crucial elements of today’s social plasma – customer-­?managed relationships (CMR), social engagement, mobile, digital and commerce – bringing high precision and creative magic to well-­?defined, addressable audiences. Our network of 35 offices across 30 countries supports more than 1,300 marketing innovators, creative technologists, experience designers and data scientists, all working collaboratively to create compelling and exciting brand engagement for our client partners.  RAPP is a part of Diversified Agency Services, a division of Omnicom Group. YOUR ROLE Provide professional editorial services expertise through technical skills and knowledge, interpersonal ability and creative thinking.  Help build effective client relationships and ensure the delivery of a high-quality product by upholding standards created by the Lead Copy Editor.  Work within a team to achieve client satisfaction as well as departmental and strategic business objectives in accordance with agency values. YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES The individual in this key role is proactive, detail-oriented and must have excellent verbal and written skills as well as a sharp eye for both print and digital editing. Responsibilities include Proofreading – verifying correct spelling and adherence to grammatical rules, backup copy and client-mandated guidelines. Ability to visually spot alignment issues and discrepancies with backup materials Interfacing with the studio, project management, client services, creative, production and other agency departments to deliver an error-free product. Ability to multitask, prioritize assignments and meet tight deadlines while maintaining high quality control standards. Exercising tact, diplomacy and the ability to protect confidential information. The ideal candidate will also be knowledgeable about the design and production of both print and interactive media. SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE At least 2 years of experience as a proofreader/copy editor, preferably at an advertising agency or marketing firm Excellent command of the English language, with respect to grammar and vocabulary, and competency in using common reference and research tools (e.g., Chicago Manual of Style , The AMA Manual of Style , Internet search, thesaurus) Effective communication/interpersonal skills to work across teams and disciplines Strong documentation skills with experience in Adobe Acrobat and MS Word markups Strong ability to multitask to meet deadlines EDUCATION/ OTHER POSITION REQUIREMENTS Bachelor’s degree in English, communications or journalism, or equivalent experience Working knowledge of a foreign language and the ability to spot basic grammatical and spelling errors in that lang NOTE:  This job description is not intended to be all-inclusive. Employee may perform other related duties as negotiated to meet the ongoing needs of the organization. Apply for this Job * Required (Optional) Almost there!   As a government contractor subject to Vietnam Era Veterans Readjustment Assistance Act (VEVRAA), we request this information in order to measure
  the effectiveness of the outreach and positive recruitment efforts we undertake pursuant to VEVRAA. Classification of protected categories
  is as follows: A "disabled veteran" is one of the following: a veteran of the U.S. military, ground, naval or air service who is entitled to compensation (or who but for the receipt of military retired pay would be entitled to compensation) under laws administered by the Secretary of Veterans Affairs; or a person who was discharged or released from active duty because of a service-connected disability. A "recently separated veteran" means any veteran during the three-year period beginning on the date of such veteran's discharge or release from active duty in the U.S. military, ground, naval, or air service. An "active duty wartime or campaign badge veteran" means a veteran who served on active duty in the U.S. military, ground, naval or air service during a war, or in a campaign or expedition for which a campaign badge has been authorized under the laws administered by the Department of Defense. An "Armed forces service medal veteran" means a veteran who, while serving on active duty in the U.S. military, ground, naval or air service, participated in a United States military operation for which an Armed Forces service medal was awarded pursuant to Executive Order 12985. Because we do business with the government, we must reach out to, hire, and provide equal opportunity to qualified people with disabilities 1 .  To help us measure how well we are doing, we are asking you to tell us if you have a disability or if you ever had a disability.  Completing this form is voluntary, but we hope that you will choose to fill it out.  If you are applying for a job, any answer you give will be kept private and will not be used against you in any way. If you already work for us, your answer will not be used against you in any way.  Because a person may become disabled at any time, we are required to ask all of our employees to update their information every five years.  You may voluntarily self-identify as having a disability on this form without fear of any punishment because you did not identify as having a disability earlier. How do I know if I have a disability? You are considered to have a disability if you have a physical or mental impairment or medical condition that substantially limits a major life activity, or if you have a history or record of such an impairment or medical condition. Disabilities include, but are not limited to: Blindness Deafness Cancer Diabetes Epilepsy Autism Cerebral palsy HIV/AIDS Schizophrenia Muscular dystrophy Bipolar disorder Major depression Multiple sclerosis (MS) Missing limbs or partially missing limbs Post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD) Obsessive compulsive disorder Impairments requiring the use of a wheelchair Intellectual disability (previously called mental retardation) Disability Status - Select - Yes, I have a disability (or previously had a disability) No, I don't have a disability I don't wish to answer Reasonable Accommodation Notice Federal law requires employers to provide reasonable accommodation to qualified individuals with disabilities. post_text: Brookhaven National Laboratory - Research Associate Physics Skip Navigation Sign In to access application status, saved documents and Job Search Agents Job Details View Job Cart (0) Send This Job to a Friend View My Account Research Associate Physics Job ID #: 664 Job Category: Postdoctoral Res Assoc/Fellows Position Type: Full Time - Post Doc Department: POAB-MINOS -EDG GROUP FLSA: Exempt Share: Facebook LinkedIn Twitter Why Work at BNL? Brookhaven National Laboratory is a multipurpose research institution funded primarily by the U.S. Department of Energy’s Office of Science. Located on the center of Long Island, New York, Brookhaven Lab brings world-class facilities and expertise to the most exciting and important questions in basic and applied science—from the birth of our universe to the sustainable energy technology of tomorrow. We operate cutting-edge large-scale facilities for studies in physics, chemistry, biology, medicine, applied science, and a wide range of advanced technologies. The Laboratory's almost 3,000 scientists, engineers, and support staff are joined each year by more than 4,000 visiting researchers from around the world. Our award-winning history, including seven Nobel Prizes, stretches back to 1947, and we continue to unravel mysteries from the nanoscale to the cosmic scale, and everything in between. Brookhaven is operated and managed by Brookhaven Science Associates, which was founded by the Research Foundation for the State University of New York on behalf of Stony Brook University, and Battelle, a nonprofit applied science and technology organization. Organizational Overview Brookhaven National Laboratory is a nonprofit research and development institution whose purpose is to advance ideas and knowledge through a multidisciplinary program of basic and applied research.  The Electronic Detector Group (EDG) in the Physics Department at BNL has an opening for a postdoctoral research associate to join in its research effort in the neutrino physics at the intensity frontier. Overview of Research Program EDG has major responsibilities in many neutrino and muon experiments; EDG physicists are working on the Deep Underground Neutrino Experiment (DUNE) and its prototype (ProtoDUNE), MicroBooNE, Daya Bay, PROSPECT, SBND, ICARUS, and the muon g-2 experiment. The EDG currently has twenty physicists at various career levels and a long history of research in fundamental particle physics. In collaboration with the Instrumentation Division, the group is performing research and development in electronics and detector design for liquid-argon TPCs. In collaboration with the BNL Chemistry Department, the group is performing research and development on water-based liquid scintillator and reactor neutrino experiments. Position Description Essential Duties and Responsibilities The successful candidate will be expected to lead the development of event reconstruction for liquid argon time projection chambers (LArTPCs), perform physics analysis on the data from the MicroBooNE experiment, and contribute to the preparations of the Deep Underground Neutrino Experiment (DUNE).  The candidate will also have the opportunity to work on other experiments that the EDG is currently conducting. This position requires a Ph.D. degree in experimental high energy or nuclear physics.  Experience with programming and software design, detector simulation, data management, and physics analysis are highly desirable. The candidate will work within the EDG and have broad associations with other groups in the laboratory and throughout the world to carry out his/her function. Domestic and international travel should be expected. Position Requirements Required Knowledge, Skills and Abilities A Ph.D. in high energy or nuclear physics. Strong record of recent accomplishments in experimental physics. Expertise in C++ and software design Demonstrated ability to perform research independently and as part of a research group. Preferred Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities Experience with particle physics detectors, digital signal processing, detector simulation, event reconstruction and analysis of the data Experience with high energy physics analysis tools such as ROOT, Geant4, Python Experience with advanced software and computing techniques Experience with web development and client-server programming Other Information BNL policy requires that research associate appointments be made to individuals who have received their doctorate within the past five years. Requires travel, including foreign travel. At Brookhaven National Laboratory we believe that a comprehensive employee benefits program is an important and meaningful part of the compensation employees receive.  Our benefits program includes but is not limited to: •              Medical Plans •              Vacation •              Holidays •              Dental Plans •              Life Insurance •              On site Child Development Center, swimming pool, weight room, tennis courts, and many other employee perks and benefits We invite you to consider Brookhaven National Laboratory for employment. To be considered for this position, please apply online at Post Doctoral Positions (http://www.bnl.gov/hr/careers/jobs/index.php?q=1) and enter the Job ID number located at the top of this page into the Search by Job ID field. Brookhaven National Laboratory (BNL) is an equal opportunity employer committed to ensuring that all qualified applicants receive consideration for employment and will not be discriminated against on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, status as a veteran, disability or any other federal, state or local protected class. BNL takes affirmative action in support of its policy and to advance in employment individuals who are minorities, women, protected veterans, and individuals with disabilities. *VEVRAA Federal Contractor Back to top View Job Cart (0) Send This Job to a Friend View My Account jobDetails

In this role, you will be: • Responsible for all of the data pipeline with a team of 8-9 people • Focus on process and data • Sending the data to other components to data scientists • Ingesting data from our partners, cleaning the data, creating reports • Leading other Data Scientists and Engineers As a Lead Data Engineer you will be overseeing all data related to our New York office (we have offices elsewhere in the country). The team is roughly 8 people right now. We already have someone in this role, but we need to split it up due to the amount of data and work we have coming in. Who Are We? We are a big data marketing startup located here in New York City, with offices around the rest of the country and the world. Our product helps to increase brand awareness and improve direct response campaigns for our client. We have raised over $40 million in funding to date, and we are growing rapidly. We literally have billions of search data queries at our disposal to provide solutions to our clients. What Skills Do You Need? • You must have Big Data technology experience such as Hadoop, MapReduce, etc... • Ideally you know Spark Compensation • $140,000 - $165,000 • Full Benefits (Medical, Dental, Vision) • Flexible Vacation/PTO Policy What's In It For You? If you are a Senior Data Engineer looking to take the next step in your career and move into a leadership role, then this is a great opportunity for you. We want to grow with you, and this will give you the chance to do so. post_text: Senior Data Engineer (Consultancy) | Averity View All Jobs Visit our website Senior Data Engineer (Consultancy) Averity - New York, NY Would the idea of getting to tackle interesting Big Data projects for some of the world's leading companies every week sound like the role of a lifetime? That's because it is. Come learn more about what we are doing. What's the Job? We are one of the country's most innovative technology consultancy firms. We pride ourselves on our ethics and our great people. Because of this, our clients include organizations around the world in retail, travel and transport, media and entertainment, technology services, government, global health, education and global development. This role will require travel. Our structure is that you will most likely be on location four days a week (Monday - Thursday). For those who love to travel and thrive in new environments, this is a great opportunity. Your work will vary from project to project. On one project you may be helping to develop and implement the Big Data architecture for a national retail company. On another project you may be advising C-level executives at a top travel company on the ways Big Data can help solve some of the biggest problems they face. The one common for theme of these projects is that you will be leveraging your deep experience with Big Data to help deliver solutions in an interactive, Agile team environment where you voice will be heard. We bring on nice, good people. You should expect that you and the people you will be working with will be leaving their ego at the door before coming here. You will de developing deep relationships with our clients and ultimately shaping the future of our company. *This role is open to anyone authorized to work in the United States. You do not need to live in one of the cities where we have an office (New York, Chicago, San Francisco, Dallas, Atlanta), to work with us. Although, if you do, we usually have group lunches on Friday, and we look forward to seeing you there. Who Are We? We are the premiere technology consulting firm in the United States. Our clients range in backgrounds, and we place an extremely high value on furthering our mission to use technology to make the world a better place. We are extremely focused on agile software development, and we have contributed to a range of open source products. We are truly an international company, and have offices in every continent around the world. What Skills Do You Need? • You will be using modern data processing technologies such as the Hadoop ecosystem and Spark • Deep hands-on experience showing expertise in Data Engineering • NoSQL • An understanding of Agile software development Compensation • $150,000 - $200,000 • Full Benefits (Medical, Dental, Vision) • Generous Paid Vacation Policy What's In It For You? This is a great chance for a Senior Data Scientist to work on a number of exciting and challenging projects with a company that values your background. You will also get to fulfill your love of travel while working with interesting organizations at the forefront of their industries. To apply for the position, please click the Apply for this Job link/button. If you would like to bookmark this position for later review, click on the Bookmark link. To email this position to a friend, click on the Email to a Friend link.  If you would like to print a copy of this position for your records, click on the Print Preview link. The New School is committed to creating and maintaining an environment that promises diversity and tolerance in all areas of employment, education and access to its educational, artistic or cultural programs and activities. The New School does not discriminate on the basis of age, race, color, creed, sex or gender (including gender identity and expression), pregnancy, sexual orientation, religion, religious practices, mental or physical disability, national or ethnic origin, citizenship status, veteran status, marital or partnership status, or any other legally protected status. Bookmark this Posting | Print Preview | Apply for this Job Please see Special Instructions for more details. Review of applicants will begin in early January 2016. Applicants should submit a cover letter that highlights their skills and abilities in areas relevant to the position; a curriculum vitae; three representative publications (electronic versions); and the names, addresses, phone numbers and e-mail addresses of three references. All applications should be submitted through The New School’s human resources web site. Position Information Position Information Position Availability: July 1, 2016 Title: NSF Post-doctoral Fellow Requisition Number: 0106071396 Location New York City Position Type: Full Time Faculty Position Status: Full-Time Department: NSPE/Dean's Office Responsibilities: The New School’s Urban Ecology Lab seeks a post-doctoral research scientist to join the Urban Resilience to Extreme Weather-related Events Sustainability Research Network (URExSRN) team funded by a 5-yr NSF grant.  The NSF Fellow will be associated with the Urban Ecology Lab and the Environmental Studies program at The New School. The focus of the NSF Postdoctoral Fellowship will be to develop a spatially explicit scenario model for examining how urban social, ecological, and technical systems change under possible alternate future scenarios for URExSRN cities, including New York City, Phoenix, Baltimore, Hermosillo, Valdivia, San Juan, Syracuse, Portland (Oregon), and Miami.  The Fellow will work closely with the URExSRN Scenario Working Group and will play a key role in the scenario development process and analysis. More information about the URExSRN can be found on the “Projects” tab at UrbanEcologyLab.com and at URExSRN.net. Postdoctoral research will include exploring options and opportunities for building resilience in project cities, understanding trade-offs associated with possible infrastructure interventions for social, ecological, and technical domains of urban systems, and assessing how urban landscape change will affect the future ability of ecosystems to provide ecosystem services for resilience.  The NSF Post-doctoral Research Fellow will participate in an ongoing research program in the Urban Ecology Lab at The New School, be tightly connected to related research through the URExSRN project, and will develop new research based on their interest and expertise with faculty at The New School and with external colleagues on the project. The expected start date is July 1, 2016. The primary location for the postdoctoral position will be at The New School’s Urban Ecology Lab. This position is for one academic year with the possibility of renewal for one additional year. The New School offers competitive salary and a full benefits package. Minimum Qualifications: This interdisciplinary position is open to scientists from diverse disciplinary fields including computer science, modeling, geography, landscape ecology, urban ecology, and related areas of the social sciences. Applicants must have completed the Ph.D. by the position start date and be eager to work with an interdisciplinary team to develop scenario models for exploring resilience in urban landscapes. The successful applicant must be adept at working with multiple researchers from a range of disciplinary backgrounds in urban ecology, including geographers, landscape and urban planners, biophysical scientists, and environmental educators.  Strong organizational, communication and writing skills are also required for coordinating research, data, and input from scenario development activities of the URExSRN. The New School is committed to maintaining a diverse educational and creative community, a policy of equal opportunity in all its activities and programs, including employment. The University is engaged in a diversity initiative and we encourage individuals from groups underrepresented in U.S. higher education to apply. The New School does not discriminate on the basis of age, race, color, creed, sex or gender (including gender identity and expression), pregnancy, sexual orientation, religion, religious practices, mental or physical disability, national or ethnic origin, citizenship status, veteran status, marital or partnership status, or any other legally protected status. Preferred Qualifications: This position is open to candidates with expertise in the natural or social sciences. The following skills are highly desirable: •	Excellent geospatial analytical skills, with experience using ArcGIS and related software libraries as they apply to modeling urban environments •	Comfort with Python scripting/programing (experience with ArcPy is also desirable) •	Agent-based modeling experience and/or cellular automata modeling •	Experience working in urban contexts and with ecosystem services assessment •	Ability to work in a multidisciplinary environment •	Excellent research design, organizational, communication, and writing skills Job Family: The New School Special Instructions to Applicants: Review of applicants will begin in early January 2016. Applicants should submit a cover letter that highlights their skills and abilities in areas relevant to the position; a curriculum vitae; three representative publications (electronic versions); and the names, addresses, phone numbers and e-mail addresses of three references. All applications should be submitted through The New School’s human resources web site. Posting Date: 12/17/2015 Closing Date: Open Until Filled Yes Supplemental Questions Required fields are indicated with an asterisk (*). Optional & Required Documents Required Documents Resume/CV Cover Letter Other Document 1 Other Document 2 Other Document 3 Optional Documents Course Proposal Document Other Document 4 Other Document 5

Return to the home page Printable Format Job Description - Site Reliability Engineer (1604108) Job Description Site Reliability Engineer - 1604108 Description In our Information Technology Team at eXelate, a Nielsen Company, we
encourage bridging creativity with stability in our efforts to scale through
supporting, growing, and optimizing our environment for our ever-growing
community of data consumers and analyzers around the globe.  We take pride
in the fact that our infrastructure is unique, in that we handle over billions
of queries a day, with the help of ~600 Linux servers addressing the heavy
lifting and our high-performance databases handling the real-time storage
demands of the Big Data Infrastructure. While our Infrastructure has a physical presence in 5 data
centers, strategically located across US and EU, as a member of the NY team, you’ll have an opportunity to exercise your
SRE skills on a global scale. The position will work closely with other team
members (and across groups) to address the deployment and maintenance needs
required to seamlessly ensure the environment is up and running 24/7. 
We’re looking for a candidate, who not only is a true Linux ninja, but has
ability to serve as a Network Architect, with a deep understanding of TCP/IP,
Load-Balancers, and firewalls, as well, has some light-weight MySQL DB
experience. So,
if you are a self-starter, highly motivated, and take pride in what you do,
then this is an excellent opportunity to prove your skills in a large scale
Linux environment. RESPONSIBILITIES: · Troubleshoot and analyze hardware, networks, application, and storage/DB
related issues · Cohesively work within a team to manage the monitoring and stability of
our multi-cloud+Colo environments · Build, configure, and proactively automate systems and services · Install and support in-house, open-source, and 3rd party applications throughout
the technology stack · Collaborate with our Developers and Data Scientists on design concepts
to help right-size, build, scale and automate production infrastructure
solutions · Provide peer support to other SREs and End Users Qualifications • Bachelors
in Computer Science or relevant work experience • At
least 3-5 years of related Site Reliability Engineering experience in Unix
environment • Configuration
and operational experience with firewalls, network switches, and load
balancers • Experience
supporting MySQL databases • Enthusiastic
about configuration management and automation • Solid
experience in at least one administrative scripting languages, such as: Bash
and/or Python • Excellent
written and verbal communication skills PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS: · Experience with any of the following tools we like: AWS, Ansible,
Zabbix, Spark, Kafka, Docker · Comfortable working in a dynamic startup environment. · OTHER INFORMATION: ·        This
position is based in NYC ·        Participation
in our off-hours on-call support rotation (Required) “Nielsen is committed
to hiring and retaining a diverse workforce. We are proud to be an Equal
Opportunity/Affirmative Action-Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression,

Return to the home page Printable Format Job Description - Identity & Access Management  Engineer (31597) Job Description Identity & Access Management  Engineer - 31597 Description Position Summary This Identity and Access Management engineering position requires a passion for building and implementing security and identity management in a fast-paced environment. It will involve all technical aspects of identity and access management and require participation in project oriented work. This position provides the opportunity to participate in multiple areas of IT infrastructure to develop and implement identity and access solutions for our environment without diminishing productivity. Position Activities Ensure WCM identity and access management infrastructure is running optimally and effectively Support ongoing and new IAM, security and compliance initiatives Improve efficiency by automating and orchestrating repeatable tasks Develop and maintain technical solutions for the ongoing improvement of identity life cycle management. Review and remediate identity and access management related tickets within IT Service Management System Manage IAM log data including configuring log sources, dashboards, rules, and reports in Splunk Do innovative identity and access management work identifying, deploying, and integrating IAM and related technologies Develops and maintains metrics and reports to provide senior management insight and evidence supporting effectiveness of IAM infrastructure, controls, projects and processes Evangelize IAM and secure practices while promoting and maintaining a favorable and positive work environment for yourself and others to assist in the overall mission of the medical college and hospital Fosters close working connections with staff and management to ensure the secure design and operations for WCM applications and infrastructure while acquiring and retaining comprehensive working knowledge of all infrastructure and related systems Performs other related duties as assigned. Qualifications Minimum Requirements 2 or more years security or IAM related experience; Bachelors degree in a related field or equivalent experience Experience with LDAP, Two-factor, SAML and other authentication technologies Experience using and managing open source technologies without vendor support Experience with Ruby, Python, PHP, PowerShell, SQL, and/or other shell scripting, or experience developing complex web applications in Ruby on Rails Ability to explain in detail how networking protocols (TCP/IP) and service protocols (HTTP, HTTPS, SSL, SSH, SMTP, SAML, DNS) function Extensive experience managing Linux servers including Apache and configuration management with either Salt, Ansible, Chef, or Puppet, or extensive experience deploying and supporting multi-tier and highly available web servers/applications/services Strong problem solving and decision making skills and the ability to make decisions independently Excellent written and verbal communication skills, on both technical and non-technical topics Comfortable working with technologies at all levels of the OSI model, layers 1 through 7 Highly Desired Requirements Passion for Identity and access management, security and privacy, and a practical and balanced approach to access management Strong understanding of virtualization and Cloud (SaaS, PaaS, IaaS) technologies and can make recommendations on its use it securel Experience working with multidisciplinary teams and with a project management office Previous experience within Information Technology at Academic Institution and knowledge of regulatory requirements (HIPAA, FERPA, etc.) Experience with administrating authentication technologies such as Microsoft Active Directory, Sun LDAP, UnboundID LDAP, Shibboleth, SimpleSAMLphp, Kerberos, OpenID Connect, Oauth, and federated identity management Experience developing web based solutions that integrate with LDAP as a data source, preferably with Ruby on Rails Skill and Abilities Fluency in navigating and using Mac OS X, Linux, and/or Windows Familiarity with SharePoint, DropBox, Confluence (wiki), ServiceNow or similar documentation storage and management systems Ability to create and present diagrams and reports for technical and non-technical audiences Ability to think outside the box in terms of designing systems and solutions Ability to deliver under tight deadlines and work off-hours as needed Ability to produce professional-level documentation and reporting using Microsoft Office Must be able to work in a very demanding and high pressure environment Working Conditions/Physical Demands No additional working conditions/physical demands provided. No relocation assistance is provided for this position. Visa sponsorship is not available for this position. Weill Cornell Medicine is committed to excellence in patient care, scientific discovery and the education of future physicians in New York City and around the world. The doctors and scientists of Weill Cornell Medicine—faculty from Weill Cornell Medical College, Weill Cornell Graduate School of Medical Sciences, and Weill Cornell Physician Organization—are engaged in world-class clinical care and cutting-edge research that connect patients to the latest treatment innovations and prevention strategies. Located in the heart of the Upper East Side's scientific corridor, Weill Cornell Medicine's powerful network of collaborators extends to its parent university Cornell University; to Qatar, where an international campus offers a U.S. medical degree; and to programs in Tanzania, Haiti, Brazil, Austria and Turkey. Weill Cornell Medicine faculty provide comprehensive patient care at NewYork-Presbyterian/Weill Cornell Medical Center, NewYork-Presbyterian/Lower Manhattan Hospital and NewYork-Presbyterian/Queens. Weill Cornell Medicine is also affiliated with Houston Methodist. Return to the home page Printable Format Job Description - Technical Content Manager (COR00064) Job Description Technical Content Manager - COR00064 Elsevier : NA-USA-NY-New York Description Technical Content Manager is responsible for developing detailed content specifications for Knovel scientific and technical informational databases. The Technical Content Manager will work closely with the Product Manager of Databases, and  subject matter experts on content sources to develop detailed specifications to maintain content using formats and structures consistent with  use cases and UX/UI requirements specified by  Product Management. The Technical Content Manager will ensure that specifications are discussed and detailed with the content product/processing teams, including where appropriate, with technology teams and with production leads at vendors. The Technical Content Manager will work closely with Elsevier Global Electronic Operations teams for content innovation and operations to develop/adopt best practices for content specification. In addition, the Technical Content Manager will develop/adopt best practices for engineering taxonomy in collaboration with Elsevier Content & Innovation team, and wherever possible. Main Activities and Responsibilities Content Specification Develop detailed content specifications for Knovel data products using detailed understanding of the data from their own domain knowledge, research, and through close collaboration with subject matter experts on content sources. Ensure specifications are clearly understood by technology and production teams, including where required, with vendors. Content Management Develop content maintenance and governance processes to ensure consistency and currency of content with sources. Identify and resolve content issues to maintain well-structured, normalized, and discoverable database content that conforms to CMS requirements. Process Control and Improvement Review existing processes and recommend process improvements for content specification for critical and interactive content, production processes, and quality outcomes, working with Product, Production and Quality/CQM teams. Taxonomy Governance Define process for taxonomy management and governance to support existing and new products, working with Knovel's CMS management team, and the Elsevier Content & Innovations group to integrate Knovel with Elsevier established taxonomy systems for growth and scalability Qualifications Technical and Functional Competencies Strong domain knowledge in Chemistry and/or Chemical Engineering. Prior experience and knowledge working with chemistry/chemical engineering data is highly desirable. Experience with technology tools - simple databases, query building, data analysis - for handling information is desirable.  Strong understanding of taxonomy use in classification and discovery in search software, both implicit and explicit (exposed in UI), including taxonomy management tools such as Synaptica. Highly proficient with MS Office (Excel, Word, Powerpoint, Outlook). Analytic skills to analyze large data sets, draw conclusions, and recommend processes for solving data challenges. Understanding of and interest in developing and working in high level content management systems and ontologies. Education, Knowledge, Skills and Experiences Minimum 3+ years working scientific and technical data, including taxonomy management/governance. Educational background in Chemistry/Chemical Engineering and additional background in information management is desirable. Past experience working in conceiving, designing and implementing content management processes is required. Excellent written skills, including the ability to clearly define and document highly technical requirements and communicating that to non-technical audiences. Elsevier is the world's leading provider of scientific, technical and medical (STM) information, tools and resources. A global company based in Amsterdam, Elsevier partners with scientists, researchers, healthcare providers, educators and decision-makers in academic institutions, governments and corporations to help them find, evaluate and use information. Our breadth of content is unparalleled, spanning virtually every STM field in the world and includes such distinguished brands as Gray's Anatomy, The Lancet and Cell. Using innovative technology, we deliver our content through tools that help our customers be more productive and successful in their work. ScienceDirect delivers the worlds' leading journals electronically to over 11 million readers in 200 countries. And physicians in 95 percent of teaching hospitals rely on ClinicalKey to get critical information that can save lives. Elsevier employs over 7,000 people in more than 70 offices worldwide. We are an employer of choice, attracting and developing talented and creative people who thrive in a challenging and fast-paced environment. We offer an excellent compensation and benefits package as well as a real opportunity for career growth in a growing organization. Elsevier is an equal opportunity employer: qualified applicants are considered for and treated during employment without regard to race, color, creed, religion, sex, national origin, citizenship status, disability status, protected veteran status, age, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law. If a qualified individual with a disability or disabled veteran needs a reasonable accommodation to use or access our online system, that individual should please contact 1.877.734.1938 or accommodations@relx.com.

They are headquartered in NYC and have offices in SF, London and Israel. Role overview: As a Fraud, Team Lead you will be implementing new mechanisms to identify fraud. You will work and collaborate closely with Data Scientists to integrate the data solution into the their platform. As hands on Team Lead you will be working with Data Systems team and using the data for the data pipeline and machine learning system. Their existing system processes billions of events daily and expose hundreds of data points to their clients and partners. You will build, coach and lead a team of engineers helping fight cybercrime, while ensuring that all the data is authentic and is not “cyberbot”. title: Research Technician II
summary: We empower exceptional scientists and students to pursue fundamental questions about living systems, and work to share scientific discoveries with researchers,...
post_text: HHMI Careers Home Employment Listings Employment Listings Search Current Openings Update Your Profile Create a Job Agent Update Job Agent Recruiting Agency Login Your user session will timeout in 5 minutes.  Please click OK to continue with your application. Research Technician II Tracking Code 413-908 Job Description About HHMI: Howard Hughes Medical Institute (HHMI) is a science philanthropy whose mission is to advance biomedical research and science education for the benefit of humanity.  We empower exceptional scientists and students to pursue fundamental questions about living systems, and work to share scientific discoveries with researchers, students, and science-curious individuals around the world. Founded in 1953 by aviator and industrialist Howard R. Hughes, HHMI is headquartered in Chevy Chase, Maryland, and employs more than 2500 people across the U.S.  Visit hhmi.org/careers to learn more about working at HHMI About the Hudspeth Lab: Our research group investigates the development, structure, and operation of the inner ear.  We are particularly interested in the molecular constituents of hair cells, the ear's sensory receptors, and in the regeneration of those cells as a potential therapy for hearing loss.  We seek an individual with experience in a full range of standard molecular-biological techniques—cloning, RNA isolation, PCRs, in situ hybridization—and in the dissection and culturing of mammalian tissues and cells.  Experience with the preparation and chemical derivatization of antibodies would be valuable, as would expertise in the production of recombinant antibodies. Summary: Perform professional work in support of scientific research.  Assist in determining suitable methods to be used in research and perform scientific investigative procedures requiring application of professional judgment and technology.  Perform preliminary interpretation of results and determine whether they are consistent with experimental goals.  Review literature. Assemble and organize data and assist and the interpretation of that data. Representative Essential Duties and Responsibilities (specific duties will depend on needs of the laboratory): Conduct literature reviews to assist in determining the most suitable methods to be used in research. Perform technical procedures such as electrophoresis, chromatography, animal surgery, or microscopy. Operate complex scientific instrumentation. May maintain insects, plants, animals and/or bacterial and tissue cultures for experimental purposes. Collect, record, organize and verify the accuracy of data. May use software applications to assemble, manipulate, format and/or perform statistical analyses of data. Analyze data, formulate conclusions and create appropriate statistical presentations, including graphs and charts, and prepare and present written or oral progress reports regarding studies. May demonstrate and explain various laboratory techniques to laboratory personnel, students and others. Actively contribute to laboratory meetings and planning sessions. Organizational Scope and Impact of Position Contributes to research results on an on-going basis.  Manages routine aspects of research projects.  Some errors may not be caught due to level of autonomy; however, individual is supervised to contain errors.  Plays a significant, but not central, role in the success of the unit. Interactions with Others Schedules work to meet assigned goals and may develop goals.  Work is reviewed at key stages by supervisor but individual is self-directed to a degree.  Brings conflicts to the attention of their supervisor for resolution.  Actively contributes information and opinions to formal and informal problem solving process.  May train others in technical areas. Preferred Qualifications: Education and Experience: Bachelor of Science degree and possibly a Master’s degree in an appropriate field of science or technology or equivalent in education and experience AND three to five years of related research experience; or, an advanced degree in an appropriate area of science or technology AND one or more years of related laboratory experience. Knowledge/Understanding/Skills & Abilities: Ability to take initiative, prioritize tasks, work independently, use good judgment, and monitor completion of assigned duties Ability to operate complex scientific equipment. In depth knowledge in a specific areas of responsibility. Fully understands role in the work unit and in related units as well as understanding how the job relates to the organization as a whole. Physical Requirements: Occasionally lifts and/or carries objects weighing up to 20 pounds. Occasionally stoops and bends. Occasionally reaches and grasps with arms and hands. Work involves possible exposure to malodorous vapors, low dose radiation, contamination by toxic chemicals and acids and presence of carcinogenic substances. Long periods of standing and/or sitting. HHMI is an equal opportunity employer. Job Location New York, New York, United States Position Type Full-Time/Regular Salary 39,600.00 - 73,600.00 USD Apply Share Return To Job Listings Contact Us / Careers © 2014 Howard Hughes Medical Institute    / Privacy Policy / Reprints & Permissions Loading...

height="0" width="0" style="display:none;visibility:hidden"></iframe> FINANCIAL ANALYST W/ STATISTICAL/ECONOMETRIC SKILLSET Job in New York, NY - Parker Lynch Contact Us Submit Resume Sign In Home Job Seekers Employers Resources Specialties + Services Locations About Blog Job Openings Search Jobs Submit Resume Job Descriptions White Papers Case Studies Salary Guide Jobs Report Bad Hire Calculator Infographics Accounting + Finance Legal Consulting Services Corporate History Our Leadership Team Work For Us Job Summary FINANCIAL ANALYST W/ STATISTICAL/ECONOMETRIC SKILLSET Location: New York, NY Category: Accounting & Finance Job Type: Direct Hire Reference: US_EN_8_22844_48608734 Posted: April 17,2016 Salary: $75000 - $85000 Annually 3 Job Description High end Fortune 50 company seeks a revenue analyst with a strong statistical modeling background..  The company offers a great work life balance environment with the opportunity to develop your career and progress up the corporate ladder.  The company offer 100% tuition reimbursement and flexible working hours.  The position includes but is not limited to: • Perform detailed revenue projections using statistical models such as regression and sensitivity models • Conduct monthly forecast calculations and reviews, in order to monitor and ensure that spending is within the company’s targets.  This analysis is performed to ensure usage of resources and revenue expectations are met. • Data analysis which includes working with large pools of data and manipulating information to perform analysis for management • Perform and develop Econometric models • Issue annual revenue plans by comparing actual results against expectations, working through budget updates throughout the year, and maintaining all plan/actual/updated analysis • Analyze revenue in each product line to determine when the level of investment should be increased or reduced • Present management recommendations, based on high integrity quantitative and qualitative analysis, to senior corporate financial management, • Implement Revenue Models, which enables the company to conduct productivity analysis based on revenue and resource history, and various resource dynamics For immediate consideration, please email your resume in a word document to ken.casaccio@parkerlynch.com An Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, or protected veteran status and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability. Back to Search Results Page> Financial Analyst Add to Job Cart | View Job Cart | Apply Now Existing Resume Apply here Job ID: 1030408_RR00009398 Area of Talent: Finance/Accounting/Billing Position Type: Full-Time/Regular Location: NYU Hospitals Center Shift: 09:00 AM to 05:00 PM NYU Langone Medical Center, a world-class, patient-centered, integrated, academic medical center, is one of the nation's premier centers for excellence in clinical care, biomedical research and medical education. Located in the heart of Manhattan, NYU Langone is composed of four hospitals - Tisch Hospital, its flagship acute care facility; Rusk Rehabilitation; the Hospital for Joint Diseases, one of only five hospitals in the nation dedicated to orthopaedics and rheumatology; and Hassenfeld Children's Hospital, a comprehensive pediatric hospital supporting a full array of children's health services across the medical center - plus the NYU School of Medicine, which since 1841 has trained thousands of physicians and scientists who have helped to shape the course of medical history. The medical center's tri-fold mission to serve, teach and discover is achieved 365 days a year through the seamless integration of a culture devoted to excellence in patient care, education and research. For more information, go to www.NYULMC.org. We have an exciting opportunity to join our team as a Financial Analyst. Position Summary: This position is responsible for providing financial information and administrative support needed for making informed managerial decisions, as well as being responsible for budget prep, forecasting, and financial reporting at a high level. Job Responsibilities: Generates reports on a regular reporting basis, or as requested. Follows instructions accurately and completely. Processes, calculates, inputs, and maintains data accurately and thoroughly in reports and other assignments. Designs and prepares tables and spreadsheets, narratives, and/or other necessary materials showing competency and understanding of financial and reporting systems. Investigates causes of variances based on a sound understanding of basic budget assumptions and work criteria. Works independently and is capable of generating reports, as needed, under minimal direction or supervision. Organizes tasks to provide appropriate information in a timely and concise manner. Prepares monthly and/or quarterly financial and other types of reports emanating from the VP of Facilities Operations, Director of Finance & Administration, Business Manager and Senior Financial Analyst as needed. Prepares and/or assists in the maintenance of up-to-date information via downloads or files, and/or data, from e-Finance, Dashboard, or other financial systems. Assists the Senior Financial Analyst in the completion of special reports and/or projects for accounting or financial reporting. Prepare/process requisitions and change orders in PeopleSoft, process invoices and ensure that supporting documents are in accordance to established specifications. Assists in generating, updating and distributing reports and/or assigned work. Review vendors statements, contact vendors to request copies, confirmation and clarifications. Maintains accurate records and files up-to-date. Develops and maintains appropriate filing systems based on office needs. Organizes filing system and record keeping minimizing space needs, and increasing office efficiencies. Functions as liaison with other Medical Center departments in a professional manner to resolve discrepancies and/or problems on behalf of the FM finance team. Makes suggestions for a positive change and demonstrates independent and critical thinking. Readily accepts new responsibilities and assignments. Collects and compiles data, statistics and other materials for reports and/or budgets regularly, or as requested. Understands basic budget assumptions and criteria to investigate causes of variances with respective departments or areas and supports departments or areas with explanations and/or justifications of variances and proposes and executes budget modifications and adjustments, where appropriate. Reviews and analyzes assigned budgets and/or related work based on historical performance, changes in operations and other relevant factors to validate appropriate recommendations or requests and provides feedback/input to the finance team appraising of activities, reports, and other pertinent office matters. Has the ability to manage multiple tasks and prioritize needs based on requests and work requirements; shows understanding of workload and office work needs; determines priorities; adheres to these priorities with minimal changes. Demonstrates flexibility in adjusting to the fluctuating needs of the office of Facilities Management. Assists in the preparation of accurate analyses and reports in a clear and well-written manner. Integrates operational and financial information; is capable of generating reports independently. Researches data accurately, independently, and thoroughly using available tools; resolves discrepancies. Effectively utilizes automation, e.g. databases, for data input and retrieval of records, as needed. Audits own work before distribution to make sure that there are no inaccuracies or data deficiencies. Completes reports in a timely and efficient manner. Maximizes office time to the fullest potential. Utilizes computer skills to maximize efficiencies within financial processes and assigned work. Demonstrates initiative for taking on new tasks and/or responsibilities without being asked. Demonstrates creative thinking by suggesting alternative options to the normal solution. Provides the necessary customer service on behalf of the office of the finance and administrative teams both within the areas of responsibility, and externally throughout the Medical Center. Is a team player with all areas of the department and cooperates and communicates effectively and harmoniously with administration, peers, general staff, and other Medical Center personnel in a courteous and professional manner; communicates with leadership and/or other appropriate personnel to increase self knowledge and understanding of the operation of a particular department or area. Minimum Qualifications: Must have a Bachelors degree plus 5 year of related experience or an equivalent combination of education and experience. Must demonstrate good communication and interpersonal skills. Good working knowledge of excel application and spreadsheets. Good analytical and computer skills. Preferred Qualifications: Excellent working knowledge of Microsoft Office, and familiarity with other computer databases and spreadsheets is highly preferred. Qualified candidates must be able to effectively communicate with all levels of the organization. NYU Langone Medical Center provides its staff with far more than just a place to work. Rather, we are an institution you can be proud of, an institution where you'll feel good about devoting your time and your talents. And just as our employees invest so much in us, we invest in our employees. We're pleased to have one of the most competitive compensation packages not only among New York's hospitals and healthcare institutions, but within the corporate sector as well. We begin with exceptional medical, dental, and drug coverage. We enhance this basic coverage with comprehensive wellness programs, and supplement those with retirement investment and benefits plans, and generous paid time off allowances. Add to that a very attractive tuition program, and you'll see just some of the ways that NYU Langone Medical Center demonstrates our commitment to our employees. NYU Langone Medical Center is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer committed to diversity and inclusion in all aspects of recruiting and employment. All qualified individuals are encouraged to apply and will receive consideration without regard to race, color, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, age, religion, creed, disability, military and veteran status, genetic information or any other factor which cannot lawfully be used as a basis for an employment decision. We require applications to be completed online. If you wish to view NYU Langone Medical Center's EEO policies, please click here . The firm’s expertise ranges from environmental remediation and urban planning, to engineering iconic buildings and designing sustainable transport networks, to developing the energy sources of the future and enabling new ways of extracting essential resources. Approximately 34,000 employees, including engineers, technicians, scientists, architects, planners, surveyors, program and construction management professionals, as well as various environmental experts, work for this dynamic organization in more than 500 offices across 40 countries worldwide. wsp-pb.com/usa WSP, an award winning and innovative multidisciplinary engineering consulting firm, has an opening for a Survey Crew Chief in Briarcliff Manor, NY office. WSP works closely with architects and owners from around the world on large complex projects with a focus on sustainability and energy performance in the built environment. Responsibilities include: Management of the field aspects of projects Working closely and collaboration with a dynamic team of experienced professionals Performance of boundary & topographic surveys Performance of engineering design surveys Performance of construction layout and GPS surveys Job Requirements Requirements: Minimum 3 years survey crew chief experience College degree and/ or L.S.I.T. preferred but not necessary Experience with Topographic Surveys, Boundary Surveys, Construction Layout, & GPS Surveys Experience with Auto CAD Civil 3D for editing field data Experience with Leica Robotic Total Stations a plus Excellent verbal and written communication skills Successful candidate must be willing to travel from time to time EOE - Minority / Female / Veteran / Disability / Sexual Orientation / Gender Identity EOE / Veteran/ Disability/ Gender (M-F)/Gender Identity/ Sexual Orientation Login to Apply User ID: Password: Forgot password? Analyze and interpret results in written and oral format. Participate in the training and guidance of less experienced employees. Essential Duties and Responsibilities: Perform routine tests of raw materials/finished products/stability samples/ IPT /PV samples including dissolution, assays, impurities, content uniformity, particle size distribution, density, water determination by KF, preparation and standardization of solutions, and tests according to the monographs/LIMS Procedures and USP, working independently. Maintain accurate lab LIMSand complete all related analytical reports, in compliance with SOPs. Ensure notebooks are reviewed in a timely manner, in accordance with SOPs. Analyze and interpret results in written and oral format in consultation with supervisor/project leaders. Review of analytical data of laboratory associates. Perform troubleshooting of day to day laboratory issues, in consultation with supervisor/project leaders. Train and provide guidance and feedback to other Scientists in the Quality Control department. Oversee the maintenance of the laboratory area for the workgroup, to ensure cleanliness and organization on an ongoing basis. Audit log books for compliance on a quarterly basis. Located in the heart of Manhattan, NYU Langone is composed of four hospitals - Tisch Hospital, its flagship acute care facility; Rusk Rehabilitation; the Hospital for Joint Diseases, one of only five hospitals in the nation dedicated to orthopaedics and rheumatology; and Hassenfeld Children's Hospital, a comprehensive pediatric hospital supporting a full array of children's health services across the medical center - plus the NYU School of Medicine, which since 1841 has trained thousands of physicians and scientists who have helped to shape the course of medical history. The medical center's tri-fold mission to serve, teach and discover is achieved 365 days a year through the seamless integration of a culture devoted to excellence in patient care, education and research. For more information, go to www.NYULMC.org. We have an exciting opportunity to join our team as an IT Audit Manager. Position Summary: Under the supervision of the Director of Internal Audit, the IT Audit Manager leads the Internal Audit Department in the development and implementation of the Information Technology (IT) annual audit plan. The IT Audit Manager will provide guidance and oversight for IT audit activities including: assessing the adequacy of the IT internal control environment, developing/conducting the IT risk assessment, identifying key IT controls and preparing audit reports with recommendations for management review and implementation. Job Responsibilities: Stay abreast of advances in technology and IT auditing techniques; regularly share knowledge with staff and audit management; effectively interact with various levels of internal management. Identify emerging IT issues, problems and recommend solutions to Internal Audit Management regarding complex application/software control issues and technical issues. Consult on the development of appropriate internal controls for new information systems applications, technologies, and projects as applicable. Provide advice on the Medical Centers' security architecture (i.e., policies, standards, procedures, and controls) to support the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of information assets including compliance with HIPAA and Privacy regulations. Work with the Medical Center IT Department in defining and updating the annual risk assessment, as well as monitoring remediation of identified areas for improvement. Work with the Medical Center IT Department in defining and updating the annual risk assessment, as well as monitoring remediation of identified areas for improvement. Oversee audits and/or audit resources conducted by external audit resources including development of audit programs and coordination of audit execution and reporting processes. Ensure the regular review of the Medical Centers' Data Center(s) and Disaster Recovery Plans including plans for infrastructure as well as key application systems, such as Epic, Peoplesoft Financials, etc. Develop annual personnel development plans for staff that include areas for improvement, goal setting, performance evaluation, and education & training plans. Create detailed work papers that support findings and recommendations including audit programs and well-written reports that incorporate management input and action plans for audits conducted in a timely manner. Evaluate, design, and conduct audits on an individual/team basis that evaluate IT control design and control effectiveness; develop and execute audit programs and testing. Lead the IT audit process in accordance with recognized audit standards, guidelines and best practices such as Control Objectives for Information and Related Technology (COBIT) as defined by the Information Systems Audit and Control Association (ISACA) or others. Minimum Qualifications: Must have a Bachelor's Degree A minimum of five years experience with Information Technology audits with a concentration of experience in a large hospital or healthcare system. Certified Information Systems Auditor (CISA) is required. Knowledge of the financial, operational, and information systems and regulatory issues confronting health care organizations. Preferred Qualifications: Master's Degree, Certified Public Accountant (CPA) is preferred but not required. Five years experience with Big Four or Public Accounting firm including an emphasis on financial and accounting applications and SOX requirements and COSO Framework Experience with continuous auditing including supporting technologies such as ACL Experience is preferred but not required. Familiarity or demonstrable experience in PeopleSoft, EPIC, Oracle Financials/Database, and network/internet security is preferred but not required. Qualified candidates must be able to effectively communicate with all levels of the organization. NYU Langone Medical Center provides its staff with far more than just a place to work. Rather, we are an institution you can be proud of, an institution where you'll feel good about devoting your time and your talents. Back to Search Results Page> Epic Radiant Analyst Add to Job Cart | View Job Cart | Apply Now Existing Resume Apply here Job ID: 1030463_RR00009567 Area of Talent: EPIC Position Type: Full-Time/Regular Location: NYU Langone Health System Shift: 09:00 AM to 05:00 PM NYU Langone Medical Center, a world-class, patient-centered, integrated, academic medical center, is one of the nation's premier centers for excellence in clinical care, biomedical research and medical education. Located in the heart of Manhattan, NYU Langone is composed of four hospitals - Tisch Hospital, its flagship acute care facility; Rusk Rehabilitation; the Hospital for Joint Diseases, one of only five hospitals in the nation dedicated to orthopaedics and rheumatology; and Hassenfeld Children's Hospital, a comprehensive pediatric hospital supporting a full array of children's health services across the medical center - plus the NYU School of Medicine, which since 1841 has trained thousands of physicians and scientists who have helped to shape the course of medical history. The medical center's tri-fold mission to serve, teach and discover is achieved 365 days a year through the seamless integration of a culture devoted to excellence in patient care, education and research. For more information, go to www.NYULMC.org. We have an exciting opportunity to join our team as an Epic Analyst. Position Summary: This position is responsible for in-depth knowledge of assigned Epic System software. This position will conduct regular day-to-day communication, review software, demonstrates a deeper understanding of business operations, and works with Epic, the Project Team(s), NYULMC Business Representatives/Subject Matter Experts, and end users to tailor the system to fit the organizations needs. This position routinely performs in-depth analysis of workflows, data collection, report details, and other technical issues associated with the use of Epic software; is responsible for developing and documenting the internal procedures that will be used in conjunction with Epic applications; and will design, build, test, install and maintain those solutions. The candidate for this position is expected to use critical thinking skills in providing systems solutions to meet business needs. Job Responsibilities: Participate in disaster recovery measures. Actively participate and contribute in meetings, including supporting meeting facilitation. Ensures all quality assurance processes are followed, including change management and testing efforts. Provide assigned on-site support during go-lives and system upgrades. Demonstrates an understanding of interface requirements and testing. Analyze new functionality in new releases to identify impact. Communicate effectively across all impacted teams associated with task assignments. Support the training team by keeping trainers abreast of new functionality and system changes. Analyze data conversion needs. Ensure the test scripts have been created, reviewed, and updated to reflect proposed workflow solutions. Make recommendations, review and test changes, enhancements, and each new release as assigned. Troubleshoot problems and address questions from users, and provide on-call support on a rotating basis. Collaborate effectively with colleagues and across teams to achieve the completion of tasks. Collaborate effectively with Epic using Sherlock or other appropriate tools. Complete all tasks in a timely manner with accurate documentation. Work with Application Managers/Directors/etc. and the entire Project Team, to collect, analyze and document business operations and workflow. Minimum Qualifications: Must have a BA/BS Degree or equivalent and 1-3 years of relevant experience . Must demonstrate effective oral, written communication and follow-up skills. Must demonstrate strong desktop tool usage including Word, Excel, and PowerPoint. Must maintain certification in at least 1 Epic application. Minimal implementation and/or support experience desired. Preferred Qualifications: Healthcare experience is preferred but not required. Qualified candidates must be able to effectively communicate with all levels of the organization. NYU Langone Medical Center provides its staff with far more than just a place to work. Rather, we are an institution you can be proud of, an institution where you'll feel good about devoting your time and your talents. And just as our employees invest so much in us, we invest in our employees. We're pleased to have one of the most competitive compensation packages not only among New York's hospitals and healthcare institutions, but within the corporate sector as well. We begin with exceptional medical, dental, and drug coverage. We enhance this basic coverage with comprehensive wellness programs, and supplement those with retirement investment and benefits plans, and generous paid time off allowances. Add to that a very attractive tuition program, and you'll see just some of the ways that NYU Langone Medical Center demonstrates our commitment to our employees. NYU Langone Medical Center is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer committed to diversity and inclusion in all aspects of recruiting and employment. All qualified individuals are encouraged to apply and will receive consideration without regard to race, color, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, age, religion, creed, disability, military and veteran status, genetic information or any other factor which cannot lawfully be used as a basis for an employment decision. We require applications to be completed online. If you wish to view NYU Langone Medical Center's EEO policies, please click here . title: Technical Recruiter, Contract
summary: Our team is responsible for hiring world-class software engineers, product managers, product designers, data scientists and technical operations engineers....
post_text:
Etsy Careers - Technical Recruiter, Contract Etsy Careers Technical Recruiter, Contract Human Resources Brooklyn, 
                    New York Apply Description Etsy's Engineering and Product Recruiting team is hiring a full-desk recruiter to help source, engage, screen, and close some of the best product and engineering talent in the country and abroad. The Recruiter will interact with people from across the entire company, impact the bottom line, and support Etsy’s mission. This is a contract role in our Brooklyn offices. About the Team Our team is responsible for hiring world-class software engineers, product managers, product designers, data scientists and technical operations engineers. We’re an extremely hardworking team that understands the importance of moving quickly while being thorough. We hold candidate experience second to none, and pride ourselves in our ability to keep hiring teams extremely happy. We love to experiment and try new things, build our own tools, and travel. We support our Brooklyn, San Francisco and international offices. About the Job You'll take on a full-desk, recruiter role. You'll source candidates, guide them through our process, negotiate offers and close them. On our team, you'll interact with hiring managers and hiring teams, often. You'll also have the opportunity to shape the strategies and tools we use to get the job done. Responsibilities: Provide a stellar experience for each and every candidate you engage Contribute to the shaping of an evolving recruiting program Manage a robust requisition load that covers a multitude of skill sets and functions Partner with hiring teams to create and execute recruiting strategies Maintain an up to date and reportable pipeline Deliver qualified, viable candidates to hiring teams Guide candidates through the hiring process Negotiate offers and close candidates About You You’re competitive and are on, even when you're off. You're persistent, have a sense of urgency, had success in a large agency environment, and want to be part of something bigger. You'll be successful in this role if you: Have recruited engineers and PMs for large b2c tech companies Have hustle Understand what it means to be a partner Can manage up Keep candidate experience in mind at all times Prefer sourcing on google.com over linkedin.com Research the technologies you are recruiting for Love to think about and debate best practices Understand the Etsy mission Follow the industry Are naturally curious What's Next If you're interested in joining the team, please send us your resume and a cover letter. Let us know how you fit the bill for each of our requirements above. Etsy is a place that values individuality and creativity, so use your judgment and write to us in your own voice. If you have a presence on the web that we can easily access (Twitter, Facebook, G+), work on a side project, write a blog, or practice another craft besides hiring the best talent out there, that means something to us and we’d love to hear about it. The firm’s expertise ranges from environmental remediation and urban planning, to engineering iconic buildings and designing sustainable transport networks, to developing the energy sources of the future and enabling new ways of extracting essential resources. Approximately 34,000 employees, including engineers, technicians, scientists, architects, planners, surveyors, program and construction management professionals, as well as various environmental experts, work for this dynamic organization in more than 500 offices across 40 countries worldwide. wsp-pb.com/usa WSP|Parsons Brinckerhoff's Power Group has an immediate opening for a Senior Project Controls Specialist in our New York office.  The key responsibilities and duties for the position includes, but not limited to: Sets up and manages support functions covering planning, tracking, reporting, quality management and internal communication Continually assess ongoing processes to identify areas for potential improvement As required, participate in initiatives to improve processes (i.e. participate in working groups) Produces consolidated reporting, including milestone summary, key issues, risks, benefits, summary of costs incurred Ensure compliance with the Company’s financial policies and procedures to include revenue recognition policies and project set up rules. software and license control Assist with the production of user documentation Provide financial guidance and support to facilitate the accurate set-up, performance and reporting of projects Other tracking/estimating, project administration, document control experience Proficiency in Oracle Primavera Contract Management, SharePoint, and MS Office, including Access The selected candidate must post_text: Careers SAE/AS Consumer Consumer Products Group | New York, NY, United States Apply Send Jobvite Senior Account Executive consumer lifestyle Marina Maher Communications At MMC, we are brand builders, storytellers, artists, mad (data) scientists, tech junkies and trendsensors armed with powerful ideas and a strong point of view on what’s going to move the needle. Our combination of creativity and smarts means we are the best at creating conversations that persuade and inspire, and ultimately impact business. The SAE on this top brand is a special mix of Beauty, Health and Wellbeing experience. It’s a unique professional challenge suited for the person who loves to combine beauty brands with consumer healthcare. Our blue-chip client roster includes numerous brands within P&G, Galderma, Reckitt Benckiser, Kimberly-Clark, Stainmaster, Bayer, Merck, Celgene, Eisai, Novo Nordisk and Merz. We are looking for talent to tell our clients’ stories through unexpected, highly-relevant and authentic ways that get consumers and healthcare professionals to take action. Our SAE plays a vital role in leading this charge by finding the right balance between beauty and science. By h elping our clients successfully navigate challenges, bringing them to the forefront of innovative programming and leading them to award-winning work. Why you should join MMC’s Consumer Lifestyle division Diverse experiences and opportunities in healthcare marketing -- from data analytics to celebrity brand ambassadors Leaders in providing innovative traditional, social and digital solutions to major pharma brands Our clients consider us true partners; they are appreciative, accountab le and receptive to our counsel Opportunity to interact with patients and advocacy groups, through various channels, including digital and live events Growth opportunities with in a collaborative team environment At all levels, there is client interaction and inclusion in planning through execution Long-standing relationships with pharma clients that continue to grow year over year Robust franchise (team) which allows for a focus and independence but also the resources an d support of a larger franchise What we like to see in our account people Love of strategy and knows how to weave it into everyday thinking/actions Experience developing an executional plan that drives to measurable business objectives (beyond media impressions) Improves upon processes; does not just follow an SOP or is satisfied with status quo Forward thinking; pushes clients and teams to develop innovative solutions Enjoys being part of a highly collaborative team Contributes expertly to highly detailed projects, such as trackers, material review calendars, etc Unafraid to accept and provide corrective counsel and manage expectations 360 degrees The ideal candidate has A Bachelor's degree, entrepreneurial spirit and love of constant learning Brings experience and passion for Healthcare Communications /Beauty and Pharma (Rx or OTC) Marketing 4+ years of experience working within the social/digital and agency space Advanced written and presentation communication skills A proven understanding and expertise in healthcare brand strategy, as well as the social/digital space and how it integrates with the wider marketing mix for Fortune 500 size brands Foster strong relationships and collaboration with cross-discipline teams that include Creative, Project Management, Media, and Analytics -- from initial brief and brainstorm, to campaign execution and measurement Strategic understanding of traditional, digital, and social-specific media planning & buying, along with the proper metrics of success and measurement opportunities Top-notch social and communication skills to deliver impeccable strategic social counsel Company Summary Marina Maher Communications (MMC) is an award-winning, integrated agency designed to deliver big ideas, compelling brand stories and results-driven programs that resonate with consumers and the media. The agency uses data-driven methodologies, deep relationships with influencers and unparalleled access to the media and celebrities to motivate action and reverberate its messages across pop culture conversations. Our always on, 360° Creative Catalyst Group brings a fully integrated approach to building consumer lifestyle and health and well-being brands, with deep experience marketing to women.  The agency, which was recently named Creative Agency of the Year by The Holmes Report and a Best Place to Work by AdAge and The Holmes Report, is an Omnicom company.
