title: Technical Research Analyst 5102-69
summary: SAS and/or R computer programming to create outcome measures, restructure data files, perform data-cleaning operations, create public use files, and perform...
post_text:
Technical Research Analyst 5102-69 in New York, NY, United States Home OK Homepage Job Seekers Login / Create New Account Search Jobs Browse Jobs Search Agent Saved Job Searches Inbox Post / Edit Resume More » Employers Login / Create New Account Post / Edit Jobs Search Resumes Manage Candidates Special offers OK Loyalty Program More » Resources Job search advice, news, and events About Us About OK Staff Pricing/Products OK Products and Pricing Help Opportunity Knocks Support Center Job Seekers Login / Create New Account Pricing/Products Search Jobs Browse Jobs Search Agent Saved Job Searches Inbox Post / Edit Resume Upgrade Resume More Employers Login / Create New Account Pricing/Products Post / Edit Jobs Search Resumes Manage Candidates Special offers OK Loyalty Program More About Us About OK Staff Help Resources OpportunityKnocks » Job Seeker Center login View Job Technical Research Analyst 5102-69 MDRC | New York NY 10016 USA | Full Time | Posted: 04/07/2016 Description Details Job Contact Similar Jobs Job Description top MDRC is seeking a Technical Research Analyst to join our K-12 Education policy group and be part of a multidisciplinary team developing evaluation research on current education policy issues. Studies conducted examine programs aimed at improving the education of students in low-performing schools. Our research includes demonstrations and rigorous evaluations of interventions related to early-grade reading curricula, teacher professional development, after-school programs, middle school and high school reforms, and district-wide policy initiatives. Our work examines both the implementation and impact of educational programs and policies. MDRC’s K-12 Education policy area has a team-oriented work culture, and the Technical Research Analyst will work under the guidance and supervision of leading researchers in the fields of education, public policy, economics, and sociology. Responsibilities: The primary role of the Technical Research Analyst is to process, manage, and analyze a variety of primary quantitative data sets to help other researchers at MDRC determine the impacts of education programs and policies. Key responsibilities include: SAS and/or R computer programming to create outcome measures, restructure data files, perform data-cleaning operations, create public use files, and perform various forms of statistical and data analysis. Writing technical memos that document data processing and data quality. Running statistical models and performing data analysis in SAS to identify the impacts of educational programs and policies. Managing the quantitative data work of research projects, including determining the timing of tasks and supervising junior staff members. Developing and managing relationships with research partners outside the organization to obtain data and ensure data quality. Beyond working with data sets, the Technical Research Analyst has the opportunity to be involved with many aspects of projects, including: Contributing to analytical sections of research reports. Developing survey and data-collection instruments. Active involvement in various stages of research projects, from proposals to project design to analysis and reporting. Possible travel to visit research sites in the field. Research Analyst Qualifications : We are looking for candidates with strong academic backgrounds and work experience in quantitative research or data management. Specific qualifications include: Master’s degree in statistics, economics, mathematics, education, or social science, or bachelor’s degree plus relevant work experience. Demonstrated experience using programming syntax with a statistical programming or database programming language such as SAS (preferred), R, STATA, SPSS, or SQL. Candidates should be able to speak knowledgably about and provide detailed descriptions of their current or recent use of statistical software. Data-management experience preferred. Experience with Microsoft Office (especially Word and Excel). Strong communication and technical writing skills. Excellent attention to detail and ability to work with data. Demonstrated interest in social policy issues affecting education and working with schools. Experience in education policy, research, or school-based work is highly desired. Please attach a programming sample to your application. The Technical Research Analyst position is based in MDRC’s New York office. Some on-the-job training is provided. Salary will be commensurate with experience. Comprehensive fringe benefits offered. Only candidates selected for future consideration will be contacted. MDRC is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. title: Research Aide
summary: The doctors and scientists of Weill Cornell Medicine—faculty from Weill Cornell Medical College, Weill Cornell Graduate School of Medical Sciences, and Weill...
post_text: Job Description - Research Aide (31604) Go to the main content section. Welcome. You are not signed in. My Briefcase | Sign In Job Search My Jobpage Basic Search | Advanced Search | Jobs Matching My Profile | Beginning of the main content section. Return to the home page Printable Format Job Description - Research Aide (31604) Job Description Research Aide - 31604 Description Position Summary Under general direction, the Research Aide works closely with the Clinical and Translational Science Center (CTCS) research team facilitators to assist research teams in the development of research plans, facilitates studies and protocols conducted on the CTSC and the community, and handles the bulk of daily study activities. Assists investigators in executing protocols on the CTSC. Works closely with other members of TREST to conduct protocols on the CTSC. Updates investigators regarding CTSC resources, policies, and procedures. Promotes CTSC and its resources to WCM and partnering institutions. Position Activities Arranges for follow-up visits with patients on an outpatient basis. Assesses patient eligibility for inclusion in specific investigational studies. Organizes and maintains study forms, documents and applications for regulatory purposes. Performs study evaluations and maintains patient care during trials. Collects, manages, and inputs study data; collaborates with staff in developing and maintaining databases; participates in data collection and entry by direct patient interview and extracts data from patients charts; follow-up with patients by telephone or direct interview. Generates statistical reports and ensures all personnel involved with patients strictly adhere to the study requirements. Performs administrative duties to maintain the proper operations of the research studies. Screens potential research subject applicants, ensuring that research subjects meet appropriate criteria; answering questions and inquiries about the research protocol, notifying appropriate research team members, principal investigators, and research participants advocates regarding problems and concerns reports by subject. Performs administrative duties to maintain the proper operations of research studies. Works with the research nurse team to ensure adherence to protocol design. Completes regulatory paperwork with research team facilitator in ensuring appropriate documentation of research in charts. Coordinates the recruitment and retention of research subjects in collaboration with community outreach staff of Cornell University Cooperative Extension and affiliated hospitals. Acts as a liaison between all CTSC research team members cross-institutionally to ensure that protocol information is current and disseminated in a timely manner. Performs other related duties as assigned. Qualifications Minimum Requirements Bachelor's degree in related field. Proficient computer skills using Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Adobe, web-based calendar systems, email and various database software Excellent interpersonal with the ability to communicate (oral and written) professionally, quickly and accurately Highly Desired Requirements Minimum two years of related work experience. Experience with research in an academic health center. Working Conditions/Physical Demands No additional working conditions/physical demands provided. No relocation assistance is provided for this position. Visa sponsorship is not available for this position. Weill Cornell Medicine is committed to excellence in patient care, scientific discovery and the education of future physicians in New York City and around the world. The doctors and scientists of Weill Cornell Medicine—faculty from Weill Cornell Medical College, Weill Cornell Graduate School of Medical Sciences, and Weill Cornell Physician Organization—are engaged in world-class clinical care and cutting-edge research that connect patients to the latest treatment innovations and prevention strategies. Located in the heart of the Upper East Side's scientific corridor, Weill Cornell Medicine's powerful network of collaborators extends to its parent university Cornell University; to Qatar, where an international campus offers a U.S. medical degree; and to programs in Tanzania, Haiti, Brazil, Austria and Turkey. Weill Cornell Medicine faculty provide comprehensive patient care at NewYork-Presbyterian/Weill Cornell Medical Center, NewYork-Presbyterian/Lower Manhattan Hospital and NewYork-Presbyterian/Queens. Weill Cornell Medicine is also affiliated with Houston Methodist. EOE/M/F/Vet/Disabled Job - WCMC-Research Primary Location - New York City Organization - Clinical Translational Science Center Schedule - Full-time Overtime Status - Non-exempt Grade - 3 Number of Openings - 1

Positive Neutral Negative Cancel Submit Analysis, Hadoop, Java, Linux, Management, Modeling, Programming, Python, Software Engineer, Video Full Time, Full Time Telecommuting not available Travel not required Job Description Vine is the entertainment network where the world's stories are captured, created and remixed. Day after day, we see the impact of Vine extend beyond our phones and prove Vine is much more than just an app. The stories shared on Vine spark new trends, influence culture and reach millions of people around the world. In this role, you’ll be a key player in developing Vine’s content recommendation system. Your team will be tasked with designing systems to solicit, understand, and transform user tastes and preferences into high quality content recommendations. Join us and build products that give creators a stage and put video entertainment in people’s pockets. This is a full-time position based in NYC, at Vine HQ. Interface with analytics, product management, and operations teams. Work with large unstructured and structured data sets (multi-terabyte+, 100MM+ daily transaction volumes). and update your profile, click here Scientist, Late Stage Bioassay Development Scientist, Late Stage Bioassay Development United States-NY-Tarrytown Requisition Number:  6489BR Req ID: 6489BR Job Summary and Essential Functions: Known for its scientific and operational excellence, Regeneron is a leading science-based biopharmaceutical company that discovers, invents, develops, manufactures, and commercializes medicines for the treatment of serious medical conditions. Regeneron commercializes medicines for eye diseases, high LDL-cholesterol, and a rare inflammatory condition and has product candidates in development in other areas of high unmet medical need, including oncology, rheumatoid arthritis, asthma, atopic dermatitis, pain, and infectious diseases. Summary: The Late Stage Bioassay Group in the Therapeutic Proteins Department seeks a Scientist to develop and optimize potency assays for antibodies in preclinical developmentThe candidate will be instrumental in generating product specific potency assays for the characterization of preclinical and clinical material. In addition, the candidate will be responsible for transferring assays to our manufacturing site. The ideal candidate will have experience developing cell-based assays to measure the biological activity of protein reagents and monoclonal antibodies (e.g. cytotoxicity assays and luciferase reporter assays). A strong background in cell biology and an understanding of signaling pathways is essential. Experience with flow cytometry, stable cell line generation, clonal cell line generation, and bioassay automation (Hamilton) is preferred. Must be able to identify assay problems and design experiments to determine sources of assay variability. Candidate must be able to work comfortably in a fast-paced, collaborative environment, and be able to conduct multiple experiments in parallel. A PhD degree in cell biology, biochemistry or related field with 0-4 years post-graduate experience is required. Responsibilities: - Develop product-specific potency assays - Mammalian cell culture of adherent and non-adherent cell lines - Stable cell line generation via plasmid based and viral-based methodologies - Set up and run bioassays including dose response and/or inhibition curves with appropriate cells. - Analyze data (Prism) and track data generated over time to determine assay stability - Optimize assays for transfer to manufacturing division. This may require single cell cloning of stable cell lines, evaluating multiple variables to assess assay stability, and implementation of automation for sample testing - Present results within and outside of the group Experience and Required Skills: Requirements: - PhD with 0-4 years of experience - Cell Culture (adherent and non-adherent cells) - Luciferase Reporter Assays - Cell Proliferation Assays - Flow Cytometry - Excellent Communication Skills - Team Player - Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously This is an opportunity to join our select team that is already leading the way in the Pharmaceutical/Biotech industry.  Apply today and learn more about Regeneron’s unwavering commitment to combining good science & good business. To all agencies: Please, no phone calls or emails to any employee of Regeneron about this opening.  All resumes submitted by search firms/employment agencies to any employee at Regeneron via-email, the internet or in any form and/or method will be deemed the sole property of Regeneron, unless such search firms/employment agencies were engaged by Regeneron for this position and a valid agreement with Regeneron is in place.  In the event a candidate who was submitted outside of the Regeneron agency engagement process is hired, no fee or payment of any kind will be paid. Regeneron is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. Implement resolutions to improve and refine existing and new processes in a production environment in line with the business strategy, in order to enable the client to use/commercialize the processes. Define, prepare, lead and execute projects/programs as well as create support for project objectives in the organization in line with requirement sand business needs and conform project management guidelines, in order to deliver project according to objectives and deliverables and realise business objectives in a structural way Operations : •Production Support:  Support operations with the production of existing and new products.  Interact with production personnel to troubleshoot and optimize processes to meet quality standards, and plant throughput goals •Process/Production Experiments:  (With the assistance of Sr. colleagues) Set up, plan, execute and analyze experiments, and reports results, taking into account possible risks to production •Relation with management:   Build and maintain a network of relevant internal and external relations, stakeholders, partners and customers, especially operations and R&D •Process Scale-up support:  Support scale-up and implementation of new processes in operational environment, according to all applicable guidelines •Lead Continuous Improvement Initiatives:  Use of Lean 6-Sigma approach and techniques to identify and execute continuous improvement initiatives in our manufacturing operations Capital Projects: •Project initiation & orientation: Identify and collect ideas, business requirements and needs, define the scope of the project, determine the members of the own project team, and give input for appraisal Program management: Initiate, define, manage and monitor the progress, alignment, quality and continuity of various multidisciplinary projects Knowledge and Experience: Bachelor’s with 6 – 10 years’ experience or Masters with 4 – 6 years’ experience (Degree in Chemical engineering. Food manufacturing) Differentiating factors: •Stakeholder Management: Manages the relation with a few (group of) stakeholders on operational level •Project complexity and risk:  Participate in well defined, medium complex projects with low risk and using given techniques •Project scope: Leads mono-disciplinary involving a limited amount of parties (2^2) and reports to PMT/OT •Autonomy:  Autonomously executes project activities within given scope, supported by senior colleagues •Coaching:  Does not coach •Project budget indication: > 100,000 and < $500,000 Job requirements •Evaluate, implement and monitor processes and operating systems for the manufacture of hydrolysates. •Project management •Follow and adhere to all company safety policies •Lean Six Sigma methodologies •Data processing. •Create/edit / maintain necessary documentation. •Monitor and improve the efficiency, output and safety of manufacturing processes through observations and measurements as well as by collecting and interpreting data from other technical and operating personnel. •Work closely with other specialists (including scientists). •All other duties, as assigned. Return to the home page Printable Format Job Description - AM - US Equity Research Analyst - Healthcare - Associate NY (160039760) Job Description AM - US Equity Research Analyst - Healthcare - Associate NY - 160039760 Job Description Business Description: J.P. Morgan Asset Management's Equities Group manages a broad range of regional and cross-border equity investment strategies globally. With 449 investment professionals in 11 countries and 13 locations, the Equities teams globally are focused on providing global insights with local delivery. The teams have dedicated portfolio managers, research analysts and traders with expertise in small, mid and large market capitalization equities as well as a range of investment styles. These investment professionals are responsible for the management and execution of J.P. Morgan Asset Management's proprietary investment processes in key geographical locations worldwide. Position: The Research Analyst will be an active member of the US Equity Growth research team, contributing to the investment process by researching companies across various healthcare subsectors and market capitalizations reporting to two senior healthcare analysts with the objective of producing actionable investment recommendations. Major responsibilities: • Performing thorough fundamental analysis of a company’s business and financial position, the quality of the franchise, the sustainability of its competitive advantage and growth potential • Focusing on gaining a differentiated fundamental perspective on companies by conducting independent research by examining SEC filings, historical financial statements, examining appropriate industry data, speaking to industry contacts, designing surveys, attending industry conferences/trade shows, and meeting with management teams • Building and maintaining financial models to estimate future earnings, cash flow potential, and an appropriate valuation framework • Identifying important secular, cyclical, and other themes affecting industry market share and other key industry dynamics • Identifying companies and producing investment recommendations within a broad coverage universe consistent with the team’s investment philosophy and process • Initiating and maintaining written and verbal communication with the Senior Analysts and Portfolio Managers • Building and maintaining industry-level data and performance analyses for Senior Analysts and Portfolio Managers Qualifications Requirements: • 3-5 years of related industry experience, including buyside or sell-side research • Life sciences education or research experience preferred but not necessary • CFA preferred • Passion for the stock market and investing generally • Superior analytical skills, attention to detail, and ability to multi-task • Strong work ethic and initiative and positive, team-first attitude imperative • Excellent financial modeling and equity valuation skills • Effective communication skills, both written and verbal • Interest/knowledge of growth investing a plus JPMorgan Chase is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer Disability/Veteran. title: Research Faculty
summary: See collaborations and maintain contact with national and international scientists who specialize in sign language assessment....
post_text: Rochester Institute of Technology - Job details Å ? ? ? ? ? ? ? ? Å ? ? ? ? ? ? ? ? Å ? ? ? ? ? ? ? ? › Home Search openings Search results Job details Help Job details Job 1 of 1 Apply to job Send to friend Save to cart View similar jobs Requisition Number 2382BR Position Title Research Faculty College/Division National Technical Institute for the Deaf Organization NTID Office of the Associate Dean for Research (OADR) Faculty Type (Tenure Status) Non-Tenure-Track Research Faculty Discipline American Sign Language & Interp Education Faculty Rank Research Assistant Professor Employment Category Fulltime Anticipated Start Date 16-May-2016 Department/College Description RIT is a national leader in professional and career-oriented education. Talented, ambitious, and creative students of all cultures and backgrounds from all 50 states and more than 100 countries have chosen to attend RIT. Founded in 1829, Rochester Institute of Technology is a privately endowed, coeducational university with nine colleges emphasizing career education and experiential learning. With approximately 15,000 undergraduates and 2,900 graduate students, RIT is one of the largest private universities in the nation. RIT offers a rich array of degree programs in engineering, science, business, and the arts, and is home to the National Technical Institute for the Deaf. RIT has been honored by The Chronicle of Higher Education as one of the “Great Colleges to Work For” for four years. RIT is a National Science Foundation ADVANCE Institutional Transformation site. RIT is responsive to the needs of dual-career couples by our membership in the Upstate NY HERC . Rochester, situated between Lake Ontario and the Finger Lakes region, is the 51st largest metro area in the United States and the third largest city New York State. The Greater Rochester region, which is home to nearly 1.1 million people, is rich in cultural and ethnic diversity, with a population comprised of approximately 18% African and Latin Americans and another 3% of international origin. It is also home to one of the largest deaf communities per capita in the U.S. Rochester ranks 4th for “Most Affordable City" by Forbes Magazine ,and MSN selected Rochester as the “#1 Most Livable Bargain Market” (for real-estate). Kiplinger named Rochester one of the top five “Best City for Families.” Detailed Job Description This position is at the Rochester Institute of Technology (RIT) within the National Technical Institute for the Deaf (NTID). RIT is a privately endowed, coeducational university emphasizing career education and experiential learning. The RIT student body consists of 15,400 undergraduate and 3,200 graduate students. RIT is an internationally recognized leader in preparing deaf and hard-of-hearing students for successful careers in professional and technical fields. The university provides unparalleled access and support services for the more than 1,200 deaf and hard-of-hearing students who live, study, and work with hearing students on the RIT campus. NTID is one of the nine colleges at RIT. NTID's primary mission is to provide deaf and hard-of-hearing students with outstanding state-of-the-art technical and professional education programs that prepare them to live and work in the mainstream of a rapidly changing global community and enhance their lifelong learning. This position is specifically within the NTID Center on Cognition and Language (NCCL), formerly the Deaf Studies Lab. NCCL investigates cognitive, language, and social aspects of the Deaf Experience. The research aim is to bring awareness to issues concerning the education and quality of life of deaf individuals. NCCL aims to bring more deaf individuals into a variety of fields of research in an American Sign Language-based, student-centered environment. NCCL proudly collaborates with many universities and centers nationally and internationally and receives federal funding for its research. This is a 12-month, three-year Research Assistant Professor position, non-tenure track, renewable annually for up to three years, at the National Technical Institute for the Deaf (NTID), at the Rochester Institute of Technology (RIT). The Research Associate Professor will have an appointment in the Department of American Sign Language and Interpreter Education and will report to the Director of the NTID Center on Cognition and Language. The Research Assistant Professor will be responsible for leading NTID’s efforts in increasing the number of American Sign Language (ASL) proficiency measures to be used to evaluate faculty and staff sign language skills. This includes developing new measures, testing the psychometric properties of the measures, developing a normative database, and assisting with the implementation of these tests to be used for tenure and promotion purposes. JOB RESPONSIBILITIES: This position leads and supports the implementation of new sign language proficiency assessment measures at NTID. Specifics of yearly responsibilities, goals, and objectives will be formalized through annual Plans-of-Work between the Research Assistant Professor and the Director of the NTID Center on Cognition and Language, in consultation with the NTID Office of the Associate Dean of Research and NTID Office of the President. KEY ACTIVITIES: Evaluating the psychometrics of existing ASL measures for the appropriateness and feasibility for use at NTID. Developing a new ASL Sentence Repetition Test appropriate for hearing individuals who learn ASL as a second language. Developing a diagnostic test that successfully demonstrates the linguistics areas of ASL that faculty and staff have mastered and the areas that need improvement. PROFESSIONAL and SCHOLARLY ACTIVITIES: Participate in professional development opportunities to further develop skills in research methods, statistics, data analysis, grant writing, and dissemination Participate in local, regional, and/or national professional organization meetings as appropriate See collaborations and maintain contact with national and international scientists who specialize in sign language assessment Conduct scholarly activities in research, and publish in scholarly journals. Seek grants and contracts through NIH, NSF, IES and the like, as principal investigator Provide mentoring to deaf and hard of hearing students pursuing research careers including those in the Rochester Bridges to the Doctorate program and the Rochester Post-Doctoral Partnership program. Required Minimum Qualifications PhD or EdD in Linguistics, Psychology, Education, or related fields Experience in sign language research Proficiency in American Sign Language is required. Ability to communicate effectively with wide range of Deaf and hard of hearing individuals. Required Minimum Education Level EdD PhD Required Application Documents Curriculum Vitae or Resume Cover Letter How To Apply Apply online at http://careers.rit.edu/faculty , search openings, then Keyword Search: 2382BR. Please submit: your curriculum vitae, cover letter addressing the listed qualifications Review of applications will begin immediately and continue until a suitable candidate is found. Additional Details The hiring process for this position may require a criminal background check and/or motor vehicle records check. Any verbal or written offer made is contingent on satisfactory results, as determined by Human Resources.RIT does not discriminate. RIT promotes and values diversity, pluralism and inclusion in the work place. RIT provides equal opportunity to all qualified individuals and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, creed, age, marital status, sex, gender, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, veteran status or disability in its hiring, admissions, educational programs and activities.RIT provides reasonable accommodations to applicants with disabilities under the Rehabilitation Act, the Americans with Disabilities Act, the New York Human Rights Law, or similar applicable law. If you need reasonable accommodation for any part of the application and hiring process, and you wish to discuss potential accommodations related to your application for employment at RIT, please contact the Human Resources office at 585-475-2424 or email your request to Careers@rit.edu. summary: In return, we offer you a truly unique and exciting opportunity working with a team of data scientists and software engineers to create real services operating...
post_text: Careers Senior Data Engineer Engineering | New York City, NY, United States Apply Send Jobvite As a Senior Data Engineer you will be responsible for designing, coding and maintaining high performance data processing applications on the JVM platform (primarily Scala). Our ideal candidate would have the skills and desire to understand our entire data stack, from Cassandra to Spark to Scala/Akka and the passion to champion new and exciting technologies to solve the challenges of delivering new types of contact data to a rapidly increasing user base. To succeed in this role you will need experience in building and deploying scalable web services starting from the data storage layer. You must have strong skills in object-oriented and/or functional languages such as Java or Scala. You will have a Computer Science or related degree and at least two years of commercial, non-internship experience working as a software developer, preferably in a small-company agile environment on large-scale or big data platforms. You will be able to express your passion for and understanding of effective engineering, modeling, and analysis practices. The ideal candidate will be comfortable developing scalable services in a *nix environment and deploying them into a cloud hosting environment (particularly AWS).  Extra points for experience with both SQL and NoSQL databases, machine learning techniques, and container-based services such as Kubernetes. In return, we offer you a truly unique and exciting opportunity working with a team of data scientists and software engineers to create real services operating at massive and global scale to produce insights that affect millions of users every single day. How many people can say that?! APPLY NOW so we can start a conversation! This role is based in our NYC office. Whitepages is the leading source for contact information in North America and is at the forefront of developing services that help people find, understand and verify personal and business identities in an ever-changing digital world. Whitepages is committed to empowering users with control, safeguarding the accuracy and authenticity of digital identities, and advancing transparency. With over 55 million unique monthly users, Whitepages offers access to more than 200 million personal identities and provides users with the ability to control their own. This role is part of the Whitepages Communication Experience group, which works closely with mobile network carriers, device manufacturers and smartphone application developers. We have strong company values and culture and would love to share why ours is an opportunity worth considering. We appreciate and respect diversity, and are an equal opportunity employer. title: Manager, Flow Cytometry Core Facility
summary: The doctors and scientists of Weill Cornell Medicine—faculty from Weill Cornell Medical College, Weill Cornell Graduate School of Medical Sciences, and Weill...
post_text: Job Description - Manager, Flow Cytometry Core Facility (31546) Go to the main content section. Welcome. You are not signed in. My Briefcase | Sign In Job Search My Jobpage Basic Search | Advanced Search | Jobs Matching My Profile | Beginning of the main content section. Return to the home page Printable Format Job Description - Manager, Flow Cytometry Core Facility (31546) Job Description Manager, Flow Cytometry Core Facility - 31546 Description Position Summary Reporting to the Director of the Flow Cytometry Core Facility, this role will provide day-to-day management of the group of instruments in the core facility.  This position will provide high level technical and management support for a group of instruments in the newly established Flow Cytometry Core Facility, part of an integrated core facility center at Weill Cornell Medical College (WCM) in New York City.  This includes responsibility for the management of flow core projects, including sample preparation, data generation, and data analysis services that use the core's florescence activated cell sorting (FACS) and analysis platforms, as designated by the Core Director.  Responsibilities include operating and maintaining equipment and implementing flow cytometry protocols, technologies and applications.  This individual will interface with vendor instrumentation engineers and field application specialists. Position Activities Manages flow core projects, including accessioning submitted samples and running flow cytometry sorters and analyzers for full-service assisted use, training investigators for unassisted use, and providing support for data analysis, data return and data archiving. Plays a key role in ensuring that a high level of florescence activated cell sorting (FACS) and analysis core services are provided to the Weill Cornell Medicine (WCM), New York-Presbyterian Hospital (NYPH), and Hospital for Special Surgery (HSS) research and clinical communities. Responsible for day to day supervision of technical staff within his/her group of instruments in the core facility.  This includes, but is not limited to the hiring, training, performance management, development and discipline of all assigned staff members. Is the Subject Matter Expert (SME) and is responsible for  fielding questions on flow cytometry sample processing, data generation and data analysis, and questions on scheduling and billing. Manages all interactions with clinicians, faculty, post-docs and graduate students in support of their projects, including scheduling, sample and process tracking, record-keeping, process quality tracking, and billing for services. Tracks quality assessment metrics for flow cytometry services and reports production problems and statistics to the Flow Cytometry Core Director.  Responsible for defining and maintaining standard operating procedures. Manages maintenance of facility equipment and interacts with equipment manufacturers and support vendors.  Monitors and orders supplies, monitors reagent expiration dates, tracks lot numbers and creates invoices. Manages and oversees the flow cytometry services coordination with other WCM core facilities (e.g., genomics facility, proteomics facility) for sample processing steps and for delivery of data results to users. Monitors quality of results from instruments and reports problems, production statistics and quality metrics to the Flow Cytometry Core Director Creates, implements and manages educational workshops and core facility user training and certification courses. Performs other related duties as assigned. Qualifications Minimum Requirements Bachelor's degree, preferably in the biological sciences, with a minimum of 5 years of experience in a core facility or biomedical research laboratory. Experience with flow cytometry technologies, applications and analysis tools.  This position requires management skills, the ability to troubleshoot, and careful record keeping.  Must enjoy working with others, have initiative, and be reliable.  Attention to detail and multitasking abilities are critical, with the ability to work independently and as part of a team, and to schedule multiple ongoing projects.  Excellent computer and communication skills are required. Highly Desired Requirements Master's degree or Ph.D. in Biology, with 5 or more years of experience in a core facility or biomedical research laboratory or with clinical trials.  Experience working in a flow cytometry core facility and managing technicians is preferred.  Experience with BD Aria and Influx instrument models is preferred.  Experience educating investigators in proper use of flow cytometry sorters and analyzers is a plus.  Technical knowledge of aerosol containment, infection control procedures and regulations associated with flow sorting, is preferred. Working Conditions/Physical Demands No additional working conditions/physical demands provided. No relocation assistance is provided for this position. Visa sponsorship is not available for this position. Weill Cornell Medicine is committed to excellence in patient care, scientific discovery and the education of future physicians in New York City and around the world. The doctors and scientists of Weill Cornell Medicine—faculty from Weill Cornell Medical College, Weill Cornell Graduate School of Medical Sciences, and Weill Cornell Physician Organization—are engaged in world-class clinical care and cutting-edge research that connect patients to the latest treatment innovations and prevention strategies. Located in the heart of the Upper East Side's scientific corridor, Weill Cornell Medicine's powerful network of collaborators extends to its parent university Cornell University; to Qatar, where an international campus offers a U.S. medical degree; and to programs in Tanzania, Haiti, Brazil, Austria and Turkey. Weill Cornell Medicine faculty provide comprehensive patient care at NewYork-Presbyterian/Weill Cornell Medical Center, NewYork-Presbyterian/Lower Manhattan Hospital and NewYork-Presbyterian/Queens. Weill Cornell Medicine is also affiliated with Houston Methodist. EOE/M/F/Vet/Disabled Job - WCMC-Research Primary Location - New York City Organization - Office of Managing Director Schedule - Full-time Overtime Status - Exempt Grade - 7 Number of Openings - 1

title: Senior Research Scientist
summary: Must ensure that the scientific approach used will lead to tools and procedures that will be useful to other DEP staff and scientists....
post_text: Hrs_ce DEPT OF ENVIRONMENT PROTECTION Job Posting Notice Job ID: # of Positions: 189710 1 Business Title: Senior Research Scientist Civil Service Title: CITY RESEARCH SCIENTIST Job Category: Engineering, Architecture, & Planning Career Level: Experienced (non-manager) Title Code No: Level: 21744 03 Proposed Salary Range: $ 74,478.00 - $ 97,875.00 (Annual) Work Location: 71 Smith Avenue, Kingston, Ny Division/Work Unit: Ben Neslin Lab Search Other NYC Jobs Job Description The New York City Department of Environmental Protection (DEP) protects public health and the environment by supplying clean drinking water, collecting and treating wastewater, and reducing air, noise and hazardous materials pollution. DEP is the largest combined municipal water and wastewater utility in the country, with nearly 6,000 employees. We deliver 1.1 billion gallons of high quality drinking water per day to 8.3 million New York City residents and more than 1 million people in Upstate New York, and we collect and treat an average of 1.3 billion gallons of wastewater per day. he Bureau of Water Supply seeks to hire a Senior Research Scientist in the Modeling Section of the Division of Water Quality Science & Research (WQSR) to be located in the Kingston, New York offices. This position will have a focus on terrestrial and stream modeling to quantify sources of nutrient loadings and other substances, from the watershed and their transport to reservoirs. The main duties of this position will be to work with the Section Chief of WQSR’s Water Quality Modeling Section to plan and develop long and short-term goals and set priorities for DEP’s Water Quality Modeling program. This scientist will provide leadership and general direction in planning, conducting, and coordinating the development and use of watershed water quality models to assist in the evaluation of impacts of DEP’s Watershed Protection Programs on water quality as required by the City’s Filtration Avoidance Determination. Research will be conducted to improve our understanding of sediment transport and quantify how both natural and anthropogenic processes affect water quality. Under administrative direction of the Section Chief for WQSR’s Water Quality Modeling Section, with wide latitude for the exercise of independent judgment and initiative, the responsibilities and tasks for this position will include the following: •A focus on terrestrial and stream model applications; these will be used to quantify loadings of various substances, such as nutrients and natural organic matter, and sediment transport to reservoirs; the scientist will assist with planning, conducting and coordinating research on Filtration Avoidance Determination-related modeling projects. Will prepare sections for Filtration Avoidance Determination deliverables and other required reports; will provide leadership and general direction for modeling support staff and contractual personnel DEP’s Water Quality Modeling Section. •Will develop and apply stream models used in the Multi-tiered Modeling System to quantify sediment transport in water supply streams with a focus on the Catskill System; will develop flow, sediment, turbidity relationships to improve models. •Will conduct model runs to evaluate the potential impacts of climate change using International Climate Change Program data downscaled for the NYC watershed. Will provide modeling, analysis and data support for water supply modeling projects by maintaining appropriate expertise and making efficient use of spreadsheet, database, geographic information systems (GIS) statistics, and programming tools as needed. •Will participate in the development of the Operational Support Tool for system operations; will plan and carry out the necessary activities to develop effective coordination with other members of the Water Quality Modeling Section, other DEP staff and outside agencies as needed. •Will create a library of model runs with documentation for reproducibility; will utilize appropriate and analytical and statistical methods in model calibration, testing, sensitivity analyses, applications and interpretation of model output. This work must be organized and documented  so that all aspects of work (including data development, calibration, testing, output, analyses, and reporting) can be accessed, understood and reproduced by modeling staff; must ensure that the scientific approach used will lead to tools and procedures that will be useful to other DEP staff and scientists. •Will participate in scientific conferences, meetings and seminars. Will develop highly technical, scientifically-sound papers on modeling work and submit for peer-review publication; will give presentations on scientific work as appropriate. Minimum Qual Requirements 1.  For Assignment Level I (only physical, biological and environmental sciences and public health) A master's degree from an accredited college or university with a specialization in an appropriate field of physical, biological or environmental science or in public health. To be appointed to Assignment Level II and above, candidates must have: 1. A doctorate degree from an accredited college or university with specialization in an appropriate field of physical, biological, environmental or social science and one year of full-time experience in a responsible supervisory, administrative or research capacity in the appropriate field of specialization; or 2. A master's degree from an accredited college or university with specialization in an appropriate field of physical, biological, environmental or social science and three years of responsible full-time research experience in the appropriate field of specialization; or 3. Education and/or experience which is equivalent to "1" or "2" above. However, all candidates must have at least a master's degree in an appropriate field of specialization and at least two years of experience described in "2" above. Two years as a City Research Scientist Level I can be substituted for the experience required in "1" and "2" above. NOTE: Probationary Period Appointments to this position are subject to a minimum probationary period of one year. Preferred Skills Extensive experience with running watershed models, such as the Generalized Watershed Loading Function (GWLF) model or the Soil and Water Assessment Tool (SWAT) model is critical. Must have a demonstrated ability to write, edit, and compile technical reports and scientific publications. To Apply Click the "Apply Now" button. Hours/Shift 35 Hours per week/Day shift Work Location 71 Smith Avenue, Kingston, NY Residency Requirement New York City residency is generally required within 90 days of appointment. However, City Employees in certain titles who have worked for the City for 2 continuous years may also be eligible to reside in Nassau, Suffolk, Putnam, Westchester, Rockland, or Orange County. To determine if the residency requirement applies to you, please discuss with the agency representative at the time of interview. New York City Residency is not required for this position. Sexual Assault Hotline: 212.227.3000 TDD phone number for all hotlines: 866.604.5350 Share this page: Job Opportunities at Safe Horizon Job Details Position: Research and Evaluation Analyst Category: AD Type: EMP Employee Term: FT Reports To: Senior Director Location: 2 Lafayette Street Description: Safe Horizon ( www.safehorizon.org ) is the largest non-profit organization helping victims of crime and abuse in the United States, and is recognized, both nationally and globally, for its expertise in addressing violence and victimization. The array of services we provide in NYC is made possible by a team of nearly 600 professionals who offer years of experience and extraordinary responsiveness to the communities they serve. The organization is structured as a network of more than 50 program locations across NYC, with central administrative headquarters in lower Manhattan. While Safe Horizon’s services are available for all crime victims and reach children, youth, women, men, and families facing crisis; we are most notably recognized for our work with victims of domestic violence, child abuse, human trafficking, and homeless youth. There is no other provider in New York State that offers this range of assistance for families affected by domestic violence. The Research and Evaluation Department is responsible for providing programs with strategies, tools and direct support to ensure the implementation of standardized practices and for conducting evaluation and research projects that contribute to Safe Horizon’s thought leadership in the field. Through the development of program practices, quality assurance protocols, documentation review, program observations, client and staff interviews, data analysis, and report writing, Research & Evaluation informs management about client needs, characteristics and outcomes of Safe Horizon’s services and programs. The role of the Research and Evaluation Analyst is to monitor client service and provide information, effective support and descriptive data in support of Safe Horizon’s mission, primary service obligation and strategic plan goals. Responsibilities: Work collaboratively as a member of the Research & Evaluation team to implement, and monitor client service practice using protocols, standards and tools; Ensure that the documentation of client-centered program practice meets agreed upon standards through implementation of policies, practices, procedures and data collection mechanisms that anticipate and respond to the operational needs of the organization; Provide technical assistance to program staff regarding the implementation of QA evaluation protocols and tools and engage clients staff and other providers in the community for purposes of process evaluation and assessment; Provide project coordination to program staff regarding the development and implementation of Safe Horizon’s client management system; Actively participate in quality assurance projects as well as program practice and process evaluations; Manage multiple data sets and data bases that contain confidential information about clients; Conduct routine site visits to engage staff in adherence to program practice with up to 10% of time on weekends or evenings; Maintain project timelines; coordinate across team members; ensure team’s compliance with deadlines; Develop reports and presentations of research updates and findings; prepare tables, figures, and charts. Qualifications: Qualifications: A Bachelor’s degree in required, a Master’s degree in public health, social work, or another related field preferred. 2 years of experience conducting program evaluation and/or quality assurance initiatives required, preferably with project management experience. 2 years of experience working with victims of domestic violence, child abuse and neglect, or sexual abuse. Willingness to travel within all New York City boroughs. If hired, I agree to abide by all of Safe Horizon’s rules and regulations, and understand that, if employed, my employment may be terminated with or without cause, and with or without notice, at any time, at the option of either the company or me. I further understand that no representation, whether oral or written by any representative or agent of the organization, at any time, constitutes a contract of employment AmeriCorps, Peace Corps and other national service alumni are encouraged to apply Safe Horizon is committed to providing equal employment opportunity to all qualified individuals and endeavors to hire individuals of diverse races, colors, creeds, ethnicities, religions, genders, gender identities or expressions, ages, sexes, sexual orientations, national origins, and disabilities, as well citizen, marital, protected veteran and HIV statuses. Education: Bachelor's Degree Salary: Hours: Not Applicable Days: N/A Submit a Resume I am a current Safe Horizon employee » DONATE NOW » Give to families in crisis NEED HELP? Call our hotlines SIGN UP » Get news and updates on Safe Horizon Social Media Safe Horizon's mission is to provide support, prevent violence and promote justice for victims of crime and abuse, their families and communities. Post-doctoral fellow in cancer signaling and therapeutics : New York, NY, United States Print Apply now Send to a friend Report a problem Tweet Facebook LinkedIn Post-doctoral fellow in cancer signaling and therapeutics; New York, NY, USA Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center ( MSKCC ) is among the top cancer treatment and research centers in the United States. As part of the Tri-Institutes (Sloan Kettering Institute, Weill Cornell Medical College and Rockefeller University), MSKCC’s researchers and students enjoy a collaborative, enriching environment and a host of educational and training resources. MSKCC offers competitive pay and benefits, including highly subsidized family housing and child-care. A post-doctoral position is available for a highly motivated individual with a background in biochemistry, molecular pharmacology and/or cell biology. Our group is interested in understanding the fundamental mechanisms of oncoprotein-dependent signaling in cancer and translating this knowledge into innovative therapeutic strategies for patients. A current priority is the characterization of novel mutant KRAS inhibitors and their therapeutic potential in lung cancer. Further insight into the type of work may be obtained in: Science, 2016, Feb 5;351(6273):604-8; Cancer Cell, 2014, May 12;25(5):697-710; and Cancer Cell, 2012, Nov 13;22(5):668-82. Applicants should have a PhD and/or MD and strong laboratory and analytical skills. Experience with CRISPR or mass spectrometry is desirable, but the ability to work independently to produce high-quality data and being an organized and enthusiastic scientist is more important. To apply please email your application to: Piro Lito, MD, PhD, Human Oncology and Pathogenesis Program litolabpostdocapps@gmail.com All applications should include the following: 1. Curriculum vitae 2. At least three references 3. A brief description of past research experience and accomplishments as well as current and future research interests 4. Expected availability date MSK is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer committed to diversity and inclusion in all aspects of recruiting and employment. All qualified individuals are encouraged to apply and will receive consideration without regard to race, color, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, age, religion, creed, disability, veteran status or any other factor which cannot lawfully be used as a basis for an employment decision. … Don't forget to mention Naturejobs when applying. Apply Apply for 'Post-doctoral fellow in cancer signaling and therapeutics' Please login to submit an application. Software Developer The D. E. Shaw Group Locations New York , United States Salary/Rate Competitive Job Sectors Hedge Funds , Information Technology Career Levels Entry/Junior , Mid Level Position Type Permanent Employment Type Full Time Start Date ASAP Posted 11 Apr 2016 Post Expires 06 Jun 2016 The D. E. Shaw group is a globally prominent investment and technology development firm based in New York City, with offices around the world. We offer a collegial work environment and high-caliber colleagues from diverse backgrounds—everything from mathematicians and computer scientists to philosophers, musicians, and journalists. Our culture combines some of the best aspects of academia, finance, and technology. We pride ourselves on adhering to the highest standards of ethics and performance, but in our offices you’ll see more flip-flops than suits—we have no dress code, and our meritocratic culture gives employees the opportunity to make significant contributions early on in their careers. If you’re intellectually curious, energized by ambitious goals, and willing to take on a new challenge, we’d like to hear from you. The D. E. Shaw group brings together some of the best minds in computer science, mathematics, physics, engineering, and other technical disciplines to work at the intersection of finance and technology. Members of our versatile technical staff exhibit a range of strong quantitative and programming abilities, with software developers and quantitative analysts collaborating on challenging problems that directly impact the firm’s continued success. Quality and innovation are essential for creating computationally-intensive solutions for trading profitably in markets around the globe. Developers bring strong analytical, mathematical, and software design skills to a variety of projects, including the formulation of statistical models for our computerized trading strategies, distributed system development, real-time data analysis, and the creation of tools for advanced mathematical modeling. Technology is an integral part of virtually everything we do, and our team enjoys access to some of the most advanced computing resources in the world. Successful candidates have traditionally been the top students in their programs and have extensive software development knowledge. We welcome talented candidates at all experience levels. Interested students should apply directly through our website at: https://www.deshaw.com/recruit/jobs/Ad/QFJ/Prog Members of the D. E. Shaw group do not discriminate in employment matters on the basis of race, color, religion, gender, pregnancy, national origin, age, military service eligibility, veteran status, sexual orientation, marital status, disability, or any other protected class. title: Electrical/Computer Engineering Intern
summary: Working with Xerox engineers and scientists, you will be assisting in the development and fabrication of a new printed electronic memory product....
post_text: Xerox Jobs - Electrical/Computer Engineering Intern in Webster, New York, United States > Home > Careers > All Jobs Xerox Jobs Where city, state, country What job title, keywords Home View All Jobs ( 1,406 ) Xerox Electrical/Computer Engineering Intern in Webster , New York Electrical/Computer Engineering Research & Development Intern A new emerging technology at Xerox is printed electronics. Xerox Printed Memory is a low-cost flexible memory device with numerous applications. The Printed Electronics group is searching for a Summer Intern to work within the Consumables Development and Manufacturing Group at Xerox. This organization focuses on research, development, and production of many of Xerox’s consumable products along with the new Xerox Printed Memory product. Working with Xerox engineers and scientists, you will be assisting in the development and fabrication of a new printed electronic memory product. Through designed experimentation, electrical and mechanical measurement, and statistical analysis of data, you will be aiding in the optimization of the product design and manufacturing process. As an intern in this area you would be: Performing electrical characterization and performance measurements and analyzing resultant data Designing, editing, and implementing code for quality control test equipment Process optimization of instrument system operation and output to increase throughput allowing for timely feedback to the production team Experience with LabView and/or Python desired Qualifications /Candidate Education/ Minimum: Full-time College Student with cumulative GPA of 3.0 / Job Requirements : Currently enrolled in an education institution pursuing a degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or a related major Proficiency with Microsoft Office software products Capable of completing tasks independently with a sense of urgency and ownership based on clear direction from manager Demonstrated success at maintaining high personal work standards Xerox is an Equal Opportunity Employer and considers applicants for all positions without regard//to race, color, religion or belief, sex, age, national origin, citizenship status, marital status, military/veteran status, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity, physical or mental disability or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws. title: Sr Android Engineer
summary: We are scientists and artists. In the last 3 years, we’ve worked on a broad range of projects, including Web (90M unique visitors per month), APIs, native...
post_text: Job Application for Sr Android Engineer at The Hackerati Apply Now Sr Android Engineer at The Hackerati (View all jobs) New York, NY What We Do Technology Consultancy The Hackerati is a boutique tech consulting firm delivering Engineering as a Service to a diverse client base, from Fortune 250s to startups. We focus on providing product delivery services in the areas of agile, big data, cloud, mobile / multi-screen, and web applications. We are a team of unconventional thinkers, visionaries, scientists, and entrepreneurial engineers. Work We've Done In the last 3 years, we’ve worked on a broad range of projects, including Web (90M unique visitors per month), APIs, native mobile (iOS/Android with millions of downloads), mobile web, machine learning, natural language processing, Big Data (330+ TB/mo), real time bidding, real time event processing (10k events/second), wearable devices, facial recognition, augmented reality, programmatic advertising, wrangling browsers and geospatial applications. We are technology and process agnostic, so as a team member you’ll be exposed to many different technologies. We use proven technologies, following basic architectural principles and design patterns and practice Agile Engineering in a collaborative shared repo team development setting. Our stacks consist of Objective C, Swift, Java/Android, Java/Hadoop, PHP, Python, Scala, Groovy/Grails, Ruby/Rails, Angular, React and Erlang. A great plus of being a Hackeratus is that you can draw upon a broad and deep collection of best practices from our respective Practice leaders to help you grow professionally. Why You Should Join Us We're not afraid to be our wild selves. We’re different. With mottos like be fearless and weird is good, our unique perspectives on life and technology make us great people to learn from and work/party with. We sponsor lunches and happy hours, band practice, electronics like Glass/Oculus/ Myo , and we’ve presented at the UN—twice. We rock that familial vibe, and you should join us if you enjoy a blurred line between work and play. What To Expect Deliver the industry's most challenging projects. As Hackerati consultants we solve problems. Hard ones. To do so, we deploy teams of Hackerati to work onsite with clients around NYC, and build products in-house, both for ourselves and clients. Engagement teams vary in size and a typical project lasts between 6 and 9 months—Thus there is on-going diversity of cool new things to build. You: have a few years experience developing native Android apps with solid experience in Java, Android SDK, API stacks, and an understanding of data models and UI have work that can be found in the Google Play app store have a solid understanding of mobile app development including multi-threading, generics, performance optimization and OOP architecture are fearless about acquiring new skills It would also be great if you... have worked on an Agile team have work that can be found in public repos on Github know the difference between unit and functional testing and QA, and you know what stubs and mocks are have mastered other software disciplines like fullstack web and Big Data create in other mediums like music, poetry, paintings, videos, and comics About the Team We’re all hackers in our own disciplines—inventors who naturally defy conventional wisdom in the name of getting stuff done. We specifically look for hackers with a blend of creativity & entrepreneurship in their DNA. Hackerati are visionary creators and explorers who are driven by curiosity and passion to improve the world around them. We are doers and dreamers. We are students and teachers. We are scientists and artists. We are The Hackerati. Blog Video The Hackerati Presents: Google Glass at the United Nations Science and Art at the United Nations The Hackerati's Demo Reel The Hackerati Agile Engineering - by Co-Founder Geoff Scott The Hackerati is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, or Veteran status. To all recruitment agencies : The Hackerati does not accept agency résumés. Please do not forward résumés via our system or by email to The Hackerati’s employees. The Hackerati is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited résumés. post_text: Brookhaven National Laboratory - Adv Technology Engineer Skip Navigation Sign In to access application status, saved documents and Job Search Agents Job Details View Job Cart (0) Send This Job to a Friend View My Account Adv Technology Engineer Job ID #: 663 Job Category: Information Technology Position Type: Full Time - Regular Department: POAE-RHIC COMPUTING FACILITY FLSA: Exempt Share: Facebook LinkedIn Twitter Why Work at BNL? Brookhaven National Laboratory is a multipurpose research institution funded primarily by the U.S. Department of Energy’s Office of Science. Located on the center of Long Island, New York, Brookhaven Lab brings world-class facilities and expertise to the most exciting and important questions in basic and applied science—from the birth of our universe to the sustainable energy technology of tomorrow. We operate cutting-edge large-scale facilities for studies in physics, chemistry, biology, medicine, applied science, and a wide range of advanced technologies. The Laboratory's almost 3,000 scientists, engineers, and support staff are joined each year by more than 4,000 visiting researchers from around the world. Our award-winning history, including seven Nobel Prizes, stretches back to 1947, and we continue to unravel mysteries from the nanoscale to the cosmic scale, and everything in between. Brookhaven is operated and managed by Brookhaven Science Associates, which was founded by the Research Foundation for the State University of New York on behalf of Stony Brook University, and Battelle, a nonprofit applied science and technology organization. Organizational Overview Building on its capabilities in computational science and data management, the Computational Science Initiative (CSI) at the U.S. Department of Energy's (DOE) Brookhaven National Laboratory was established to integrate and leverage computer science, computational science and applied mathematics expertise and investments across multiple programs at the Laboratory. In providing leading computational and data science solutions for BNL’s flagship facilities – RHIC, LHC Atlas US Tier One Center, NSLS II, CFN —CSI is confirming Brookhaven as a leader in tackling the "big data" challenges at the frontiers of scientific discovery. CSI’s mission is to provide “Leadership in the hypothesis driven analysis and interpretation of large volumes, high velocity, heterogeneous data’. We are pursuing this mission by engaging in research into novel approaches and methods, the provision of data management and analysis facilities, and the practical application of these resources to domain science challenges. Position Description The Computational Science Initiative is seeking a system administrator to support centralized high performance compute, network, and storage systems used by scientist at BNL’s research facilities. The job candidate is expected to be familiar with the design and operation of a centralized, shared data center that is used by thousands of users. Major Duties and Responsibilities: Provide system support for Linux (Red Hat/CentOS/Scientific Linux) based physical and virtual servers Manage multi petabyte scale data storage systems Support basic facility infrastructure services, e.g. file service, authentication/authorization service, backup service, monitoring. Work with application developers and administrators on the deployment and operation of services Participate in the planning, maintenance, and evolution of the data center Participate in the evaluation of new technologies to support the data processing and storage requirements of scientific researchers at BNL. Position Requirements Required Knowledge, Skills and Abilities: Bachelor’s degree in physical sciences, engineering, or computer science related fields A minimum of 5 years relevant experience Extensive knowledge of Red Hat (or derivative) Linux  system administration Comprehensive knowledge of Linux virtualization technologies Demonstrated experience with different types of high performance and/or high capacity data storage systems. Experience with compute and storage hardware in a data center environment. Demonstrated ability to work autonomously on a daily basis in a collaborative environment with time sensitive deadlines. Preferred Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities: Experience in more than one of the following areas/technologies, in descending priority order: Experience with Red Hat Enterprise Virtualization, OpenStack, and libvirt virtualization environments Experience with scale out storage systems/technologies, e.g. GPFS, Lustre, Ceph, OpenStack Swift, HDFS Experience with basic data center infrastructure services, including a subset of the following: DNS, NTP, OpenLDAP, Kerberos, and Active Directory Email  - SMTP/IMAP/Webmail servers (Postfix/Dovecot/Roundcube) Monitoring - SNMP, Ganglia, Nagios, Cacti Databases – PostgreSQL, MySQL Web Services – Apache HTTP, Apache Tomcat, Shibboleth Network Access – GridFTP/Globus Online, Ssh, NX, VNC, RDP Backup Services – TSM, TiBS Cobbler and Puppet installation and configuration management Broad knowledge of diverse hardware and software components of compute clusters, web servers, database servers and computer networks. Experience with Grid (PKI) certificate based network services Experience deploying and operating secure, Internet  facing servers, Knowledge of diverse network technologies, e.g. Infiniband, OmniPath, Fibre Channel, Ethernet, SAS. Other Information None At Brookhaven National Laboratory we believe that a comprehensive employee benefits program is an important and meaningful part of the compensation employees receive.  Our benefits program includes but is not limited to: •              Medical Plans •              Vacation •              Holidays •              Dental Plans •              Life Insurance •              401(k) Plan •              Retirement Plan •              On site Child Development Center, Swimming Pool, Weight room Tennis Courts, and many other employee perks and benefits We invite you to consider Brookhaven National Laboratory for employment. To be considered for this position, please apply online at External Positions (http://www.bnl.gov/hr/careers/jobs/index.php?q=3) and enter the Job ID number located at the top of this page into the Search by Job ID field. Brookhaven National Laboratory (BNL) is an equal opportunity employer committed to ensuring that all qualified applicants receive consideration for employment and will not be discriminated against on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, status as a veteran, disability or any other federal, state or local protected class. BNL takes affirmative action in support of its policy and to advance in employment individuals who are minorities, women, protected veterans, and individuals with disabilities. *VEVRAA Federal Contractor Back to top View Job Cart (0) Send This Job to a Friend View My Account jobDetails

title: Sr Frontend Engineer
summary: We are scientists and artists. In the last 3 years, we’ve worked on a broad range of projects, including Web (90M unique visitors per month), APIs, native...
post_text: Job Application for Sr Frontend Engineer at The Hackerati Apply Now Sr Frontend Engineer at The Hackerati (View all jobs) New York, NY What We Do Technology Consultancy The Hackerati is a boutique tech consulting firm delivering Engineering as a Service to a diverse client base, from Fortune 250s to startups. We focus on providing product delivery services in the areas of agile, big data, cloud, mobile / multi-screen, and web applications. We are a team of unconventional thinkers, visionaries, scientists, and entrepreneurial engineers. Work We've Done In the last 3 years, we’ve worked on a broad range of projects, including Web (90M unique visitors per month), APIs, native mobile (iOS/Android with millions of downloads), mobile web, machine learning, natural language processing, Big Data (330+ TB/mo), real time bidding, real time event processing (10k events/second), wearable devices, facial recognition, augmented reality, programmatic advertising, wrangling browsers and geospatial applications. We are technology and process agnostic, so as a team member you’ll be exposed to many different technologies. We use proven technologies, following basic architectural principles and design patterns and practice Agile Engineering in a collaborative shared repo team development setting. Our stacks consist of Objective C, Swift, Java/Android, Java/Hadoop, PHP, Python, Scala, Groovy/Grails, Ruby/Rails, Angular, React and Erlang. A great plus of being a Hackeratus is that you can draw upon a broad and deep collection of best practices from our respective Practice leaders to help you grow professionally. Why You Should Join Us We're not afraid to be our wild selves. We’re different. With mottos like be fearless and weird is good, our unique perspectives on life and technology make us great people to learn from and work/party with. We sponsor lunches and happy hours, band practice, electronics like Glass/Oculus/ Myo , and we’ve presented at the UN—twice. We rock that familial vibe, and you should join us if you enjoy a blurred line between work and play. What To Expect Deliver the industry's most challenging projects. As Hackerati consultants we solve problems. Hard ones. To do so, we deploy teams of Hackerati to work onsite with clients around NYC, and build products in-house, both for ourselves and clients. Engagement teams vary in size and a typical project lasts between 6 and 9 months—Thus there is on-going diversity of cool new things to build. You ... are strong in some/all of the following: HTML, CSS, Javascript, JQuery, AngularJS, node.js, Backbone, D3 have experience building high-availability, high-performance, scalable websites or web applications have knowledge of modern web frameworks, including mobile-first, responsive design frameworks and third-party APIs are able to write clear, consistent, simple-to-use interfaces have UI/UX development experience (experience working with designers is a big plus) are turned on by functional programming are fearless about acquiring new skills It would also be great if you... have worked on an Agile team have work that can be found in public repos on Github know the difference between unit and functional testing and QA, and you know what stubs and mocks are have mastered other software disciplines like fullstack web and Big Data create in other mediums like music, poetry, paintings, videos, and comics About the Team We’re all hackers in our own disciplines—inventors who naturally defy conventional wisdom in the name of getting stuff done. We specifically look for hackers with a blend of creativity & entrepreneurship in their DNA. Hackerati are visionary creators and explorers who are driven by curiosity and passion to improve the world around them. We are doers and dreamers. We are students and teachers. We are scientists and artists. We are The Hackerati. Blog Video The Hackerati Presents: Google Glass at the United Nations Science and Art at the United Nations The Hackerati's Demo Reel The Hackerati Agile Engineering - by Co-Founder Geoff Scott The Hackerati is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, or Veteran status. To all recruitment agencies : The Hackerati does not accept agency résumés. Please do not forward résumés via our system or by email to The Hackerati’s employees. The Hackerati is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited résumés. Scientist I, QC Apply now Job ID 33357BR Candidate must be able to work independently, as well as on teams within the cell culture, Analytical Chemistry, Microbiology, Environmental and Incoming Quality Control Laboratories. Must have the ability to multitask in a fast paced environment and prioritize work as necessary. Carry out standard operating procedures involving basic laboratory techniques, calculations, materials measurement, operation of laboratory equipment and record keeping necessary for Quality Control testing of raw materials and finished products. Responsible for testing data records, notebooks, customer reports and computerized data storage. Utilize specialized technical knowledge and skills to make detailed observations and analyze data to ensure assays are within operating parameters. Advise manager of factors that may affect quality of data. Suggest options / ideas for corrective and preventative actions. Requires a functional knowledge of laboratory equipment and techniques such as GC, HPLC and ICP-MS. Accuracy and attention to detail is required in performing all functions of this position. Initiative, organizational and computer skills are extremely valuable to ensure effective laboratory operations. Must demonstrate judgment, tact and diplomacy; in dealing with internal and external customers. Must possess self-motivation and the ability to work on routine analysis with no instructions or new assignments with limited instructions. Excellent written and oral communications skills are required. Responsible to: Read, understand and interpret analytical procedures Write WINS and SOPs Provide expert interpretation of data and compare results to established specifications or anticipated trends Adheres to written work instructions and procedures. Works with Research and Development and manufacturing Sciences to facilitate the development and or transfer of new assays. Interacts with diverse internal functional groups to solve moderate complex problems. Responds to internal and external audit observations and identifies and implements appropriate corrective and preventive actions. Initiates investigations into process failures, product failure and safety incidents, and identifies and implements and appropriate corrective and preventive actions. Requirements/Qualifications Bachelors Degree in Chemistry, Analytical Chemistry, or related field with 5 years experience in Analytical Chemistry. Masters Degree in Chemistry, Analytical or related field with 2 years experience in Analytical Chemistry. Extensive experience with HPLC or UPLC. Experience with ICPMS prefered Experience with analytical method validation Experience with cGMP, GLP, CLIA or other lab regulation is preferred Experience with Empower Software is preferred. title: Environmental Planning Specialist
