post_text: Hrs_ce DEPT OF ENVIRONMENT PROTECTION Job Posting Notice Job ID: # of Positions: 237989 1 Business Title: Environmental Planning Specialist Civil Service Title: CITY RESEARCH SCIENTIST Job Category: Engineering, Architecture, & Planning Career Level: Experienced (non-manager) Title Code No: Level: 21744 02 Proposed Salary Range: $ 68,239.00 - $ 85,644.00 (Annual) Work Location: 59-17 Junction Blvd Corona Ny Division/Work Unit: Environmental Planning Support Search Other NYC Jobs Job Description The New York City Department of Environmental Protection (DEP) protects public health and the environment by supplying clean drinking water, collecting and treating wastewater, and reducing air, noise, and hazardous materials pollution. DEP is the largest combined municipal water and wastewater utility in the country, with nearly 6,000 employees. We deliver 1.1 billion gallons of high quality drinking water per day to 8.5 million New York City residents and more than 1 million people in Upstate New York, and we collect and treat an average of 1.3 billion gallons of wastewater per day. The Bureau of Environmental Planning and Analysis (BEPA) is seeking a City Research Scientist to support the development of the city-wide Stormwater Management Program (SWMP) according to the State Pollutant Discharge Elimination System (SPDES) Municipal Separate Storm Sewer System (MS4) Permit - SPDES Permit No. NY0287890. As part of the SWMP and related green infrastructure efforts.  The City will develop a pollution prevention/good housekeeping (PPGH) program for municipal facilities and operations within the City’s separately sewered and direct drainage areas. Under general supervision, the selected candidate will support the Bureau’s work in the PPGH program development, site inspections, identification and analysis of management practices, policies and procedures that will be implemented to reduce or prevent the discharge of pollutants of concern from municipal facilities and operations to receiving waters. He/she will research other cities’ programs, collect information from internal and external stakeholders, and conduct field assessments of municipal facilities and operations. The candidate will perform special studies as assigned to support other MS4 permit and stormwater projects such as planning, coordination, implementation and assessment of the pollutant removal effectiveness of green infrastructure demonstration projects in priority MS4 waterbodies; and site-specific recommendations for stormwater management and pollution prevention practices. Additional responsibilities may include, and are not limited to: (1) research and quantitative/statistical analysis of data related to water quality, land use, mapping, and green infrastructure planning; and (2) assisting the senior engineer with project and contract management tasks such as monitoring project phases to ensure compliance with timelines and deliverables, report preparation, budget tracking, coordinating meetings with internal and external stakeholders. Minimum Qual Requirements 1.  For Assignment Level I (only physical, biological and environmental sciences and public health) A master's degree from an accredited college or university with a specialization in an appropriate field of physical, biological or environmental science or in public health. To be appointed to Assignment Level II and above, candidates must have: 1. A doctorate degree from an accredited college or university with specialization in an appropriate field of physical, biological, environmental or social science and one year of full-time experience in a responsible supervisory, administrative or research capacity in the appropriate field of specialization; or 2. A master's degree from an accredited college or university with specialization in an appropriate field of physical, biological, environmental or social science and three years of responsible full-time research experience in the appropriate field of specialization; or 3. Education and/or experience which is equivalent to "1" or "2" above. However, all candidates must have at least a master's degree in an appropriate field of specialization and at least two years of experience described in "2" above. Two years as a City Research Scientist Level I can be substituted for the experience required in "1" and "2" above. NOTE: Probationary Period Appointments to this position are subject to a minimum probationary period of one year. Additional Information Appointments are subject to OMB approval. For additional information about DEP, visit www.dep.nyc.gov To Apply Click on the "APPLY NOW." Hours/Shift 35 hrs. a week/day shift Work Location 59-17 Junction Blvd, Corona, NY Residency Requirement New York City residency is generally required within 90 days of appointment. However, City Employees in certain titles who have worked for the City for 2 continuous years may also be eligible to reside in Nassau, Suffolk, Putnam, Westchester, Rockland, or Orange County. To determine if the residency requirement applies to you, please discuss with the agency representative at the time of interview. Recruitment Contact Recruitment Contact: Grace Pigott Recruitment Email: Recruit@dep.nyc.gov DEP is an equal opportunity employer with a strong commitment to the diversity of our organization and workforce. Your voluntary response to the NYCAPS on-line application section for referral information will assist us tremendously in our ability to track the success of our outreach and recruitment efforts. Please be sure to indicate your source of referral to this job. title: Asset Management Business Development Associate
summary: The people of Two Sigma – a dynamic and diverse group of scientists, researchers, engineers, technologists, and business professionals – are accomplished...
post_text: Asset Management Business Development Associate Location: New York, New York, United States Ref#: POS-1512 Share with: Facebook LinkedIn Twitter Send to a friend What is Two Sigma and why apply for a job with us? Two Sigma is a career destination for the intellectually curious who want to learn, invent, and create. The people of Two Sigma – a dynamic and diverse group of scientists, researchers, engineers, technologists, and business professionals – are accomplished analytical thinkers and passionate problem solvers. We are a technology company that applies a rigorous, scientific method-based approach to investment management. Since our founding in 2001, Two Sigma’s vision has been to develop technological innovations that intelligently analyze the world’s data to consistently deliver value for our clients. Business Development at Two Sigma The Business Development team is focused on accelerating Two Sigma’s position as a pioneer at the intersection of technology and finance.  Technology drives our business and inspires creative and exciting business opportunities. BizDev plays a central role in developing and advancing company strategy, fostering new idea generation, and catalyzing innovation into tangible business results.  Expansion into new business areas, new global markets and asset classes for trading, new geographies for business activities, and new investment products and distribution channels to further serve our clients are a few examples of how we help Two Sigma grow.  Our impact is a direct result of the broad and deep relationships we forge across the entire company and with our extensive network of business partners.  We are always thinking about the trends shaping our industry and how we are positioned for future growth and success. Asset Management Business Development & Strategy Position The Asset Management Business Development (AMBD) team plays an integral role in helping to grow our Asset Management business, which leverages Two Sigma’s research, data, and technology-driven approach to provide investment solutions to leading institutional investors globally.  The AMBD group works across teams in modeling /portfolio management, engineering, and investor relations, as well as with colleagues in operational and regulatory-focused areas, to develop and implement our business strategy, cultivate business partnerships, generate and execute on new product ideas, coordinate with internal / external stakeholders to deliver on business expansion initiatives, and drive further operating efficiency for our business. The AMBD position requires both “big-picture” thinking and strong conceptual / analytical problem solving skills to successfully work across our business, investment, and technology groups to deliver on new strategic initiatives.  A successful candidate will also develop and leverage broad and deep relationships across the entire company, as well as with our extensive network of business partners, to further position the Asset Management business for future growth. Core competencies of the team consist of: Idea generation; Strategy development; Business planning; Project management; Research and competitive intelligence gathering; Market and business analysis; Product development & structuring; Relationship management and development. Requirements Include: Bachelor’s degree in finance, economics, mathematics, engineering, or related discipline from a top university. 5-8 years of work experience; background in consulting, investment banking, or internal strategy / business development. Excellent analytical / conceptual problem-solving skills with great attention to detail. Demonstration of high intellectual capacity and curiosity. Robust business analysis / project management skills with an understanding of financial markets and the investment lifecycle. Strong work ethic, self-starter and quick-study mentality. Strong communication and presentation skills. Passion to work in a dynamic, collaborative, and results-oriented environment. Advanced skills in MS Office (incl. Excel, PowerPoint, Visio, Project); experience with databases and SQL is a plus. Apply Now

title: Manager of Statistical Data
summary: Work alongside agency partners to identify project opportunities, build an analytical community, ensure adoption of analytical tools and processes, and promote...
post_text: Hrs_ce DEPT OF INFO TECH & TELECOMM Job Posting Notice Job ID: # of Positions: 237856 1 Business Title: Manager of Statistical Data Civil Service Title: COMPUTER SYSTEMS MANAGER Job Category: Information Technology & Telecommunications Career Level: Manager Title Code No: Level: 10050 M1 Proposed Salary Range: $ 53,051.00 - $105,000.00 (Annual) Work Location: 253 Broadway New York Ny Division/Work Unit: Mayor's Office of Operations Search Other NYC Jobs Job Description DoITT provides for the sustained, efficient and effective delivery of IT services, infrastructure and telecommunications to enhance service delivery to New York City's residents, businesses, employees and visitors. As the City's technology leader, DoITT is responsible for maintaining the foundational IT infrastructure and systems that touch every aspect of City life from public safety to human services, from education to economic development crossing the full spectrum of governmental operations. The Mayor’s Office of Operations was established pursuant to the NYC Charter to oversee the daily operations of City agencies, coordinate City initiatives, and assist agencies in improving service quality and delivery. The Office is also responsible for measuring agency performance to provide greater accountability. The Office of Operations is seeking a Manager of Statistical Data. The successful candidate will serve as a Manager of Statistical Data reporting to the Mayor’s Office of Operations Responsibilities will include: •	Build and administer databases to facilitate data analysis on a wide range of subjects •	Develop, test, and implement statistical models; •	Create data visualizations to communicate complex ideas; •	Manage a portfolio of analytical approaches to complex business problems; •	Program or customize statistical software and other analytical tools to support the use of data to improve decision-making; •	Compile, process, and manage datasets from multiple sources to support analysis; •	Prepare senior-level reports for executive management suggesting conclusions, making recommendations for improvement, and supporting evidence-based decisions; •	Work alongside agency partners to identify project opportunities, build an analytical community, ensure adoption of analytical tools and processes, and promote standards and best practices when working with data; •	Maintain regular communication with the user base of citywide analytical tools about training opportunities, system changes, and new programs; •	Manage special projects and initiatives as assigned. The position’s responsibilities include commitment to and compliance with the City s EEO policy. Minimum Qual Requirements 1. A master's degree in computer science from an accredited college and three years of progressively more responsible, full-time, satisfactory experience using information technology in computer applications programming, systems programming, computer systems development, data telecommunications, database administration, planning of data/information processing, user services, or area networks at least 18 months of this experience must have been in an administrative, managerial or executive capacity in the areas of computer applications programming, systems programming, computer systems development, data telecommunications, data base administration, or planning of data processing or in the supervision of staff performing these duties; or 2. A baccalaureate degree from an accredited college and four years of experience as described in "1" above; or 3. A four-year high school diploma or its educational equivalent approved by a State's department of education or recognized accrediting organization and six years of experience as described in "1" above; or 4. A satisfactory combination of education and experience equivalent to "1", "2" or "3" above. However, all candidates must have at least a four-year high school diploma or its educational equivalent approved by a State's department of education or recognized accrediting organization and must possess at least three years of experience as described in "1" above, including the 18 months of administrative, managerial, executive or supervisory experience as described in "1" above. Qualification Requirements (continued) NOTE: The following types of experience are not acceptable: superficial use of preprogrammed software without complex programming, design, implementation or management of the product; use of word processing packages; use of a hand held calculator; primarily the entering or updating of data in a system; the operation of data processing hardware or consoles. Preferred Skills The preferred candidate should possess the following: •	Advanced knowledge of data management and statistical analysis and high level MS Office applications; •	Experience which demonstrates a proven record of providing analytical and/or technical assistance for complex, interdisciplinary projects involving multiple stakeholders; •	Experience mediating among groups with competing perspectives; •	Experience implementing projects that improve operational efficiency; •	Flexibility, multi-tasking capability and enthusiastic work ethic; •	Strong written and verbal communication skills; •	An understanding of urban issues, especially New York City government and current city affairs; •	An understanding of New York City’s operational agencies; •	Ability to think creatively, embrace new approaches and pioneer innovative solutions to intricate problems. To Apply For City employees, please go to Employee Self Service (ESS), click on Recruiting Activities > Careers, and search for Job ID #237856 For all other applicants, please go to www.nyc.gov/jobs/search and search for Job ID #237856 -or- If you do not have access to a computer, please mail resume indicating Job ID # to: Department of Information Technology and Telecommunications (DoITT) Recruitment Office - 255 Greenwich Street - 9th Floor - New York, NY 10007 SUBMISSION OF A RESUME IS NOT A GUARANTEE THAT YOU WILL RECEIVE AN INTERVIEW APPOINTMENTS ARE SUBJECT TO OVERSIGHT APPROVAL Hours/Shift Day Work Location New York, NY Residency Requirement New York City Residency is not required for this position POSTING DATE: POST UNTIL: 04/13/2016 Until Filled Search Other NYC Jobs The City of New York is an Equal Opportunity Employer t Help test Hrs_ce Default Local Node: DbName: Portal: Node: WorkCenter Id: Url: test

title: Accenture Analytics - Data Science Senior Manager
summary: Manage, architect and analyze big data in order to build data driven business insights and high impact data models to generate significant business value....
post_text: Accenture Analytics - Data Science Senior Manager Search Type to search SIGN IN MENU STRATEGY CONSULTING DIGITAL TECHNOLOGY OPERATIONS INDUSTRIES CAREERS About Accenture Corporate Citizenship Inclusion and Diversity Investor Relations Leadership Newsroom Scroll Swipe 0 Shares Print Job Listing ? {"countries":[{"CountryName":"Brazil","Locale":"pt-BR","Language":"pt-BR","SiteCode":"10200"},{"CountryName":"China","Locale":"cn-en","Language":"en","SiteCode":"10200"},{"CountryName":"China","Locale":"cn-zh","Language":"zh-CN","SiteCode":"10200"},{"CountryName":"France","Locale":"fr-fr","Language":"fr-fr","SiteCode":"10200"},{"CountryName":"Germany","Locale":"de-de","Language":"de","SiteCode":"10200"},{"CountryName":"Italy","Locale":"it-it","Language":"it","SiteCode":"10140"},{"CountryName":"Japan","Locale":"jp-ja","Language":"ja","SiteCode":"10001"},{"CountryName":"Spain","Locale":"es-es","Language":"es","SiteCode":"10200"},{"CountryName":"United Kingdom","Locale":"gb-en","Language":"en-GB","SiteCode":"10003"},{"CountryName":"USA","Locale":"us-enTaleo","Language":"en","SiteCode":"10003"}]} Accenture Analytics - Data Science Senior Manager Job Location: CA - San Francisco, CA - San Francisco, DC, DC - Washington, IL - Chicago, MA - Boston, NY -New York, PA - Philadelphia, TX - Dallas, TX - Dallas Job Number: 00375385 00375385_en APPLY GET REFERRED SAVE THIS JOB - Job description Organization: Accenture Analytics Travel: 100% (Monday - Thursday) Position: Accenture Analytics – Global Management – Data Scientist The digital revolution is changing everything. It’s everywhere – transforming how we work and play. Are you leading the way as a digital disrupter? Accenture Digital is driving these exciting changes and bringing them to life across 40 industries in more than 120 countries. At the forefront of digital you’ll create it, own it, and make it a reality for clients looking to better serve their connected customers and operate always-on enterprises. Join us and become an integral part of our experienced digital team with the credibility, expertise, and insight clients depend on. Accenture Digital is powered by three practices –Mobility, Interactive, and Analytics. As part of our Analytics practice, you’ll deliver analytically-informed, issue-based solutions that help clients make faster, smarter decisions. You’ll play a critical role in helping them tackle complex business issues. JOB DESCRIPTION Your client’s eyes probably glaze over when you discuss in detail logistic regression, cluster analysis, neural nets and other segmentation models, but they certainly appreciate your uncanny ability to utilize those to lower their marketing costs and improve marketing effectiveness. Or perhaps they rely on you to provide analytics that stimulate sales, strengthen customer loyalty and generate purchases. If you’ve earned a reputation for your analytics expertise, Accenture may be the perfect place to take the next step in your career journey. YOUR ROLE: Data Scientist There will never be a typical day at Accenture Analytics, but that’s why people love it here. The opportunities to make a difference within exciting client initiatives are unlimited in the ever-changing digital landscape. Here are just a few of your day-to-day responsibilities. · Design, develop and deploy state-of-the-art, data-driven predictive/descriptive models to solve business problems using the latest and most appropriate technologies in statistical modeling and machine learning. · Create new insights from predictive statistical modeling activities that target and deliver value to our clients. · Manage, architect and analyze big data in order to build data driven business insights and high impact data models to generate significant business value. · Create models and processes to collect, distill and interpret data with a view to aid better, more informed decision making. · Examine and explore data from multiple disparate sources with the goal of discovering insights which in turn can provide competitive advantage for our clients. + Basic qualifications YOUR EXPERIENCE : Strong background in statistical concepts and calculations · 10 years of experience with real data · Innovative and strong analytical and algorithmic problem solvers · 7 years of experience with open source machine learning tools: Python/scikit-learn or Revo R. · 7 years of experience with scripting languages (e.g., Python, Ruby, Perl, Bash) for orchestration and data manipulation · 7 years of Data engineering experience, including SQL and experience manipulating structured and unstructured data sources for analysis. · Bachelor’s Degree in a relevant field like statistics, computer science or applied math, physics or relevant subjects or 4+ years of experience in computer science, applied mathematics, or other quantitative/computational discipline SET YOURSELF APART: Preferred Skills · Experience with MapReduce/Hadoop and related technologies (e.g., Pig, Hive, Cascading). · Familiarity with Amazon Web Services and Elastic MapReduce a plus. · Familiarity with Hadoop based commercial packages (e.g. Cloudera, Hortonworks) · Experience in text mining/NLP · Master’s or PhD in a relevant field like statistics, computer science or applied maths, physics or relevant subjects · Expert in Deep Learning · Published papers in Machine Learning or Deep Learning OUR COMMITMENT TO YOU · Your entrepreneurial spirit and vision will be rewarded, and your success will fuel opportunities for career advancement. · You’ll make a difference for some pretty impressive clients. Accenture serves many of the Fortune Global 100 on high-profile projects. · Opportunities to learn daily through training, assignments and collaboration with experts across the company. · Access to leading-edge technology. · Along with a competitive salary, Accenture offers a comprehensive package that includes generous paid time off, 401K match and an employee healthcare plan. Learn more about our extensive rewards and benefits http://careers.accenture.com/us-en/your-future/rewards-benefits/Pages/index.aspx CALL TO ACTION Now is the time to become a digital disrupter. The opportunity is here—what’s stopping you from pursuing it? Click the menu icon to display the main navigation. Type anywhere at any time to use our smart search tool.

(CED) Senior Market Research Analyst Apply Now Print Save Share Description Con Edison Development, Inc. (CED) Who We Are Con Edison Development develops, owns and operates renewable and energy infrastructure projects. The company is an unregulated subsidiary of Consolidated Edison, Inc. [NYSE: ED], the nation's oldest and one of the largest investor-owned energy companies. How We Began Con Edison Development was formed in 1997. Through acquisitions, expansions and greenfield development, we quickly built a substantial portfolio of fossil-fueled and hydro-electric merchant generation assets in the Mid-Atlantic and New England regions that totaled 1700 MW. In 2008, the company completed the sale of its portfolio, realizing an approximate $400 million profit. Where We Are Today The company now is focusing on renewable energy and gas assets as part of an overall corporate goal of responsible environmental stewardship. Through its deep resources and trusted relationships with a range of energy-related companies, Con Edison Development has already built a substantial renewable energy pipeline nationwide. Our Mission By targeting renewable asset development and operating energy assets in an environmentally responsible manner, Con Edison Development helps build the leadership position of Consolidated Edison Inc. (Con Edison) in the industry and enhances its reputation as a responsible steward of the environment. Our Commitment to Renewable Energy Consolidated Edison, Inc., parent company of Con Edison Development, has publicly announced a significant capital investment to develop its renewable footprint. We are exploring opportunities to develop, own and operate a range of solar, wind, and energy storage installations in the United States. Overview: The Senior Market Research Analyst will contribute to the achievement of CED’s financial and strategic goals by developing, analyzing, and communicating energy market information, including, but not limited to, the renewable energy sector. Market information will be gathered primarily from secondary sources and occasionally from primary sources and will include industry, competitor, customer, partner, utility, regulatory, political (federal, state, local), and product information/research. Responsibilities: Develop and lead analysis of competitive and market intelligence in support of CED’s Business Development activities Identify, gather, sort, prioritize and analyze pertinent data; manage database of renewable energy industry trends and activities Assist Project Development in developing and maintaining database of financial, business, and industry activities; monitor and report on competitive information Evaluate industry trends and technologies for renewable energy/ storage business Perform various administrative duties Qualifications: Education: Undergraduate degree in a technical or business related field including, but not limited to, economics, math, market research, finance, statistics, marketing, engineering MBA preferred Skills: Microsoft products – including Access and Microsoft Project (experience preferred) Salesforce.com Database management software Web-based information sources Excellent oral and written communication skills Experience : 3-5 years in database management, market analysis and assessment or market research capacity Energy industry experience required (renewable preferred) We are proud to be an EEO/AA employer Male/Female/Disabled/Veterans. We maintain a drug-free workplace and perform substance abuse testing. You must be eligible to work in the US independent of company sponsorship. Job Information Location: Valhalla, New York, United States Job ID: 27749581 Posted: April 4, 2016 Position Title: Senior Market Research Analyst Company Name: Con Edison Development, Inc. title: Visiting Researcher - Network Science and Machine Reasoning Solutions
summary: At this moment, our applications are mainly on large-scale Social Analytics, Behavioral Analytics, Neuron Analytics, and Visual Analytics....
post_text: Visiting Researcher - Network Science and Machine Reasoning Solutions - Job Details Toggle header links Toggle search controls Back Job search Sign in/Register Primary job category Travel Required City / Township / Village Country Close in Share 0 Visiting Researcher - Network Science and Machine Reasoning Solutions 36654BR Job Description The Network Science and Machine Reasoning Solutions department at the IBM T. J. Watson Research Center is seeking visiting researcher to conduct fundamental and applied research in Network Science. We focus on all aspects of large-scale Graph Computing -- graph database, high performance computing graph infrastructure, network graph analysis and graphical models library, and graph visualization. We are leading researchers from worldwide labs and universities to create graph computing system to advance Network Science. Our graph system is being applied to all four types of Network Science: (1) Social/Economic Networks; (2) Information/Knowledge Networks; (3) Natural/Bio/Cognition/Brain Networks; and (4) Communication/Mobile/Man-Made Networks. At this moment, our applications are mainly on large-scale Social Analytics, Behavioral Analytics, Neuron Analytics, and Visual Analytics. These projects offer the opportunity to work with team members with backgrounds in Signal Processing, Network Science, Machine Learning, Information Retrieval, Natural Language Processing, High Performance Computing, Visualization, Economics, Database, etc., as well as collaborating with academic partners in universities. Our lab has access to large computing resources and data. We encourage researchers actively publishing papers, creating software to solve real-world problems, and contributing to high-quality research communities. We are recruiting scientists with multi-disciplinary backgrounds in computer science, electrical engineering, physics, psychology, or related fields. The successful candidate will be the one with visionary research credentials who can advance emerging sciences to the next level. The World is Our Laboratory: No matter where discovery takes place, IBM researchers push the boundaries of science, technology and business to make the world work better. IBM Research is a global community of forward-thinkers working towards a common goal: progress. title: Business Manager (CEO Support)
summary: We are a diverse team of data scientists, software engineers and business people from over 20 different countries with offices in New York, Zürich & Singapore....
post_text: Job Application for Business Manager (CEO Support) at Teralytics Apply Now Business Manager (CEO Support) at Teralytics New York, US Are you an experienced Business Manager, Consultant or Business Analyst with a keen interest in the world of analytics technology? Do you possess the business acumen required to manage internal and external stakeholders from your prior experience in consulting and/or investment banking? Who are Teralytics? Teralytics is a fast-growing technology start-up with great ambitions in supporting the emerging big data economy.  Teralytics processes anonymized data from over 350 million people worldwide to deliver valuable information about location, mobility, demographics and online behaviour. Our data products provide strategic information that increases efficiency and profitability for customers in the financial, retail, transportation, and media sectors. We offer our employees extensive strategic input in a highly-dynamic environment. Teralytics is funded by international venture capital firms who previously invested in companies such as Facebook, Spotify, Skype and AirBnB. Your role We at Teralytics NYC, are currently searching for a Business Manager to support the CEO directly in the rapid scaling of our company. You will have a key input into business decisions and responsibility for managing the CEO’s all round duties. Tasks will include: Working directly with the CEO to provide support in all daily activities Preparing internal and external documentation, communication and slide material Keeping track of and following up on all to-do items of CEO Supporting preparation and follow-ups on board meetings Coordinating and tracking the execution of complex strategic initiatives across different business units Representing the CEO in external and internal meetings Your profile As well as an exemplar past record within a professional environment you will possess excellent English communication skills, both verbal and written. You should have prior experience with a top-tier strategy consultancy or investment bank in an associate or analyst position You will require a strong interest in technology, ideally with a mixed engineering and business background or having previously worked on technology cases. You will also need to be: A strong team player with the ability to work across cultures Capable of working with minimal supervision in an unstructured & fast pace start-up environment Able to influence people to get things done & hold good leadership skills Committed to a minimum of 1-year in the position with the possibility to grow into various roles after that Your new team We are a diverse team of data scientists, software engineers and business people from over 20 different countries with offices in New York, Zürich & Singapore. We are smart, hungry and fast moving; operating in small teams, with freedom for independent work and fast decision making. Our team combines employees with backgrounds ranging from McKinsey and Asset Management to Google and Yahoo. Teralytics is an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. Contact Information For more detailed information on this Business Manager job, or to discuss any other potential jobs with Teralytics in NYC, Zürich or Singapore please contact Daniel Tudor (Talent Acquisition Manager) on daniel.tudor@teralytics.net or 0041 786 245 224. www.linkedin.com/in/danieltudorteralytics Apply for this Job * Required First Name * Last Name * Email * Phone Resume/CV Drop files here Attach Dropbox Google Drive Paste Cover Letter Drop files here Attach Dropbox Google Drive Paste LinkedIn Profile Website How did you hear about this job? post_text: Hrs_ce HOUSING PRESERVATION & DVLPMNT Job Posting Notice Job ID: # of Positions: 237018 1 Business Title: Director Civil Service Title: CITY RESEARCH SCIENTIST Job Category: Policy & Analysis Career Level: Experienced (non-manager) Title Code No: Level: 21744 03 Proposed Salary Range: $ 76,340.00 - $100,322.00 (Annual) Work Location: 100 Gold Street Division/Work Unit: Research & Program Evaluation Search Other NYC Jobs Job Description The New York City Department of Housing Preservation and Development’s (HPD) Division of Research & Evaluation seeks a Senior Researcher to join its team as Director. HPD Research & Evaluation conducts rigorous statistical analyses, large scale surveys, and evaluations of Agency programming to support new knowledge and help refine practices related to the housing stock, population, and communities we serve. R&E leverages resources within and across the traditional divides of government and academia to facilitate discussion and establish an innovative and holistic approach to housing policy research. Our research produces methodologically sound findings to shape effective policy and programming, and promote data-driven policymaking in New York City and beyond. The Director will report to the agency’s Assistant Commissioner of Research & Evaluation, who resides in the Office of Strategy, Research, and Communications. S/he will oversee all of R&E’s research projects and provide day-to-day leadership for the team of researchers conducting short-term as well as long-term analyses and data collection.  The Director will also provide support for long-term grant-funded research activities and the implementation and oversight of the Housing and Vacancy Survey (HVS), a triennial representative survey conducted by the U.S. Census Bureau under contract from HPD. The Director will work with the Assistant Commissioner to develop the agency’s research agenda, as well as design and execute program evaluations and various statistical analyses in support of the team’s ongoing projects and the needs of the Commissioner. S/he will work closely with the team to define new projects, develop analytic strategies that serve the needs of the agency, execute program evaluations and policy studies, mentor and support junior researchers and RAs, and present findings to academic and policymaking audiences. The Director will participate in high level meetings with the Agency and City Hall in order to facilitate and support the City’s evidence-based policymaking practices. Specific duties of the Director include working with internal, senior-level stakeholders to identify and prioritize programs of interest for evaluation, developing research proposals for high priority areas of interest, writing funding proposals to philanthropic and federal agencies, and conducting analyses as appropriate. The Director will be responsible for ensuring the quality of the research team’s work, including activities related to compiling, presenting, and disseminating findings. The Director would be responsible for helping the Assistant Commissioner to develop new grant-funded projects and long-term evaluations. As such, s/he should have a clear set of research interests that are relevant to HPD’s mission and a desire to connect his or her own research activities to the broader R&E research agenda. An interest in cross-disciplinary policy research is particularly relevant. The Director will be expected to work directly with stakeholders at all levels of the agency.  As such, teamwork and relationship building will be essential components of the role. The ideal candidate is one who is able to learn independently, think and work collaboratively, practice strong research ethics, and exhibit a commitment to conducting research with the goal of improving public policy. In addition, the Director should possess strong communications and leadership skills, including the ability to cultivate and manage a team that is curious, collaborative, and dedicated to public service. The New York City Department of Housing Preservation and Development’s (HPD) Division of Research & Evaluation seeks a Senior Researcher to join its team as Director. HPD Research & Evaluation conducts rigorous statistical analyses, large scale surveys, and evaluations of Agency programming to support new knowledge and help refine practices related to the housing stock, population, and communities we serve. Our research produces methodologically sound findings to shape effective policy and programming, and promote data-driven policymaking in New York City and beyond. S/he will oversee all of R&E’s research projects and provide day-to-day leadership for the team of researchers conducting short-term as well as long-term analyses and data collection.  The Director will also provide support for long-term grant-funded research activities and the implementation and oversight of the Housing and Vacancy Survey (HVS), a triennial representative survey conducted by the U.S. Census Bureau under contract from HPD. The Director will work with the Assistant Commissioner to develop the agency’s research agenda, as well as design and execute program evaluations and various statistical analyses in support of the team’s ongoing projects and the needs of the Commissioner. S/he will work closely with the team to define new projects, develop analytic strategies that serve the needs of the agency, execute program evaluations and policy studies, mentor and support junior researchers and RAs, and present findings to academic and policymaking audiences. The Director will participate in high level meetings with the Agency and City Hall in order to facilitate and support the City’s evidence-based policymaking practices. Specific duties of the Director include working with internal, senior-level stakeholders to identify and prioritize programs of interest for evaluation, developing research proposals for high priority areas of interest, writing funding proposals to philanthropic and federal agencies, and conducting analyses as appropriate. The Director will be responsible for ensuring the quality of the research team’s work, including activities related to compiling, presenting, and disseminating findings. The Director would be responsible for helping the Assistant Commissioner to develop new grant-funded projects and long-term evaluations. As such, s/he should have a clear set of research interests that are relevant to HPD’s mission and a desire to connect his or her own research activities to the broader R&E research agenda. An interest in cross-disciplinary policy research is particularly relevant. The Director will be expected to work directly with stakeholders at all levels of the agency.  As such, teamwork and relationship building will be essential components of the role. The ideal candidate is one who is able to learn independently, think and work collaboratively, practice strong research ethics, and exhibit a commitment to conducting research with the goal of improving public policy. In addition, the Director should possess strong communications and leadership skills, including the ability to cultivate and manage a team that is curious, collaborative, and dedicated to public service. Preference will be given to the following education, experience and skills: •Doctoral Degree in Public Policy, Urban Planning, Public Administration, Sociology, Economics, or other related field; •2-3 years of experience conducting research, including the identification of outcome measures, ensuring reliability and validity, sampling, primary and secondary data collection, data management and methods of analysis; •OR Masters degree in a related field AND 5 years of experience. Minimum Qual Requirements 1.  For Assignment Level I (only physical, biological and environmental sciences and public health) A master's degree from an accredited college or university with a specialization in an appropriate field of physical, biological or environmental science or in public health. To be appointed to Assignment Level II and above, candidates must have: 1. A doctorate degree from an accredited college or university with specialization in an appropriate field of physical, biological, environmental or social science and one year of full-time experience in a responsible supervisory, administrative or research capacity in the appropriate field of specialization; or 2. A master's degree from an accredited college or university with specialization in an appropriate field of physical, biological, environmental or social science and three years of responsible full-time research experience in the appropriate field of specialization; or 3. Education and/or experience which is equivalent to "1" or "2" above. However, all candidates must have at least a master's degree in an appropriate field of specialization and at least two years of experience described in "2" above. Two years as a City Research Scientist Level I can be substituted for the experience required in "1" and "2" above. NOTE: Probationary Period Appointments to this position are subject to a minimum probationary period of one year. Preferred Skills Experience managing a diverse staff and mentoring junior researchers; Literacy in all of the following sets of statistical methods: econometrics, spatial analysis, hierarchical modeling and/or survey analysis; Fluency in multivariate (OLS) regression and categorical data analysis, as well as assumptions underlying such methods; Mastery of statistical software such as Stata or SAS; Experience developing surveys and overseeing primary data collection efforts, including managing field interviewers; Ability to communicate complex statistical data and concepts to a lay audience while maintaining the integrity of one’s findings; Proven desire to learn by doing and work hard to ensure the highest quality work product; Energetic, pro-active, independent, and intellectually-curious; Strong written and oral communications skills, including peer-reviewed publications and/or presentations at academic conferences; Understanding of housing policy, concepts and theories, including proven ability to frame research questions that address core questions or issues in the field; Knowledge of NYC housing landscape, including past research experience working with New York City neighborhoods, population, and/or housing stock. To Apply Apply Online Work Location 100 Gold Street Residency Requirement New York City residency is generally required within 90 days of appointment. However, City Employees in certain titles who have worked for the City for 2 continuous years may also be eligible to reside in Nassau, Suffolk, Putnam, Westchester, Rockland, or Orange County. To determine if the residency requirement applies to you, please discuss with the agency representative at the time of interview. post_text: Hrs_ce DEPT OF HEALTH/MENTAL HYGIENE Job Posting Notice Job ID: # of Positions: 225945 1 Business Title: Program Analyst, Office of Policy, Planning and Strategic Data Use (PPSDU) Civil Service Title: CITY RESEARCH SCIENTIST Job Category: Health, Policy & Analysis Career Level: Experienced (non-manager) Title Code No: Level: 21744 03 Proposed Salary Range: $ 76,340.00 - $100,322.00 (Annual) Work Location: 42-09 28th Street Division/Work Unit: Office of Policy and Planning Search Other NYC Jobs Job Description The Office of Policy, Planning and Strategic Data Use (PPSDU) in the Office of the First Deputy Commissioner for the New York City Department of Health and Mental Hygiene (DOHMH) is responsible for creation of a DOHMH agenda addressing health promotion, health equity, and health-in-all policies; increasing DOHMH capacity for collaboration with the health care system; and promoting evidence-based and data-driven population health programming in the health care system. The office also coordinates performance management reporting to ensure programs meet their goals and objectives which helps to guide senior management decision-making. Under direction of the Director of Program Analysis, the Program Analyst will: •	Coordinate development, analysis and reporting of internal performance indicators. •	Coordinate and lead Agency-wide efforts, including a learning collaborative, to support divisional contacts in performance indicator development and analysis and quality improvement. •	Identify and coordinate training opportunities for staff. •	Attend QPR meetings and track indicator change requests from senior leadership. •	Work with divisional contacts to address change requests or refinements. •	Support the Office of the First Deputy Commissioner and the Commissioner’s Office in the QPR process and in the follow up on requests from QPR meetings. •	Maintain Agency QPR SharePoint page and update Agency-wide divisional indicator data as necessary. •	Maintain Agency’s indicator data collection system and participate in identification of a replacement system. Coordinate development, analysis and reporting of external performance indicators and reports. •	Serve as Agency lead in coordinating the preparation and submission of mandated citywide reports, such as the Mayor’s Management Reports. •	Serve as Agency liaison to the Mayor’s Office of Operations and other City offices on mandated reporting. •	Support divisional contacts in narrative and indicator development for citywide reports. •	Ensure that performance data is reported timely and accurately in the City’s data collection system. •Support other activities of PPSDU including, but not limited to: •	Serve as team lead on designated projects or initiatives. •	Support Director of Program Analysis in analyses and reporting of Take Care New York 2020. •	Collaborate on the identification and release of key datasets in NYC Open Data. Minimum Qual Requirements 1.  For Assignment Level I (only physical, biological and environmental sciences and public health) A master's degree from an accredited college or university with a specialization in an appropriate field of physical, biological or environmental science or in public health. To be appointed to Assignment Level II and above, candidates must have: 1. A doctorate degree from an accredited college or university with specialization in an appropriate field of physical, biological, environmental or social science and one year of full-time experience in a responsible supervisory, administrative or research capacity in the appropriate field of specialization; or 2. A master's degree from an accredited college or university with specialization in an appropriate field of physical, biological, environmental or social science and three years of responsible full-time research experience in the appropriate field of specialization; or 3. Education and/or experience which is equivalent to "1" or "2" above. However, all candidates must have at least a master's degree in an appropriate field of specialization and at least two years of experience described in "2" above. Two years as a City Research Scientist Level I can be substituted for the experience required in "1" and "2" above. NOTE: Probationary Period Appointments to this position are subject to a minimum probationary period of one year. Preferred Skills The successful candidate will: have experience in program evaluation or measurement; have experience in project management with diverse teams; be able to work with staff of varying levels and represent the Agency on citywide initiatives; be proficient with Microsoft Office suite including extensive experience with Excel; have excellent written and verbal communication skills; have ability to work independently and to handle multiple responsibilities simultaneously; be a strong team player and actively support other colleagues. To Apply Apply online with a cover letter to https://a127-jobs.nyc.gov/ In the Job ID search bar, enter: job ID number #225945. We appreciate the interest and thank all applicants who apply, but only those candidates under consideration will be contacted. title: Institutional Review Board Director
summary: The doctors and scientists of Weill Cornell Medicine—faculty from Weill Cornell Medical College, Weill Cornell Graduate School of Medical Sciences, and Weill...
post_text: Job Description - Institutional Review Board Director (31516) Go to the main content section. Welcome. You are not signed in. My Briefcase | Sign In Job Search My Jobpage Basic Search | Advanced Search | Jobs Matching My Profile | Beginning of the main content section. Return to the home page Printable Format Job Description - Institutional Review Board Director (31516) Job Description Institutional Review Board Director - 31516 Description Position Summary Under guidance and direction from the Director, Human Research Integrity and Education, directs the Human Research Protection Program of Weill Cornell Medicine with the Division of Research Integrity. The WCM IRBs are charged with ensuring that research involving human participants is conducted in accordance with federal, state, local and WCM regulations, laws and policies, and ethical principles as part of the WCM Human Research Protection Program.  The WCM IRBs review all human research conducted by faculty, students and staff of WCM to protect the rights and welfare of human research subjects. Position Activities Under guidance and direction from the Director, Human Research Integrity and Education, and in consultation with the IRB Chair(), the HRPP Director is responsible for the day to day administration of the IRBs. This administration includes, but is not limited to: ensuring compliance with all applicable regulations and policies concerning human subjects research; directing and managing the activities of the IRBs in the aggregate and individually; organizing and facilitating the submission of research protocols by WCM researchers and the review of protocols by the members of the IRB; providing educational training and outreach programs to members of the WCM research community; developing and updating the WCM IRB policies and procedures; conducting administrative and expedited reviews of research protocols in an active and growing research environment; and representing WCM and the WCM IRBs at regional and national meetings of human subject protections administrators and policy-makers. The HRPP Director functions as the direct supervisor of the IRB staff. The HRPP Director serves as the primary contact for communications between the WCM IRBs and members of the WCM research community. These communications include notifications of IRB determinations, consultations concerning individual research protocols, and public presentations about the policies and procedures of the WCM IRBs. In consultation with the Director, Human Research Integrity and Education and the IRB Chair(), set agendas for IRB meetings. Researches, documents, and provides guidance to the IRBs on protocol-specific concerns relating to international, federal, state, and local regulations and laws concerning human subjects research, and, as necessary, solicits external expert guidance for the Board's consideration. Assigns and provides guidance to IRB members serving as protocol reviewers. Attends IRB meetings, supervises documentation of meeting minutes, and ensures adequate attendance to meet regulatory requirements for a quorum. Conducts periodic reviews of WCM IRB policies and procedures to ensure compliance with all applicable regulatory requirements. Develops and revises policies and procedures in consultation with the Director, human Research Integrity and Education and the IRB Chair() to ensure that the concerns and needs of the research community are adequately addressed in the Board's deliberations and guidance materials. Provide guidance to the WCM IRBs on changes in relevant University and federal policies concerning human subjects research protections. Coordinate the IRBs policies with the other administrative components of WCM (e.., OSRA, DSMB, IBC, CTSC, ESCRO, etc). Participate in meetings and communications concerning the WCM HRPP. Facilitates periodic internal and external audits of the IRBs activities and prepare responses to audits and program evaluations (e.g., Q/A audit, federal audit, accreditation, etc.). Coordinate institutional agreements pertaining to human subjects research protocols (e.g., NIH Certificates of Confidentiality, Institutional Investigator Agreements, etc.) in conjunction with the WCM Institutional Official for human subjects research protections (i.e., the Assistant/Associate Dean). Manage staff of WCM IRBs to ensure compliance with WCM Human Resource policies and the timely and efficient discharge of all IRB responsibilities. In consultation with the Director. Human Research Integrity and Education and the IRB Chair(), coordinate special projects involving IRB staff (e.g., internal or external audit) as needed. Provides guidance to the Director, Human Research Integrity and Education, the Assistant Dean of Human Research Compliance, and the IRB Chair() concerning appointments to the IRBs in order to ensure that committee membership adequately represents the scientific and practical research expertise necessary to ensure the adequate review of all projects submitted to the IRB and meets all regulatory requirements for committee membership. Maintain the federal record of the IRBs membership in accordance with the requirements of the federal Office of Human Research Protections (OHRP). In accordance with the policies and procedures of the WCM IRBs, advise investigators in the preparation of IRB protocols and the interpretation of applicable regulations, laws, and policies. Conduct reviews of IRB submissions, including new protocols, continuing reviews, amendment requests, and other submissions and reports. Document protocols compliance with all applicable regulations and policies and, when necessary, work with investigators to ensure that all information necessary for the committee members to complete their reviews is included in the protocol submissions. Assist in the development and implementation of the WCM online data management and submission and review system for the WCM IRBs. Coordinate maintenance and customization of system, as needed. Revise content of the system to ensure compliance with WCM IRB policies and procedures. Coordinate WCM IRB staff support for users of the system. Develop guidance and educational materials for the IRB website. Ensure timely updating of website and accuracy of materials electronically distributed to University researchers electronically (e.g., automated emails concerning committee actions, SBS IRB manual). Prepare annual and occasional reports on WCM IRBs activities, workload, and efficiency. Provides guidance to the IRB Supervisors to determine review status of IRB submissions, in accordance with regulatory requirements and definitions and the policies and procedures of the WCM IRBs. Provides guidance to the IRB Regulator Supervisor on determinations of exemption from the HHS regulations and determinations of non-Human subjects research. Reviews notifications of all board determinations and requests for modification or clarification to investigators. Ensure adequate maintenance of all pending, active, and closed protocol files in electronic and paper format in accordance with all applicable state, federal, and WCM policies concerning records retention. Coordinate access to the IRBs files in the context of internal and external audits. Ensure that IRB records (e.g., meeting minutes, protocol determinations, etc.) meet all applicable federal and WCM regulatory requirements. Conduct periodic outreach presentations and meetings with members of the WCM research community to ensure adequate representation of researchers concerns and emergent research paradigms in the WCM IRBs policies and membership. Develop relationships among members of the research community in order to enhance regulatory compliance and to facilitate the timely and reasonable review of WCM research involving human participants. Support WCM researchers in their development of research protocols that meet applicable ethical and regulatory requirements. Represent WCM, the Division of Research Integrity, and the WCM IRBs in regional and national working groups concerning human research protection policies and procedures. Regularly attend regional and national meetings of human research protections administrators and policy-makers to ensure that the policies and procedures of the WCM IRBs represent the current state of the profession. Conduct presentations and workshops on IRB procedures and policies for faculty, students, and research staff. Working with the IRB Compliance Manager and in collaboration with the Quality Assurance Unit of the Joint Clinical Trials Office, develops and revises, as necessary, educational materials for distribution and website presentation concerning IRB policies and procedures and regulatory ethics. In consultation with the Director, Human Research Integrity and Education and the IRB Chair(), provides initial training and orientation for new IRB members and staff on ethics, policy, procedures, regulations, and duties. as well as continuing education for IRB members and staff, and provides periodic presentations of current debates and concerns relating to research ethics and regulations concerns human research protection. Performs other related duties as assigned. Qualifications Minimum Requirements Masters degree. Knowledge of relevant federal, state, and local regulations relevant to the conduct of research involving human participants. Familiarity with computerized databases Five years with experience in human subjects research protections administration in a major academic medical center and/or research ethics administration with direct and obvious relevance to regulatory compliance. Highly Desired Requirements Experience in the conduct of research involving human subjects. Experience executing IRB functions in an electronic (i.e., paperless) office environment. Experience with publication/presentation record in academic discussions of research ethics or human research protections. Experience developing policies and procedures for human subjects protections. PhD or equivalent, in biomedical, social, or behavioral sciences discipline involving research with human participants. Experience teaching or training. Experience with supervisory responsibility. Working Conditions/Physical Demands No additional working conditions/physical demands provided. No relocation assistance is provided for this position. Visa sponsorship is not available for this position. Weill Cornell Medicine is committed to excellence in patient care, scientific discovery and the education of future physicians in New York City and around the world. The doctors and scientists of Weill Cornell Medicine—faculty from Weill Cornell Medical College, Weill Cornell Graduate School of Medical Sciences, and Weill Cornell Physician Organization—are engaged in world-class clinical care and cutting-edge research that connect patients to the latest treatment innovations and prevention strategies. Located in the heart of the Upper East Side's scientific corridor, Weill Cornell Medicine's powerful network of collaborators extends to its parent university Cornell University; to Qatar, where an international campus offers a U.S. medical degree; and to programs in Tanzania, Haiti, Brazil, Austria and Turkey. Weill Cornell Medicine faculty provide comprehensive patient care at NewYork-Presbyterian/Weill Cornell Medical Center, NewYork-Presbyterian/Lower Manhattan Hospital and NewYork-Presbyterian/Queens. Weill Cornell Medicine is also affiliated with Houston Methodist. summary: The successful candidates are expected to develop and apply novel network inference and mining algorithms to analyze large scale genetic, epigenetic, genomic,...
post_text: Postdoctoral Fellow and Senior Scientist in Computational Biology : New York, United States : Naturejobs nature.com Sitemap Login Register naturejobs.com What Description or keyword Where Country, city or postal code Post a job Reach thousands of science jobseekers Upload your CV Apply for science jobs quickly and easily Jobs News and Blog Career Expo For employers Popular Science Jobs: Biomedical Science Environmental Science Science Technician Food Science Forensic Science Home Search results Postdoctoral Fellow and Sen... Postdoctoral Fellow and Senior Scientist in Computational Biology : New York, United States Print Apply now Send to a friend Report a problem Tweet Facebook LinkedIn The Multiscale Network Modeling Laboratory ( MNML ) at Icahn Institute of Genomics and Multiscale Biology, led by Prof. Bin Zhang, is seeking excellent candidates for Postdoctoral Fellow and Senior Scientist positions in Computational Biology. Candidates must have a PhD in Bioinformatics, Neuroscience, Cancer Biology or a closely related field. The successful candidates are expected to develop and apply novel network inference and mining algorithms to analyze large scale genetic, epigenetic, genomic, and clinical data in cancer and neurodegenerative diseases such as Alzheimer's, and Parkinson's etc. The candidates will be responsible for identification of novel disease targets and pathways and development of biologically plausible disease models for experimental and clinical validations. The candidates will work in a multidisciplinary environment including an international team of leading scientists in systems biology, cancer and neuroscience. MNML is focused on construction and characterization of multiscale biological networks from large-scale genetic and genomic data for discovery of novel targets and mechanisms underlying complex human diseases. Several influential gene network inference algorithms developed by MNML have been extensively used for identification of novel pathways and gene targets, as well as development of drugs. The new additions to MNML are expected to significantly broaden and deepen our current state-of-the-art research in cancer, ageing and neurodegenerative diseases. For more information about MNML , please also visit http://research.mssm.edu/multiscalenetwork . Please send your cover letter and resume alongside contact information of at least three referees to Prof. Bin Zhang (email: bin.zhang@mssm.edu ). … Don't forget to mention Naturejobs when applying. It’s everywhere – transforming how we work and play. Are you leading the way as a digital disrupter? Accenture Digital is driving these exciting changes and bringing them to life across 40 industries in more than 120 countries. At the forefront of digital you’ll create it, own it, and make it a reality for clients looking to better serve their connected customers and operate always-on enterprises. Join us and become an integral part of our experienced digital team with the credibility, expertise, and insight clients depend on. Accenture Digital is powered by three practices –Mobility, Interactive, and Analytics. As part of our Analytics practice, you’ll deliver analytically-informed, issue-based solutions that help clients make faster, smarter decisions. You’ll play a critical role in helping them tackle complex business issues. JOB DESCRIPTION Your client’s eyes probably glaze over when you discuss in detail logistic regression, cluster analysis, neural nets and other segmentation models, but they certainly appreciate your uncanny ability to utilize those to lower their marketing costs and improve marketing effectiveness. Or perhaps they rely on you to provide analytics that stimulate sales, strengthen customer loyalty and generate purchases. If you’ve earned a reputation for your analytics expertise, Accenture may be the perfect place to take the next step in your career journey. YOUR ROLE: Data Scientist There will never be a typical day at Accenture Analytics, but that’s why people love it here. The opportunities to make a difference within exciting client initiatives are unlimited in the ever-changing digital landscape. Here are just a few of your day-to-day responsibilities. · Design, develop and deploy state-of-the-art, data-driven predictive/descriptive models to solve business problems using the latest and most appropriate technologies in statistical modeling and machine learning. · Create new insights from predictive statistical modeling activities that target and deliver value to our clients. · Manage, architect and analyze big data in order to build data driven business insights and high impact data models to generate significant business value. · Create models and processes to collect, distill and interpret data with a view to aid better, more informed decision making. · Examine and explore data from multiple disparate sources with the goal of discovering insights which in turn can provide competitive advantage for our clients. + Basic qualifications YOUR EXPERIENCE : Strong background in statistical concepts and calculations · 5 years of experience with real data · Innovative and strong analytical and algorithmic problem solvers · 3 years of experience with open source machine learning tools: Python/scikit-learn or Revo R. · 3 years of experience with scripting languages (e.g., Python, Ruby, Perl, Bash) for orchestration and data manipulation · Data engineering experience, including SQL and experience manipulating structured and unstructured data sources for analysis. · Bachelor’s Degree in a relevant field like statistics, computer science or applied math, physics or relevant subjects or 4+ years of experience in computer science, applied mathematics, or other quantitative/computational discipline SET YOURSELF APART: Preferred Skills · Experience with MapReduce/Hadoop and related technologies (e.g., Pig, Hive, Cascading). · Familiarity with Amazon Web Services and Elastic MapReduce a plus. · Familiarity with Hadoop based commercial packages (e.g. Cloudera, Hortonworks) · Experience in text mining/NLP OUR COMMITMENT TO YOU · Your entrepreneurial spirit and vision will be rewarded, and your success will fuel opportunities for career advancement. · You’ll make a difference for some pretty impressive clients. Accenture serves many of the Fortune Global 100 on high-profile projects. · Opportunities to learn daily through training, assignments and collaboration with experts across the company. · Access to leading-edge technology. · Along with a competitive salary, Accenture offers a comprehensive package that includes generous paid time off, 401K match and an employee healthcare plan. Learn more about our extensive rewards and benefits http://careers.accenture.com/us-en/your-future/rewards-benefits/Pages/index.aspx CALL TO ACTION Now is the time to become a digital disrupter. Job Title Senior Research Scientist - Analytical Education Doctorate Location Albany, NY - Albany, NY 12203 US (Primary) Career Level Experienced (Non-Manager) Category Analytical Date Needed By Job Type Full Time Travel Required 0 - 10% Job Description Opportunity For A Senior Research Scientist - Analytical (Drug Product) Albany Molecular Research Inc. provides global contract research and manufacturing services to the pharmaceutical and biotechnology industries. The Senior Research Scientist is an expert in one or more analytical techniques. The Scientist’s principal responsibility is the design, development, validation and implementation of analytical procedures. The Scientist is expected to provide significant contributions to the problems assigned, and to demonstrate an ability to solve problems. The Scientist is self-motivated and continually demonstrates initiative in handling responsibilities, and strives to do the job better. RESPONSIBILITIES Conduct laboratory operations in a safe manner. Maintain familiarity with the Chemical Hygiene Plan. Exhibit safety awareness and safe work practices. Follow responsible actions regarding chemical disposal. Maintain compliance with all regulations at the federal, state, and local levels, as well as appropriate SOP’s. Present quality written documentation, notebooks, methods, validation reports, data reports and summaries. Communicate effectively in verbal and written form on research results, issues, and plans. Act as a technical consultant: volunteer suggestions on analytical procedures. Perform literature searches to collect information from a spectrum of sources. Develop efficient, selective analytical procedures for assigned compounds. Process samples with developed method in an efficient manner. Possess laboratory skills which allow for the methods development and processing of samples of materials which are difficult to handle or analyze. Possess the accumulated knowledge to approach such materials efficiently and safely. Demonstrate proficiency in multiple techniques. Recommend and implement methods to increase the quality of products and/or services. Adapt to changing priorities such that productivity and efficiency is unaffected. Devise improved procedures for existing projects, as required. Originate novel ideas or approaches to other’s projects. Contribute suggestions on analytical procedures to coworkers. Manage workload and time to enable the incumbent to perform multiple projects effectively, and ensure all necessary paperwork is completed on a timely basis. Volunteer to assist with other tasks in the analytical function not directly related to specific projects. Discuss routinely with supervisor the status of the assigned programs and potential problems. SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES This position may have supervisory responsibilities assigned. # of Hires Needed 1 Job Requirements Education and/or Experience Ph.D. in Analytical Chemistry, or other applicable chemistry field, or equivalent industry experience. Experience in the development and validation of analytical methods for finished dosage forms. title: Researcher and Data Analyst, Developmental Disabilities
summary: For Assignment Level I (only physical, biological and environmental sciences and public health) A master's degree from an accredited college or university with...
post_text: Hrs_ce DEPT OF HEALTH/MENTAL HYGIENE Job Posting Notice Job ID: # of Positions: 238223 1 Business Title: Researcher and Data Analyst, Developmental Disabilities Civil Service Title: CITY RESEARCH SCIENTIST Job Category: Health Career Level: Experienced (non-manager) Title Code No: Level: 21744 01 Proposed Salary Range: $ 57,969.00 - $ 70,142.00 (Annual) Work Location: 42-09 28th Street Division/Work Unit: MRDD Unit Search Other NYC Jobs Job Description Hiring Rate:  $57,969.00  (Flat-Rate -Annual) On-Board After One Year: 63,765.00 - $70142.00 (Annual) The Bureau of Developmental Disabilities, within the Mental Hygiene Division of the New York City Department of Health and Mental Hygiene, oversees the Division’s portfolio of contracted services for children and adults with developmental disabilities including autism spectrum disorders, intellectual disabilities, cerebral palsy, and other neurological impairments. Contracted providers offer a range of vocational programs and recreation services meeting the needs of individuals, families and caregivers. The Bureau also evaluates needs and services data to inform local services planning and priorities, conducts program performance monitoring, and gives technical assistance to contracted service providers. The Bureau seeks a Research Scientist to conduct research, coordinate local surveillance and discovery efforts, and perform data analyses to support its local planning and program evaluation activities. The Research Scientist position will report and be under the supervision of the Bureau Director. You will: -	Research best practices, program models, and program performance standards in the developmental disabilities field, to inform Bureau program planning and performance evaluation activities. -	Working closely with Division leadership and staff,  and with external stakeholders, to coordinate efforts to evaluate consumer needs and demand for services. -	Identify and implement mechanisms to monitor and evaluate programs for their effectiveness and quality. -	Assist with the development and implementation of  surveys, questionnaires and other surveillance methods, identify potential data sources, and analyze new and existing datasets  to inform local programming, planning  and priorities. -	Author and present reports for senior managers and stakeholders based on findings from analyses. -	Participate in the development of  programmatic and scientific presentations. -	Work closely with Bureau leadership and staff to collaborate on and coordinate data analysis and research in support of Bureau activities. Minimum Qual Requirements 1.  For Assignment Level I (only physical, biological and environmental sciences and public health) A master's degree from an accredited college or university with a specialization in an appropriate field of physical, biological or environmental science or in public health. To be appointed to Assignment Level II and above, candidates must have: 1. A doctorate degree from an accredited college or university with specialization in an appropriate field of physical, biological, environmental or social science and one year of full-time experience in a responsible supervisory, administrative or research capacity in the appropriate field of specialization; or 2. A master's degree from an accredited college or university with specialization in an appropriate field of physical, biological, environmental or social science and three years of responsible full-time research experience in the appropriate field of specialization; or 3. Education and/or experience which is equivalent to "1" or "2" above. However, all candidates must have at least a master's degree in an appropriate field of specialization and at least two years of experience described in "2" above. Two years as a City Research Scientist Level I can be substituted for the experience required in "1" and "2" above. NOTE: Probationary Period Appointments to this position are subject to a minimum probationary period of one year. Preferred Skills -Experience in survey methods, conducting analyses of complex datasets and maintaining documentation of datasets -Knowledge of the developmental disabilities field or another mental hygiene services area -Excellent organizational, interpersonal, oral and writing skills -Proficiency in Microsoft Word, Excel, and PowerPoint -Proficiency with  SQL, GIS (ArcMap), SAS, SPSS, SUDAAN, and other statistical analysis software -Graduate level work in data analytic techniques, mathematics, statistics, measures of association, or related data analysis fields. To Apply Apply online with a cover letter to https://a127-jobs.nyc.gov/ In the Job ID search bar, enter: job ID number # 238223. We appreciate the interest and thank all applicants who apply, but only those candidates under consideration will be contacted. Residency Requirement New York City residency is generally required within 90 days of appointment. However, City Employees in certain titles who have worked for the City for 2 continuous years may also be eligible to reside in Nassau, Suffolk, Putnam, Westchester, Rockland, or Orange County. To determine if the residency requirement applies to you, please discuss with the agency representative at the time of interview.
