post_text:
Job: Program Director, IBD and Crohn's Disease - The Chronicle of Philanthropy Skip to main content Log In Subscribe Today Store JOBS Toggle navigation Search the Chronicle Home Magazine Resources Data Grants Webinars Jobs Favorites Search the Chronicle Job Details Program Director, IBD and Crohn's Disease The Leona M. and Harry B. Helmsley Charitable Trust Posted: April 11, 2016 Location: New York, United States Position: Program Field: Health, Philanthropic advisors, Research Salary: Commensurate with experience Website: http://www.helmsleytrust.org Application Deadline: Open until filled Category: Grant administration, Grant making, Program administration and management Employment Level: Full-time Apply Now Save Job ABOUT THE ORGANIZATION: The Leona M. and Harry B. Helmsley Charitable
Trust The Leona M. and Harry B. Helmsley Charitable Trust (“Helmsley”)
aspires to improve lives by supporting exceptional nonprofits and
other mission-aligned organizations in the U.S. and around the
world in health, selected place-based initiatives, and education
and human services.  Since 2008, when Helmsley began its
active grant making, it has committed more than $1.5 billion. 
For more information on Helmsley, please visit www.helmsleytrust.org . The IBD and Crohn’s Disease Program Helmsley’s IBD and Crohn’s disease program made its first grants
in 2009, and has now awarded over $183 million to scientists in
nine countries to find a cure, and until then better treatments,
for IBD and Crohn’s disease. Helmsley is the world’s largest
private foundation funder of IBD and Crohn’s disease research and
treatment initiatives.  The program has made significant
investments in research on the human genetics of IBD and
understanding the human microbiome as it relates to IBD, as well as
supporting numerous efforts to pursue transformational approaches
to understanding and treating IBD. Seven consortia have been
funded, significant intramural research programs are being
supported at major scientific organizations in the United States
and Israel, and the program is providing significant support for
new ways to use bioinformatics techniques to study and treat
IBD. ABOUT THE OPPORTUNITY: Helmsley seeks a full-time experienced professional with medical
research or healthcare expertise to direct an evolving program
addressing next generation questions in IBD and Crohn’s disease
care, research, treatment and prevention. The IBD and Crohn’s
Disease Program Director will work closely with Helmsley staff and
Trustees to craft and implement a robust program strategy through
designing, executing and evaluating grants and programs. He/she
will provide programmatic and management oversight for smaller
initiatives as well. Helmsley’s prominent position in the IBD and Crohn’s disease
research and treatment space creates the opportunity for the
Program Director to lead initiatives bringing together leading
researchers and organizations in the IBD, Crohn’s disease and
autoimmune disease areas to collaborate and knowledge share. This
increased level of transparency and access to data has the
potential to move the space more quickly towards a cure. The
Program Director role is a unique and exciting position which will
significantly impact these diseases, and in turn, improve the lives
of millions of individuals afflicted by IBD and Crohn’s
disease. Key Responsibilities: The Program Director will be responsible for designing,
initiating and supervising a grants program of about $22 million
annually. Primary responsibilities include providing intellectual
and organizational leadership in: Developing and maintaining a multi-year strategic plan,
including the assessment of critical gaps and needs as well as the
design and implementation of related initiatives; Leading, managing and evaluating existing program research
networks and partnerships to maximize impact; Representing Helmsley’s IBD and Crohn’s disease program with a
variety of external facing activities including strong thought
leadership and community support; Supervising ongoing programs and grants, including effective
monitoring and evaluation activities; Managing program budget and staff of 4; Being a senior role model for Helmsley’s staff and partners;
and Working collaboratively with colleagues across Helmsley to
develop and support trust-wide initiatives and to advance the
overall impact of Helmsley’s work. Program Development : Work collaboratively with staff, consultants, other funders and
external organizations to develop and manage requests for
funding. Identify and assess prospective projects, work collaboratively
with applicants to refine plans and project budgets in preparation
for potential funding. Lead program meetings. Provide expertise or identify consultants in the development
and execution of operational, business and management plans. Develop program message as part of the Trust’s overall
communications strategy, including all collateral materials and
press releases. Develop and manage program budget. Monitoring, Evaluation, and Dissemination : Develop measures of impact for program and activities. Conduct site visits and grant reviews and supervise the
preparation of written and oral summaries of grants for Trustees’
review and approval. Supervise grants portfolio. Work collaboratively with staff and consultants to assess,
evaluate and disseminate results of program and projects. Represent the Helmsley’s IBD and Crohn’s disease program. Department Management : Manage, develop, and hire staff as needed. Develop work plans, training, and annual performance
assessments. Lead all members of the program team in keeping abreast of
current developments, opportunities and needs within the IBD and
Crohn’s disease community. QUALIFICATIONS AND EXPERIENCE: The successful candidate will have a strong entrepreneurial,
innovative and collaborative approach to grant making along with
medical research or healthcare expertise. She/he will possess
strong communication skills and have experience convening multiple
stakeholders and consortia as well as facilitating collaborative
projects with other funders, including public charities, government
agencies and industry partners. The candidate must also have
experience supervising staff and partnering closely with
colleagues. Key Professional Experiences and Personal Attributes
include: Extensive experience—7 to 10 years—in medical or healthcare
sector. Experience with data and data-sharing initiatives
preferred. Extensive project management skills as a team-oriented leader
with a strategic mindset and vision. Demonstrated ability to transform vision and ideas into
concrete and sustainable programs. Highly developed interpersonal, relationship building, and
relationship management skills. Strong written and oral communication skills with the ability
to translate concepts appropriately to diverse stakeholders,
especially distilling and articulating complex, scientific
information. Experience handling multiple priorities effectively, organizing
time efficiently and ability to function well in a fast-paced
environment. Exceptional attention to detail. Demonstrated understanding of business planning and budgeting
methodologies and tools. Ability to work closely with colleagues and Trustees in a
collaborative environment, which requires the demonstrated ability
to work with flexibility, efficiency and diplomacy both
individually and as part of a team. Proven ability to make sound decisions and justify
recommendations. Passionate about and committed to the organization and program
mission of improving treatments and ultimately finding a cure. EDUCATION: Completion of an advanced degree
(master’s degree or higher) in a scientifically relevant field and
at least seven years of relevant experience required. A combination
of education and experience may be substituted for the education
requirement. TRAVEL: Travel required, approximately
10-20%. COMPENSATION: Salary and benefits are
competitive and commensurate with experience. The Helmsley Trust is an Equal Opportunity Employer and
encourages candidates of all backgrounds to apply for this
position. Please email cover letter and resume or nominations in
confidence to: Helmsley@sandlersearch.org . Subscribe Today Subscribe Today 1255 Twenty-Third St., N.W. summary: Perform data manipulation and analysis using SQL, SAS and Microsoft Excel and present results and recommendations to Credit Risk Management....
post_text:

Job Search My Jobpage Basic Search | Advanced Search | All Jobs Beginning of the main content section. Return to the home page Printable Format Job Description - Quantitative Risk Analyst II (3D700) Job Description Quantitative Risk Analyst II - 3D700 Description : BASIC FUNCTION: Perform advanced data and statistical analysis in support of the creation and maintenance of statistical models, including Regression and Multivariate models. Support Quantitative Risk and Credit Risk Management in data analysis and model construction. POSITION RESPONSIBILITIES: Assist in establishing, monitoring, evaluating and interpreting data with a risk management focus with an understanding of business strategy. Demonstrated working knowledge of Credit Risk databases to provide data and analytical support to Senior Management. Perform data manipulation and analysis using SQL, SAS and Microsoft Excel and present results and recommendations to Credit Risk Management. Track portfolio performance and risk strategy results. Incorporate observations and data in to existing models to improve predictive results. Identify deviations from forecast/expectations and explain variances. Identify risk and/or opportunities. Prepare exhibits and supporting materials and develop recommendations for credit policy. Contribute to loss forecasts, demographic and credit limit utilization analysis. Provide financial analysis and data support to other groups/departments including Finance, Marketing, Funding, Collections and Corporate Development as needed. Perform Portfolio Management campaign tracking and analysis. Provide guidance and direction to lower level analysts regarding all aspects of data analysis and the construction of predictive statistical models. Act as a lead in managing Credit Risk Modeling projects and initiatives under the guidance and direction from Management. Present data, results and/or recommendations to Senior Management as necessary. Identify opportunities to leverage statistical solutions to solve business problems. Adhere to applicable compliance/operational risk controls in accordance with Company or regulatory standards and policies. Promote an environment that supports diversity and reflects the M&T Bank brand. Maintain M&T internal control standards, including timely implementation of internal and external audit points together with any issues raised by external regulators as applicable. Complete other related duties as assigned. NATURE AND SCOPE: This role is highly technical in nature and requires demonstrated attention to detail, execution and follow up on multiple initiatives within the Credit Risk department. The ability to identify, analyze, rationalize and communicate complex business problems and recommend solutions is a key factor of success in this role. MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS REQUIRED: Minimum three (3) years previous relevant experience. Bachelor degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Quantitative Analysis or another technical discipline, or in lieu of degree, seven years’ experience required. Or in lieu of experience, a degree from North Carolina State University with a concentration in Analytics; no prior experience necessary. IDEAL QUALIFICATIONS PREFERRED: Master’s Degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Quantitative Analysis or another technical discipline. Banking or Financial Services experience; Previous Credit Analysis experience preferred. Experience with SAS, SAS Enterprise Miner and other Statistical Software Packages Advanced Knowledge of SQL and Microsoft Office Ability to utilize analytics in a collaborative manner across business functions and product lines to derive optimum solutions. Demonstrated ability to communicate complex concepts. Demonstrated ability to manipulate and analyze data across large databases. About M&T At M&T, we strive to be the best place our employees ever work, the best bank our customers ever do business with and the best investment our shareholders ever make. So when looking to advance your career, look to M&T. As a top 20 US bank holding company and one of the best performing regional banks in the country, we offer a wide range of performance based career development opportunities for talented professionals. And through our longstanding tradition of careful, conservative and consistent management and a strong commitment to the communities we serve, we continue to grow with a focus on the future. Job Title Senior Research Scientist - Analytical Education Doctorate Location Albany, NY - Albany, NY 12203 US (Primary) Career Level Experienced (Non-Manager) Category Analytical Date Needed By Job Type Full Time Travel Required 0 - 10% Job Description Opportunity For A Senior Research Scientist - Analytical (Drug Product) Albany Molecular Research Inc. provides global contract research and manufacturing services to the pharmaceutical and biotechnology industries. The Senior Research Scientist is an expert in one or more analytical techniques. The Scientist’s principal responsibility is the design, development, validation and implementation of analytical procedures. The Scientist is expected to provide significant contributions to the problems assigned, and to demonstrate an ability to solve problems. The Scientist is self-motivated and continually demonstrates initiative in handling responsibilities, and strives to do the job better. RESPONSIBILITIES Conduct laboratory operations in a safe manner. Maintain familiarity with the Chemical Hygiene Plan. Exhibit safety awareness and safe work practices. Follow responsible actions regarding chemical disposal. Maintain compliance with all regulations at the federal, state, and local levels, as well as appropriate SOP’s. Present quality written documentation, notebooks, methods, validation reports, data reports and summaries. Communicate effectively in verbal and written form on research results, issues, and plans. Act as a technical consultant: volunteer suggestions on analytical procedures. Perform literature searches to collect information from a spectrum of sources. Develop efficient, selective analytical procedures for assigned compounds. Process samples with developed method in an efficient manner. Possess laboratory skills which allow for the methods development and processing of samples of materials which are difficult to handle or analyze. Possess the accumulated knowledge to approach such materials efficiently and safely. Demonstrate proficiency in multiple techniques. Recommend and implement methods to increase the quality of products and/or services. Adapt to changing priorities such that productivity and efficiency is unaffected. Devise improved procedures for existing projects, as required. Originate novel ideas or approaches to other’s projects. Contribute suggestions on analytical procedures to coworkers. Manage workload and time to enable the incumbent to perform multiple projects effectively, and ensure all necessary paperwork is completed on a timely basis. Volunteer to assist with other tasks in the analytical function not directly related to specific projects. Discuss routinely with supervisor the status of the assigned programs and potential problems. SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES This position may have supervisory responsibilities assigned. # of Hires Needed 1 Job Requirements Education and/or Experience Ph.D. in Analytical Chemistry, or other applicable chemistry field, or equivalent industry experience. Experience in the development and validation of analytical methods for finished dosage forms. Location: New York, NY Posted Date: 4/15/2016 Position Type: Full time Job Code: 76959.21548 Salary: Required Education: Doctorate/PhD Areas of Expertise Desired: Job Description About Pfizer A career at Pfizer offers opportunity, ownership and impact. All over the world, Pfizer colleagues work together to positively impact health for everyone, everywhere.Our colleagues have the opportunity to grow and develop a career that offers both individual and company success;be part of an ownership culture that values diversity and where all colleagues are energized and engaged;and the ability to impact the health and lives of millions of people. Pfizer, a global leader in the biopharmaceutical industry,is continuously seeking top talent who are inspired by our purpose to innovate to bring therapies to patients that significantly improve their lives. Role Description CTI seeks an individual with a strong background in biologics drug development. The successful candidate will lead cross-functional project teams from the discovery/screening stage through clinical candidate. The successful candidate will be responsible to ensure project progression by designing and executing experiments to characterize the biological function of targets and the effect of drug candidates on the modulation of target function. Projects are formed as collaborations between Academic Investigators and Pfizer scientists led by CTI and including other functional area scientists. Projects can be focused in any of several therapeutic areas. Skilled leadership and excellent interpersonal and communication skills are essential. Responsibilities *Review Academic proposals from the CTI network. Co-author drug development plans and statements of work for selected projects *Lead a drug development project team. Form cross-functional, matrixed teams consisting of Academic collaborators, biologics technology scientists, cell biologists, pharmacologists, toxicologists, pharmacokineticists, and others as needed. Set project strategy and drive to data driven decisions in a timely manner *Work closely with project manager to plan and oversee the execution of project activities *Collaborate and coordinate with several Pfizer departments and therapeutic areas to ensure efficient advancement of the project and meet aggressive project deliverables, goals and timelines *Able to work independently, creatively and collaboratively to design and implement key experiments to address aspects of the basic and translational biology of targets, link to human disease and validate the mechanism of action of biotherapeutic drug candidates *Analyze, interpret, and present scientific and logistical data, strategic path forward and project updates at internal and external meetings. Prepare publications. Requirements Qualifications *PhD and Postdoctoral training in Biochemistry, Life Sciences, or a related field and 5+ years industry experience is REQUIRED. *Strong project leadership skills. *Strong collaborative and team-work skills. *Experience leading preclinical drug development teams (at least 1 year of leadership experience required). *Evidence of successful delivery of clinical candidates. *Capable of leading multiple projects in parallel in a matrixed environment. *Skilled biologist/biochemist with in depth knowledge of cellular and signaling pathways related to drug discovery. *Knowledge in one or more of the following therapeutic areas: oncology, immuno-oncology, metabolic disease, inflammatory or autoimmune disease. *Outstanding interpersonal and communication skills. *High level of self-motivation, entrepreneurial spirit and ability to thrive in a matrixed, goal- and team-oriented setting. EEO & Employment Eligibility Pfizer is committed to equal opportunity in the terms and conditions of employment for all employees and job applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, age, gender identity or gender expression, national origin, disability or veteran status. Pfizer also complies with all applicable national, state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment as well as work authorization and employment eligibility verification requirements of the Immigration and Nationality Act and IRCA. Pfizer is an E-Verify employer. Back to Search Results in Share 0 Navigation About BioSpace Jobs For Employers Post a Job Now! title: STELR Engineer Job
summary: SRC is currently seeking highly motivated electrical engineers, computer engineers, software engineers and computer scientists to join our Science, Technology...
post_text:
Syracuse STELR Engineer Job - NY, 13201 Search by Keyword Share this Job Email similar jobs to me

Please enable JavaScript to subscribe.

Email STELR Engineer Job Apply now » SRC and SRCTec Date: Apr 5, 2016 Location: Syracuse, NY, US Position Description SRC is currently seeking highly motivated electrical engineers, computer engineers, software engineers and computer scientists to join our Science, Technology and Engineering Leadership Rotation (STELR) Program. This leadership development program offers three years of six-month job rotation experiences in a variety of functional disciplines including systems engineering, digital design engineering, RF engineering, mechanical engineering, product engineering and software engineering; working on advanced radar systems, electronic warfare systems, communications systems and chemical and biological sensors. There is an opportunity to travel across several company locations. STELR members are provided with a variety of personal development opportunities including senior leader mentorship, technical and leadership training, special project assignments and team leadership experience. While participating in the program, STELR members are encouraged to pursue an advanced degree through our generous tuition support program. To learn more visit www.srcinc.com/careers/STELR Responsibilities include, but are not limited to - Signal processing, analysis and algorithm development - Hardware design and design review participation - Software development and code review participation - System integration and test - Field testing support Position Requirements - Must be a December 2015 or May 2016 graduate possessing a GPA of 3.5 or above - Must possess strong communication and presentation skills, leadership experience and a record of demonstrated innovation and ambition. - Prior internship or co-op experience preferred - Knowledge of one or more of the following programming languages: C, C++, C#, VHDL, Matlab - Knowledge of digital and analog communications, radar, and signal processing experience is a plus - Ability to follow International Standard Organization (ISO) and Capability Maturity Model Integration (CMMI) processes for software and system development Security Requirements Must be a U.S. citizen. Applicants selected will be subject to a government security investigation and must meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information. Who We Are Founded in 1957, SRC, Inc. (formerly Syracuse Research Corporation) is a mid-size, not-for-profit, research and development company. We specialize in the areas of defense, environment and intelligence. Our core capabilities include: chem-bio defense; communications systems; cybersecurity; electronic warfare; environmental health analysis; intelligence, surveillance and reconnaissance; life cycle management, manufacturing; operational integration; and radars and sensors. We are a trusted advisor to many customers and have a reputation for redefining possible® through world-class, award-winning products and services that support our mission to help keep America safe and strong. The SRC enterprise includes several companies focused on bringing game-changing technologies to the commercial and international markets in the areas of big data analytics, unmanned aircraft system detection, and chem-bio threat identification. These companies all leverage the long history of innovation that SRC is known for to provide customers with the best solutions for their most challenging problems. To learn more, visit visit www.srcinc.com/about/companies. Why Join Us? SRC, Inc. is a not-for-profit organization, without stockholders. We reinvest our earnings back into our company, thus improving the quality of our work, our people, and our programs. SRC is committed to providing a positive, supportive and healthy work environment. From your first day, your opinions will be valued, you will be challenged with exciting work, and you will have the flexibility to develop the best solutions for our customers. As a result, we have been named to numerous state (New York, Ohio, Texas and Virginia) and national “Best Company to Work For” lists. In addition, you’ll receive a competitive salary and comprehensive benefits package. Highlights include: a minimum of three weeks of vacation (accrual begins on day one); 10 sick days per year; 10 percent automatic contribution to your retirement; an exceptional, low-cost health care plan with Excellus BlueCross BlueShield; and 100 percent tuition support for up to 18 credit hours per year. To learn more about us, visit www.srcinc.com. As an EEO/AA employer, the Company does not discriminate in its employment practices due to an applicant or employee’s race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, veteran or disability status, or any other basis protected by federal law. Dedicated research analysts produce long-term valuations for the companies in their sector, and portfolio managers use these insights to construct portfolios for our clients. The US Equity Fundamental Research group is currently looking for a Research Analyst to cover Industrial companies. The main responsibilities in this position include: • Research companies and industries. Cover the given universe of companies. • Make relative valuation comparisons and investment recommendations to portfolio managers. • Participate in managing regional and global analyst funds. • Work and communicate with a global network of JPMIM analysts. Qualifications • Strong understanding of financial markets and securities valuations • Buy-side experience preferred • Ability to deliver clear/concise investment recommendations under significant uncertainty • Ability to distinguish between essential and nonessential information • Strong spreadsheet modeling skills • Excellent oral and written skills. Ability to work effectively with colleagues based in New York, London and Tokyo • At least seven years of relevant experience analyzing companies in the Industrials industry • Educational background: CFA JPMorgan Chase is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer Disability/Veteran. Sign Up Overview Your Saved Jobs Your Job Alerts Your Profile Your Documents Your Applications Help Search Browse Explore Your Job Alerts Your Saved Jobs 0 Return to Search Results Assistant Director, Mouse Neurobehavior Core Institute for Genomic Medicine, Columbia University Medical Center savedJobs The Institute for Genomic Medicine (IGM) at Columbia University Medical Center (CUMC) is looking for an Assistant Director of the new Mouse Neurobehavior Core (MNBC). The MNBC will be the only neurobehavioral testing facility within animal vivaria under the auspices of the University’s Institute of Comparative Medicine (ICM), and therefore will be of central importance and have significant impact to CUMC neurological, neurosensory and behavioral laboratories that use mice in their research Working with the facility Director, the Assistant Director will supervise all operations for the MNBC. Primary responsibilities will be to outfit the Core with behavior test equipment, and to establish and validate a variety of testing protocols. The Assistant Director will also train users on equipment and advise Columbia scientists on study design and data analysis and will work with investigators in developing new testing methods. The position requires experience in behavioral research using mice, personal skills to interface with PIs and train staff, and organizational skills to ensure the smooth operation of the facility. Key Responsibilities Setting up and validating behavioral tests in house in the MNBC in conjunction with adopting existing tests from MNBC users into that facility (30%). Interfacing with PIs to develop or import new tests, or apply existing tests in new ways (15%). Training users (PIs, postdocs, students, technicians) in the use of equipment (20%). Advising on study design and data analysis (15%) Maintaining/trouble shooting equipment and tests, coordinating users within the facility, ordering supplies, tracking quantitative and qualitative metrics and service fees (20%). Key Metrics for Success Establishment and validation of testing equipment and protocols in timely manner User satisfaction, gauged through user meetings and regular meetings with facility Director Capacity and use (near capacity booking means success) Grants and papers that result from access to the facility Ability to interface effectively with faculty and users Minimum qualifications Ph.D. in relevant discipline with direct experience in behavioral testing in mice Knowledge of study design and data analysis associated with behavioral testing Hands on experience in setting up and validating testing apparatuses. Ability to write animal protocols and to interface with Institute for Comparative Medicine and the Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee. Administrative and supervisory experience preferred. Please send a cover letter and CV to Dr. Wayne Frankel, wf2218@cumc.columbia.edu NOTES: Additional Salary Information: Commensurate w/experience Internal Number: MNBC Send Me Similar Jobs By Email About Institute for Genomic Medicine, Columbia University Medical Center The Institute for Genomic Medicine was established in January of 2015 under the direction of Dr. David B. Goldstein as a part of Columbia University's Precision Medicine Initiative. The overarching goal of the institute is to create a cohesive, Columbia-wide research and teaching environment for human genetics and genomics. Recent technological advances in genome sequencing and adoption of electro ... nic medical records have paved the way for the creation of patient-centered personalized medicine that will be one of the cornerstones of the medical field.

Columbia, the IGM, and IGM partners will help drive innovation in genomic medicine through vibrant research, clinical applications and outreach efforts. In support of these efforts, the institute is in the process of establishing a genetics environment that offers the benefits of scale and expertise to facilitate the integration of genomic analysis across the Columbia community. post_text: Amneal |   QC Scientist II 2015-07-26 ­ <style type="text/css"> .wpb_animate_when_almost_visible { opacity: 1; }</style> Careers Contact News Customer Login Search for: About Our Story Leadership Locations North America Asia Australia Europe Philosophy Philanthropy Products Catalogs United States Australia Germany Spain Scandinavia United Kingdom Pipeline Amneal Biosciences Operation API/Raw Materials Product Development Manufacturing Packaging Distribution Account Management Partnering International Amneal Nordic Amneal Australia Amneal Germany Creo Pharma – UK Amneal Spain Consumer Information About Generic Drugs Drug Safety FAQs Glossary About Our Story Leadership Locations North America Asia Australia Europe Philosophy Philanthropy Products Catalogs United States Australia Germany Spain Scandinavia United Kingdom Pipeline Amneal Biosciences Operation API/Raw Materials Product Development Manufacturing Packaging Distribution Account Management Partnering International Amneal Nordic Amneal Australia Amneal Germany Creo Pharma – UK Amneal Spain Consumer Information About Generic Drugs Drug Safety FAQs Glossary Careers at Amneal Careers at Amneal Job Openings Mission & Values Home » Careers » QC Scientist II 2015-07-26 « Return to List Job Detail QC Scientist II 2015-07-26 Requisition# 2015-07-26 Position: Fulltime Shift: 2nd Shift Location: Brookhaven, NY Department: Quality Control Lab Exemption: Yes Description: Perform testing of raw materials, in-process and finished pharmaceutical dosage forms, products on stability, cleaning verification samples following written procedures and applicable SOPs, calculate and report results on applicable specification documents, participate in method transfer activities within departments or between facilities or organizations. Provide feedback on systems and analytical procedures to promote continuous improvement and enhancement of compliance posture. Responsibilities: Responsibilities include but are not limited to: Perform physical analysis involving complex techniques such as X-ray diffraction, DSC, Malvern mastersizer. Perform chemical analysis of raw materials, in-process and finished pharmaceutical products, including products on stability, according to written methods or compendial methods as applicable, material specifications, using analytical techniques such as IR spectroscopy, UV-Vis spectroscopy, and chromatographic techniques adhering to company policies as identified in standard operating procedures (SOPs). Prepare samples for analysis involving thorough cleanliness and complex steps for analysis using chromatographic techniques and analyze. Create and maintain laboratory record documentation (notebooks and computer-based), document exact steps followed during analysis execution, calculate and report results in a timely manner. Actively participate in and lead investigation of out-of-specification laboratory results, when required. Actively participate in method transfer activities between facilities within the organization or between organizations. Prepare and execute method transfer protocols, method verification/validation protocols as and when required. Assist, as and when needed, laboratory supervisor for handling non-routine special projects requiring activities in the laboratory. Ensure that expired chemicals and reference standards are removed from laboratory area, perfrom calibration of HPLC, GC as assigned by the supervisor. Interact with newly hired laboratory technicians or Assistant Scientists for providing hands-on training on simple analytical techniques and laboratory instruments. Requirements: Must possess in-depth knowledge of analytical chemistry techniques, such as spectrophotometric, dissolution and drug release, chromatographic techniques (standalone or hyphenated) and measuring physical parameters (viscosity, particle size or droplet size by laser diffraction, melting point by DSC). Must be able to follow compendial (USP/EP/BP/JP) procedures for analysis. Must understand and apply cGMP requirements applicable to quality control laboratory. Must have ability to apply advanced technical skills to troubleshoot and resolve complex analytical and instrument-related problems effectively and in a timely manner and report actions to the laboratory management in a timely manner. Must be able to identify trends in analytical data. Must be precise and consistent in day to day analysis. Must be able to execute compendial procedures involving complexity. Must be able to effectively communicate results, problems or issues, verbally as well as in writing. Must be able to assume a role of a leader in team environment as and when required. Must be computer literate and savvy with MS office applications, software programs related to LIMS. Must be able to work in a team environment and be flexible to easily adapt to changes in assignments. Must be willing to work extended hours, including weekends, as and when required. Must follow safe practices as identified in appropriate MSDS during working with chemicals, and must follow applicable state and federal regulations. Must be capable of maintaining clear and concise laboratory records and communicating clearly both within and between departments. Must be thoroughly familiar with cGMP applicable to laboratories in pharmaceutical settings and with method verification/validation concepts. Must be able to review laboratory records to ascertain compliance with applicable specifications, methods, and SOPs. Additional Information: Qualified candidates should submit a resume, including salary history and requirements, to www.amneal.com/careers We offer a comprehensive compensation package which includes medical, dental and vision insurance as well as an employer-matched 401(k) plan. Amneal Pharmaceuticals is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or protected veteran status. Back to Search Results Page> Admin Manager Add to Job Cart | View Job Cart | Apply Now Existing Resume Apply here Job ID: 1031093_RR00009670 Area of Talent: Managers/Directors/Administrators Position Type: Full-Time/Regular Location: NYU Hospitals Center Shift: 07:00 AM to 03:00 PM NYU Langone Medical Center, a world-class, patient-centered, integrated, academic medical center, is one of the nation's premier centers for excellence in clinical care, biomedical research and medical education. Located in the heart of Manhattan, NYU Langone is composed of four hospitals - Tisch Hospital, its flagship acute care facility; Rusk Rehabilitation; the Hospital for Joint Diseases, one of only five hospitals in the nation dedicated to orthopaedics and rheumatology; and Hassenfeld Children's Hospital, a comprehensive pediatric hospital supporting a full array of children's health services across the medical center - plus the NYU School of Medicine, which since 1841 has trained thousands of physicians and scientists who have helped to shape the course of medical history. The medical center's tri-fold mission to serve, teach and discover is achieved 365 days a year through the seamless integration of a culture devoted to excellence in patient care, education and research. For more information, go to www.NYULMC.org. Position Summary: We have an exciting opportunity to join our team as a Admin Manager. In this role, the successful candidate under general supervision of the Senior Administrative Director, works collaboratively as a member of the management team to facilitate the integration, management and data needs for a busy outpatient facility. Provides direction and directly manages administrative supervisor, administrative coordinator, front end intake staff, and concierge staff. . Position requires independent coordination of major work functions within the center. Job Responsibilities: Performs other related duties as needed. Functions as a respectful member of the health care team. Handles stressful situations with little or no supervision. Maintains confidentiality on matters to which they are privileged. Works collaboratively with a variety of personnel including (e.g., Directors, Section Chiefs, institution practice managers/nursing directors, management team, technologists and nurses, technical and office support staff). Submits requests for minor constructions/repairs within the intake department, requests for new telephones, relocation of telephones and makes arrangements for installation of cabling for new telephones relative to the intake department. Assists with the evaluation of products, supplies, space and non-imaging equipment acquisition, use and delivery of service. Supervises intake and concierge staff and address daily operational issues resulting with patient check in, patient check out, and patient throughput. Plans, directs and organizes ongoing in-service education to the staff. Distributes instructions/educational material for annual inservice of staff and maintains records of tests (includes Environmental Service, Fire Safety and OSHA [Infection Control] tests). Selects and evaluates intake and concierge staff; ensures staff receives training and provides ongoing guidance. Assigns, coordinates and evaluates the work of concierge and intake staff in the department; maintains related records concerning personnel and operations in the department. Provides management support Snr. Administrative Director. Interacts with managers within and outside the department to plan, problem solve and facilitate departmental operations and serves as a resource person. Demonstrates knowledge of the organization's mission and core values and incorporates them into the performance of duties at the Center; serves as a role model and facilitator for these standards. Ensures incoming calls are answered timely with excellent customer service Minimum Qualifications: Bachelor's degree Three years relevant experience or an equivalent combination of education and experience Must include prior experience supervising staff, activities and projects Excellent organizational, communication and interpersonal skills Knowledge of medical terminology Preferred Qualifications: Masters degree and/or 5 years related experience Extensive knowledge of EMR and working with 1199 employees Qualified candidates must be able to effectively communicate with all levels of the organization. NYU Langone Medical Center provides its staff with far more than just a place to work. Rather, we are an institution you can be proud of, an institution where you'll feel good about devoting your time and your talents. And just as our employees invest so much in us, we invest in our employees. We're pleased to have one of the most competitive compensation packages not only among New York's hospitals and healthcare institutions, but within the corporate sector as well. We begin with exceptional medical, dental, and drug coverage. We enhance this basic coverage with comprehensive wellness programs, and supplement those with retirement investment and benefits plans, and generous paid time off allowances. Add to that a very attractive tuition program, and you'll see just some of the ways that NYU Langone Medical Center demonstrates our commitment to our employees. NYU Langone Medical Center is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer committed to diversity and inclusion in all aspects of recruiting and employment. All qualified individuals are encouraged to apply and will receive consideration without regard to race, color, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, age, religion, creed, disability, military and veteran status, genetic information or any other factor which cannot lawfully be used as a basis for an employment decision. We require applications to be completed online. If you wish to view NYU Langone Medical Center's EEO policies, please click here . Please click here to view the Federal "EEO is the law" poster or visit http://www1.eeoc.gov/employers/poster.cfm for more information. title: Research Support Assistant, Level II (Analytical Psychopharmacology)
company: Research Foundation for Mental Hygiene, Inc.
summary: Additional experience in statistical analysis of epigenetic and biochemical data will be useful but not necessary....
post_text:
Research Support Assistant, Level II (Analytical Psychopharmacology) - Job Listing - Research Foundation for Mental Hygiene, Inc. Jobs Search Jobs | Submit an Application | Applicant Information | Home Research Support Assistant, Level II (Analytical Psychopharmacology) April 04, 2016 - April 18, 2016 Location: Orangeburg, NY Salary Range: Salary is Based on the Experience Exempt/Non-Exempt: Non-Exempt Benefits: Full Benefits Package Employment Type: Full Time Division/Department: Nathan Kline Institute Description: The Department of Analytical Psychopharmacology at Nathan Kline Institute for Psychiatric Research seeks outstanding applicants for a post-doctoral scientist position. This job requires a strong background in the area of molecular biology and biochemistry. Experience in handling genetically modified animals. Experience in conducting gene expression, DNA, and RNA processing is highly desirable. This job requires epigenetic analysis of gene targets from treated animals. Additional experience in statistical analysis of epigenetic and biochemical data will be useful but not necessary. Experience in hippocampal slices electrophysiology and learning and memory behavior is a plus. As an integral member of our team, the candidate will design strategies to solve challenges, execute experiments, identify next steps, and communicate findings to the team. Excellent communication and teamwork will be critical. An understanding of neurological, psychiatric and learning and memory disease biology will be an added advantage. Applicants are having peer-reviewed publications relevant to molecular biology, neurophysiology or biochemistry, are particularly encouraged to apply. Duties: The person should be able to conduct experiments with minimum supervision on molecular biology of several neuronal target genes and animal genotyping and  behavior. The person should be able to conduct and analyze epigenetic and immunoblot experiments with minimum supervision. Person should be able to conduct animal experiments with many pharmacological agents. Qualifications: Ph.D in biochemistry, biotechnology, neuroscience or related area. 


*The Research Foundation is a private not-for-profit corporation and is not an agency or instrumentality of the State of New York.  Employees of the Research Foundation are not state employees, do not participate in any state retirement system, and do not receive state fringe benefits. Excellent Benefits Package. Affirmative Action/Equal Opportunity Employer/Minority/Women/Disabled/Veteran Employer. VEVRAA 41 CFR 60-300.5(a) compliant.

Applications will only be accepted through website at: http://corporate.rfmh.org - Click on Employment Opportunities. Applications will be accepted only during the posting dates as listed at the top of the job announcement.

title: Python/Django Developer
summary: You will be a critical member of this team of highly skilled developers and scientists. Experience with data migration, transformation, and scripting....
post_text: Python/Django Developer | Smith & Keller Webfonts are for trial purposes only x Apr 13 New York, NY Python/Django Developer django, JavaScript, PostgreSQL, python the run down The world has moved beyond text. Every day there is more audio and video recorded than was recorded in the entire 20th century. Unfortunately, these media files are only occasionally sorted, rarely organized, and at best have a short text description. And generally the text is… lacking. Our mission is to improve human communication. Using our self-service API, any application can easily submit audio and video files for analysis. We perform sophisticated signal processing, automated speech recognition, and natural language processing to turn this unstructured information into actionable data. The first step is search. Using our API, we can tell you exactly where each word is said in the audio. We’re looking for a world-class Python/Django Developer. Someone who loves data and who loves software. The Python/Django Developer will play a key role in the design and implementation of our cloud-based platform. As part of a small team, you will have an opportunity to work on many different components and touch a lot of different technologies. You will be a critical member of this team of highly skilled developers and scientists. what you'll do Participating in project planning including effort estimates for development planning purposes Developing solutions design and deployment plans Performing code inspections Implementing software components based on the technical specifications Providing technical team leadership to a small group of software developers Tracking and reporting on team progress and status Working closely with business and technical teams to ensure the successful completion of all technical deliverables what you should know 5+ years Python/Django programming experience (expert level) 3+ years’ experience with PostgreSQL database Good understanding of front-end technologies and platforms, such as JavaScript, HTML5, and CSS3 Experience managing hosting environments, including database administration and scaling an application to support load changes Experience with data migration, transformation, and scripting Good understanding of server-side CSS preprocessors, such as LESS and SASS Proficient understanding of OWASP security principles Full Software Development Life Cycle Strong English communication Highly adaptable and a quick learner, delivery and results focused what would be nice to know Previous work experience in agile software development environment Experience with Test Driven Development Python/Django Developer Upload Resumé Back to Job Description Follow Us Contact Us team@smithandkeller.com Job Seekers Employers Browse Companies Browse Candidates Search Jobs Contact

title: Senior Patient Coordinator
summary: The doctors and scientists of Weill Cornell Medicine—faculty from Weill Cornell Medical College, Weill Cornell Graduate School of Medical Sciences, and Weill...
post_text: Job Description - Senior Patient Coordinator (31602) Go to the main content section. Welcome. You are not signed in. My Briefcase | Sign In Job Search My Jobpage Basic Search | Advanced Search | Jobs Matching My Profile | Beginning of the main content section. Return to the home page Printable Format Job Description - Senior Patient Coordinator (31602) Job Description Senior Patient Coordinator - 31602 Description Position Summary Under direct supervision, performs daily front-desk operations of busy Weill Cornell Imaging Practice with multiple modalities. Position Activities Performs daily reception front-desk functions at Weill Cornell Imaging including: greets patients and visitors in a friendly and professional manner, handles inquiries, and provides directions as needed. Using GE Imagecast RIS scheduling system and IDX Flowcast, checks-in patients who present for scheduled appointments - marks patient as “arrived.”  Provides patients with forms and paperwork, explanation of reason for paperwork, and what needs to be completed, including HIPAA forms, etc.  Schedules patients using RIS. Provides patient with IDX printout of demographic and patient registration in system and asks patient to verify and correct data. Updates system data as needed. Responds to general questions from patients regarding Outpatient Imaging Center, services offered, and health insurance coverage. Registers new patients and updates registration of patients already at WCMC.  Ensures all appropriate forms and paper [i.e., order for exam, AOB, ABN (if applicable), etc.] are received.  Makes copies of insurance documents, orders for exams, and other paper documents.  Receives documents from patients and scans documents into RIS system under patient’s file. Maintains constant awareness of patient flow and monitors patients in waiting area to ensure that patients are moving along in process of exam.  For example, if patient is waiting too long, take the initiative to determine reason for delay by contacting technologists or nurses; then relay reason for delay to patient with expected time to examination. Answers phones effectively, efficiently, and professionally in accordance with Weill Cornell-We Care standards.  Handles all incoming calls appropriately. Directs/transfers phone calls to appropriate person; assists nurse when necessary. Obtains detailed information and forwards messages to the appropriate nurse, technologist, or radiologist. Confirms appointments for future dates. Assists with scheduling phones as needed. Checks out patients after completion of examination and before leaving Outpatient Imaging Center. Explains to patient process by which written exam will be issued to referring physician, to whom report(s) will be sent. Patient may request copies of images (i.e. CD).  Collects co-pays and other payments at time-of-service payments (cash, checks, credit card payments).  Completes and signs receipt for cash or checks received and secures cash and cash in accordance with WMC and Departmental Cash Control policies.  Works with supervisor to ensure that daily checks and cash are deposited on a daily basis. Provides patient with contact information for Weill Cornell Imaging at NYP should patient have other questions or concerns after leaving OIC. Schedules follow-up appointments as needed. Serves as Radiology Call Center operator during peak hours. Explains billing procedures to patients; refers patients to PO Business Office representative on the site or refer to POBO customer service. Maintains routine office equipment (i.e., computers, printers, photocopiers scanners, etc.) in good working order and notifies supervisor of malfunctions if needed.  Loads paper into photocopier as needed. Maintains own desk, reception, and check-out space in a neat and orderly fashion.  Maintains awareness of general appearance of waiting areas and other public areas – notifies WCMC Facilities/Housekeeping of necessary clean-up. Performs other job related duties as requested. Performs other related duties as assigned. Qualifications Minimum Requirements High School diploma required. Minimum of 2 years working experience as a Receptionist, Secretary, or Customer Service Representative. Highly Desired Requirements Some college or Bachelor’s preferred. Experience working in a radiological office or department. Working knowledge of IDX, Epic, or Eagle. Previous experience working with various Managed Care Companies. Skill and Abilities Must possess excellent communication skills and be detail oriented. Ability to work in a fast paced multi-task environment. Must be a team-player. Excellent data entry skills. Must possess outstanding customer services skills; compassionate, courteous, and helpful phone manner. Must be able to a tactful demeanor while handling a continuous stream of high volume patient inquires. Working Conditions/Physical Demands Work Conditions Must be able to work flexible hours and possible weekends. No relocation assistance is provided for this position. Visa sponsorship is not available for this position. Weill Cornell Medicine is committed to excellence in patient care, scientific discovery and the education of future physicians in New York City and around the world. The doctors and scientists of Weill Cornell Medicine—faculty from Weill Cornell Medical College, Weill Cornell Graduate School of Medical Sciences, and Weill Cornell Physician Organization—are engaged in world-class clinical care and cutting-edge research that connect patients to the latest treatment innovations and prevention strategies. Located in the heart of the Upper East Side's scientific corridor, Weill Cornell Medicine's powerful network of collaborators extends to its parent university Cornell University; to Qatar, where an international campus offers a U.S. medical degree; and to programs in Tanzania, Haiti, Brazil, Austria and Turkey. Weill Cornell Medicine faculty provide comprehensive patient care at NewYork-Presbyterian/Weill Cornell Medical Center, NewYork-Presbyterian/Lower Manhattan Hospital and NewYork-Presbyterian/Queens. Weill Cornell Medicine is also affiliated with Houston Methodist. EOE/M/F/Vet/Disabled Job - WCMC-Administration Primary Location - New York City Organization - Radiology Schedule - Full-time Overtime Status - Non-exempt Grade - 4 Number of Openings - 1

title: Data Analyst, Primary Care Information Project
summary: The New York City (NYC) Department of Health and Mental Hygiene’s (DOHMH) Primary Care Information Project (PCIP) is devoted to improving population health in...
post_text: Hrs_ce DEPT OF HEALTH/MENTAL HYGIENE Job Posting Notice Job ID: # of Positions: 225117 1 Business Title: Data Analyst, Primary Care Information Project Civil Service Title: CITY RESEARCH SCIENTIST Job Category: Health Career Level: Experienced (non-manager) Title Code No: Level: 21744 01 Proposed Salary Range: $ 57,969.00 - $ 70,142.00 (Annual) Work Location: 42-09 28th Street Division/Work Unit: Primary Care Info Project Search Other NYC Jobs Job Description Hiring Rate Part-time: 31.73 On-board After One Year: 34.90 - 38.39  per/hour The New York City (NYC) Department of Health and Mental Hygiene’s (DOHMH) Primary Care Information Project (PCIP) is devoted to improving population health in New York City through health information technology.  PCIP is the largest project of its kind nationwide, focusing on the efficient use of prevention oriented electronic health records (EHRs) in NYC.  We strive to transform the quality of health care services in these neighborhoods by helping providers use electronic health records and other health technology to improve the quality of care. The Data Analyst is being recruited to produce and analyze public health data from EHRs in the context of population health, to explain and track trends, and to relay the results of this data to other DOHMH programs for use in resource allocation, program evaluation, policy, and planning. The Analyst will work with a dynamic, cross-disciplinary team that extracts data from the Hub, a cutting-edge, real-time query system which gathers data from EHRs at more than 720 doctor’s offices, community health centers, and hospital clinics. The Hub covers 2 million patients per year in NYC and allows the DOHMH to answer relevant public health questions in a timely manner. As an integral part of the Hub Epidemiology team: •	Collect, clean, analyze and report on Hub data, producing graphical representations, models, and statistical output using analytic software packages. •	Produce data-driven reports, presentations and papers for dissemination internally and externally, including research publications related to relevant issues affecting the New York City health care system such as chronic disease, infectious disease, behavioral health, and the impact of Health Information Technology on healthcare in New York City. •	Manage Hub query planning, scheduling, and data management analytics. •	Partner with other DOHMH bureaus to develop joint Hub projects to analyze and improve the quality of care delivered to low-income New Yorkers. •	Rapidly respond to requests for data from the Bureau, Division and Agency leadership. •	Pursue personal research interests aligning with PCIP and Hub team goals. Minimum Qual Requirements 1.  For Assignment Level I (only physical, biological and environmental sciences and public health) A master's degree from an accredited college or university with a specialization in an appropriate field of physical, biological or environmental science or in public health. To be appointed to Assignment Level II and above, candidates must have: 1. A doctorate degree from an accredited college or university with specialization in an appropriate field of physical, biological, environmental or social science and one year of full-time experience in a responsible supervisory, administrative or research capacity in the appropriate field of specialization; or 2. A master's degree from an accredited college or university with specialization in an appropriate field of physical, biological, environmental or social science and three years of responsible full-time research experience in the appropriate field of specialization; or 3. Education and/or experience which is equivalent to "1" or "2" above. However, all candidates must have at least a master's degree in an appropriate field of specialization and at least two years of experience described in "2" above. Two years as a City Research Scientist Level I can be substituted for the experience required in "1" and "2" above. NOTE: Probationary Period Appointments to this position are subject to a minimum probationary period of one year. Preferred Skills •	Excellent written and oral communication skills. •	Ability to work collaboratively in a cross-disciplinary team environment. •	Demonstrated organizational skills and detail orientation. •	Analytic and statistical skills with experience in manipulating and analyzing data using statistical software; SAS preferred. •	Knowledge of epidemiological data analysis, research, and program evaluation methodologies. •	Familiarity with geographical information software such as ArcMap preferred. •	Experience with scientific writing preferred. •	Competency in Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, and PowerPoint). •	Willingness to adapt to new data structures and tackle novel problems creatively. •	Working knowledge of or interest in a range of public health topics. To Apply Apply online with a cover letter to https://a127-jobs.nyc.gov/ In the Job ID search bar, enter: job ID number # 225117. We appreciate the interest and thank all applicants who apply, but only those candidates under consideration will be contacted. Work Location 42-09 28th Street, Long Island City, NY Residency Requirement New York City residency is generally required within 90 days of appointment. However, City Employees in certain titles who have worked for the City for 2 continuous years may also be eligible to reside in Nassau, Suffolk, Putnam, Westchester, Rockland, or Orange County. To determine if the residency requirement applies to you, please discuss with the agency representative at the time of interview. title: Manufacturing Engineer
summary: Our dedicated scientists conduct their research with the highest integrity, finely tuned processes and superb skill....
post_text: Applicant Home Job Description Job Title: Manufacturing Engineer Job ID: 180366 Location: USA,NY-Painted Post Return to Previous Page Corning is the world leader in specialty glass and ceramics, creating and manufacturing keystone components that enable high-technology systems. Corning’s history is filled with breakthrough technologies that have played an important role in the way the world works. We thrive on solving difficult, commercially relevant problems through an innovative and collaborative research and development process. Corning succeeds through sustained investment in R&D, more than 160 years of materials science and process engineering knowledge, and a distinctive collaborative culture. A world leader in industrial research and development, Corning staunchly believes in change. We thrive on seeking new opportunities to make a difference for mankind and bringing them to life. Our dedicated scientists conduct their research with the highest integrity, finely tuned processes and superb skill. Breakthroughs occur when our researchers leverage existing technologies across product lines or come as the result of a profound moment of inspiration or even as an unexpected, experimental outcome. That is when research is at its most exciting. We do everything possible to sustain our culture of innovation. We continually invest in research and development to provide our scientists with the resources they need. This has enabled our scientific community to develop a unique ability to solve complex problems and maintain a keen focus on things that really matter -- technologies that improve our lives and change our world. R&D is the foundation on which Corning’s history has been built, and we have no doubt it will lead us to future technological triumphs. To know more about Corning's Science and Technology division, please visit the R&D website at: http://www.corning.com/r_d/index.aspx Scope of Position: Supporting early stage manufacturing (both process and equipment) to meet sample making commitments Improving existing manufacturing processes, equipment and capabilities Supporting or leading continuous improvement activities, new product or process introductions and cost reduction projects Working with other team members to solve difficult technical, engineering related problems Day to Day Responsibilities: Provide problem solving support (both process and equipment) to production operations Train operations personnel on equipment and processes Use rigorous processes and technical knowledge to build detailed technical understanding for key process steps Assure safety of operators and equipment and comply with safety and environmental regulations Function as a team member or team leader on focused projects Trouble shoot material, process and equipment issues, identify root causes and implement corrective actions Implement and document material, process and/or equipment changes Use simple statistical tools and Designed Experiments (DOE) in process problem solving and process improvement Assure quality and repeatability of processes and products Support new product introductions through equipment upgrades, process validation, documentation and training Develop SME knowledge of material, process and/or equipment in focused areas of manufacturing or engineering Travel Requirements: Minimal Hours of work/work schedule/flex-time: M-F, business hours;  Flexible hours may be required to support off-hours experimentation/operations on weekends and evenings Job Title: Manufacturing Engineer Reference Number: 180366 Required Education: BS or MS in Engineering (Materials, Mechanical, Chemical) Required Years and Area of Experience: 1-3 years of manufacturing experience (can include internships and co-ops) Required Skills: Character ethic, integrity and leadership Creative/innovative problem solving Strong technical fundamentals with process engineering skills Able to collaborate across organizational boundaries and integrate solutions Results oriented and high commitment Able to handle multiple complex tasks and set priorities with multiple internal customers Demonstrated leadership or teamwork in accomplishing common goals Strong data analysis and interpretation skills Practical experience with basic statistics Basic knowledge of Six Sigma (DMAIC) methodology Desired Skills: Six Sigma Green Belt trained Product and process development (Innovation Stages 2 & 3) Early stage manufacturing experience Soft Skills: Strong written and verbal communication skills Personal initiative and commitment Organized with good planning and time management skills Ability to build relationships within cross functional groups;  team building skills Positive attitude, flexible and good work ethic EOE/AA including Veterans and Disabled. summary: Support BCD epidemiologists and subject matter experts by, e.g., ensuring that Maven data are clearly documented, advising BCD analytic staff on efficient...
post_text: Hrs_ce DEPT OF HEALTH/MENTAL HYGIENE Job Posting Notice Job ID: # of Positions: 237614 1 Business Title: Reportable Disease Analyst, Bureau of Communicable Diseases Civil Service Title: CITY RESEARCH SCIENTIST Job Category: Health Career Level: Experienced (non-manager) Title Code No: Level: 21744 02 Proposed Salary Range: $ 68,239.00 - $ 85,644.00 (Annual) Work Location: 42-09 28th Street Division/Work Unit: Communicable Diseases Search Other NYC Jobs Job Description The Reportable Disease Data, Informatics, and Analysis Unit is responsible for the database systems, processing, data quality, and analysis of surveillance data for >73 infectious diseases. The unit also provides data management and epidemiologic and analytic support for outbreak investigations, including large-scale public health emergencies. The Reportable Disease Analyst will assist in maintaining the critical daily operations and quality assurance of notifiable communicable disease surveillance data and supporting the methodological and analytic needs of research staff in the Bureau of Communicable Disease (BCD).  Activities will include: -	Support daily operations, maintenance, and quality assurance for surveillance data residing in and extracted from Maven, BCD’s reportable disease surveillance database. -	Support BCD epidemiologists and subject matter experts by, e.g., ensuring that Maven data are clearly documented, advising BCD analytic staff on efficient methods for accessing data, automating data processes, and ensuring the quality and completeness of data available for analysis. -	Serve on weekly rotations, every 4-6 weeks: As analyst of the week, run automated statistical analyses to detect reportable disease clusters, review output and address issues, and de-duplicate persons requiring human review. As electronic clinical laboratory reporting analyst, clean electronic laboratory data requiring human review and collaborate with informatics specialists to identify and resolve laboratory reporting issues. -	Write, adapt, debug, maintain, and produce documentation for SAS programs for automated processing, quality control, analysis, visualization, and archiving of data and results. -	Perform data analyses in parallel with other analysts and compare and reconcile results to ensure accuracy. -	Provide epidemiologic and statistical consultation for study proposals and manuscripts. -	Prepare data and meta-data in response to internal and external data requests. -	Provide data collection, analysis, and mapping support for outbreak investigations, emergency response activities, and special epidemiologic projects, as needed. -	Contribute to summary reports and research papers describing surveillance methodologies and analysis results. Minimum Qual Requirements 1.  For Assignment Level I (only physical, biological and environmental sciences and public health) A master's degree from an accredited college or university with a specialization in an appropriate field of physical, biological or environmental science or in public health. To be appointed to Assignment Level II and above, candidates must have: 1. A doctorate degree from an accredited college or university with specialization in an appropriate field of physical, biological, environmental or social science and one year of full-time experience in a responsible supervisory, administrative or research capacity in the appropriate field of specialization; or 2. A master's degree from an accredited college or university with specialization in an appropriate field of physical, biological, environmental or social science and three years of responsible full-time research experience in the appropriate field of specialization; or 3. Education and/or experience which is equivalent to "1" or "2" above. However, all candidates must have at least a master's degree in an appropriate field of specialization and at least two years of experience described in "2" above. Two years as a City Research Scientist Level I can be substituted for the experience required in "1" and "2" above. NOTE: Probationary Period Appointments to this position are subject to a minimum probationary period of one year. Preferred Skills Expertise in manipulating and analyzing large datasets; experience with SAS, SAS macros, and SQL preferred. Advanced knowledge of infectious disease epidemiology and biostatistics. Experience in helping colleagues to access and analyze data. Experience with data visualizations, including mapping using ArcMap and interactive data displays. Experience in outbreak investigation and public health emergency response. Excellent writing and speaking ability, strong interpersonal communication and time management skills, and attention to detail. To Apply Apply online with a cover letter to https://a127-jobs.nyc.gov/.  In the Job ID search bar, enter: job ID number # 237614. We appreciate the interest and thank all applicants who apply, but only those candidates under consideration will be contacted. Work Location 42-09 28th Street, Queens, NY, 11101 Residency Requirement New York City residency is generally required within 90 days of appointment. However, City Employees in certain titles who have worked for the City for 2 continuous years may also be eligible to reside in Nassau, Suffolk, Putnam, Westchester, Rockland, or Orange County. To determine if the residency requirement applies to you, please discuss with the agency representative at the time of interview. post_text:
Research Associate Search for More Jobs Forward this job to a friend Apply by email without Registering Apply by creating/using account Sign in Language Previous Research Associate Next - Basic Job Information Ref No.: 16-03571 Location: Pearl River - Job Description E CLARO is a company that delivers talent. We provide fully customizable, comprehensive talent acquisition and management of seasoned professionals through a number of business models, including: Consulting, Professional Hire, Global Integrated Delivery™ and Managed Services. Research Associate Eclaro is looking for a Research Associate for an eighteen months contract opportunity for our client in Pearl River, New York. Job Description: We are looking for a highly performing, self-motivated, detail oriented Scientist to support antibody drug conjugate (Client) and targeted immunotherapy drug discovery at Pharmaceutical Oncology (ORU) in Pearl River, NY. The successful candidate will work in a matrixed team environment as part of the Oncology Rinat Research & Development (ORRD) Histology & Biomarker (OHB) group. The candidate will work as part of a team that uses histology and immunohistochemistry (IHC) methods to study protein/target expression, biomarker development, pharmacodynamics, efficacy and safety effects of molecules/compounds in development. The successful candidate will be responsible for overseeing the smooth functioning of the daily technical processes of the lab. The candidate will have the following responsibilities: Receive (physically and electronically) & QC the incoming pipeline of samples Trimming, process and embed all blocks that come into the lab Section and H&E stain samples for several lab initiatives, as independent projects to work on with hiring manager Perform routine IHC of established panels of markers for several initiatives. Subsequently, work with the hiring manager and lab scientists to interpret the data and report to the relevant teams Section blocks, coverslip slides and perform other supportive tasks for the program scientists in the lab Order, receive and organize lab supplies Maintain lab equipment (call vendors for service etc) Act as a liaison for the In Vivo Pharmacology group Enter experimental data into the lab databases Work with student workers to organize and inventory blocks The candidate must have worked in the research setting for minimum 3-5 years and prior histology experience is required. Additionally, the successful candidate will have cell biology training and a deep understanding of the scientific method. The candidate will be flexible and be able to adapt to change as the lab is in a dynamic research environment, responding to the needs of the ORRD research unit. We are looking for someone enthusiastic, energetic, able to follow instructions, detail oriented, agile to change, and will be an excellent and honest communicator. The successful candidate will be expected to maintain an electronic laboratory notebook, use email, and meet weekly with the group manager - therefore basic computer skills are required such as Microsoft Outlook and Office (Excel, Powerpoint). If interested, you may contact: Joy Retanan Joy.Retanan@eclaro.com (646) 695-2949 http://www.linkedin.com/pub/joy-retanan/85/4ba/333 E CLARO recruits and manages a staff of highly skilled individuals in an array of specialized disciplines. This approach enables our clients to leverage new opportunities, respond to increased and changing demands and increase their profitability. Please visit www.eclaroIT.com to see why the Right People are The Answer™. Specialties: Customized solutions for Human Capital and Talent Acquisition, Permanent placement and retained search, Recruiting, Staff Augmentation, Contract Labor, Managed Services, RPO, MSP, VMS, IT solutions, management and support, offshore business process outsourcing. Equal Opportunity Employer : E claro values diversity and does not discriminate based on Race, Color, Religion, Sex, Sexual Orientation, Gender Identity, National Origin, Age, Genetic Information, Disability, Protected Veteran Status, or any other legally protected group status. post_text: Senior Data Engineer - CMP.jobs CMP Contact MyCMP Blog About Home page title goes here my CMP OpenID: email: password: Live jobs back to all live jobs Be the first to know about 'Senior Data Engineer' and similar jobs. rss share Senior Data Engineer < Previous Job Next Job > As a Senior Data Engineer, you'll support data infrastructure services, like Hadoop, Kafka, Vertica, etc., from building and configuration to maintenance and curation. You'll be a technology evangelist, helping people throughout the organization use data to make informed decisions and draw accurate conclusions. You will work closely with analysts, data scientists, and developers to make data processing transparent and provide data services that help drive and support business goals. The most exciting part about working here is the enormous potential for personal and professional growth. We are always seeking new and better tools to help us meet challenges such as adopting proven open-source technologies to make our data infrastructure more nimble, scalable and robust. Some of the cutting edge technologies we are currently implementing are Kafka and Spark. What you'll be doing: o	Design and build efficient, reliable and scalable enterprise level distributed transactional data processing systems o	Optimize jobs to utilize Kafka, Hadoop, Vertica, Spark Streaming resources in the most efficient way o	Monitor and provide transparency into data quality across systems (accuracy, consistency, completeness, etc.) o	Increase accessibility and effectiveness of data (work with analysts, data scientists, and developers to build / deploy tools and datasets that fit their use cases) o	Collaborate within a small team with diverse technology backgrounds o	Provide mentorship and guidance to junior developers What you'll need: o	BA / BS degree in Computer science or related field o	5+ years of software engineering experience developing software, including 3+ years for distributed production systems i.e., Hadoop o	Fluency in Java, experience in Python is a huge plus o	Strong understanding of RDBMS, SQL o	Passion for engineering and computer science around data o	Willingness to participate in 24x7 on-call rotation for production support Compensation $140,000/y Employer Unlock Location Terms fulltime Duration Full Time Industry Interactive Hotness hot Share & Get $500 Referral!
