Albert Einstein College of Medicine, Inc. Job Summary Company Albert Einstein College of Medicine, Inc.? Location Bronx, NY 10461 Industries Education Job Type Full Time Employee Years of Experience 2+? to 5 Years Education Level Associate Degree Payroll Compliance Specialist About the Job Founded  in 1955, the Albert Einstein College of Medicine (Einstein) is one of  the nation's premier institutions for medical education, basic research  and clinical investigation. A full-time faculty of some 2,000 conducts  research, teaches, and delivers health care in every major biomedical  specialty. The college has some 730 medical students, 193 Ph.D.  students, 106 MD/Ph.D. students and 275 postdoctoral fellows. Einstein's  major strength, in addition to training physicians and scientists, is  its science. During fiscal year 2015, the faculty's consistently high  level of scientific achievement resulted in the awarding of more than  $150 million in peer-reviewed grants from the National Institutes of  Health (NIH). Einstein  is part of Montefiore Medicine Academic Health System, an integrated  academic delivery system comprising seven campuses, including 8  hospitals, a multi-county ambulatory network, a new state-of-the art  “hospital without beds”, a skilled nursing facility, school of nursing,  home health agency, and the state's first freestanding emergency  department. As the University Hospital for the Albert  Einstein College of Medicine, Montefiore is a premier academic health  system, employing Einstein's clinical faculty and training Einstein's  medical students, over 1,300 residents, 420 allied health students, and  1,600 nursing students annually. The  Albert Einstein College of Medicine is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative  Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration  for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual  orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran or  disabled status, or genetic information. Einstein seeks candidates  whose skills, and personal and professional experience, have prepared  them to contribute to our commitment to diversity and excellence, and  the communities we serve. Job Requirements The  Payroll Compliance Specialist will assist the Director of Payroll  Services with the university compliance as it pertains to nonresident  alien tax operations and all payroll compliance operating requirements.  This position will assist with the development and documentation of NRA  related policies in compliance with applicable state and federal  regulations. Responsibilities Oversee Non Resident Alien process Assist with the preparation  and filing of the annual withholding tax return for U.S. source income  of foreign persons (Form 1042S). Support the Director in  converting the manual NRA process to an automatic process which will  require integration between Windstar and the Banner HR Module. This  includes partnering with various university departments to put in a new  workflow process with documentation and standard operating procedures. Understand federal and state statutes and apply them to non-resident employees ensuring university compliance. Accumulate and analyze data relating to foreign students and visiting scholars' tax status. Assist with the development and delivery of tax training for NRA employees on a quarterly basis. Interface with foreign students concerning tax issues associated with their VISA status Maintain data integrity of [tax related] information within the Banner and Windstar Systems Review all forms and documents  required to be completed by foreign students and visiting scholars  receiving scholarship or fellowship grants. Enter/Review correct earnings codes for nonresident aliens in the Banner and Windstar Navigator Systems. Analyze tax treaties and employee status. Overpayment procedures and processes Assist with the development of  a process including documented standard operating procedures to  identify employee overpayments and request recovery. Track status and identify root causes of overpayments. Develop employee communication on overpayment policy, procedures and notifications. Management and maintenance of Payroll Unclaimed Property Understand NYS statutes and how it applies to university unclaimed wages. Partner with University Treasury Department to develop procedures to track and post unclaimed wages to the general ledger. Establish a system that  identifies by calendar year all outstanding paychecks and steps taken to  validate repayment to intended party. Provide Technical Support to the Payroll Services Department Support departmental data uploads/downloads Write/Apply Script when needed for departmental reporting Manage the Payroll Services Self Service Website Other duties as assigned Experience & Education BA/BS degree in accounting or related field; 2-3 years' experience in Payroll or related customer service field Prior knowledge of foreign national tax compliance; research and problem analysis Skills and Competencies The successful candidate should possess the ability to work collaboratively across departments and manage numerous projects. Must be able to work in a  fast-paced environment while managing numerous deadlines and communicate  well both verbally and in writing. Strong analytical skills, attention to detail, strong verbal and written communication skills are essential. Proficiency in Microsoft Office particularly Word and Excel. Ability to quickly learn and utilize new systems. Demonstrated commitment and track record in implementing continuous improvement techniques and processes. Demonstrated outstanding skills in human resources management and service delivery Apply Here: http://www.Click2Apply.net/8zvsy3qqhw PI93437543 Apply Job Tools Follow Company Your information may be shared with the company. Date: Apr 13, 2016 Location: West Henrietta, NY, US Company: VWR Web Merchandising and CRM Manager Physical Location: 5100 Henrietta Road Location: VWR Education Location City: West Henrietta Department/Function: Leadership / Sr Management State/Territory/Province: US-NY Last updated: 4/13/16 1:58 PM Description VWR (NASDAQ: VWR), headquartered in Radnor, Pennsylvania, is a leading, global, independent provider of products, services and solutions to laboratory and production facilities. With sales in excess of $4.3 billion in 2014, VWR enables science for customers in the pharmaceutical, biotechnology, industrial, education, government and healthcare industries. With more than 160 years of experience, VWR has cultivated a value proposition delivering product choice, operational excellence and differentiated services to improve our customers’ productivity from research to production. Read more about our Value Proposition below this exciting career opportunity. Description: The Manager- Merchandising is responsible for all activities regarding product information, product pricing, cross referencing and supplier information including project coordination and management. Job Responsibilities: - Leads cross functional SciEd team to develop and execute SciEd marketing calendar including print, emails and content, promotions, and social media. - STEP Business Owner. Manages Merchandising team for execution of following master data tasks: - Executes new product process in PIM - Implements product discontinuations for Print Marketing Materials and Web - Manages product correction process in PIM - Manages Product Master Data - Merchandise All Primary Catalogs and Websites for VWR SciEd Brands - Implements the brand strategy dictated by each Brand Manager - Develops online landing pages to meet the marketing needs of brand and publisher - Develops categories and site merchandising to support e-marketing campaigns on and off line - Defines Web-Analytics: site performance-general stats (i.e. visitor info, sales, etc), click stream reporting , customer funnel analysis, category and merchandise performance (top/bottom categories, products, brands, etc.), identifies most compelling ad imagery & copy, category ad click-thru analysis, onsite search, home page & landing page features, site ads, promotions, space allocation, traffic analysis - Project Manages Annual Catalog Process for All Brands - Pulls lists and target audiences for various print, digital and email campaigns - Resolves problems. Serves as central contact for the Designers and copywriter to resolve any questions and issues that surface in the process of page development, in a timely fashion. Does the legwork of seeking solutions from appropriate source (category mgr, brand mgr, warehouse) - Proofs page drafts from Design. Disseminates drafts to Category Managers. Ensures that their edits are implemented and structure of piece is reflective in CMS publication. - Responsible for VWR SciEd Ratings and Reviews - Manages lease data from MDR and integrates and updates data in SFDC - Harmonizes Activities Between Catalog, Brand, Ecommerce, Regulatory & Category Management - Manages a team of 4-6 direct reports. - Performs other duties as assigned. Experience & Skills: - Knowledge of distribution, VWR systems, and VWR business processes; skills in project management - a plus - Demonstrated excellent oral, written and communication skills - Must be results-driven, self-sufficient, highly motivated and able to lead cross-functional teams - Must be able to work effectively with all organizational layers and willing to challenge decisions - Must be able to motivate associates in an operational environment and make difficult decisions - Familiarity with HTML and other web development tool would be considered a plus. Qualifications: - 4-year college degree, preferable in science discipline - 3-5+ years leadership responsibility - 8+ years of applicable business experience - Experience in a manufacturing or distribution environment is preferred - Experience in managing a team of personnel in an operational environment - Experience in direct marketing: catalogs, email a plus - Experience in project management a plus - Experience in the areas of product and supplier master data preferred Environmental Working Conditions & Physical Effort: Typically works in an office environment with adequate lighting and ventilation and a normal range of temperature and noise level. Work assignments are diversified. Examples of past precedent are used to resolve work problems. New alternatives may be developed to resolve problems. A frequent volume of work and deadlines impose strain on routine basis. Minimal physical effort is required. Work is mostly sedentary but does require walking, standing, bending, reaching, lifting or carrying objects that typically weigh less than 10 lbs. Our Value Proposition: VWR’s differentiated services provide innovative, flexible and customized solutions from scientific research services to custom-manufactured chemical blends. Our dedicated team of more than 8,500 associates is focused on supporting scientists, medical professionals and production engineers to achieve their goals. In addition to being a part of a global organization, VWR offers its associates competitive salaries and a wide range of benefits designed to help them stay healthy, plan for the future, prepare for the unexpected and balance the demands of work and home. VWR offers an outstanding benefits package that includes a 401(k) plan with a generous company matching contribution; medical, dental and life insurance; short- and long-term disability; EAP (employee assistance program); flexible spending account (FSA); holiday/vacation time; work/life balance programs; and education assistance. At VWR, our associates are the framework of who we are and how we succeed. We value their accomplishments and offer long-lasting opportunities for growth and success. As a result, a substantial percentage of our associates have 10-, 20- and 30-year histories with VWR. Their loyalty reflects our ongoing commitment to offering great compensation, an engaging culture, and real opportunities for growth and success. VWR is a great place to work and we look forward to adding more outstanding members to our team. Resume Submissions To VWR From Third Party Recruitment Firms Will Not Be Considered VWR is an Equal Opportunity / Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status. VWR maintains a drug free workplace . VWR is a US Federal contractor. Sign Up Overview Your Saved Jobs Your Job Alerts Your Profile Your Documents Your Applications Help Search Browse Explore Your Job Alerts Your Saved Jobs 0 Return to Search Results Postdoctoral Research Scientist, Department of Otolaryngology Head & Neck Surgery Columbia University Medical Center savedJobs The Department of Otolaryngology Head & Neck Surgery is actively seeking a Postdoctoral Research Scientist who will assist the Principal Investigator at the Columbia University Medical Center. The incumbent will conduct research and ensure that all experiments are appropriately conducted following the policies and procedures of Columbia University. Duties assigned to this title will require an in depth knowledge of inner ear research, and may involve organizing and implementing complex research plans, the development of methods of research, testing and data collection, analysis and evaluation, and writing reports containing descriptive, analytical and evaluative content. The duties will require the exercise of independent discretion and judgment in carrying out research activities within the predetermined research scope and methodology. Columbia University is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. The ideal candidate should have experience in inner ear research with strong productivity during their PhD training on topics related to auditory neuroscience, hearing loss, and neural plasticity. Individuals are expected to have experience working with mouse models, quantitative PCR, Western blots, histological and immunostaining examinations, ABR and DPOEA testing, and knowledge of neuronal molecular anatomy. Our group has goals of understanding the mechanism of noise induced hearing loss within the central auditory centers, specifically looking at the role of astrocytes and microglia, and differences in response properties to steroid treatment. Internal Number: PDRS1Kim Send Me Similar Jobs By Email About Columbia University Medical Center Columbia Otolaryngology has one of the first and most renowned programs for ear, nose and throat disorders. Our department is part of NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital, voted among the top seven hospitals in the nation by U.S. World News Report. title: Director of Research and Evaluation, Bureau of Primary Care Access and Planning
summary: During this period of unprecedented health care reform, primary care remains a key anchor to advance population health and is undergoing rapid change....
post_text: Hrs_ce DEPT OF HEALTH/MENTAL HYGIENE Job Posting Notice Job ID: # of Positions: 225823 1 Business Title: Director of Research and Evaluation, Bureau of Primary Care Access and Planning Civil Service Title: CITY RESEARCH SCIENTIST Job Category: Health, Policy & Analysis Career Level: Experienced (non-manager) Title Code No: Level: 21744 4B Proposed Salary Range: $ 87,461.00 - $115,000.00 (Annual) Work Location: 42-09 28th Street Division/Work Unit: Primary Care Access & Planning Search Other NYC Jobs Job Description The Bureau of Primary Care Access & Planning (PCAP), in the Division of Prevention and Primary Care, at the NYC Department of Health & Mental Hygiene (DOHMH) is seeking a City Research Scientist to serve as Director of Research and Evaluation for the Bureau. During this period of unprecedented health care reform, primary care remains a key anchor to advance population health and is undergoing rapid change.  PCAP has a dedicated staff working to improve access to quality, culturally appropriate primary care for New Yorkers, particularly those who are at risk for poor health outcomes. The Bureau sets and implements policy, program and research initiatives aimed at maximizing the impact of primary care on population health, including increasing health insurance coverage and reducing access barriers experienced by NYC’s underserved populations. The Director will lead research and data analysis activities related to improving population health through ensuring access to quality primary care for all residents of NYC. The successful candidate will work with other staff to achieve the Bureau and Division’s objectives for surveillance and research activities to better meet the health needs of New Yorkers. Specific Duties & Responsibilities •	Plan, develop, implement and oversee research, surveillance and program evaluation activities to support the Bureau’s work.  Areas of focus will include but are not limited to:  1) Primary care access and utilization 2) Health insurance coverage, 3) Emergency department utilization and ambulatory care sensitive hospitalizations; and 4) Primary care capacity planning and analysis in emergency response. •	Produce data-driven reports, presentations and papers for dissemination, as well as author technical and journal publications, related to relevant issues affecting the New York City health care system, including DSRIP, the Affordable Care Act and vulnerable populations including low-income and immigrant. •	Lead and oversee research related grant applications that further the organization’s mission, goals and programs. •	Provide leadership, general direction and guide research activities to a small team of analysts and provide technical and analytical expertise on epidemiologic and statistical methods to other staff in the Bureau. •	Identify and track key surveillance indicators as well as augment existing surveillance approaches with new or novel methodologies. •	Design and oversee analyses of existing data (including Community Health Survey, SPARCS hospitalization and emergency department and Medicaid claims/Salient) to support planning and policy development, evaluate program and policy impact and outcomes and improve quality of services. •	Identify and rapidly respond to requests for data and systems analysis from the Bureau, Division and Agency leadership. . •	Supervise, manage, clean, analyze and report on quantitative data, particularly large datasets, using analytic software packages. •	Participate and collaborate in cross-divisional and cross-agency planning and working groups and conduct special projects and other duties as assigned. •	Maintain multiple projects simultaneously and function effectively both independently and as part of a team. •	Work on special projects as needed. Minimum Qual Requirements 1.  For Assignment Level I (only physical, biological and environmental sciences and public health) A master's degree from an accredited college or university with a specialization in an appropriate field of physical, biological or environmental science or in public health. To be appointed to Assignment Level II and above, candidates must have: 1. A doctorate degree from an accredited college or university with specialization in an appropriate field of physical, biological, environmental or social science and one year of full-time experience in a responsible supervisory, administrative or research capacity in the appropriate field of specialization; or 2. A master's degree from an accredited college or university with specialization in an appropriate field of physical, biological, environmental or social science and three years of responsible full-time research experience in the appropriate field of specialization; or 3. Education and/or experience which is equivalent to "1" or "2" above. However, all candidates must have at least a master's degree in an appropriate field of specialization and at least two years of experience described in "2" above. Two years as a City Research Scientist Level I can be substituted for the experience required in "1" and "2" above. NOTE: Probationary Period Appointments to this position are subject to a minimum probationary period of one year. Preferred Skills •	Expertise in epidemiological data analysis, research design & program evaluation methodologies •	Strong analytic and statistical skills with experience in manipulating and analyzing data using statistical software such as SAS or SPSS •	Experience with scientific writing as demonstrated through a strong track record of publishing in top-tier journals •	Experience with navigating Internal Review Board (IRB) processes and expertise about related policies and procedures •	Experience with DOHMH’s Community Health Survey, SPARCS, eMedNY, Salient or other Medicaid claims databases, MEPS, BRFSS, etc •	Supervisory experience, such as leading and advising staff involved in various projects •	Experience successfully preparing grant applications including developing research questions •	Experience with geographical information  software such as ArcGIS •	Knowledge of and interest in public health, health policy and primary care •	Ability to quickly become familiar with specific topic areas within public health and health policy in which the individual may have had no prior knowledge •	Excellent project management and written and oral communication skills •	Competency in Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, and PowerPoint). To Apply Apply online with a cover letter to https://a127-jobs.nyc.gov/ In the Job ID search bar, enter: job ID #: 225823. We appreciate the interest and thank all applicants who apply, but only those candidates under consideration will be contacted. Work Location 42-09 28th Street, Queens, NY, 11101 Residency Requirement New York City residency is generally required within 90 days of appointment. However, City Employees in certain titles who have worked for the City for 2 continuous years may also be eligible to reside in Nassau, Suffolk, Putnam, Westchester, Rockland, or Orange County. To determine if the residency requirement applies to you, please discuss with the agency representative at the time of interview. post_text: Hrs_ce DEPT OF HEALTH/MENTAL HYGIENE Job Posting Notice Job ID: # of Positions: 225197 1 Business Title: Nutrition Data Analyst, Bureau of Chronic Disease Prevention and Tobacco Control Civil Service Title: CITY RESEARCH SCIENTIST Job Category: Health Career Level: Experienced (non-manager) Title Code No: Level: 21744 02 Proposed Salary Range: $ 68,239.00 - $ 85,644.00 (Annual) Work Location: 42-09 28th Street Division/Work Unit: Chronic Disease Prevention Search Other NYC Jobs Job Description We are seeking for a highly motivated and productive public health professional to be a part of an internationally-renowned bureau. The Research Scientist will report to Research and Evaluation staff and work closely with the Healthy Eating staff.  The qualified candidate will be responsible for participating in the development and implementation of research and program evaluation activities to support public health programs and policies designed to reduce the burden of chronic disease in New York City. DUTIES WILL INCLUDE BUT NOT BE LIMITED TO: • Working closely with other Bureau staff to ensure that research and evaluation activities are aligned with bureau goals related to health eating. • Supporting implementation of evaluation plans for the Bureau's programs and policies. Ensuring the rigor of study designs and the integrity of data collection and analysis. • Working with the R&E unit staff to coordinate core unit activities including surveillance, data management and analysis, preparation of summary tables, figures, and maps related to healthy eating. • Assist in the development of analytic plans; analyzing data in support of bureau research and program evaluation efforts, as needed. • Drafting reports and presentations for internal and external audiences. • Contributing to the preparation of grant requests to support unit and bureau efforts, as opportunities arise. • Identifying and developing opportunities for collaboration with internal and external researchers and stakeholders. • Drafting and coordinating submission of peer-reviewed articles and other reports. • Providing additional research, evaluation and analytic support as necessary for bureau programs. Minimum Qual Requirements 1.  For Assignment Level I (only physical, biological and environmental sciences and public health) A master's degree from an accredited college or university with a specialization in an appropriate field of physical, biological or environmental science or in public health. To be appointed to Assignment Level II and above, candidates must have: 1. A doctorate degree from an accredited college or university with specialization in an appropriate field of physical, biological, environmental or social science and one year of full-time experience in a responsible supervisory, administrative or research capacity in the appropriate field of specialization; or 2. A master's degree from an accredited college or university with specialization in an appropriate field of physical, biological, environmental or social science and three years of responsible full-time research experience in the appropriate field of specialization; or 3. Education and/or experience which is equivalent to "1" or "2" above. However, all candidates must have at least a master's degree in an appropriate field of specialization and at least two years of experience described in "2" above. Two years as a City Research Scientist Level I can be substituted for the experience required in "1" and "2" above. NOTE: Probationary Period Appointments to this position are subject to a minimum probationary period of one year. Preferred Skills --A Ph.D. degree in public health, or related field --2 years' experience in public health practice; --A Master's or Ph.D. in epidemiology, public health or related field --Expertise in managing, cleaning, analyzing, and reporting on quantitative data, including large datasets, is essential --Preferred candidates should have excellent analytical skills and reasoning; strong written and oral communication skills; experience utilizing mixed methods, including qualitative data; and a general appreciation for data quality. To Apply Apply online with a cover letter to https://a127-jobs.nyc.gov/ In the Job ID search bar, enter: job ID #: 225197. We appreciate the interest and thank all applicants who apply, but only those candidates under consideration will be contacted. Work Location 42-09 28th Street, Queens, NY, 11101 Residency Requirement New York City residency is generally required within 90 days of appointment. However, City Employees in certain titles who have worked for the City for 2 continuous years may also be eligible to reside in Nassau, Suffolk, Putnam, Westchester, Rockland, or Orange County. To determine if the residency requirement applies to you, please discuss with the agency representative at the time of interview. Associate Director, Account Medical Advisor/Sr. Associate Director, Account Medical Advisor - Northeast (4) - 161282 Associate Director,
Account Medical Advisor or Senior Associate Director, Account Medical Advisor The qualified candidate
will be hired at the appropriate level commensurate with education/experience. Note:  There are 4
openings in this territory. The Associate Director, Account Medical Advisor ,
will function as a field based extension of Medicine serving as the account
medical lead working with key decision makers (KDMs) at regional payors,
pharmacy benefit managers, and organized customer groups and other managed care
customer organizations. The Senior Associate Director, Account Medical Advisor (AMA), will function as a field based extension of Medicine serving as the
account medical lead working with key decision makers at national &
regional payors, pharmacy benefit managers, organized customer groups, and
other managed care customer organizations. The AMA will leverage a deep understanding of the overall
healthcare environment along with his/her scientific acumen across multiple
therapeutic areas to serve as a highly credible and knowledgeable scientific
resource to assigned accounts and to the Managed Markets account sales 
and Managed Markets Marketing team and will be front line in responding to
scientific inquiries of the account.  The AMA will serve as an
account-focused resource for  who will, in adherence to the principles of
scientific exchange, obtain scientific insights driven by approved scientific
objectives to inform the strategies and objectives of Medicine.   The
AMA role is essential to ensure that Medicine remains customer focused, and
takes into account the needs and focus of the managed markets customer base in
developing its medical/scientific strategy.  Demonstrate leadership by
anticipating trends and providing account-related insights to the commercial
account team to enable them to capitalize on opportunities to influence how
care is accessed and delivered. The AMA is the lead Medical point of contact for his/her
regional accounts and will proactively establish science-based relationships
within the account.  AMAs will provide strategic medical leadership and
insights to the commercial account teams to help inform their account planning
and will coordinate appropriately with his/her commercial counterparts to
ensure transparency about their account interactions.   The AMA will
be the lead medical resource for the account team and expert on scientific
developments in the marketplace.  The AMA will execute the TA objectives
while ensuring that strategic medical initiatives are executed according to
plan.  The AMA will gather scientific feedback and insights on (a)
TA-specific scientific topics of interest, and (b) BI’s clinical development
programs including trial design and bring such feedback into BI.  The AMA
will identify appropriate account based scientists with an interest in and
qualifications for conducting research. As an employee of
Boehringer Ingelheim, you will actively contribute to the discovery,
development and delivery of our products to our patients and customers. Our
global presence provides opportunity for all employees to collaborate
internationally, offering visibility and opportunity to directly contribute to
the companies' success. We realize that our strength and competitive advantage
lie with our people. We support our employees in a number of ways to foster a
healthy working environment, meaningful work, diversity and inclusion,
mobility, networking and work-life balance. Our competitive compensation and
benefit programs reflect Boehringer Ingelheim's high regard for our employees. Duties &
Responsibilities for both AD, AMA and SAD, AMA: Ensure the timely and
     appropriate delivery of relevant scientific information including
     scientific data,  clinically-relevant level of health economics and
     outcome research data, and information on BI’s pipeline or marketed
     products to key decision makers (KDMs) with appropriate scientific
     expertise within identified regional accounts.  Respond to requests
     from the customers and in a manner consistent with applicable compliance
     guardrails and the principles of scientific exchange that aligns with
     customer needs and BI's account medical objectives as defined in account
     plans. Build strong and trusted
     relationships with the medical and scientific leadership at the account by
     serving as the Medical point of contact.  Develop and enhance
     knowledge of the customer by working collaboratively with the account team
     and other customer-facing personnel.  Execute the medical/scientific
     strategy for the regional accounts assigned in accordance with the
     TA-specific and account-specific medical objectives and provide insights
     and feedback regarding account interactions to Medical and Commercial team
     members.  Identify and deliver meaningful scientific content
     appropriately in response to customer inquiries and in alignment with
     approved AMA account and TA-specific scientific objectives Engage in scientific exchange
     to understand customer data needs, gather feedback and scientific insights
     that may identify gaps that BI can potentially address through the Clinical development plan Product maintenance and
      optimization plan Development of appropriately
      vetted scientific resources and materials. Analyze and assist with
     reporting of scientific insights from accounts for which the AMA is
     responsible. Assess and understand account strategies for disease
     management, treatment protocols and the patient journey. Share scientific
     insights from customer interactions with internal stakeholders to inform
     and/or influence commercial and/ or clinical development strategies to
     meet the challenges posed by the evolving public and private healthcare
     trends and healthcare policies. Identify appropriate account
     based scientists with an interest in and qualifications for conducting or
     participating in BI-sponsored clinical studies or external collaborative
     research studies and communicate this information according to established
     Medicine or Commercial process and procedures. Gather and interpret the
     customer's research objectives and communicate such information to
     appropriate BI personnel. Have a deep understanding of the Triple Aim and
     of account drivers and communicate proposed scientific partnership or
     collaboration opportunities and ideas (e.g. traditional/non-traditional
     research, pragmatic clinical trials, Real World Evidence generation) that
     may address BI interests to the appropriate BI personnel consistent with
     applicable process and procedures. Expand BI’s understanding of
     key account drivers, internal workings, and clinical decision making
     approaches regarding population health.  In addition, the AMA will be
     aware of and communicate insights regarding medically relevant
     developments within the competitor landscape to internal
     stakeholders. Ensure internal stakeholders
     are aware of customer needs, expectations, and perceptions on matters
     related to BI products, initiatives, and clinical development.  Work
     with other account team personnel including other AMA (beyond assigned
     accounts) to understand customer macro trends and areas of focus and
     evaluate whether these may be leveraged across AMA-assigned
     accounts. Continuous learning to maintain
     a high level of knowledge regarding New scientific developments in
      our products and therapeutic areas of interest Changes within the assigned
      AMA account that impact BI strategically Macro trends and changes in
      the healthcare environment with impact to customers and to BI The AMA will adhere to all
     relevant BI policies and procedures and compliance expectations for AMA
     activities.  The AMA will incorporate ethical decision-making into
     all business practices. Additional Duties &
Responsibilities for SAD, AMA: Build strong and trusted
     relationships with the medical and scientific leadership at the account by
     serving as the lead Medical point of contact. Lead the development of the
     medical/scientific strategy for the national account plan, and coordinate
     the seamless implementation at affiliated regional accounts. Develop, with
     input from BI account team’s knowledge of the customer, the TA-specific
     and account-specific scientific objectives and execute
     appropriately.  Strategically collaborate with other customer-facing
     account team colleagues and provide appropriate insights and feedback
     about account interactions to Medical and PM team members. Identify and
     deliver meaningful scientific content appropriately in response to
     customer inquiries and in alignment with approved AMA account—and TA
     specific- scientific objectives. The AMA may mentor new or
     existing AMA and will train other AMA or MSL on scientific topics, macro
     trends and changes, clinical developments, and market shaping
     developments. The AMA will adhere to all
     relevant BI policies and procedures and compliance expectations for AMA
     activities. The AMA will incorporate ethical decision- making into all
     business practices. The AMA may act as liaison with Compliance and support
     other operations personnel involved in new procedure and standards
     development Associate Director, AMA
Requirements: Master’s degree, from an

PharmD, PhD, MD, DO) with a m inimum of five (5) years in the pharmaceutical/healthcare industry including either two (2) or (3) years in a customer-facing role or in a formulary management/market access role is required. Bachelor’s degree with Healthcare

post_text: Full Stack Engineer - Customer Service Powered by NLP at HiringCatalyst Apply To Position Full Stack Engineer - Customer Service Powered by NLP New York, NY Full-Time A seed funded, NYC based startup is looking to add a Full Stack Engineer to their founding team of seven.  With an elite team of scientists and PHDs, this company is working with one of the world's largest data sets to create a next generation data model for human-computer interaction.  In the short term, this technology will enable them to offer a tremendously valuable service to Fortune 500 companies.  The long term scope of this innovation could be far more significant. As a Full Stack Engineer, you will make use of your engineering skill set to collaborate with scientists and data engineers to build tools that enable analysis and experimentation upon massive amounts of customer interaction data.  In addition, you'll work on the core functionality of the asynchronous chat application that will be powered by in house Machine Learning and NLP algorithms.  This company is currently working with a Go backend, but it's not expected that prospective candidates have experience with Go. Requirements: Bachelors, Masters or PHD in Computer Science or related field 3+ years professional experience as a full stack software engineer Proficiency with at least one modern server side scripting language - Go, Python, Java, Ruby, etc.. Experience building complex JavaScript applications Able to identify needs, conceptualize elegant solutions and execute upon them without much management. post_text: Software Engineer In Test - Machine Learning, Computer Vision, Search Algorithms - Ruby and Node.js at HiringCatalyst Apply To Position Software Engineer In Test - Machine Learning, Computer Vision, Search Algorithms - Ruby and Node.js New York, NY Full-Time A software developer's time is best spent doing the thing he or she is intended to do - developing.  Repetitive tasks are a drain on time, and at team scale that's a significant loss in productivity.  We form engineering teams to increase what we can accomplish in a short period of time, but with less than perfect processes and procedures that rapidly growing team can actually become less productive.  A Software Engineer in Test sees this wasted time and is profoundly irritated by it. One of NYC's top software companies is looking to hire a Software Engineer in Test of this ilk.  This position calls for someone who can work as an engineer while driving quality in new features and releases.  With developers as your end user, feedback is local and available in abundance.  This dynamic fosters a level of collaboration and technical growth that's truly unique in the realm of test engineering. The bar for this position is particularly high as it centers around this company's most complex and critical in house system - search functionality.  This position is about more than automation - its focus is to engineer the best possible tools to help teams build quality into every new feature, function and release.  The primary technologies used will be Ruby on Rails and Node.js. Requirements: Bachelors, Masters or PHD in Computer Science or related field A minimum of two years of professional engineering experience Mastery of a server side programming language such as Java, Python, C#Ruby, Scala, PHP or JavaScript A strong grasp of CS fundamentals, data structures and algorithms Nice To Have: Expertise with open source testing tools such as Selenium and Cucumber Experience working on search engines and platforms A background in Machine Learning, Computer Vision or Natural Language Processing Apply To Position Powered by Breezy HR AddThis Sharing Hide Show AddThis

title: Data Scientist
summary: We recognize that Data Scientists come in all shapes and sizes. You have 2+ years in a Data Scientist, Data Researcher, Data Analyst, or similar role....
post_text: VentureLoop : Curalate - Data Scientist Login | Register Home Job Search Employer/VC Post a Job LoopTwo VentureLoop HR Click for Full Company Profile Company: Curalate Investors First Round Capital New Enterprise Associates Overview: Curalate is the world’s first monitoring, analytics, and brand intelligence tool focused on visual based platforms. They help brands form stronger relationships with consumers and help consumers discover great content. Hide company information Job Details Send to Friend: Job Title: Data Scientist Job Date: 04-13-2016 Duration: Full-Time Company: Curalate Job Location(s): New York City, NY, US Description: Curalate is seeking a passionate, creative data scientist who thrives in a fast-paced environment to join our team. Today our platform and tools help marketers at over 800 of the world’s largest brands and retailers make better data-driven decisions around their content; now we’re looking for someone to help do the same for us. While data and analytics are deeply ingrained in our DNA at Curalate, this is our first full-time data science position. In this role, you’ll wear a number of hats and work across functional teams, lending your skills and experience to help us make better data-driven decisions, extract novel insights from our existing (largely untapped) datasets, and ultimately move even faster as we redefine online visual marketing. We’ll lean on you to help us set up rigorous product experiments and synthesize results into a meaningful narrative. Finally, you’ll be partly charged with evangelizing best practices for working with data across our organization. Responsibilities: Work with MySQL, Amazon Redshift, Apache Cassandra, or other data systems to extract (and interpret) interesting datasets Perform rigorous statistical analysis with Microsoft Excel, MATLAB, or your tool of choice Run data-driven experiments across the Product and Engineering organizations, establishing, testing, and adjusting hypotheses Play the role of data storyteller, turning data-driven insights into actionable narratives. Establish and spread best practices for data collection and analysis (at scale) About you: We recognize that Data Scientists come in all shapes and sizes. As this position will be our first full time data scientist role, we are looking for a candidate who is well-rounded, with strengths more on the analysis and data storytelling side. Successful candidates will meet the following criteria: You have 2+ years in a Data Scientist, Data Researcher, Data Analyst, or similar role You have a strong statistics background You relish tackling big, hairy problems in a poorly-defined scale You have extremely strong written and verbal communication skills You have previous real-world exposure to big (e.g. terabyte-scale and up) datasets You feel at home in relational databases. You have a basic conceptual understanding on non-relational / NoSQL databases and distributed systems. You can turn basic ideas and algorithms into code; you have the ability to quickly learn a new programming/scripting language (full-blown production software engineering skills are NOT required) You’re a self-starter, willing to hit the ground running with minimal marching orders You’re excited about learning new things every day About Us: Curalate is the leading marketing and analytics suite for the visual web and a partner to more than 800 of the world’s most-loved brands. We’re a passionate team of visual thinkers, makers, and storytellers dedicated to helping brands create authentic connections with consumers through images. And we’re building something really powerful. Much like the brands we work with, our people are nothing short of inspiring – and we’re looking to grow our team. If you’re scrappy, creative, curious, and FUN, then we think Curalate could be the place for you. No recruiters, please. Our ability to find and deliver information faster than any other source has completely revolutionized how critical, relevant and actionable information reaches the news, finance, public sector and corporate security industries. Our ascent to being the most exciting company in New York City and the “super tool of journalists and hedge funds” as well as security professionals in both the corporate and public sectors has led to numerous accolades and achievements. We’ve been named #13 on CNBC’s Disruptor 50 list, added to the AlwaysOn Global 250 Top Private Companies list and received an invitation to speak at the World Economic Forum. Headquartered in New York City and nearing 200 employees, Dataminr provides a challenging and dynamic environment where everyone feels that they have the freedom to be innovative, impactful and influential. We’ve crafted a culture that promotes team interaction, work-life balance and the sharing of information and ideas because it empowers us to do our best work and have fun. If you want to be a part of the most interesting and exciting high-growth tech company in New York, please keep reading! Who you are: You're a dedicated data scientist who wants nothing more than to help us sort, analyze and deliver relevant information from terabytes of unstructured data in the social media space. We strive for strong abstractions that allow for fast iteration, easy integration and short development cycles, allowing us to constantly learn from our data and empower our clients to apply these insights toward product enhancements. Desired Skills & Experience: Ph.D. in Computer Science, Math, Statistics or related field Solid background in data mining, data visualization, statistical analysis, computational NLP or machine learning with at least 5 years experience Ability to communicate complex quantitative analysis in a clear, precise and actionable manner Extensive programming and system design experience, ability to work with big data with minimal engineering support Experience with Hadoop/MapReduce, Hive/Pig and NoSQL databases Proven track record of solving challenging problems in both academia and industry Self-motivation and an ability to handle multiple competing priorities in a fast-paced environment Ability to work both independently and collaboratively within a team Our offering of competitive benefits and perks include: Company paid benefits for employees and their dependents, such as medical, dental, vision, disability and life Flexible spending account to be used for out-of-pocket medical, transit, parking and dependent care expenses 401(k) savings plan Generous leave Daily catered meals A kitchen fully stocked with snacks and beverages …and this is just to name a few! Dataminr is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. Individuals seeking employment at Dataminr are considered without regards to race, sex, color, creed, religion, national origin, age, disability, genetics, marital status, pregnancy, unemployment status, sexual orientation, citizenship status or veteran status. title: Data Scientist
summary: We are seeking Senior Data Scientists to develop new strategies to extend credit to millions of small businesses across the country....
post_text: VentureLoop : OnDeck Capital - Data Scientist Login | Register Home Job Search Employer/VC Post a Job LoopTwo VentureLoop HR Click for Full Company Profile Company: OnDeck Capital Location: 1400 Broadway New York, NY 10018 Investors Foundation Capital Institutional Venture Partners RRE Ventures Contour Venture Partners Overview: At OnDeck, we are using the latest in technology and big data to disrupt the small business lending space. What takes big banks several weeks to complete, we can do in mere hours at On Deck. Our goal is to make lending fast, friction less, and to help small businesses reach their true potential. Hide company information Job Details Send to Friend: Job Title: Data Scientist Job Date: 04-10-2016 Duration: Full-Time Company: OnDeck Capital Job Location(s): New York City, NY, US Description: OnDeck (ONDK) uses data aggregation and electronic payment technology to evaluate the financial health of small and medium sized businesses to efficiently deliver capital to a market underserved by banks. Through the OnDeck platform, millions of small businesses can obtain affordable loans. We are changing the way small businesses borrow money by combining our passion for Main Street with cutting-edge technology. We evaluate businesses based on their actual performance, not personal credit, and that’s enabled us to say “yes” more often and faster than traditional lenders. What excites us at OnDeck? Technology. Innovation. Small businesses. We believe in our employees and power their growth through being challenged every day and offering careers that inspire. We’re all about teamwork, passion and making an impact. Oh and having fun – Whether it’s a game of Ping-Pong, team get-togethers or weekly happy hours in the office. Department summary: The Credit and Data Analytics teams at OnDeck are responsible for the models and policies that drive our success in the industry. Through our data-driven approach, our models and tools sift through thousands of data points to (i) target businesses via marketing, (ii) evaluate & quantify the financial health of our applicants, (iii) enable prudent credit risk management, and (iv) provide an industry leading customer experience. The team combines model building experience with a strong focus on software engineering best practices to ensure our models can be deployed in production and impact the day to day functioning of our business. We are seeking Senior Data Scientists to develop new strategies to extend credit to millions of small businesses across the country. We’re seeking inquisitive minds looking to reshape the face of small business lending by digging deep into the mountains of data that traditional banks have overlooked. Our team derives insights that direct multi-million dollar customer acquisition strategies, lending algorithms, and product features. As a Data Scientist at OnDeck, you will: Build the innovative statistical and machine learning models that drive every user’s interaction with OnDeck Make a direct and tangible impact on OnDeck’s explosive growth Develop and test new strategies alongside multiple stakeholders and technology teams Implement complex predictive models and strategies in OnDeck’s state of the art decisioning platform Develop creative solutions to bring OnDeck’s analytical tools to new markets and products Work with our extensive small business database in Spark on AWS to build relevant datasets that inform our marketing, sales and credit efforts Use these datasets to build predictive models (regression, random forests, naïve bayes etc) that inform our customer acquisition and loan processing processes Work closely with the data engineering team to ensure your models are robust, can be refreshed automatically and are continuously tested and being pushed to production Qualifications for success: You have a Master’s degree or PhD in a quantitative field (statistics, math, engineering, economics, etc) 4+ years of experience in modeling/analytics roles within the technology or financial services industries Expertise in statistical modeling, machine learning, and working with very large datasets Expertise using SQL, R and/or Python Experience with R/Python machine learning implementations, Unix/Linux scripting, object oriented programming a plus Ability to manage input and expectations across a diverse group of stakeholders Strong communication and data visualization skills; comfort communicating complex analyses to a variety of audiences What we offer you: Medical, dental, vision, and life benefits from day one. Paid/flexible sick-leave, vacations, and holidays so you can take off the time that you need when you need. Up to four months paid parental leave for all new parents. Adoption assistance with reimbursement of up to $5K. We want you to have time to bond with your new bundle of joy. Order lunch on us from Seamless. You can order what you want, when you want and from where you want. We’ll match your 401(k) contributions and offer a discount through our Employee Stock Purchase Plan. All to complement your personal financial strategy. We want to help advance your career. Take classes relevant to your job and the first $5K is on us. Enjoy our annual company summer party, holiday party and department quarterly outings. Semi-annual Hackathons to give our teams a fun way to innovate together and come up with awesome ideas. Our partnership with SoFi gives you access to student loan refinancing, personal loans and even mortgages. We work hard, we play hard. Build or join an OnDeck intramural club, group, and/or sports team and be part of our OnDeck Community. Fully stocked kitchens with free snacks & drinks. summary: Collaborate and reliably share feedback from life science accounts that you manage with Flatironâ??s team of product managers, quantitative scientists,...
post_text: VentureLoop : Flatiron - Director, Outcomes Login | Register Home Job Search Employer/VC Post a Job LoopTwo VentureLoop HR Click for Full Company Profile Company: Flatiron Location: 291 Broadway Suite 401 New York, NY 10007 Investors First Round Capital GV IA Ventures Great Oaks Venture Capital Overview: Flatiron is a business and clinical intelligence platform for cancer care providers. Our web-based platform seamlessly integrates and structures disparate information systems to produce a truly longitudinal and comprehensive view of the patient population. Hide company information Job Details Send to Friend: Job Title: Director, Outcomes Job Date: 04-14-2016 Duration: Full-Time Company: Flatiron Job Location(s): New York City, NY, US Description: Our mission is to serve cancer patients and our customers by dramatically improving treatment and accelerating research. Our team is building a disruptive, oncology-specific software platform that connects cancer centers across the world on a common technology infrastructure to address key healthcare challenges. Today, the Flatiron Health OncologyCloud™ platform includes the industry-leading electronic medical record for oncology, a first-of-its-kind analytics tool, patient portal, and integrated billing management. Our goal is to help cancer centers and life science companies leverage real-world oncology data at a scale and clinical depth never before seen, to advance cancer care and accelerate research. Today, Flatiron Health supports our Life Sciences partners with both Data and Analytics (D&A) and Point of Care (POC) offerings. Our Data and Analytics group is seeking an individual with an outcomes research background and client-facing experience who is excited about changing the world of oncology. We’re looking for someone that can represent the company as a clinical data and product expert to our life science partners. This job requires a foundational expertise in outcomes research as well as client management and organizational skills, an entrepreneurial spirit, and a passion for tackling one of the most complex medical and technological challenges of our time. Responsibilities: Serve as an outcomes research expert, interfacing with our life science partners to align Flatiron's offerings with research needs and selling new projects and services to meet those needs (e.g., refine client’s research questions, translating client’s needs for handoff to internal delivery teams) Develop and manage relationships with medical groups (and commercial groups) within our life science partners to advance the integration of our products through demonstrated value In coordination with our life sciences delivery teams, ensure all existing contractual milestones are achieved Collaborate and reliably share feedback from life science accounts that you manage with Flatiron’s team of product managers, quantitative scientists, engineers, oncologists, business development leaders, and other cross-functional colleagues Closely partner with our Accounts’ Principals to execute against Flatiron’s Life Sciences sales strategy to drive explosive growth but does not include the execution of the research projects Spearhead new business proposal writing, development of client presentations, and tailoring of other client facing materials Actively seek out knowledge sharing opportunities with your Accounts team colleagues Be the day-to-day communication point person, including on-site representation at client meetings (anticipated travel: 20-40%, including local day trips to client sites) Requirements: You have a MS or PhD (or equivalent) in biostatistics, epidemiology, health economics or related discipline with 4+ years of work experience (excluding post doctorate) in client-facing roles of increasing responsibility, delivering products or services to life science partners You have performed advanced professional analytical work in surveillance, detection, and prevention of diseases; health outcomes analyses; biostatistics; longitudinal data analyses; or other expert quantitative areas pertinent to health (which is supported by a strong publication record) You can apply your outcomes research background (preferably including a focus on cancer) to support end-to-end client engagement process, including capabilities presentations, project scoping, and customer support You have experience utilizing data and partnering with life science companies, and are comfortable presenting to every level of the client’s organization, including senior management You have a deep understanding of data and the competitive landscape in the bio-pharmaceutical market You are flexible, have a start-up mindset, and enjoy a fast-paced and rapidly evolving environment You have the ability to juggle multiple client interactions and deadlines simultaneously and the versatility to collaborate with individuals at all levels and across various functions within life sciences companies You have exceptional written and communication skills and experience owning high profile client relationships You have the agility to work across teams and develop internal relationships, including business development, quantitative sciences, engineering, medical oncology, delivery and product management You embrace use of new software applications with a command of MS Office (Word, Powerpoint, Excel) You have the following traits Data driven Detail-oriented Proactive, self-motivated and self-directed Engaging, personable, positive attitude Thrive in highly uncertain situations Bonus Points: Experience working with alternative data sources (and an ability to speak to the benefits of Flatiron’s data offerings first-hand) -- e.g., claims, chart review, other EMR data Disclaimer: Local Candidates Only home | contact us | advertise with us | privacy policy | about us | help | terms of use | login ©2007-2016 VentureLoop.
